N9GYcydZy_cMP2EBx7SVWQ.text: I am updating my original review on this restaurant because the service and food have declined SIGNIFICANTLY since my first visit. I will NEVER eat here again. On my first visit I ordered the chicken and waffles. The service was GREAT and the food was awesome. I was so excited, I told everyone! I took my husband just a few days later and the experience was night and day!   I've tried it four times since then and the service has been AWFUL. Most recently, I found HAIR IN MY FOOD!!   The cashier, who identified herself as "Lace" was RUDE!   I am so disappointed because I thought that this would be my new breakfast spot. It WON'T!  Small businesses really need to be careful who they let operate their establishment. I've seen so many good places driven into the ground because of people like "LACE". .

I7LwUXouwIWp36S5MG-KEA.text: This is one of my favorite breakfast spots in town.. I've had the Portuguese sausage and eggs, Buffalo fried chicken and eggs and of course steak and eggs twice! Just sayin.. the food is good and the service is excellent! Bruce was fast and accurate also.. they have the best pajamas!

8GEyLbgIuu5z2IiyW3yIOg.text: Amazing service and breakfast!! Desire my server was great! One of if not the best breakfasts I've had in a long time! Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the best breakfasts I&#39;ve had in a long time!! Fantastic!

USpTTlassSswY8dLmFLhiw.text: We started out w/a fresh carrot/green apple juice. $3.95 small for the price compared to "bite" and "skinnyfats" the combo didn't work together either. My wife had the pineapple/banana smoothie which was better tasting.  The fried chicken breast was overbreaded and dry which would've been ok if it came w/gravy. I suggested to them that they not put powdered sugar on top of the chicken and leave it for the waffle,  and speaking of waffle it was soggy because of the chicken on top. I told all this to the girl at the front desk taking our check and she credited the waffle.  My wife's Philly steak and eggs was excellent and I would highly recommend.  The waiter rushed us and gas bad timing.  Overall experience is good from the place itself and the food.

tm2C5qTaKZFStLUCNvybAw.text: No Wifi at all. This spot is bad for business meetings. If you have special dietary needs you may as well skip the place.  They have no idea what to do with a diabetic.  She actually said let's replace your bread with potatoes.  WTF?

SOR2ru8oVWM8QYeRLM01KQ.text: Took 50 minutes to be seated and another 45 minutes for the food. Horrible management.

Ln9r-TRtNEoXLbMv3Oe_4g.text: I drove all the way here from North Las Vegas for brunch & it's so worth it! They have the BEST hashbrowns I've had in while! The first time I went, I had the Red velvet chocolate chip pancakes, half order since 1 pancake is bigger than the plate. I didn't even need any frosting, butter or syrup..! it was AMAZING! the next time I went, I ordered the Ultimate steak and eggs with hashbrowns & my daughter ordered the chicken fried steak. Both were extremely huge & delicious! I can't wait to try more & DEF will be back sooner than later for sure!! Pricing is pretty average and you definitely get your money's worth!   If you plan to go, plan for a wait! we waited about 30 minutes to get seated for just the 2 of us... which was expected since we went on a Sunday morning.

Don't be in a hurry if you come before noon they pick them in. Today we came around 1pm. No wait at all. 5 STARS for sure.

I really like how you can order a fresh French Press coffee that they bring to your table.  Not your typical breakfast joint watered down coffee.  Cup O Bread is a must.

_-1WkAyTbzjnq88IQlMHyQ.text: After three tries we have decided we will not be back for a while. The first time everything was great from the food to the service. The second time we came in on a weekday morning and it took about 10 minutes for anyone to acknowledge us at the door and get a seat. Once seated it took about 35 minutes for us to get our food. We also noticed that a few tables around us were getting impatient as well with the flow of food/service. The family sitting next to us ended up getting their whole check comped due to having to send their food back twice because of the temperature of their food. We assumed that maybe this second visit was just a bad day/one off. The third time in, my father ordered coffee and his first creamer cup showed up super dirty and he had it sent back. The second creamer was dirty as well and cracked on the inside of the spout. When we touched it part of the porcelain came off. If that had been in his coffee then we would have had a serious issue. Other than the service, the food is pretty good but we will not be back for a while.

j1Bm-iuZWLfX5uf65DtJYw.text: The food is alright but never order from here through Postmates because they ALWAYS forget something or simply choose to cancel your order after 50 minutes. I tried one last time today to order from them and once again they forgot two items that I paid for. This is the third time this has occurred and I certainly will NEVER try them again. The managers solution was to have me drive by to pick up a voucher... the reason I paid the postermates charge was so I wouldn't have to drive anywhere. Their food is alright, just not worth the hassle. Mimosas Gourmet on Durango has way better food and customer service. I suggest you go or order from there.

a3NLvL8PmxejHSbsIS5WRQ.text: This place is the worst!  On my third attempt at giving it another chance, I showed up and was greeted with "we have been very busy this morning so the cooks are all on break for a while".   The wait staff is generally rude and snippy.  These people really don't enjoy what they are doing for a living.   Don't waste your time with this place!

CdsYsgVmlEEbvERWHtNcjA.text: Good food, prompt service, and a friendly attitude are what you will find at Rise & Shine.  Walking in we found a staff dressed in pajamas, and they were as friendly a team as you will find in Las Vegas.  Seating is spacious, with lots of room between tables.  This also leads to a low room volume; just loud enough to have a buzz, but not so loud that you can't hear the music playing or the server speaking with you.  The food was good, and the price was right.  People talk about the rib eye chilaquiles and they are right - it's a good dish.  So is the corned beef hash, and the requisite "green" juice - kale, cucumber, apple, and honeydew. And it is a great place for kids.  There is a little play area outside with artificial turf, and inside a kids menu with decent selections.  We found this one morning thanks to fellow Yelpers, and we agree that it is a good place.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ugZURCqmH2GaNRuacIf-wg.text: Well. My first time here. My favorite breakfast is Corned Beef Hash & Eggs which they had so of course I ordered it.  A bit disappointing cause it lacked Corned Beef Hash. Why can't anyone give the customer what they pay for. I'll keep trying to find what I want.

7ofWkIrcEL6QVrGhQlnBMQ.text: will never eat in your cafe again,,coffee cups are gross.looks they they are not clean with 3 to 4 coffee rings in them.waitress told us that the health department passes them.. not True,they do not clean and sanitize dishes,so how nasty is everything else..I will contact the health department and channel 13

XyUk56Io94Wqp3XIBvNlWA.text: This is my favorite place to eat breakfast & lunch when I visit vegas! I always request Sarah because she is very attentive & always has a smile on her face! Definitely the best waitress there :)

x8On1VHYkP8Nr8HTxeBJ9Q.text: I love a place with kitsch that's fun. But more than that, I love a place that has kitsch but also really delicious food that isn't all just a gimmick.  The waitstaff in pajamas is a wonderful touch and the adorable floral umbrellas overhead really brightened my day.  We came here for a very late brunch last Saturday, around 1:30-2pm? The menu was full of delicious sweet and savory things that just looked decadent and to die for. I have a hard time eating heavy food early in my day (yes, I'd slept in on a weekend in Vegas, sue me :P) so I opted for something a little fresher than the pancakes and country fried steak fare - a NY strip steak Caesar salad (dressing on the side like always). I ordered my steak rare and WAS IT EVER RARE. I love my steaks borderline mooing and this was beautiful. It was really thinly cut and just melted in my mouth. The romaine of the salad was crunchy and really fresh, and the bite to the Caesar dressing was a great complement to the steak.  I had a few sips of a friend's banana-berry-other-things smoothie and wished I'd ordered one myself. It was a little seedy but the flavor was on point.  I was, like always bummed to hear "Is pepsi okay?" when asking for a diet coke, and I wish I'd gotten a sierra mist or something instead of the minute maid pink lemonade that's just kinda sweet and tasteless. Oh well.  My friends were all taken aback by how delicious their meals were. I stole some fries from one and they were skinny, crunchy yet fluffy, and seasoned beautifully with a little garlic and herbs I think?  I'd love to come back here, maybe on a day when I've somehow gotten an early start (or maybe come in on a morning flight so I'm ready to stuff my face upon arrival) so that I can try some of the more luxurious things. But I'd love to come back!!

CON2LsUhjbivYG_bT232VQ.text: This place is seriously the best breakfast in Vegas! My boyfriend and I come here every Sunday and we love it! The hostess at the front is always so sweet and accommodating! The only reason for the missing star is for the servers. This location is always busy and always very full. There aren't enough servers to accommodate all of their tables and it is definitely noticeable for small things like not getting enough refills, having to get up and go to the server station and ask for things like syrup or butter. It isn't the servers fault but they give too many tables to only one server and they get overwhelmed and can't give every guest 5 star service. Otherwise, the food is incredible, the hostesses are awesome, and the atmosphere is nice but they definitely need more help!

gjeksodGBWObWIe64WB39A.text: Super good coffee - French press style - lots of good menu items- so many great options to choose from! Order one of each!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w-I63lmCsIXzs2Lqa-pL9A.text: Tiny portions, waiters didn't know the menu. Items not properly described on menu.. Real disappointment

1g5L2xtFIARAhxllc7Nj9w.text: In a restaurant that was super busy when I went in, our hostess was super helpful in accommodating us, our server laura was adorable, dark hair, very personable and efficient  gave us amazing service , she made sure all our needs were met and she paid special attention, even tho it seemed she had a lot of tables. The food was piping hot and yummy Definitely coming in next week to try some of the items i missed

9ruzi0m1SjNDONEO9UecDw.text: What a great atmosphere!  I love the flowers on the ceiling.  Food was tasty and good portions.  Service was excellent.  Even the hostess was very helpful and kind.  Will be back!

How7BajXTUYwW-ndbKaIQA.text: So sad that I haven't eaten here sooner!!! Came here after the gym hoping for some basic steak and eggs but we got so much more!! Ordered the chilaquiles and it came with steak and eggs on the side. Such a great portion for the price. The chicken wrap was great as well. You could tell the ingredients were fresh. Great recommendations by Chelsea, our server, and great service. She was very knowledgeable about the menu and friendly. The atmosphere was very calming and friendly for breakfast-goers.  A++++

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo chicken wrap and chilaquiles

FPAlP4LVpiX3SKfI-8WRnA.text: Holy Cow! This is such a cute little place! The decor is bright, cheerful and inviting. The staff actually dress in pajamas and the service is excellent. Our waiter Tyler generously walked us through the menu. Speaking of the menu which is well thought out and eclectic, it provides a twist on old time favorites. The portion sizes are more than generous and the Southern Style Chicken Fried NY Steak and Eggs was absolutely mouth watering! Thank goodness my friend and I decided to split a plate . And they serve french press coffee! Need I say more? This is definitely gonna be my new breakfast go to place!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yep this was a half portion!

KwTiivcM35NBnZ8-3vrbGQ.text: The food is absolutely amazing! Very friendly service and atmosphere. Price is better then most places around with the best food around. I'd definitely recommend giving this place a try!

ruQcmRyOwE-dJUKEznfvtw.text: I've been to Vegas a few times and have been looking for a great breakfast spot that wasn't on the strip or an all you can gorge fest. We randomly came by Rise & Shine and it is hands down my new favorite spot in all of Vegas.   They have a fresh squeezed juice bar. The meals are filling and they have the best hash browns I have ever had in my life. On top of the fact that they specialize in steak and eggs they also have a lot of healthy options from vegetarian to the meat lovers.   Even if it's not an option make sure to try the 'pot of bread.'   Thanks guys you made my trip!

S-cYAW7GVgY1Iyn_bZeeFQ.text: I love the chicken and waffles here for breakfast. Upgrading to the banana foster waffles is a must. I like their flamingo location because of this. They do not have the banana foster waffles at the southern highland location which is a bummer because it's a closer drive. But it's worth the extra few miles.

3PQgL3uGK_oOhzWlIolahg.text: Amazing food!  The cup of bread was incredible.  And our server, Sarah, was the best.  She was helpful and informative!

V9g0YFJSVdIU8gwqVRE_Ew.text: If I could give less I would.  We eat everywhere and friends w all gms, managers and bartenders in vegas because we treat people very well and in turn we get the same. We placed a $110 pick up order and they got EVERYTHING wrong.  After getting home and calling for a resolution I was told "we can offer a credit for next time?  There is nothing we can do."  It wasn't about he money or a credit.  It was not being accountable, lying to me, not offering an apology nor a solution after they took $110 dollars from me. The service, food, communication the WORST I've experienced in Las Vegas.

8sVcOemPnLtp1OrKAbKEpw.text: I find the location convenient - close to the 215. The restaurant is always clean and brightly decorated. The staff is knowledgable and very friendly; especially if you are lucky enough to get Maddy as your server. The food is amazing! I have never been disappointed and always enjoy fresh and cooked just the way I like it breakfast. The ultimate steak and eggs is a great value, the steak is tender and seasoned perfectly, and the sides are not the generic sides you get at most chains. A must try this weekend.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AMWvRiJ9nhUs5eS2Pm8u6Q.text: This was our first visit to this restaurant.  We did a google search for "breakfast in Las Vegas". My wife and I were greeted by a friendly hostess.  We waited 10 minutes for a table  which was exactly how long she told us it would be.  Our server Amberly was very friendly.  She took the time to explain a number of items on the menu.  Our drink orders were brought in a timely manner.  The food arrived fairly quick and tasted as good as it looked.  I had the french toast/platter and my wife had the eggs benedict.   The noise level inside the restaurant was a little high.  But that could be remedied by the addition of soundproofing material on the ceiling.   Overall our experience was very pleasant.  We will be coming back again to this location.  Once again, we want to commend Amberly for her high level of service.  We will be asking for her on our next visit.

JDjQDV2Rb9WB_tcVb-MxSA.text: Love, love, LOVE this place! We wanted to get away from the strip and do some exploring. Tried this place out because of a friend's suggestion. After looking at all the photos, we were convinced we had to try it out. SO GLAD WE DID!! The food was delicious!! I had the sausage biscuits with eggs and potatoes. The gravy was so good, perfect consistency, the biscuits were awesome, eggs - perfect! It must have come with bacon (or I stole it from someone elses's plate) but it was good! The Mister had some big breakfast with ham (I think), don't really remember, but it looked good and he was VERY happy with our meal. Our son had the philly chessesteak omelet (again, I think), and he loved it. The prices were great, too! All three of us had a wonderful meal and it was under $50! Service was amazing! From the guy who seated us, to our server, to the cashier, they were all great! The only downside was the wait - took almost an hour to get seated outside, but it could have been because there were numerous sports tournaments in the area and the place was packed. We will definitely make this place a breakfast stop-off during all of our Vegas trips!

pUo_fu1j8mcW3rOwjJkM5Q.text: One of the bigger easier places to get into for breakfast! Food is fantastic waiters are quick and place is nice and clean. It's nice being able to jump into a place and not wait 30-40 minutes to eat. Ridiculous. Not too far from the house and away from the tourists. I'm happy this place opened up!

HzR1b6MLnaI0R5mtuQVZcw.text: I have been there more than a few times cause I live around the corner and I leave with the same impression every time. That is for the very mediocre food they are sure expensive and service is just plain bad!  OK so what is the problem? well two people for breakfast one being oatmeal was $35!!! Speaking of oatmeal, ordered was for oatmeal with milk and fruit, forgot milk and fruit, came back in 5 min and we ask where it is, then came back another two min with milk but no fruit. Unbelievable.

6m3YGTmVdzJjlDjp1W-iLA.text: This was our first time here and we both ordered the same thing, so I can't speak for their entire menu, but what we ordered was great.  And the portions were HUGE!!  Great service too.  Ashley was the best!  Answered all of our questions and was extremely pleasant.  Will definitely be coming back to try different things on the menu.

8ZwE-gnJXI9ScHZzE84qPQ.text: I loved this place in the past but no more service has changed and I don't like being charged for toast that is given after the meal is done but I spoke with the manger who just happen to be checking me out and asked how was my meal after I explained she removed the toast and gave me and my son 2 $5 off coupons I will be returning and recommend to all just bad day toast

58DqxYNrRtHU4zx3dgSRug.text: I have to say I was excited to try new place for breakfast. The interior looks really nice and servers were also good. Unfortunately the organization isn't very good. Wait to be seated is kind a long and not to mention 20 minutes wait to get our meals .. All that might be forgiven taking in mind that the place is new and needs to find its system yet . However when we got our gogo fresh juice with rotten cucumber as decoration and also bluberies in the fruit cup were all rotten..that just killed my taste buds.. Our server offered us new juice as we didn't drink even half of it but I just couldn't. . At least I was expecting not to be charge for something that should not even leave the kitchen which we were. So ... long wait to be seated , long wait for food which tasted good, that yes ..but fruit and veggies should be fresh in my opinion .. Would not go back ..

Wdg2RDklEq6_u-W7h_wDnA.text: my go to breakfast spot. the buffalo chicken breast is hands down the best i've ever had. the service is amazing & i envy the fact that the servers wear pajama pants. lol will always come here!

UD5oPc-LuZhi9ixMchfY0g.text: It was okay nothing to rave about. The wait time for a table on Mothers day was decent but once you got to the table I waited close to and hour for my food. At 1st i figured it was just busy until i realized the two tables next to us who came after us already received their food.... my server apologized before i could say anything and then brought out our food which was COLD and very mediocre also my eggs were wrong I ordered country scramble and the server brought out hard scramble with cheese. I thought it was a mistake which no biggie but on the receipt that is how she put it in the system even though she blamed the cooks smh. I must say I don't have interest in going back. Also I did enjoy the watermelon drink but if you are like me and enjoy eating the fresh fruit the out on the side of the glass do not do it don't even try it my watermelon slice tasted spoiled very rotten. But hey the environment was nice and the slow service was actually nice. But I wont be back.

lGxgUDlM9N6NeUB_mkwiNw.text: The food is great haven't had a bad meal yet.   Coffee is wonderful. The old fashion pancake is just the right amount of sweet.  Big enough to feed 2-3 people.  We request * Sammy *. She is wonderful delight to the morning, great personality and make u feel very welcome.  Take her recommendation.  If I haven't tried it. I say come in and be surprised.

gDtcL5C20vUzp78cNaXTxQ.text: Our waiter was super super sweet first and foremost. The food wasn't good at all. My eggs were way over cooked as well as potatoes hash browns and I never got my toast until I asked. Food Wasn't that hot. My son had the carne Asaf's buritto and we both didn't like the taste. It had a taste of spegetti ohs. His beans were cold   Anyway you get a lot of food but we won't be back.   I let the front know I wasn't happy with it but I let her know I would Go ahead and pay full price.   My son exchanged his burrito to the red Velvut pancakes which we got to go.

Xr-Ig8Y3ertdWWROxTJWaQ.text: First time trying Rise and Shine. It was good. The steak and eggs were very good especially for the price. It wasn't a wimpy steak and very flavorful. My wife had chilaqulies also very flavorful. Service was good. We'll definitely return.

pjBRFsa0tGXet_mVnVUKmA.text: Perfect place for breakfast with the family! They have fresh juices which is a major plus! I ordered their oatmeal which was pretty good and my boyfriend loves their country fried steak and eggs. The waiters and waitress wear pajamas and it makes the restaurant a fun environment. Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wgv-681TeRZDf5oNiwNU8Q.text: Worst place ever for breakfast been here 3 times and every time I have to send my food back today there was a hair on my breakfast there was only 2 other people eating in the place I asked them Terry make it and send the manager overShe came over with a little smirk on her Face and ask me what would I like her to do she said she would remove the hair I said I wanted her We make my entire meal. PS she wears the same pajamas every day

J6lrOHCyLlWGg0qVi3U95g.text: Used to love this place, but I went today and the Rib Eye plate my girlfriend had ordered was burned. I get that it's cooked on a grill, but instead of the usual grill marks, the whole top of her steak was completely charred. Shd ordered a medium rare and as she cut the steak, half the steak was medium rare but the side that was burned was well done. Did the cook forget the steak on the grill???? She was excited to come today for lunch but the steak completely killed the mood. The NY Steak plate I had ordered also had the same problem. Uneven cook, one side completely burned.  We loved the steak and eggs here, but it seems like the quality just gets lower every time we come.

wzSGJIvehTHJTjqkDD9uPQ.text: Rise & Shine is a very good American breakfast place. Me and my beautiful wife arrived there on a Sunday morning after having a terrible experience trying to grab some crepes at a small restaurant. The little restaurant got invaded by a large group of cyclists . Let me tell you about that first:  The cyclists were everywhere, I mean everywhere!!!! Sticking out of the restaurant in a large line; mostly speaking Chinese with a bunch of cameras  hanging in their neck. They had their bikes  standing all over the place and could not decide what they wanted to order. After standing at the door  letting them in and out because the line was so long, while that restaurant had only one guy cooking crepes, we decided to move on to our next bookmarked restaurant.  So, that's how we ended up at Rise & Shine! At first we were really mad about the cyclist group, but then we were glad they were there. Otherwise we would not be here at Rise & Shine right now. As we arrived in the restaurant we were welcomed by a wonderful hostess that took us to a nice table right the way. The only downside I feel about the restaurant is that the main room is very large and noisy. Besides that, this place is perfect.  They have really good and healthy food , which is our main concern as we millennials and we love an extremely healthy life style. So, lucky you for reading this review because I'm going to tell you we ordered and why it was so amazing. First of all, their portions are huge, I mean, we both do #crossfit and we eat a lot, yet still we were able to split the Ribeye breakfast dish... it was really cheap if you take in consideration that it came with two eggs, a large piece of meat  and chips with salsa avocado and beans. We also ordered two fresh juices, check my pictures of you don't believe it!!!  Rise & Shine is a must go if you are looking for a place that will fit your entire family in one large room with very large portions, cheap prices and the best quality of all: HEALTHY!!! We were pleasured to be serve by AMBER, who recommended the Ribs dish, and confirmed that the juices were made from fresh fruit . Thank you Amber, thank you Rose & Shine  for the amazing experience. Ah, one more thing, thank you Chinese  cyclists  for taking over the little crepes restaurant ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rise &amp; Shine CoW
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qvl4QLUqpjXR3lzeWT1GlQ.text: Walked in the back door like we had been there before, but no it was our first time.  My bestie Jeff C. & I were starving & really excited over the breakfast pix we saw on Yelp.    Love the decor & colorful upside down umbrellas & humorous other knick knack (socks, pix).  Every meal we past was fried or covered in whipped cream.  Possible that's what they are known for & why they got so many stars.  As we were seated, I had to grab a napkin to wipe off my seat, which I hate to have to do.  It has become a pet peev of mine.  I do like that as a breakfast place they have the jelly, hot sauce & sugar on the table.    Collin our server was very nice & quick.  He also had recommendations when we asked what to drink & about their specialty 'pot of bread.'  I was not impressed w/ the taste of the pot of bread, but the presentation was very cute.  It tasted like bread w/ a slight hint of cinnamon, nothing special.    My friend usually gets iced tea so is a great critic of it so when I saw his face after the first dirst drink I knew it wasn't good.  He described it as iced tea made w/ regular tap water.  Gross!  Collin recommended the Watermelon Strawberry juice, which was probably the best part of Jeffs meal.  He got the Bangers Omelette & I did the Lox Omelette, which I perfect at home.  My omelette was ok.  It was unevenly filled.  One bite was cream cheese, one salmon, on capers & horrible onions that I picked out.  They serve Lavazza coffee which is ok.    I will give this place one more shot.  My dad loved the Loco Moco & I see its w/ beef & spam so dad needs to try it!  Also, next time I'll try something fried like the country fried steak.

f6i7bp18OUTfjZLtoHuAlQ.text: The environment was warm & welcoming. We were seated right away. The staff was friendly and attentive & their work uniforms are pajamas. The food was amazing, fresh & hot. The bread in a cup (cinnamon bun) was everyone's favorite. The chicken & waffle was delicious, the chicken was tender and flavorful & the waffle was crispy and soft, served with hot syrup!! Nothing screams southern food with biscuit & gravy. Such a cozy feeling dining here. New favorite spot for brunch!! Highly recommend.

XXatgPuam-w57zqLnt35Kg.text: Rise n Shine !  Pow! Breakfast foodie alert.  Leave on ya PJs if you'd like the servers have their PJs on too.  Get yer coffees French Presses and or Fresh squeeze juice from all kinds of fresh veggies and fruit. We tried the Go-Go Green , kale cucumber green apple honey Dew etc . (No pulp ! Tasted Great)  Plenty of options on the menu and I mean plenty!  I've had  a hard time choosing all 3 times I've gone.  The Avo-Veggie Benny is what I think I'll try next !  I've tried the chilaquiles with a steak and they were great but you better come with an appetite for steak and eggs.  This last time I went I ordered chicken and French Toast. It's not on the menu but I requested they switch out the waffles with the toast.  They went to the back and asked and it was a problem. score !  The Salmon Lox omelette we ordered turned out to be a home run as well. Some words I've heard from my peers when going to Rise n Shine was "I'm so glad we came here" "this was a good choice" etc. the service has been good when I've gone on my 3 visits. Like most breakfast spots this place will get busy so come ahead of time before you are hungry ! Or wait after the rush! It's a descent size place with a patio and has its own unique decor , the inside almost gives me an Alison Wonderland Betsey Johnson type vibe lol . Good job guys. I'll be back.

D4isYBl6IqNqRp_XmT8Kyw.text: First time here and I'm kicking myself for not coming in sooner! The ultimate steak and eggs were awesome! Steak was seasoned and cooked perfectly, and the Cup o Bread with the cream cheese sauce was delicious as well. Also amazing service from the entire staff. One of the cooks made sure I was enjoying my food since I was sitting at the counter, and Amberly was very friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu giving me great recommendations. Can't wait to return!

AB64NtM2KUa3kMO4gRIevw.text: We were looking for a fun place to have a late breakfast and we found it!!  The decor, the menus, and the servers outfits all make the ambiance of the restaurant very fun and inviting and remind you of just waking up and rolling out of bed to have breakfast at a friend's cabin.  The one think you have to order is the pot of bread. It's not really a pot, it's like a cinnamon roll made in an espresso cup and comes to you warm and gooey. They also serve it with homemade cream cheese sauce to dip it in and that is one step away from heavenly goodness! So yummy, don't miss it!!  We ordered chilaquiles and chicken and waffles and we really only needed to order one or the other. The portions are incredibly large so be prepared and come with your appetite.  The other thing they do that goes above and beyond the norm, they warm their maple syrup up!!! Oh yes, you read that correctly -- warm maple syrup...it changes everything!!  Oh and if you're new to the restaurant, the server will take you on a tour of the menu!!! How adorable is that!?!?!?   I would most definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilaquiles are enough for the family

7POnmB4x9OVgYni-a63caA.text: This was my favorite breakfast place.   My steak was Always perfection, it melted in your mouth, and the staff was professional and funny.   So, we arrived at 10:30 am and we wait 10 minutes or so before we could sit and order.  Our food came out around 11:30 am.  We came at the same time as several large parties and I think our order just kept getting pushed back.  My over-medium steak was charred to a crisp and easily half the size of my normal steak.  I didn't want to wait for another steak I was hangry.  And the last time I asked the Owner a question she was snappy and rude.   So I am going to take my $45 elsewhere. The server told us we should review the service, not the steak on Yelp.

LRGGbxBLNub9Umt8Hkj5hg.text: Nice place for breakfast. Good fresh juices. Service is excellent. But there's nothing about the food that sets them apart from any other breakfast joint. I liked it. If I'm on that side of town again I'd go back.

P-Tsr7F76Y-ZTMvJP3o7ug.text: it was our first time at rise n shine.. after failed attempt to eat at another diner near by. amberly was friendly and very helpful with the menu. our 8 yr old son enjoyed and finished an order of their egg benedicts to himself!

NFghWYWhiA4GGemE7aigow.text: This probably my favorite breakfast place in all of vegas. Their portion size is huge but they don't  compromise quality of the food. I tried their ribeye steak breakfast combo. (Came with two eggs and hash potatoes). I also had the classic cut French toast with watermelon juice. Big space and cozy vibe. Great friendly staff and service as well! I will def come back. Best breakfast in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8JuqLaNoXhf-gl0x1tAtkg.text: Had an amazing yet simple breakfast today. First off the wait staff was great.  My server was Amberly she was amazing always so helpful and positive.  Just had the 3 egg breakfast and took Amberly's advice and went with the turkey kielbasa and dam was she right about that.  The meal was great I was there by myself and never felt rushed to get out.  This is one of the few places I will eat breakfast at.  Can't wait to return

bPMyr9BpSnjBESmYp0DkWQ.text: Excellent breakfast spot! I was inspired to try it after seeing it in my news feed with a well deserved "review of the day". Yelp did NOT steer me wrong! I did not understand having steak for breakfast until recently trying chicken fried steak for the first time. I now get the magical combination of eggs and steak, especially if the steak is dressed in crispy batter and smothered in delicious gravy :) That is what I had here. The country fried steak with eggs and hash, pancake, cup of bread, and fresh carrot-green apple juice. Sounds like a lot? It definitively was! I was full for the entire day AND had half left for breakfast the next day. I don't think any chicken friend steak  will be as good as the first one I had but at Rise & Shine it came pretty darn close. I enjoyed the sausage gravy and appreciate being served two cups of it, one is never enough. The potato hash was nice and crispy on the outside and eggs were made as I wanted them, over easy.  My honey wanted the Ultimate steak and egg breakfast but with New York cut instead of ribeye. Accommodating his request, presented no problem and he loved his meal. He also had an everything bagel on the side (greedy!) that was fresh and yummy. We shared an old fashion pancake, large enough to have as a breakfast on it's own, moist and fluffy - really delicious. I also really enjoyed the cup of bread, it's kind of like a cinnamon roll in a cup with warm cream cheese frosting on the side. Really yum. The fresh squeezed juice paired perfectly with glorious breakfast we had.  Aside from great food, our server was sweet and accommodating. I appreciate the ability to customize and add what ever you want. The restaurant has a charming decor, with flowers everywhere. Wonderful, care free experience at Rise & Shine.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country fried steak, New York steak and eggs? Old fashion pancake on the side
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge old fashion pancake
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York steak with eggs and hash

qo26KW-TJQvgtGL7LJUUyg.text: Really great food and good service! Wait was super long but only cause it was Mother's Day

WSf9ZIWcRc_NKzBU7UqRGA.text: Here now, just had brunch. Food was fantastic and our server Amberly was even better. Will definitely be back.

M0D4h9Uto9lIAgXCl-CQFw.text: After I went to the gym once a month, this is my favorite "hang-out" place to grab unlimited coffee. I would say it is a little bit pricey place for breakfast but the quality of food and ambiance is great! I love how the servers wear pajamas that makes me want to work with them. Definitely will suggest to locals or tourist who will get to travel to that area.

-dUCVxg-P5hgmz80Q07VCg.text: 5 stars. Hands down! My boyfriend & I went here on a Sunday morning, very crowded & we were told it would be a 20-25 minute wait. We were seated within 10 minutes. Customer service was very friendly & loved that their work attire was pajamas.   Everything was delicious! Pancakes, coffee, OJ, eggs Benedict, cup of bread. Loved it all & can't wait to go back. One of the best egg Benedict I've ever had. Overall great experience, spacious restaurant that is conveniently located, great atmosphere with pretty cool decor.

OHmh777hB-Gp4_bJtodiyg.text: Second time coming now and we'll definitely be back again. The cinnamon crunch French toast is great and the hash browns are to die for. I think it's the only reason we plan on coming here more often besides the waitresses and waiters in pajamas.  Definitely well worth the wait in line also.

a8kNMC7lmL7Zm5zZZS9fiQ.text: Yum yum yum! Cute breakfast joint, nice staff, good music, and bomb food! Almost anything on the menu I hear is too die for. I usually go with the breakfast platter offering a ham steak and theirs does not disappoint! The ham steak is a little saltier than what I am used to but still delish! Also don't miss out on fresh squeezed juices they are amazing!!!!

mxBej0vnOYP-IidZ0_cDBQ.text: My first time here I ordered the ribeye steak and eggs with my steak temperature being medium rare. When my food came to the table, it was made as requested if not better than I had asked for and it was so good that I had to come back for it again. Unfortunately the second time I ordered the ribeye steak and eggs the steak was absolutely terrible. As the first time I came in, I ordered my steak at a medium rare temperature and my steak came out completely burnt. I tried to use A1 sauce for my steak but because it was so burnt the A1 sauce couldn't take out the charcoal taste. I wasn't able to take another bite of my food because I was so disgusted. Being a place for steak and eggs, it's definitely not living up to the name and I'm definitely not going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a6d14qjTP1mDVM9pwEt8Ag.text: The steak and chilaquiles were amazing. The services was great, my server Ashley was super friendly. I recommend this place and will definitely return.

QkFyN5Z7Nd1ZG72rqDmH0g.text: There are two main reasons im giving this place such a low rating. 1. Being the food/prices &  2. Being the service.   I was very excited to try this place as I had seen it frequently on my drive to work.   Lets start off, I came here for the first time this past weekend. As soon as we were seated in our booth our waitress came to take our drink order, then headed off to get them, I ordered the watermelon strawberry juice, my sister got a Pepsi, and my mom orders the Green Juice. 10 minutes pass by and she is no where to be found, she finally comes with the Pepsi and 3 waters. My mom inquired about the juices and the waitress very rudely replies with "Yeah i dont know whats taking them so long" as she gestures towards the juice bar. So i asked her if she could go check for us if they were ready, and she gave me the death stare of a life time and replied with "UM YEAH I GUESS". She brings back the juices which are deceiving in picture on the menu, 5.25 for 8 oz of juice in a tall glass; what a rip off. After we got all our drinks it was time to order the food.    Im a sucker for Eggs Benedict, I ordered the Steak and Eggs Benedict bagel. When our food got to the table my Benedict sauce was coagulating and separating, and my moms sourdough toast was cold and stale as a brick. So I asked if I could have them bring me new sauce on the side, and new toast, the waiter rudely informed me that I would have to pay 2.95 for a tiny size of extra sauce. I tried to explain to him that it was already cold and separated, and he spoke over me saying "I cant control the temperature in here". Obviously that is not what I was trying to get through to him, so I just ordered the extra sauce and left it at that I was too hungry to go around in circles with him.   To say the least the quality of food was poor for the prices they were asking. The Benedict sauce was cheesy tasting and tasted as if it was out of a package. The eggs were snotty and slimy, poached eggs are supposed to have fully cooked whites and a runny center. The steak was charred to a crisp and when I brought it to the waitresses attention she said that it was because the base for their season steak rub is coffee grounds so it gives it a smokey flavor. This was not a smoky flavor this was completely burnt ash, and 40% of my steak was fat and gristle.  The french press coffee was bitter and gritty and tasted like nothing more than Folgers.    Asking for anything was like pulling teeth, both waiter and waitress gave us major attitude and made it known that we were an inconvenience to them. When it came time to pay up at the front the receptionist asked how our meal was and we were honest. She said "I appreciate your honesty and I will relay your feedback to the chef and the manager", in the most fake tone ive ever heard, and as soon as we started to turn our backs I saw her roll her eyes and shake her head towards our waitress like we had just been ridiculous and rude. Which we were not, we were very nice about everything.   I usually try to give places a second chance before i rate them but I dont think i will be returning. I dont like paying to be treated poorly when I ask for wrongs to be made right.   Summary: Overly priced low quality food and bad customer service.

7Jfy57kyRBdClwRnEsnxXw.text: Love LoVe LOVE this place ! Stacy is our favorite server ! She is always so wonderful and fun ! She always gets the order perfect and makes sure we are as happy as the last time ! Definitely recommend this for the start of your day !!! YUM ! Food is always cooked perfectly and if it isn't or you don't like it they will fix it ! OH ! And definitely try the Pot of Bread ! Sounds weird , I know ! WORTH TRYING FOR THE FIRST TIME ! If Stacy isn't there when you go , that's okay because everyone else is always so lovely as well !  Update: Braiden makes THE BEST lattes and coffees here !!! I love when he is working the juice bar because I know my drink is going to be so good !!! As always Stacy was amazing as well !! LOVE THIS PLAACCEEEE

jMxOehoUtkRE9v8_pgT5ig.text: Went for the first time today and it was really good food our waiter was Amberlee and she was very helpful with helping me find exactly what I wanted !

TzufRwTeANA2B4BDURU_RA.text: We stopped in a little bit ago to celebrate my nephews early birthday. We were greeted sweetly and seated quickly in a big comfy booth. The atmosphere is so dang cute, definitely "rise and shin-y" there's twirling umbrellas hanging from the ceiling, little metal roosters in the corner and lots of other eye catching sun shine-y decor. Our waitress came quickly and took our drink orders and our food at the same time because we were ready. She was so awesome! Our waters came out right after we ordered them and shortly after our carafe of freshly squeezed orange juice that was so divine! Nephew ordered the rise and shine burrito without any cheese, after the food runners brought out the food our waitress stopped by to see if everything was delivered and if there was any cheese at all on my nephews plate (he was so impressed because nobody ever asks) he said that it was absolutely delicious and the refried beans on the side were the best he's ever had, he practically licked his plate clean! my hubby and I shared a buffalo chicken (sauce on the side) with eggs and hash browns plate with a side of biscuits and gravy. There are Not enough compliments to describe this heavenly plate of food, perfectly seasoned, crunchy  and huge breast of chicken, thick cut yummy hash browns and perfectly fluffy scrambled eggs! The sausage gravy and biscuits were a perfect touch and we both left full and happy! Our cup o'bread didn't end up coming out with our food so our waitress brought us extra. They were so dainty and cute, fluffy and that cream cheese syrup dipper was amazeballs! Our waitress was never too far away if we needed her and it was probably the best customer service we've ever had at a restaurant! We will definitely be adding rise and shine to our regularly visited spots!

VApReG-qWh8GIgiegpkIDQ.text: Yummy food...  Exceptional service... We were greeted by our server Ashley immediately. Food was hott when it got to table, felt like a home cooked meal...

eUF6v6z4-lyAn0F3Jvyl_w.text: Nicole was amazing at Rise & Shine. She took her time explaining the menu and was very understanding with my son's allergy. Thank you for great service.

X9_5jLXis-EJGpLKNvZYJg.text: First time here, we were very impressed with the Ribeye Chilaquiles! Service was outstanding even though she was new. The french press coffee was nice and strong, plus they accidentally brought us free bread-in-a-cup with the icing. The ribeye was cooked perfectly, just melted with each bite. Chilaquiles were not soggy and not overly crunchy. I already want to come back to Vegas!

AW5cB61mztKQZ4s835DyAw.text: Kim was our server today and she was great. We had yogurt parfaits and they were made fresh. Really nice place to visit if you are from out of town and looking for that local and home town feel try this place.

AL6quy45UQJBvdPQJyUUGg.text: I've paid $50-100 for a ribeye on the strip, and that's just for the steak itself. At $15, this is the best steak n eggs I've experienced in Vegas. You also get eggs and PERFECTLY crusted hash browns (only thing better is to ask them to fry it on both sides). These little details are lost in a hurry in other local breakfast joints. Decaf coffee was weak (instant?). OJ was very fresh tasting, worth every penny. Service was friendly and top notch.

Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot o bread. Cool looking and not too sweet.

oPkTTY6pf7D4DYmpl4Rg7Q.text: Amberly provides great service on top of serving great food. The crew and I recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oExyztZD36PAguLz31IxXw.text: First time coming here and it was great!  We were seated quickly and received a friendly greeting from our server, Amberlee.  Since it was our first time, Amberlee made some menu recommendations then gave us ample time to review the large variety of choices. I had the Avocado Bagel Sandwich, which was HUGE, with fries, which were skinny, seasoned, and cooked crispy. My husband has the ribeye & eggs with the rub. He said it was very good and from his clean plate I'd say he'd order it again!  Amberlee was attentive throughout the meal (but not hovering), keeping the coffee cups full. She even made up a to go cup for my husband. Overall a great experience and we will be back soon!

UKa9DocSqPm4O0c_bZpqUA.text: The best steak for breakfast.  We ask to have it served with white rice and we love it.  Also the French press is amazing.

BEpwjLkHvMQUg6ELuikgFw.text: Hostesses are very sweet, our waiter was exceptionally nice and accommodating. Decor is adorable and brightened my mood.   The two of us had steak and eggs, fried steak and eggs, corned beef and hash red velvet pancakes and two sides of bacon. Everything from start to finish was amazing. Glad I found this spot :)   Will be back for more yummy yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ceiling fixtures are so cute!
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs, red velvet pancakes, fried steak and eggs, a side of corned beef and hash, all to die for.
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great regular coffee

E9CnbJozp2VlULjGw5Gm0Q.text: We had an amazing breakfast today! Ashley, our server, was so friendly and helpful. She helped pick out some really tasty coffees and was great at checking back if we needed anything. The food is pricey, but definitely worth it. You must try the steak (obviously) and eggs.

PvhrG57RgsqIvXKWpF5kNw.text: PRICEY!!!!! This is not a strip establishment. $12 on each menu item for breakfast? Unless you get the $7 oatmeal (it is not even a bowl, a cup and a quarter maybe?) It would be ok it the portions were large, but they are not.  Food is average. Sorry I am not into a $12 two egg, meat, potato, and toast then add a coffee for $2.95. $15 breakfast is excessive. Then a tip? How quickly you add up to $20 per person. No thanks, won't be back.

UMJ7YDizGoqtUDGhlG4khg.text: Food was a 4.  Not allergen friendly AT ALL. Hashbrowns are not GF. I don't understand since Hashbrowns are literally just shredded potatoes and maybe some seasonings or veggies. $1.95 for a fruit plate. It at least was a decent size rather than a cup of fruit you would get elsewhere. I had the steak and eggs w/fruit instead of potatoes, no toast due to allergy. I made note that my daughter and I would be sharing and we both have a dairy allergy, please use no milk or butter. I ended up having a mild reaction, so that made me unhappy. Otherwise, it's kind of hard to screw up steak and eggs- one of the more simple dishes. Husband had ham & egg Benny. He said it was good and the vinaigrette was unexpected but unnecessary (hollandaise and vinaigrette was overkill sauce wise ). He said Hashbrowns were burned on the top layer and not cooked through the middle. Service was a 2.  I wanted to like this place. I wanted to LOVE it. I did not. Our server couldnt have acted like she cared less that we were there. We sat for probably 7-9 minutes before coffee was brought out. Never were given water. Had to ask for extra utensils. She brought out coffee once right before our food was dropped and there was no refill. Never an ask if we wanted anything else (more coffee, to go cups). It was full but there were several servers on and it wasn't insanely busy.   It wasn't a spectacular experience. I don't expect much from breakfast joints- you go to breakfast out of convenience or leisure, not to really be wowed. I can just say that this place is probably not for me. Might try once more and hope for a better outcome.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute decor.

apCt0KFdJQJjGPWWvME9wA.text: The restaurant itself is fine, good ambiance and not too loud. The biggest problem is the slow service. Took forever to get food after ordering. And the order was wrong, but because of the delay we ate it anyway.

o4oPfwMhuFB8UGTrx0zIeA.text: Should of know to go somewhere else when the place was empty.  The service was great but the food was so bad. An egg white omelette should not look like a whole egg omelette over cooked. I just couldn't finish, we also had a Benedict that was just as bad the hollandaise sauce made the muffin soggy and it had balsamic or something sour you really shouldn't mix sour with creamy. The only thing I enjoyed was the pot of bread and the latte.

z0RHuAJDemr6euruYYVlCg.text: Nice place. Wait wasn't too bad but I felt the service could have been better. Had to repeat request for small things and the pot of bread was a lot smaller than I thought they would be. The food is delicious though.  Overall it's a place we can go to again.  I had the chicken egg white omelette and I tried the lox Benedict and buffalo chicken and eggs from the rest of my party..all were delicious. The red velvet pancake is yummy too.

jzQKeDBqI8bkYuB_67tszw.text: I love this place. Portions are not as big as Hash House , but this is so much better quality here. The flavors of every dish I've had are delicious. Today tried the Steak burger with Bacon , Mushrooms , and Swiss with Herb fries. The burger was ground Rib Eye. Amazing. One of the best burgers I've had. Have also tried the Steak and Egg Chilaquiles and the Steak and Egg Benedict with Spinch. Get the Coffee with your own personal French Press. I try to stop on here when I'm on this side of town. You will not be disappointed. The flaw is the restrooms need air freshner. A nasty smell of Sulphur and Rotten Eggs all throughout the restroom. Get some of those Air pump timed sprays or call Roto Rooter. Seriously !!!

fAodNjPlcAOUQYREliYpZg.text: Foods is great only reason I did not give 5 stars is that they do not serve alcohol..

KsHXnbmzvnYkR__3BN2_eQ.text: We wanted to try this place out since it is fairly new and we'd never been before. So this Sunday we decided to take the plunge and give it a chance.   First off, we went at 10:30 on a Sunday. Obviously, we are expecting a wait. We were told 25 minutes and they sat us pretty close to that time frame. We got a nice booth by a window. That was a pleasant surprise. One thing I noticed while waiting was the fresh juice station. That was a really neat touch and something you don't see often. It also helps swallow the $3.25 for a glass of apple juice.   So things were starting out pretty well. The menu is expansive. Lots of options. My dad ordered ham and eggs and my boyfriend and I ordered The Ultimate Steak and Eggs. We also ordered a stack of pancakes for all of us to share. Then, we waited. And waited. And waited. Again, understandable since we could see it was busy. Still waiting. At least 30+ minutes went by. Finally our server, Brody, came up to us and said, "Sorry for the wait on your meals but there was some confusion in the kitchen with your ticket." I can't stand this excuse. All that means to me is that our server forgot to ring in our food, our ticket was lost, or the kitchen messed something up. But please don't say that to me like we don't know what's going on. The best way to handle that situation is to say, "I'm sorry about the wait on your meals. I've notified a manager of the situation and we are working hard to get your good here as soon as possible. Let me grab your pancakes so you all have something to munch on." We were brought our bread. About 10 minutes later, our food arrived. One of us missing toast. And of course, not a pancake in sight. And no mention of them coming. So I told him to forget the pancakes. The hash browns were good. The steak was okay. None of it was stand out. I feel like I could have gotten this meal anywhere.   When we went to pay, we mentioned our disappointment to the cashier who also did nothing to try to remedy the situation. No manager came by to check on us. 40 minutes or more waiting for food is ridiculous. Even when you're busy. Most entrees come to your table within 20 minutes. The only reason I know any of this is because I've worked as a server in restaurants for over 5 years. This just wasn't a great experience because of the service. I'm happy to go elsewhere.

6ePQVrAJ5YMpgM5updpAbg.text: If an outstanding meal is what you are looking for then this is the place! Amazing Chris provided amazing service and the coffee was fantastic!

vxnAVxcqJDXb4PiA8qyyfg.text: Food was really good, service was good. We were seated promptly and they will let you have your dogs on the patio. We went on a Tuesday morning though so not many people were there. The watermelon and strawberry juice was great and they might have the best pancakes I've ever eaten... Didn't even need syrup. Would recommend but keep in mind the portions are huge.

ilQL-N7eevv7jVULt9WRNA.text: Was greeted immediately and with kindly by the hostess. The atmosphere is nice in there. Indoor and outdoor seating available. Menu at a a really good variety. I opted for the steak and eggs.... On point! Steak cooked how I like it. Was juicy and far from dry. They have this green healthy juice that has kale in it, that was really good too. With the fresh juice they offer, I wish they offered a flavored iced tea. But overall, great dining experience. Good service and food for the amount spent.

xjYf4MUcbXj4i_eHDQMbVw.text: Probably the best breakfast I've had in my whole life. We went there because they allow dogs on the patio, but now, I don't think I even want to try other breakfast places in the area. The pot of bread is one of a kind - I could eat the icing on its own!

1HBvL4dRmUkPso9hHUzGAw.text: First time, food was great. Service was good, lived the umbrellas... You must get the bread in a pot.

h6skZVQg5wIrb7TGa_ss5A.text: Everything food-wise was decent, nothing spectacular.  Our waitress was very nice, took extremely good care of us and tried to provide some recommendations from the menu.  We ordered the prime rib and eggs breakfast with scrambled eggs, hash browns and their cinnamon roll in a cup.  The steak was thin, overcooked but had a nice seasoned flavor.  The eggs were scrambled - easy enough.  Hash browns were pretty greasy.  The cinnamon roll in a cup was a nice touch.  Overall, an OK experience but I doubt I'll be rushing back.

Xl4Jbfw54Ev-FCI8YB8hfg.text: This place is GRUBBIN!! I highly recommend ordering something with a whole steak.. I got The Ulitmate. They're seasoned perfectly and really hit the spot. The French pressed coffee is bomb.com. And don't forget to order the pot of bread. Noms!

1GYUFn2sM8iXUxooFo_leg.text: I like this place. Thought i had reviewed before. Very good food, great service and nice breakfast spot feel.. i go there about once a month.

stkbJQY_BoPYngmLNrGrDA.text: This is the best breakfast spot I've been to in Vegas. There meat is not frozen, fresh delivered every morning! I've had the country fried steak and eggs and also the chicken and waffles. It would be impossible for me to compare the two because they are both fantastic. Highly recommend this place!

yGj2yoSjHWEqB15Z7JzoFA.text: My wife and I tried this place for the first time today.  We ordered the grilled chicken cobb salad and asked they hold the bacon, bleu cheese and the green onions.  When it came out there was almost nothing on it the chicken breast was maybe 4oz, there was supposed to be avocado and egg but there was none and for $13.95 it was not a good deal.

akv5YymuxNW0psN7Mq7S9A.text: This place is fantastic!! Food is beyond delicious and the staff is awesome. There's usually a wait, but don't be impatient.. It is worth the wait to get in. Hopefully they'll open the patio seating soon. I had the Spiced Ribeye Steak with chilaquilas (spelling) the steak was phenomenal... The only request is Bigger steaks!! Do not pass this place up. Be patient and get in.. You won't regret it!!!

vtADk3e5NVigB0FOhEPcPQ.text: This place was extremely crowded, which is always a good sign. The wait was about 15 minutes before we got our booth. So my husband ordered the crunchy French toast. It's made with the usual French toast ingredients with cinnamon toast and corn flake cereal, powdered with powder sugar with a whip cream topping. It was simply delicious! I ordered the chicken and waffles plate. I was excited to be having this plate since it is one of my favorite dishes but I really didn't like my plate. The chicken was bland and my waffle was extremely soggy. Needless to say I was disappointed with my dish. Now with this in mind, I was wondering if I'd give this place another shot. Let's just say if it wasn't for my husband's dish, my answer would've been no. Since his plate was delicious, I'd definitely would give this place another try but the chicken and waffle will definitely not be even considered.

QvX0VWTDG_PWIY1iRbmppA.text: Another very nice dining experience. Didn't make it until lunchtime, so went with something other than steak & eggs. The Cobb Salad comes with a generous helping of expertly prepared grilled chicken, as good as I've ever tasted, plus all the best fixins: bacons bits, chopped egg, blue cheese... good stuff!

WKfp4IH1CUiOP6zXkEBh4A.text: Dear diary,  Today I was hungry. So I went to ride and shine. It was good. I liked the food. Amber, she was cool. I hope I can come back again. Steve came but he left. Anyways...

sSxNcv7Zps8na81UyJA6Qg.text: New breakfast place! Heard about this place from a coworker. It's a bit of a drive from us but we made it after seeing the delicious Yelp photos. When I first saw it, I was thinking how big of a place it was. After we finally figured out how to get in, the decor was something else. The staff wore pajamas, there were rotating flowers hanging from the ceiling, there were paintings of farm animals. It was very interesting.   Talk about the portions! I ordered Chicken Avocado Bacon sandwich. Price was about $9 and it was so big. The chicken comes grilled or crispy. I decided on crispy and it definitely had a kick to it. It was spicy but the right amount of spice. Comes with skinny fries, my favorite.   The beau got the ultimate steak and eggs. Comes with 3 eggs (or you can order it with 2), hash browns and a large portion steak. The beau really loved the flavor. It tasted like it was cooked in the grill at a BBQ. The toast was even so good and it came out with whipped butter! Bomb!   We ordered iced Italian roast coffee. It was pretty good but I think next time I'm going to get caramel roast coffee.   Can't wait to come back and try other items on the menu. This place looks promising!

nRhqpDPIiiGgNUUyuV6oTQ.text: I LOVE this place and of all the restaurants in the city, I always come back here. The menu is varied and everything I've eaten, they've done brilliantly! The portion sizes are very generous, the eggs are delicious, the hash brown is so good and we love the French Press. Some of the beat coffee in the city! Come with an appetite though! You won't be disappointed!

_sLMvW56lQYuGAXrFGbeDg.text: Food was delicious I order the "Ultimate Steak and Eggs" and our Server Devyn was EXCELLENT...!!!!! I will come back for sure :):)

AZFzFz54hp_VBju7-WZ6bA.text: Stay away unless you like servers with attitudes and you have all day to wait. Got seated fairly quickly and got coffee and water. Placed order food and drinks are very pricy. Placed not packed so expected food in 20 minutes. After an hour of sitting without our server coming by i asked another server where our food was. She replied in a condescending time that she was not out server and just walked away. I threw 10 to cover the coffee and juice and we left. I will never stop at a rise and shine again. I see why the staff wears their pajamas. It takes them hours to get your food. Avoid like the plague.

onDmNw7Z3dxLgl8ehNbKIQ.text: The only time I'll rise & shine early on a weekend is if a hearty breakfast is involved!   This place has become one of my favorite breakfast places here in Vegas. Especially on a Sunday, don't be surprised if there's a 30+ minute wait. But... it's totally worth it!  The servers uniform are PAJAMAS!! So, you know it's a cool & fun place. And the food is Deeeeeelicious!!   The Country Fried Steak: Good! The Steak n Eggs: Good! The Pot of Bread: Good!  The portion sizes are massive as well, so I'd recommend sharing so you can try different things =)

DRmhs6yBkHjddoZuQ8JPOg.text: My family and I ate here and the food is delicious! I ordered the Cinnamon Toast Crunch French toast and it was to die for. My mom ordered their signature steak...she loved it! My sister ordered the same thing I ordered and we both wished we had bigger stomachs to eat more. I will be eating here as frequently as I can!

R4OeLx7SwHiWreNIrSS1SQ.text: It's was decent, I had the chicken and waffles... waffle was fluffy but the chicken didn't have any flavor. Great portion and orange juice was fresh squeezed. A bit on the high priced side too.

MYdRWnnQ6VnwNzZOzDVLSg.text: Food is amazing and the overall look of the restaurant is great! They also had so many options on the menu. The service was pretty good, but definitely thought our server could've been a little better. But, I thought the servers being able to wear pajamas was so cute, love it!

GtG_Hnj-DWxr_taDuUgW4g.text: I just really had a taste for eggs and hashbrowns and didn't feel like making it myself. So I decided to try this place that I drive by oh so often.   I love that they have outdoor seating. The food and service were fine. It wasn't expensive but nor was it cheap. I would make a return visit.   Although, I couldn't understand why the wait was so long while they seemed to simultaneously have a number of empty tables.

fdcT7EPYwEIRtsWoa14Huw.text: Excellent service All around , from the moment we walk in , until the moment we drove away .. the food was AMAZING. Nicole was our server and she was amazing , our food was worth way more than we paid , we had no issues what so ever .. loved there pajama theme , Lattes were amazing . Steaks were juicy and tender ! Everything was great ..! You have to come here ! Thank you again Nicole ! We came all the way from Houston Texas

j0hZMv8o20Zsvi_1-w58PA.text: Good food and great juice drinks. This is a fun place to grab breakfast. The pancakes are HUGE!! The chicken fried steak was good. Enough to share for sure!!

q0ClFckdue8-htiNEIu1Gw.text: This has been one of my favorite breakfast places to go in Vegas. Eggs Benedict is always my go to dish and Rise & Shine has never let me down with their various forms of it. They add balsamic vinegar to the top of the hollandaise which makes it rich and delicious! This most recent time my hash browns were  a little too crispy but still tasted great.  The staff is always speedy and friendly as well.  This place is almost always busy but if you're willing to sit on the shaded patio, you can usually skip the wait.   There are plenty of good places to grab breakfast in the city, but make sure to check out Rise & Shine, as you'll probably also add them to your short lost of favorite breakfast places.  And don't forget to share a cup o' bread with the table while you're there!

9A-lrI7xvJhbQYyjQzgiJA.text: I was not a fan. We couldn't even figure out where to enter. They need better signage.  As we walk in, we were seated right away. My hubby and I order the rib eye steak chilaquiles and it just wasn't that great. It lacked flavor that I only had a few bites before I didn't want any more.   One thing I did like is that they had cool socks at the front of the store. I did purchase a pair.

ogTGyymQVNcsjscJScYisA.text: I have been trying eggs Benedict all over town and now have a favorite. The Avo-Veggie eggs Benedict was amazing. I could eat it every day. The eggs were cooked to perfection and still hot. The avacado was mashed so it didn't slide all over and just the right amount of hollandaise. The balsamic drizzle sent it over the top.  My only disappointment was my soda was flat. But not a big deal.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L9BT1_LAebzHZbRwkndzAQ.text: If you like a hearty breakfast, Rise & Shine is your place.  I stopped by the Flamingo location to give their red velvet pancakes a try. The parking and entrance set up are confusing.  The parking is on the side and behind the building.  There's a sign directing you to a ramp but I found it easier to walk through a section of parking lot.  Once inside, I was seated quickly.  The dining room is spacious and has all kinds of great eye candy hanging inside.  I believe this building used to house Joe's Crab Shack and they've done a great job of making you forget that.    The menu is huge.  Every breakfast food imaginable is on the menu.  My server (male, forgot his name) was wonderful.  He was busy with many other tables but always kept my drink filled and made sure I was completely happy with my meal.  The red velvet pancakes were monster sized!  I'd guestimate that each piece was easily the size of a frisbee.  There were three pieces.  I wasn't crazy about their cream cheese dressing as it tasted like it had a hint of cinnamon in it.  Their warm fresh maple syrup was delicious on its own, but a little sweet for this particular pancake which were dusted in powdered sugar and contained chocolate chips.  I'd definitely recommend this place for breakfast lovers, large groups, and anyone who is in the mood to try something new.

uiif1nv9Kd7z2yjha5AieQ.text: I've been here several times and this is a great breakfast spot I love. I always get their pigs on a bagel but take off the ham and banger and then I live their fresher squeezed juice. The watermelon and strawberry is my favorite. I wish that they would give me more though because there are no free refills. Their pancakes are also good but be careful when ordering them because they are huge! I'm sure one person can share one pancake. Also their bread in a cup is always warm and delicious. Everytime I have come here I don't think I have waited anymore than 30 minutes. Services is usually pretty fast.

3iOFQTGwNBWjlsg69EJ6lw.text: I actually had to come twice before I wrote this review.  I try to keep my reviews as focused on the food as possible, but this one will be little bit different.   I'll start by saying the place itself looks really cool!  The vibe is super chill, big space, and all those fans on the ceiling add a unique spirit to the place.   The food (breakfast burrito, hash brown, chikilitas and more) was good! The right combination between breakfast and brunch place with a touch of Mexican flame to it.   The one thing I didn't like, and most likely will make me not come back will be the service. Not that it was bad, it was ok, but honestly I expect more than just ok from a place like this. Bottom line it seemed like the servers (all of them) give you the feeling like they're doing you a favor. The servers dress in Pajamas which is a cool concept, but honestly I didn't appreciate their moody tone of voice like they just got out of bed.   Trust me, I know food! And good service too :)

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito and hash browns

FKlNSsOnIzICXf45IOSO0Q.text: Wow!  The name says "a Steak & Egg Place" and it's legit.  This is how you do steak and eggs, and how you create a place to enjoy eating.  Let's start with the service:  the hostess greeted my wife and I as we walked in and had us seated immediately, offering us a choice of seats:  booth, table, outdoor.  Our waitress (Chelsea) was right there with us but never in the way or overbearing.  Drinks were ordered and delivered quickly and we were given time to look over the menu--the pretty large menu!  All the usual breakfast options were there, along with a real variety of steak options.  I had the Steakhouse Omelet and was pleased when Chelsea asked me how I wanted my steak cooked.  I've had steak and eggs in a number of places over the years, but it's oddly uncommon that you get a say in how the meat is prepared.  I ordered medium and it came out perfect.  (The picture I posted didn't really do it justice).  The omelet was fluffy and full of generous amounts of everything the menu said would be in there.  My wife had the "Two-Fisted Bagel& Egg Sandwich" and it was put together and presented just as well as my order.  Be warned though, you might want to eat this breakfast sandwich with a fork and knife.  You can pick it up with two fists, but there might be spillage.  A few of the little things that make a nice place even better:  the cream for your coffee is fresh and comes out in a creamer rather than the more common bowl of plastic half & half containers just sitting on the table.  Water and other beverages are served in glasses, made of glass.  Each table also has a tray with salt and pepper, and a solid assortment of the more popular condiments and sauces that go well with steaks and eggs.  The restaurant interior is cool too.  Umbrellas for light fixtures, a sort of at-home feel to the tables and chairs, and a waitstaff that serves you in their pajamas.  I originally thought it might be little awkward, but it actually works to set a very comfortable environment.  Keep in mind, it's been our experience that it's hard to get in without a long wait during peak breakfast/brunch hours on the weekends.  That's because it's that good.  But if you're able, head over on a weekday and treat yourself without the wait.  Finally, ample outdoor seating and a military discount (present your ID when you pay) locks in my high score for this fine addition to the local breakfast scene on the westside.  Go and enjoy.  Your mouth will be happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Spice-Rubbed Ribeye Steak Chilaquiles.  My steak was cooked medium and the eggs over easy.  Wonderful!
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Philly Cheesesteak Bagel Sandwich. Knife and fork required!
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is how to do steak &amp; eggs!  The Steakhouse Omelet.

nps0_imv6nqOgo1wrMO_zg.text: This place is absolutely amazing. I'm visiting Las Vegas and came across this place to eat breakfast. Nicole went over the entire menu with my family and I which was awesome and her customer service was phenomenal. She made me feel like a regular which I appreciated. If you are in town this is a must have.

MIUz23QgSd0-hm7H9OHLCA.text: The entrance to this place is a bit confusing. You'd expect it to be somewhere facing the parking lot, which there is a ramp for handicapped access, but the main entrance is around to the back facing the freeway. As I walked in, I noticed right away that the dining area is very open and spacious, with high ceilings and a variety of seating arrangements. On a Saturday morning at 9am, we were seated immediately. Not bad.  The hostess seemed to be in training. We followed her to our table and the entire time, she kept looking at someone else to make sure she picked the right table. I would've appreciated a more personal greeting and some eye contact. The server was better, refilling coffee every few minutes and checking to see if everything was okay.   The menu was very confusing. I expected to see STEAK & EGGS, yet the first thing I noticed was an entire column dedicated to freshly squeezed juices. What? Apparently they have a full service juice bar in the corner. Graphically, the menu itself uses a hundred of different fonts and it just makes things look busy; nothing really leads your eye to their very small selection of actual steak & eggs.  I opted for the loco moco. I always like to try loco moco from places because there is usually a unique spin on it. I know what the traditional loco moco tastes like, so trying something new is always fun. What this place does is they use a ribeye patty and a "gravy-yaki" gravy. IMHO, I am not a fan of the gravy. I like regular brown gravy and teriyaki sauce separately, but in this attempt at combining the two just totally took away from the overall simplicity of what a loco moco "should" be. In terms of taste, it's almost there, but not quite. I think it needs another pop of flavor to tie everything together. The ribeye patty, on the other hand, was cooked to medium-rare perfection. Props to the chef in that regard!  The payment process was such a mess. It's awkward enough that they verbally ask you how much you'd like to tip on the card, but the way the girl handled the receipts and not being sure which receipt to hang on to and such just put the cherry on top of an overall, awkward experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco. Not like your typical Hawaiian loco moco, but not totally bad either. The sauce is some kind of teriyaki gravy.

jLb5NxDxnqWvSoCKM8QSCw.text: Wake up! It's time for breakfast!  Well that was how Cesar Q. and I felt this morning.  We've seen the pictures and all the reviews so it was time for some steak and eggs!  The location is great and very convenient.  Just off the 215 and Flamingo.  It's in the old Joe's Crab Shack building.  The ambiance is bright and the building is huge so lots of comfortable space.  We sat inside at a 4 top table but noticed the awesome outdoor dining once we had already ordered.    I never ever order chicken fried steak!  However, after seeing the incredible pictures posted by my fellow yeeps I took the plunge!  I orders that which I never order and I liked it! I'm sure my hips will appreciate it too.  My meal came with a choice of eggs and bread.  It was also served with the home fries that were truly amazing! I just may swing by for an order of these yummy little carbs all by themselves! They are that good!  Anyway I selected scrambled eggs and to my disappointment they were from a carton, not fresh scrambled eggs!  When your at a restaurant that specializes in breakfast one would expect fresh cracked eggs.  I opted for the biscuit as my bread choice.  It was just ok. The gravy that came with my chicken fried steak tasted homemade.  I really enjoyed it.    On a side note, it was really nice having all the sauces on the table so I didn't have to ask.  Not only was that convenient they also had cholula!  So many times places only have tobasco! YUCK!  There was also ketchup and a-1 steak sauce.  The service was efficient yet our waitress didn't seem "happy".  She was ok but did not give us the feeling that she enjoyed her job. I do feel it took a long time for our meal to come out (25 minutes) however my husband did order a steak with his eggs that were over cooked.  He did mention that the steak was great!  I felt comfortable as the staff was wearing their PJ's.  Pretty cool concept!    I opted for the 4 star rating as all in all the meal was quite good.  If I could have done 3.5 I would have.  Would have preferred fresh cracked eggs.  I will be back for some of their coffee and those damned potatoes! I'm still thinking about them!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge ass chicken fried steak! Tasted good.  Potatoes were awesome.  Eggs were from a carton

I wish there was a location in the northwest side of Vegas!  Portions are humongous, that's probably why it's a bit pricey. I love their freshly squeezed orange juice. "Cup o bread" is a MUST! I could eat 10 of those. I've tried many dishes here and they're all pretty tasty.

The kids had cinnamon toast crunch/ yogurt / strawberries /bananas.  Fast friendly service.  Will come back, the menu is full of yum yums
