lxINxSsWEWiti8f6Qieeig.text: First time here, love breakfast, so it's been open now for a few weeks/months? Thought we'd try it, arrived 8am, they open at 7am. Several tables outside and a few more inside with early risers.   We get a table and begin looking over the menu and I notice the servers are in PJ's, kinda weird? Any way we place our drink orders, they have the usual but have added some ice coffee's, juices and smoothies!   I am a big fan of omelets and of course I go for the fancy steakhouse omelet, tenderloin  steak, cooked your way, cheese, mushrooms, onions and spinach with a bernaise sauce, hash browns and choice of toast or pot of bread.  I usually get toast but today I tried the pot if bread, warm, cinnamon smelling good, but only the top done, inside the cup, 'it's RAW' as Gorden always says!  My steak omelet was really good, steak cooked perfect and the lemony bernaise was so good.  My husband enjoed his spicy rub ribeye chiliquilies, and we shared a short stack red velvet pancake! It was all very good.   Service was good, food was good and reasonable priced, but they should work on the doughy pot of bread.

Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AUIwshycjOYtEU01ldapkQ.text: During my Sunday morning bike rides, I had seen that Rise & Shine was opening a new location close to where I live.  I had been to the original one and I wanted to try this.  I was going to stop the week before but remembering it was Mother's Day and I knew the place would be slammed, I waited a week to go.  I went inside and had my name put on the list and requested a patio table.  When I was taken outside, I was told to pick any place I wanted.  I chose a two top in the sun.   I was left a menu and as I looked at it, my server stopped by and asked about coffee.  I ordered the French press coffee which says 2 cups.  It yielded three plus.  I ordered the S'mores waffle.  It was a waffle with some marshmallow fluff, chocolate syrup, whipped cream, and some Chex cereal for the graham cracker.  With the waffle I was served warm maple syrup with some cinnamon sticks infusing the syrup and two small cups of soft butter.  The waffle was good but I was expecting more marshmallow and less whipped cream, and Chex cereal is not really a good replacement for graham cracker.  Some squares of real graham cracker would have been better.  Service was good but I must note that I don't understand the seating problem this place seems to have.  Evidently, one person write names down, where the person requests to sit, and then hands off the person with a menu to one person who seats people coming in.  The patio was 1/3 full, the interior was about the same, and yet I waited for about 5 minutes before being shown outside.  It just seems like an inefficient system and when they're busy, I can understand the reason for the backup.  One note, if you ride here on your bike--yeah, I know, few of you will--you can lock it up using the boards on the ramp going to the entrance as the anchor for your cable and lock.  I'm glad I tried the new place.  I won't be a regular.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yelp shirt on busser.
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French press.
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The building.

DLesLRirm-Dl1Q0fPBLGwQ.text: Our first time at "Rise & Shine. Our server Amberlynn was ABSOLUTELY amazing, I highly recommend you ask to be seated in her section. Definitely returning b4 leaving back home.

meS1W1dBgRfmvW36751usg.text: Totally Enjoyable Breakfast Experience!  It started with our charming server Sammie, extremely nice, accurate, and inviting!   On Sammie's suggestion I had the Strawberry Watermelon juice which was light, a little sweet and delicious.   Then, being torn between breakfast and a steak, I ordered the ribeye chilaquiles. The Steak was very well seasoned and perfectly cooked. The chilaquiles were very enjoyable.   Once my watermelon juice was delivered the piece of watermelon attached to the glass fell off onto the table. Sammie was beside herself, then came back with a plate full of watermelon replacement pieces! This is the kind of dedication to the customer that creates repeat visitors-and deserves this type of review.   Congratulations "Rise and Shine" is a big WINNER!  Cheers!

sgA1GM9ZdXJvmD81X16BZQ.text: Fatty steak, but cooked as I wanted.  Hostess was not friendly.  Seemed to look through me or around me and I just wanted a table for 1. Best part was my waitress, Sammie.   Blonde from Great Britain, friendly and attentive.

sUzPqM8nSg7EYJJ5Y5JhSQ.text: My family and I walked in around 1pm a few days after they opened and we were seated promptly.   The restaurant is very large, unlike many other breakfast spots in town, so I was already pleasantly surprised. The decor is fun with spinning flowers dangling above the dining area and fun pictures to admire on the walls.  For my entree I decided on the fried chicken breast and waffles while my mom and fella both opted for different versions of the chilaquiles. As a last minute decision we ordered a pot o bread when we saw a bunch of them come out of the kitchen for another table, tempting us.   Service was slow to start, but I cut them some slack since they just opened and are finding their groove. It got better and more attentive as the meal progressed.   Our food came out and the portions were enormous, making me wish we had shared. My chicken breast eclipsed my waffle on my plate and I wish they had not places the chicken on top of the waffle since the heat seemed to make the waffle limp and a little mushy. The flavor of the waffle was good but the chicken wasn't as good as I expected. It was cooked well but the flavor of the batter seemed off. It had a spicy kick but still seemed very bland and had a starchy aftertaste that I didn't care for.  My mom and fella raved about their chilaquiles and after sampling them I can't say I agree. The temperature seemed a bit on the colder side and the cheese wasn't entirely melted. The steak that came with my fella's meal was a little over cooked and the seasoning was a bit overdone. He loved his dish, so I guess that's all that matters. The pot of bread was awful, I don't recommend this at all. It was dry and flavorless. I took a bite and left it alone.   Overall, the service was good and the food was hit and miss. My family loved the meal so we will likely be back, but I will be sure to sample a different dish next time and hope for the best.

zn1XuMrIhAya8_MxIthbXg.text: This experience is definitely a lot better than the last..  Shocked it isn't packed, seeing as how it's New Year's day.  Got sat right away. Our server, Roy, did an amazing job taking care of us. I ordered the California Turkey bagel sandwich with the turkey and bacon on the side (vegetarian) and added grilled onions, which came with fries, and the bf ordered a Belgium waffle. My sandwich was huge, and tasted delicious. However, there were barely any grilled onions :( he enjoyed his waffle, and ordered a French press, that was tasty. I hadn't been here in a while and forgot they drown EVERYTHING in parsley, and my fries were covered in it, which destroyed the taste.  Only 4 stars for the parsley and skimpy toppings, everything else 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soooo frickin delicious

AgXtvzxjh77DAWKLfa5ZCQ.text: I'm very disappointed to give 1 star and really want to give 1 star, but because I frequent here and normally is a 4 star joint! Took my family here visiting from out of state, took forever to get coffee & water. There were no straws given to us. Had to look at our waitress just to get napkins and straws. Ordered the same thing, the ultimate steak and egg, medium well and eggs scrambled soft. Got my food and had a overly super duper cooked steak!. I was hungry too! So it goes back and the waitress brings just the eggs and hash browns & says, I didn't want you to be hungry! . I ordered my food at the same time.. They bring me out a bloody a$$ steak! Yo!! I'm done, so may I get a box, I'll go home and cook it myself. No manager, no anything came over. 19 minutes later, still sitting here with no box, had to ask for coffee again. So the tip game is a wrap! I always tip at least $15! Sad to say, I won't be back, nor bring anyone I know here. **At least my brother's food was good- He said***

_NlXpj6eIjCcW_v_qxumhQ.text: I like the interior. I can definitely see the joes crab shack DNA under the new decor. They took the Joes decorations off the walls but they didn't change the floorplan or walls at all. It was very busy during our visit and everyone seemed to b loving it. Our waiter was fantastic, friendly and quick. Unfortunately my tea tasted like toilet water. It was so horrible that I had to order a new drink after one sip. I had an omelet with wheat toast. The toast was simultaneously burnt and cold. My omelet was fine.   (Seat check) we had to clean old food from our own seats before sitting down.  They have no breakfast sausage at all. They only offer banger sausage which is more like a bratwurst. I thought this was really weird.   The very appealing looking pot of bread was described to us as a cinabun mixed with fresh baked bread. We're not fans. It tastes like regular bread with a hint of cinnamon.  Although the food was very underwhelming I will probably give them one more chance in the future. The problem is there are 4 or 5 fantastic breakfast places near me who always get it right.

FiglZHHl2rX7IuXWgKloBA.text: This place is so weird. On one hand you have their steak, especially the ribeye, which is absolutely perfect every single time. It's amazing, and worth coming here by itself. Actually, most of their food is good, and the coffee is great.  But the HASH BROWNS... they're HORRIBLE!! I don't get it! It's like they're marinated in dish soap or something. Every single time we've been here (seriously, the streak is crazy good), we've hoped the hash browns have changed. Nope. I don't know what they use to flavor it, but food goes to waste every time.  They're so.... weird. And leave a weird aftertaste. But again, the other stuff we've had (loco moco, omelettes, cup o bread, that amazing ribeye etc.) has all been good. Just please do something about those hash browns. Did I mention the hash browns taste weird?

70AU_EDagqCqpi2gD0ma5A.text: Excellent  service and friendly staff. Food was perfect and fast. Definitely my new place to eat breakfast in vegas.

I4g9QImTq_77ZPkY02ygMw.text: Don't bother.   The much touted pot of bread is a waste.  It is really a dinner roll stuffed in a very small cup with cinnamon and a little side of sour tasting frosting.  Our pot was stale and over heated in the microwave until it was so tough one could not chew it. Similarly, biscuits were hard, heavy and leaden - not worth the calories.  Service - fair at best.  We had the ever-disappearing waitress who never came back except to drop off the check.   Too many other breakfast places that are good to return here.

ABs2crxEnn8OUdV9f3vWRA.text: The food is good, and the place is decorated nicely; it's a really cute idea. However, the execution is not up to par. My family and I went once before during the soft opening and it took almost 3 hours to get seated have food and pay then bill. Not a great first experience. But we decided to try it again. The wait wasn't as bad, but the service was definitely lacking. It felt very unmanaged. There were three hostesses(doing nothing) and one person cleaning up tables(very slowly). There is a serious lack of structure as the waiters were all over the place, very frantic and not very friendly. Our waitress couldn't even take our whole order at once. She had to do drinks and then food. She seemed very incompetent. And the pajama uniforms are just ridiculous. Maybe if they all matched that might look okay, but otherwise it's very unappealing. I seriously doubt we will ever go back.

YV30z17AfYtJrL8PV9wz-g.text: Average at best, too long of wait for both table and food. Food is good but not worth the wait.

xcpR92djNjxf5GYUFKbrvA.text: First time and experience was great! Ashley was our server and she was very nice! Recommended a few options and helped us decide on our meal. Salmon Benedict was delicious! My friend ordered a pot of toast with her meal and the kitchen was out, but Ashley made sure to bring one out before we left. Service was great and we will back!!  Thank yo

_03IbJ5Vo1N0O7hdZ4StrA.text: Overall, we preferred the Southern Highlands location of Rise and Shine in terms of access, service and quality.  The Flamingo location is difficult to access for anyone with a handicap.  The food is average and does not reflect the prices when compared to comparable menus at other restaurants.  Service was less than average when we were there on a weekday, mid-morning.

yNwa1fytW63ME5cbZvEVrA.text: Very good quality.  Food was very flavorful.  Serving size is excellent!  They did have a little trouble with scramble soft eggs.  But everything was so good, the eggs didn't matter.  Oh yeah the fresh juice options are great!  Will definitely return.

aTPfrJHZvMIQhEbxHJWWmA.text: Horrible service, got in around 11:45 tons of tables open still waited a good 5 mins to be seated. Indoors were incredibly cold, we decided to move towards the outdoors seating. Waited to even get water to the table, had to go inside myself and get silverware. Over 45 mins later looking around for our food, we were told the large parties food just got pushed out ours will be next. & the prices are rather high for an off the strip breakfast place.

WdAWuefrgirc8JVsSJ4wfA.text: I was really expecting a lot from this place and came out feeling very disappointed. To start, I could t believe how long we had to wait to get seated. We waited roughly about an hour for our party of three to be seated. Once seated we waited a while to be helped. Our waitress was not friendly or attentive, her attitude towards. As for the food, I ordered the breakfast burrito (steak and chorizo) and the pot of bread. The burrito was ok, nothing special or tasty, and the pot of bread was very tasteless. It was literally a plain piece of bread with a bit of cinnamon inside and a side of butter. I don't think I'll come back, or recommend the place to anyone else. I did not like the insane amount of time one has to wait to be seated, the quality of the food or the poor service.

8R8Gp5NG6_VOkS3RAy_c4A.text: Our 1st time in and they now have patrons for life. Service was fabulous! All the staff were wonderful. G is for "Great!"  She is a wonderful ambassador for the place. If you stop by for a meal, be sure to ask for her. The food is just as wonderful. We had the Ham & Eggs Benedict and the Biscuits &  Gravy. Both were fantastic as well as the fresh squeezed fruit juice.

mmklDTGcTZrN9dSPJQGfjA.text: This place has very good food. I have eaten here twice. The only reason I gave them 4 stars is because each time I've been there I've had to wait about 20-30 minutes before getting seated in what looks like and almost empty restaurant. Overall after I have been seated everything has been good.

NreUqYy4PZt0qO2vFhT0mA.text: Love love love the food!!! Great food portion and great service!!! Amberlee was so helpful and made our breakfast very enjoyable

whmbIPE1kB_KFbxE6S-dCQ.text: I was excited to find out that they opened a location on Flamingo. We are big fans of the location at Southern Highlands. I'm still in love with the steak and eggs! We also get the home made corn beef hash, well done. I'm giving a 4 star only because the 3 times we went there the wait to be seated was too long and the AC was blasting. Hopefully the wait won't be so bad. I still recommend this place for a great breakfast/brunch!

4Pn_RP5h1Y8YjVISJgwYvQ.text: Had breakfast with sara as our server.  My lady had the by strip with spinach and bear aisle over an everything bagel.  She said it was very tasty and the portion was large.  I had a ribeye with eggs, hash browns and their own house baked cinnamon pot of bread.  For only $15 the ribeye was surprisingly tasty.  I get a little wary when I eat a steak that is under $45 but this was great for the money.  We will be back and ask for sara.

0qve9TKCbBxRjK66_EhYJQ.text: One of the best kept secrets In Vegas. The food is delicious and the staff is super friendly!

gSVihII6LgFfnRS13OVMqQ.text: Delicious food, fantastic wait staff and good vibes. I'm going to eat here more often.

TePUVFm6olc9C8oXnLOQNg.text: Lil bit of a wait but the food and service made up for it... The portions are huge and the food is great!! My best friend and I have been there twice so far.. We try to go to a new place every Saturday for breakfast but we always seem to end up here.. 6/6/15

0cccpW5QtqxczFbVGq7rhg.text: Love this place... Comfy and clean. I have a few favorites... Carrot/apple juice, corned beef/eggs, pot of bread and Chris is the greatest. I apologize if I misspelled her name... She checks on you and remembers the details. Love her... Want great breakfast, here is where you need to be.

T5qDjrgK0AS5OD1mO8Xzlw.text: This was my first time here. The service from  Madison & Betty was spectacular!! The food was AMAZING!!! My daughter & I had Steak Burgers, SO GOOD!! My son had the chicken. I tasted it & it was FABULOUS! The service is above and beyond!!

XaQ-1QhKv6NDxRFJNDwe3A.text: Good breakfast restaurant, well prepared food. Servers are good. I have been twice and both times it was consistent. We go early because they get busy after about 9 and you have to wait. I did notice that even when we arrive early they still make you wait...with the restaurant half full. They either need more staff or stop letting the kitchen dictate how many tables to fill.

koiLbnODJm9Wan2qJcbNXw.text: Best chicken fried steak I've had in a long time!  Try out the Chamucos Jalapeno sauce (local from Henderson, NV)...it has a sneaky slow burn. Luckily we got here before the crowd...this place gets packed.

PajcVi-urP6JVB6WWxHe-Q.text: We got the steak chiliqueles  and biscuits &gravy  .... steak was overcooked, asked for a medium rare and got a medium. Was very happy with the chips until I got to the beans, wich had a weird spice added to them. Eggs were cooked very well. Buiscuits (there were 2)were good til I ate the first one was nice and hot like it should be but the second one was cold and the gravy around it was cold. Server was nice and if we had questions she explained very well. Everything else on the biscuit plate was really good. Really happy they didn't overcook my eggs, they were perfect.

ZVe3juYmZgPWlBCOSTsqdA.text: We arrived at rise & shine for breakfast and not knowing what to expect were pleasantly surprised how good the food was but the service I can't tell you was the best I have ever had! Our server was Jerry and he was so attentive but not in a pushy kind of way! I will definitely be back to see him! Thank you Jerry for making our breakfast awesome!

m5COpkksASuzhzmm9NVg5A.text: My friend and I tried this restaurant this week for brunch. Our waitress,Chelsea, was excellent. The staff is very cute in pjs. The atmosphere is adorable with all of the umbrellas spinning on the ceiling. It entranced my 5 month old baby.  I ordered the steak and eggs. My steak was a horrible cut of meat, trying to find something to eat off of it. I said something to the waitress. She apologized profusely and said she would tell the manager. He or she, not sure because they never came over, took 15% off of bill... It was $1.99 off the entire bill... Um thanks but no thanks. The rest of the food was good. What bothered me the most is that this FAMILY friendly restaurant does not have a baby changing table anywhere in the restaurant. My baby needed to be changed, desperately. Parents you know what I'm talking about... And we went into the ladies room no table, plus there is no counter space. So we had to wait to get home. When I asked about he changing table, the hostess kind of just shrugged me off. Why would there not be a Koala Kare in the restroom, in fact BOTH restrooms. Again family friendly it is not. This is not a big deal to most; but it is for a mom dealing with a baby.

AIc-D6fk52ZjQeZaXava-A.text: I wanted to try a new place and with yelps reviews I wanted to try.... I'm not one to nit pick but i don't think the ribeye is a rib eye, but a chuck cut thin. The rest of our food was great cause I could see 3 eggs and hash brown. The tables show their age and if not careful you can cut y I urge arms on the peeling clear

TLlVlXkQtTw3VVSViINtrQ.text: I just had the best bananas foster waffle of my life!! Crispy vanilla waffle with Caramelized sugar, bananas and cinnamon. So good.

LPl3rsgro0dDZKmJx7A7XQ.text: Right next to my LVAC gym and had to drop by and check out what it's all about. The ultimate steak and eggs breakfast was fantastic. The 8-9 oz. steak was cooked to perfection and was evenly smothered with gourmet black pepper. They're home style potatoes was the perfect combination with my steak, and truly was one of the best potatoes I've had in the valley.  My server Christina was great. A new local favorite...

Fi8Vd9TYa1ghGkJ4vWa93Q.text: When you walk in to a breakfast place at breakfast time and it is EMPTY you have to think twice I did and after having a rude hostess tell me I had to have biscuits and gravy with eggs I guess she didn't have any knowledge of the menu as it showed them as a stand alone side then treated as a second place customer I took my advice and LEFT.

I3vw54PoO_w3yZwjw3N7JQ.text: Boyfriend and I always go to a new breakfast joint every Sunday and we ended up coming here yesterday. The French press coffee was the best part of our meal, along with the fresh squeezed orange juice and "cup of bread". The service was prompt and the server was friendly. Boyfriend ordered the steak and eggs with hash browns. I ordered the spice rub steak and chilaquiles. I know the steak is supposed to be spice rubbed but wow, the only flavor I found in that steak was a burnt one. Both meals were lacking in flavor and were mediocre at best. I would only recommend this place for the orange juice and for the cool little "weak, medium, strong" device that comes with the french press coffee. Other than that, I would not come back here.

Hardly any sausage flavor.  Hash browns were under cooked.  The food was cold.  I think the waitress forgot until I asked because people that arrived after me were getting their food.  I was told the Kitchen was backed up.  I will never return

Also almost $4 for a skinny glass of OJ with no refill is kinda steep

ysOebVfKtaEy-KUcLiCH1A.text: Rise and Shine is a great family and friends restaurant. Although it is busy, it's justified with its great price and great food. The atmosphere is open and is a very family friendly location. It also is open for friends and family. The food was great and was well worth the wait. The employees were extremely friendly and made the experience that much more fantastic. This is has become my friends and I's new favorite breakfast place. If I could give this place 6-stars, I would!

WdOeFMHs3C51g7CVBp280Q.text: I love the decor and the wait staff gets to wear PJs! The service and food were excellent! We will be back!

RJR80NYseoAVOOeZ2ZlQQA.text: We've been going here every Sunday for brunch for about two months now. The food is amazing and the portions are huge. They have a ton of great options to please everyone. I highly recommend the food ! The place is also very cute. The only downside is that you will wait a very long time , not only to be seated but to get your food as well . We're typically are there for an hour and half to two hours when we go and most of that is just waiting . Despite this fact I still would really recommend them !

GFt4--u4CL-5oA-dqQf7jw.text: Great customer service. The steak and eggs were incredilbe. Definitely a go to breakfast spot.

Z9SQXb0LXB_CiQsgUGuTMA.text: Decided to try rise and shine as we have seen it many times as we are frequent eaters at greens and proteins.   We went in and waited for  9 minutes to get seated, several employees  passed us by and nothing.  One even mentioned we'll be right with you.  It was probably longer than 9 minutes, that's when I looked at my watch.  Note there was plenty of available seating.  so we decided to leave and go to the other breakfast place nearby.   Unfortunately we weren't able to try the food but the service was terrible.

8cdF30zYAiW6YFO4xA-VZg.text: Had the steak and eggs. Eggs were very good but the steak was a little too seasoned for my taste also order medium rare and it came medium/well done. Service was great and food was fast. I'll probably be a return customer and try some other things. They have a great outside dining area when the weather is nice.

8W5SrZtPJdzQhsI2MJHw0A.text: Food here is fantastic when you finally get it. Plan on waiting 45-60 minutes in the weekends to be seated. Once your seated plan on another 45 minutes for your food to get to the table. Who ever is in charge of the operation aspect of the business needs some education on running a restaurant. They leave tables open for prolonged periods while people wait and then sit people at 4 tops when there are only two people and two tops are open. Another negative is that they have a patio but don't utilize it and there doesn't seem to be enough seating inside.

whgMabFar0Gg1PZNd76KFA.text: My first time going to Rise and Shine with my bf. We were told that the kitchen was going to take a little longer today; we didn't care. We sat down and ordered our food. My bf ordered orange juice water,  plan pancakes,  eggs, hash browns and sausage. I order banana, pecan frosted flake pancakes and a water. It took 45 minutes to get our food.  Waitress was nice but 45 minutes isn't a "little" wait. Service was good and food was good. I was disappointed when I received my pancakes but didn't say anything to the waitress because I didn't want to wait another 45 minutes for a redo. My pancakes had banana foster style bananas on too , brown sugar & pecans everywhere, whipped cream with frosted flakes on top of that. I can't have dairy so that ruined my frosted flakes. I don't like bananas foster style cooked bananas. I assumed they would be sliced and inside the pancakes, but they weren't. The menu didn't mention anything. After a few bites I started feeling very sick; I realized they must add a lot if milk to their batter (which has never happened to me before)Also the bill came to $45. That's ridiculous for 2 people and what we ordered. Just disappointed overall.  Sorry but I won't be coming back

Rk9BjzEvhzCiuioJrEuBGA.text: We asked for a table for four and was seated at a table with only three chairs, so we were left to grab a chair at a neighboring table ourselves. Then after we ordered, it took an extremely long time for our food to come out only for our food to come out cold and for the waitress to forget my friend's bread in a cup. When we asked about the bread, she claimed it didn't come with our friend's meal even though the waitress asked said friend to choose between the bread in the cup or toast when she told took our order. They also charge $1.00 for a side of ranch. I would not recommend wasting your time here.

ztJjQ_PTOj9g0pVi40rpbQ.text: Love going to this place post workout LOL! Get my protein on  Waitstaff is informative on the menu, dressed in PJ's, they are still moving like they're  not asleep  Juices taste fresh, great flavor. Food is simply amazing. Hubby ordered chilaquilles, looked so good I had to take a chip....even their chips were marinated in poblano sauce and seasoning! Who does that ?!?!? They do and it adds a whole new/amazing taste experience My eggs benni hit the spot...with the addition  of avocado,tomato, spinach and hash browns...so so ono!! A little on the pricey side but every once on a while, that's ok

rr1HyNHRXX5nqhpcGeCsgQ.text: This is an AMAZING place for breakfast!! The food was awesome; large portions, friendly staff (I couldn't remember waitress' name but it begins with an A-she's the BEST!) we will be back again and again!! Next time I'm coming in my jammies! ( the wait staff wear their jammies).

H2ZPyvXoxomHfMmX9CPyOg.text: They clearly don't need to advertise because I'm sure the word-of-mouth is insanely good but I must say best breakfast I've had in a very very long time. My wife will never forget as she puts it "the cinnamon roll in a cup thing" our breakfast were great I had steak and eggs and the service was friendly and quick. I love the pajamas as uniforms. Definitely a keeper.

dUMqwGsX9pKkGAP7qyXGyA.text: I'm not sure how I've missed this place. I herd about the south location but I didn't want to drive from Aliante to Southern Highlands. When my wife had mentioned it to a co worker they said "oh the one on flamingo, we live that place" what!!!! There is one close to me.  So as the weekend neared I was pretty stocked to ride over. All I could think of is ultimate ribeye and eggs.  So as my wife and I was seated I was ready to order. I glanced at the menu and was ready as my iced tea showed up.  I put a little spin on my ultimate ribeye. I wanted a little spice so I had them add it and ordered my eggs over medium and extra crispy hash browns. The best part is the bread (toast, biscuit, or a cup of bread) I haven't ate any bread in weeks. So the cup of bread was a hit. Five stars for the cup of bread.   It's a pretty nice size place. Use to be a Joes Crab Shack. They have spinning umbrella lights. Waitress wear pajamas and the bus boys wear a shirt that says "spooning leads to forking, so don't forget to use the condiments"  I'll be back for sure

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

teb3T-Epcjj0cPrCLXAxtA.text: Tied this for the first time and was pleasantly surprised. Busy on a Saturday morning but no wait. A lot of options on the menu, not just typical breakfast. Tried the rise and shine chiliquiles which were really good. Too Much to eat for both of us. Will be back!

6iGgpFaDq0nI8bABeNgJfg.text: VISUAL AESTHETIC: 5/5 The exterior of the building is a mix between champagne mango and mustard yellow with a macaroni and cheese colored roof top. There is an outdoor patio with seating available and a small grass area circled with a fence behind it. Overall, it gives a sort of "barn-like" feeling. This ties in with Rise & Shine being a "steak and eggs place", so you think of cows and chickens.   Inside the restaurant is spacious, tables not too close that you would feel harassed while having a conversation or intruding someone else's. Rise & Shine has floral umbrellas hanging upside from the ceiling, which are absolutely adorable. Overall, the decor is witty and gives a diner feeling.   The waiters and waitresses are all dressed in pajamas which is a quirky plus that I found was not only cute, but suitable to market the brand of the business.   FOOD: 4.5/5 I had brought a friend along and she ordered the fried buffalo chicken breast with hash browns and scrambled eggs, with the pot of bread. The sauce did not soak through the batter rendering the crispness to be soggy, which is a plus because many of the restaurants I go to unfortunately do this. The eggs were fresh, and the potatoes were hot, crisp on the outside, with a soft tenderness within.   I am not a first time customer and ordered my usual: the New York strip steak spinach Benedict on an everything bagel. The taste was replicated as my prior visits, however I found that the cut of steak was much smaller this time around with the amount of spinach being quite sparse as well. But overall, the bagel was toasted perfectly leaving the inner bread tender but the exterior nice and crunchy. I asked for a medium rare steak and my expectations were met.   SERVICE: 5/5 Typically Rise & Shine has great service, and I had that experience today as well. Our waitress constantly checked up on us to assure that my friend and I were satisfied and had everything we needed. From refills to containers for packing, she made sure to even bring along the check right away.   OVERALL EXPERIENCE: 4.7/5 Breakfast is essentially easy when it comes to appeasing a large audience, at least when it comes down to average food, service, or visuals. To exceed expectations, niches are required, right? Rise & Shine gives great service, fresh food, and an adorable environment to tie it all together.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The interior with the flower umbrellas.
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Above: The fried buffalo chicken. Below: NY strip steak spinach benedict.
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pot of bread.

emCub2otCCZ10edWkTp7yg.text: First timer here. We were in the mood to venture out instead of hitting our usual local weekend breakfast spots.  Of course, I Yelp before parking. Not too sure about staff wearing PJ's, but the reviews coaxed me to try it. As we enter, at first glance I see this location is very spacious. Tables are evenly separated. The decor is bright and whimsical. Then I crowd check, not bad. There are enough guests to say "this place is a crowd pleaser".  Lucky me, no waiting. We are greeted and seated rather instantly.  Waitress is very friendly and professional.  I ordered the chilaquiles with a hard fried egg Hubby had biscuits n gravy and we split 2 pancakes.  Inquired about the coffee, a fine Italian Import. Hubby was given a sample and really liked the  Rich strong flavor, so he ordered a cup.   The GM was on the floor, checking in on guests. It was so nice chatting with her. Can't wait for their new location to open.  The best part was the 2 giant pancakes staying hot thru the meal!  Everything was very yummy!   Warning: Portions are large  Open: 7am to 3 (Just in case there are some late sleepers reading my review.

gKq0ydB9BaPHwZwHe9lHpw.text: Had the loco loco and Sharrie had the eggs Benedict.  Both were good standard breakfast fare.  The problem today is the noise from the kitchen staff, wiping silverware and THROWING in the tray. This occurred during our entire meal. There are better way in handling silverware. Bill $35.99 for two which is on the high side so I expect more.

nR0DQ0qXIppdiQQ6FOj4uA.text: This might just have replaced Hash House as my go to for over the top, filling, stick to your ribs, breakfast.  Thanks to my little sis who's a local, she suggested coming here and I'm glad she did. Everything on the menu looked delicious and I ended up ordering the Chicken Fried Steak, which is basically a platter of food.  You get a small cow that's battered in a nicely crisp coating/crust. Was quite easy to cut into and dip into my country gravy that was also used to douse my biscuit.   Two eggs (any way you like it) over easy, was fun to crack and let the yolk ooze over my chicken fried steak which was on top of a layer of shredded hash browned potatoes. The potatoes were still crisp and enjoyable. I'm not a fan of soggy hash browns.  It was a lot of food, but I can handle it and I was on vacation, so I deserved every single bite and calorie that I consumed.

T1wlBLHwUjpGmSmO2MLSvA.text: The staff was very friendly, but my only complaint is that they used the vegan logo for vegetarians items. Which is confusing and incorrect. I would love to see this corrected!

Bz8zD8xrVzRppElLo5XUHw.text: I like to think of myself as a breakfast connoisseur. I love breakfast, it's my favorite meal of the day. This place is top notch!  Occasionally there's a short wait, but trust me, it's worth it. The atmosphere is fun and unique. In the waiting area they sell funny knee high socks and pajamas.   There's big bright flowers on the ceiling that spin. The waiters and waitresses wear pajamas. I've been here 3 or 4 times now and I've had excellent service every time.    My favorite things to order here is the French press coffee and the pot of bread. What's a pot of bread you ask? It's pure heaven in a little ceramic cut. Similar to a cinnamon roll but no icing. It's usually served with butter and warm cream cheese like sauce for dipping. It will make your tummy really happy, I promise! Once you try it, you'll be hooked!   Now hurry up and get on over there and order yourself a pot of bread!!

C_OuEjTDZGrAGHcwMuU62Q.text: This is the best best breakfast place i have been to in my entire life! Plus the waitresses are wearing  pjs loooove it!!!!

mvaH6m3NG8WdA61LviN2Fg.text: This has been on my bookmark list for a long time and finally went over with my friend to give it a try. It's located on West Flamingo in the old Joe's Crab Shack. Arrived at 11am and waited 15 minutes for a table. By the end of our meal, it was actually pretty empty.   Menu has lots of good options, it took awhile to decide what I wanted to eat as there seemed to be lots of delicious breakfast items to choose from. I finally opted for the Ultimate Steak and eggs, while my friend went with the Smoked Salmon benedict. We each ordered a juice (orange for him, strawberry watermelon for me) $4.95 each....ouch. Served in a 12 oz glass.  I ordered steak medium rare and eggs over medium. Eggs were perfect but steak was overcooked. Nice pot o bread and crispy potatoes on the side. Steak was nicely seasoned and still tender even if overcooked to medium well. My friend said the smoked salmon was really good with plenty of salmon and the hollandaise sauce seemed homemade instead of out of a can. I'll try that next time.  Service was just ok, nothing great about it. It took a good 20 minutes from order to receiving food, and then an extra 10 minutes after completing meal to get the check.   I'll come back as many of the meals on other people's plates looked good. Chicken fried steak, and the pancakes looked delicious.  Food 4 stars, service 3 stars, prices 3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ribeye steak and eggs

V7j0_nK5g6iBofX4DscQwQ.text: Great food and huge portions! Chicken and waffles are wonderful. Chicken has a light but satisfying crunch and the waffle was light and airy. The maple syrup has a cinnamon stick in the bottle. Nice mild spice to offset the sweetness. Staff is courteous and attentive. Our new favorite breakfast and brunch place!!

QfyXYx7UX6Y0AD-7MpzkPw.text: What a huge disappointment this place was.... The restaurant is super cute and the staff are in their cute jammies. Everything on the menu sounded great, especially the ribeye steak breakfast, which is what I ordered....  I ordered my steak medium rare. It was raw. They seriously threw it on a grill then flipped it and threw it on a plate. The steak was still frozen!!!!  My potatoes were like hay, super dry! Never got my toast. Finally after having my food for about 15-20 minutes my server checks on me.... She asks if everything is ok? I say no, my beef is still mooing. She says oh no, let me get you a new steak. She takes the steak and returns with my same steak!!!! Ummmmm, I thought you weren't supposed to put food back into a cooking kitchen after it's been dropped to a table....??? Gross! So you're telling me, other customers returned, contaminated food, has been on the same cooking surface that everyone else's food gets cooked on??? Disgusting. I wish I had something nice to say about this place. Oh wait, I do, my friend enjoyed her French toast. Luckily she shared so I had a few bites while our server was helping other tables. Oh and the good thing was they took my meal off the check!!!! Well almost my entire meal. I still had to pay for my coffee which I did not drink, because it tasted either old or too dark of a roast or something.... it just was gross. Poor management. They could give a hoot if any customers return.

DeRA4t46R4vMgUdCZ3372g.text: Went to eat here for my first time here.. would definitely come back.. great service and not only that but our food was served fast.. the food was delicious.. I ordered the waffle and my friend the chicken fried steak which she let me try with the gravy sauce.. it was bomb! Yes I said it! Definitely recommend to try out this place for breakfast!

irN9Xtv5zlbwyuSwqotoJg.text: Wooooo-Hooo  I've had chicken fried steak in 9 different states and this is by far my absolute favorite! Absolutely in point, it was so good a tear almost came down my eye from the party in my mouth , the gravy was flavorful with a mild kick. My other half had the chicken and waffles and let me tell you that waffle was crack, the syrup dispenser had cinnamon sticks in there which added another dimension of lip-smacking flavor I didn't want to end. The portions are HUGE so good luck finishing the entire plate. It was our first visit and our server Samantha was very helpful and nice ( nice smile )since the menu is big and my wife is finicky. We will definitely be back for more of this deliciousness. If you want a party in your mouth and not worried about calories go by put that food in your mouth and enjoy it'll be worth it.

_8fg-jN_lDUZTaoAxfy8sQ.text: First time here from Orange County,CA. Loved the service that Amberly provided! She would bring us what we needed without us having to ask! We will definitely come back next time we are in Las Vegas!

vXqU4K-zAt7P5W0VVgDMcQ.text: We are from Edmonton Alberta Canada and we are on vacation for a week. We have been mostly reduced to being on the Vegas strip, and only access to food there.  Today we chose to rent a vehicle and sightsee. As a treat I found Rise & Shine and surprised my wife with a nice breakfast here.  Our server was Amberly and she was extremely pleasant and attentive and provided an exceptional quality service experience.  The food was next level and very filling. We had the crunch cinnamon French toast and are leaving with leftovers and can't wait to eat it again at the hotel!  This would absolutely be almost daily place to eat if we lived in Las Vegas. One day. For now we can only dream!

The chilaquiles were tasty, had the chicken breast & waffle and waffle memorable since I'm a waffle head! Also plated was an omelet. All very large portions and really good food. Stop here if n town or passing through Vegas, you'll want to return.  *Wasn't open MLK Day*

CoJ00J1auuK8bXu5GSXnjw.text: Good was really good. Staff walks around in PJs. Seriously where do you get to work in your pajamas.   Very good touch.  I got the ribeye w avocado and the waitress found me blue cheese crumble which I love on my steak(yes I am weird)  My eggs were good and my hash browns were perfect crispy!   The cup of bread was a cross between a cinnamon roll and popover.  W a side of cream cheese syrup.  Very sweet and yummy

JXW8wIzrgA2aohVbZhbGOQ.text: Everything was amazing! Love this place it's so cute and the staff is very friendly. Samie was our server and was egg-cellent

x9U0zBwXYHBFvJ4m-ALpKA.text: Terrible service and when I asked to speak to a manager she refused and the server was being very rude about it. I then get my food and realize it's very cold and has a piece of hair in it. Never going again. Don't recommend.

6iqqskwe479pl4HZbrd3uQ.text: This rating is only for this particular location.   I have been to the other two Vegas locations and have great service.  After waiting 30min to sit down we finally ordered. I ordered the ultimate breakfast steak and eggs. My steak was grossly undercooked(rare) and I ordered Medium. I let my server know and she took the steak so that it could be cooked more.  It came out well done and practically burnt.  To make matters worse my waitress was hard to get a hold of and I had to finally call over a manager to explain that the meal just wasn't edible.   Instead of offering a new steak or taking it off of our bill, she gave a $5 discount and said have a great day.  I think this place is just too understaffed and unexperienced to handle a busy Vegas community. Super disappointed with this location.

5hiD779cYJPYHDl_Xz2_Lg.text: My boyfriend and I came here one day for breakfast. We were seated immediately and our server stopped by shortly after. Our server was great and had great energy!  My boyfriend had the smoked salmon and eggs benedict which he enjoyed. He said the salmon tasted fresh and the eggs were cooked perfectly.  I had the iron baked Belgian waffle recommended by our server with a side of fruit. It was delicious and perfect for breakfast. The fruit was sweet and fresh, it was the perfect accompaniment to my big 'ol waffle. I didn't think the waffle would be satisfying but it was and I enjoyed it tremendously.   Bottom line: If you're looking for a breakfast spot in the area, this place is worth checking out.

6pBwgszhPC3yaPhojcPHKw.text: First time eating here and what a great treat.Their cup o bread was dessert before breakfast. The food was out of this world. Maria our waitress very friendly and helpful since this was our first time here. Worth the drive from north last Vegas. Please visit maria.

KNsn89aUGCd0hkXzNakgQw.text: We stopped by here for breakfast on our drive to the Grand Canyon. We got here pretty early so there was no wait at all.   The decor was nice and colorful. There was a small area that had merchandise to buy. it looked mostly like socks.  The place was big, spacious, and looked clean and organized. It looks like it would be able to host a big group.  Our waiter was wearing nursing scrubs (or I thought they were). I figured that he either got off a late shift from the previous job or was about to go to his second job. I didn't think anything of it until I saw a waitress not in working uniform either. Then it hit me.. Rise & Shine... breakfast... pajamas.. Pajamas = working uniform - haha clever.  There were so many things on the menu that I kind of got hit with analysis paralysis. I ended up settling for my safe pick, chicken and waffles, which did not disappoint me. I liked that the chicken was flattened, it makes it easier to eat it sandwich style. I like to eat my chicken and waffles with syrup and hot sauce so I was happy to see it already on the table. My friend got the steak and eggs which looked really good as well.  Unique style, big and spacious, good food, friendly staff. No complaints.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffles
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OmiQk7T8n6lLpn898bKwBw.text: If you are thinking about trying Rise & Shine I highly recommend it.   This particular location earned 5 stars and we were told by our waitress that there are two other locations in town one being on our side of town even.   The hostess sat us within seconds of stepping inside and I was delighted by the decor. The waiters and waitresses get to wear pajamas which is ADORABLE and they seem so happy like they are enjoying their job. How could you not? Your in jammies!   We ordered Steak and Eggs and coffee in a coffee press but first let me tell you about this bread in a crock the serve first. Holy man....it is all things good in this world. It is baked in this crock or dish served to you warm with cinnamon butter frosting stuff. It is delicious. As if that isn't enough goodness along came our breakfast. The steaks were cooked just as we ordered them and seasoned perfectly with this coffee rub, eggs were spot on and the hash browns crispy. Portions were perfect not overly huge and I left satisfied and not uncomfortably stuffed.   Our server was so pleasant and had time to engage in conversation which was so nice and made us felt welcome. She didn't hover over us and wasn't intrusive she simple was genuinely a happy person I wish I had gotten her name so I could give her a shout out or so you could request her.   They also have a cute section where they sell shirts and other gift shop type items too.   In warmer months they have a nice size patio for outdoor dining that I can't wait to enjoy too.   I highly recommend giving them a try and I know I will be back for sure.

CXQBCnwW-YraWR9mz46urA.text: I've been here twice before and had a great experience both times so I decided to bring my family.   Little one: ordered juice and something from the kids menu which he enjoyed   Bigger little one: ordered fresh strawberry & watermelon juice (YUM) and the Rise & shine burrito. He loved it although it was a bit spicy - no biggie.   I had a Nutella Latte which was delicious (hard to mess up anything with Nutella) along with the cup o bread which is always on point. I ordered the country fried steak and this is where things started to go down hill. The batter was nice and crunchy as always but for some reason it had a lot of pepper. I mean A LOT!!! But it's ok to have a little spice because the country gravy should offset it right? Wrong. The gravy had a lot of pepper too!!! I'm not sure if the cook had a heavy hand or they just love pepper but I was always told not to over season things because you can add more to it later. The hash browns weren't cooked very well but I'm not a big fan of potatoes anyway so it wasn't a big deal. I continued to finish my plate the most I could before the pepper got to me.   My dad ordered the ham steak, over easy, hash-brown and cup o bread. The only thing he really liked was that cup o bread. The ham steak was dry and the char flavor was over bearing. He didn't care for the hash browns either which he stated should be crispy and not limp.   The service there was great and the server handled the situation with grace and I say this because my father was very disappointed and disgusted with the food so he wasn't kind at all. She came back with the check and took his meal off the bill.   I appreciate the fact that she did that but I think the manager should've came over to find out what was wrong, which nobody did. Which is why I came to yelp so that maybe management will see this review and make changes.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. See all the pepper? And this was a less spicy piece.

nx7ffUwU4GNPnw76ugPi1g.text: I've been here on a Saturday morning and there can be a good half-hour wait for a table. This Monday morning was much quieter, less than half the restaurant was occupied, so lots of tables were available.  The top of their menu has the Big Bone-In Country Ham Steak & Eggs. It comes with a large slab of ham, two eggs, hash browns, and for a bread a choice of a "cup-o-bread", toast or biscuit. The ham was on the large side, cooked nicely with grill marks on the meat. The "Cup-o-Bread" was a soft cinnamon roll type bread baked in a small cup and was served with a small cup of something similar to the icing found on a cinnamon roll. A filling breakfast.  Service was good. One of the gimmicks here is that many of the servers wore pajamas, nothing bizarre, just regular pjs.

Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cup-o-Bread

IlP4inO17WXqY60L2vFkPA.text: I've been here before but at a diff location. It's always decent but I got uncooked ish hashbrowns not my fave kind in general. They use thick pieces of ham in the build ur own omelets. They're known for their "Pot O Bread" cinnamon type roll in a mini mug w/sweet dipping sauce. We went after 11am so -it was pretty empty & there was plenty of parking. Friendly staff but I wish someone had cleaned my booth area, pieces of food on the seat & a crayon, food wrapper & crumbs on the floor... utter cleanliness is a pet peeve of mine,especially when you're not busy-someone should have cleaned that section before seating guests there.

p818lhAbwrFL0bxpIWwW6A.text: Amberly was a great server. Refilled my coffee seconds after the cup was empty. Smile on her face. French toast was bomb! Thanks.

EXZXa4TPk58Wx9SIvhPSRg.text: After living in Las Vegas for a decade, I always love when I'm surprised to find a new favorite. This one is hidden by the LVAC on flamingo. The food was so good. Eggs were fresh and tasty. The fruit cup was perfect - berries and bananas - and the chicken was really well done. It was different than any other place. Fried but still tasted light. And the pot o bread was really different and not insanely rich. Definitely coming back.

4NaihPMmeF9yNF7e_o173g.text: The restaurant itself was nice. Server could have maybe presented a smile. The food was good and portions were huge. I am not kidding, pancakes should be on a man vs food challenge. You can share them with at least four people. The menu really should have a disclaimer. I was sort of embarrassed when they accidentally tried to serve them to our neighbor table and then sat them down    in front of me. They are the size of a vinyl record, and I mean an album not a 45.   They were good, just B-I-G

dZ0it6QHLhPHmXTC1VkqvA.text: UNFRIENDLY... but i love coming to this place with my family or friends. but giving it a 3/5 because the first time i came there was hair in my food and the waitress was kind of mean about it and also that they are very very slow when it comes to the food coming out in a timely manner.   but i keep coming back because i love their fresh squeezed oj and steak and eggs. also their cup o' bread is pretty good. I ONLY COME FOR THE FOOD, don't expect to come here for fast and/or friendly service
