-oJSmimXu2DRYazBe7VReA.text: Holy Pancake, Batman!  If you're in the area, do yourself a favor and visit Rise & Shine. We had a very large party who each order a wide variety of dishes and our brunch evolved in a game of "who's food is better". Everything was so delicious but if I had to recommend one thing, it would the pancakes. Pro Tip: 1 pancake will feed a small village; we shared 1 between 12 people.   PS... Nicole was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DeIWu2KTMiWiiGiAdpY-ig.text: Previously living in southern highlands I was a frequent customer of the original location and was finically able to try their second location. We arrived on a Sunday around 9:30 a had a 10-15 min wait for a party of 6. This place is huge and so spacious! The food is spot on and very consistent to taste to the southern highlands location which is great! The portions are huge & delicious. Our server was a little spacey and forgot a couple items we requested or condiments that we had to ask for a second time, but no biggy, it was busy and she did bring them fast on the second request. Overall, clean friendly staff and will be back again.

y_J7-DEGmShDObSRB2p-ng.text: Food here is terrible, I've gave this restaurant 3 chances and all 3 times is was disgusting. I'm not picky or anything hence why I came back so many times to try new things. The burrito I had zero flavor, I then got the ribeye and eggs which was over cooked, dry, and paper thin. Last I got biscuits and gravy, how can you mess that up. Well they did, again dry and thrown together for 13$ plus you only get two small biscuits not a real meal. My friends went the other day and they said their food was terrible as well. Even when I dined in I watched other tables complain so they gave them "cow cash" or whatever it's called. Cool they wear jammies I guess to attract and distract at the same time of how bad the food is. Overpriced food for something that I can make better at home. Save your money, go to ihop even because this food is not worth it.

Xjr47zXCA6NJ3pZs-Wj7xA.text: Been wanting to try this place.  And the reviews are mixed.  The exterior of the place is nice, but the interior is dark and the decor really doesn't mix with the kind of vibe they're trying to create.  Rise & Shine should be bright and cheery.  This place just looks strange inside with it's strange looking upside down umbrellas hanging from the ceiling.  The staff was ok, but were not overly friendly or attentive.   The menu variety does look good and I will be back to order a few other items.  My friend and I both had Build Your Own Omelettes which were great.  Probably the best omelette I've ever had.  The hash browns were beyond disgusting though.  I've never seen hashbrowns like this and I don't know why people insist on putting onions in hashbrowns?!   Potato Salad and hashbrowns do not need onions!   If made right, they stand on their own merit.  The Pot of Bread was good, but it is badly plated and difficult to eat the way it is.  I almost broke the cup trying to get it out.  Overall, it is ok.  I will probably try the one in Southern Highlands next time to see if it is any better from an ambiance and staffing point.

0W0JeaYYPqJqWE-KUysPVQ.text: I ordered the rib eye & eggs breakfast. It was decent. Steak was nicely seasoned and wasn't too huge of a portion. Only complaint was my hash browns were cold. Other than that the food was on point. I would come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mTBHrvxPM_Xraejp5g0ZXA.text: I finally found a new breakfast joint! Yay!   Came here with the bf and his parents around 11:30 on a Sunday. The wait was already 45mins and blazing hot outside. They have a small seating area inside while you wait but it was already crowded. The decor and atmosphere was bright and fun. Staff was very attentive and friendly from beginning to end.   Now for the food! What an extensive menu! Cold pressed juices? Loco moco? Steak? Eggs? Rice? It has everything an indecisive diner could want! We ordered a chilaquiles, a Belgian waffle with all the fruit, steak and eggs and the red velvet pancakes. Oh my gosh the portions and tastes! Not as obnoxiously big as Hash House but still enough for two meals per plate. Not bad since the average price is $12 per dish. I can honestly say this is the first place I've really liked their scrambled eggs. Not underdone and seems way more than two eggs(but I'll take that!) I wish the pancakes were fluffier. And the pots of breads if you order a la carte seem small for $3+ but it all still tasted great. I also ordered the green apple carrot juice. My bf's dad was having trouble getting refills on his coffee. The server meant well and did everything he could while juggling several other tables. All good. I was happy. I'll definitely be back. Like soon.

1ReGXzqywJifqwvTXdWhjA.text: We were waiting for this place to open and we were excited to try it.  It's overpriced for what you get. Normal breakfast places around town cost you about $10 for a great breakfast but this place is about 30% higher and the food is okay at best.  The service was mediocre and kind of slow for how dead they were.  I can definately say that with so many options in this town that we won't be back.

1E7A9xEErreKj6E0WOdxOQ.text: It was a bit pricey but I liked it.  I wish I would have tried the chicken and waffles.  Maybe another time.

ZMIWX8EJW3Q9HSd1Z2R2kA.text: Wow. A place devoted to steak and eggs? You had me at hello. The menu selection has something for everyone, the obvious steak and eggs but also omlettes and flapjacks. The service was great and the atmosphere was inviting. I had the Ribeye and 3 eggs and my girlfriend had the steak omlette, both were fabulous. Will be back, egg and I might be dead to me now, but omlette house remains in my heart.

T00J2-RLpxbmLq6GAuexGw.text: Its our first time at rise and shine and were glad we tried it :) , theyre very generous on serving and the price is not that bad ...i highly recomend it ....

eszu8IwPmMGHNSbQrWXl5w.text: My first Yelp review and our (me, Hubby and doggies) first visit to Rise and Shine.  We called ahead to confirm the dog-friendly patio and were told yes.  Upon our arrival we were promptly seated and our server,James, was very pleasant and enthusiastic about the menu.  He provided his recommendations and we asked him about food for the doggies.  They put together a scramble for the doggies and offered water for them, too.  I had the original pancake - heavenly! Half-order was more than enough; Hubby had the chicken and waffle.  Loved it! Coffee was great, too. Excellent service, delicious food and nice roomy patio for all of us.  We will be back!

T3AIxvbidjuM0764f5Kaxw.text: Just went here for the first time! Our server Ashley was amazing and so friendly! Treated us like family! Atmosphere is so cute! Everyone wears pjs! The food is delish! Big portions! Can't go wrong with that!

4vPHbTyxfy4unur8nMeJkA.text: I loved this place!! I had their ham and eggs Benedict and it was amazing and cooked perfectly. My friend also loved the chicken and egg white omelette. Service was great and our food came out quickly. I'm upset I couldn't try more things due to a time crunch, but I will definitely be back. They have so many other options I'd love to try.

-NFqjMd9ny1feRETpDKa5w.text: I tried Rise and Shine for the first time today from a recommendation from my friend.  The staff was very friendly and we had great service.  I ordered the biscuits and gravy.   The gravy really made the dish very good.   Hash browns are really tasty as well.  Definitely going back for more.  Nice decor and there's a very friendly atmosphere here.  Highly recommend.

tMIZzGFYl9tIkefFlZ6RZA.text: Food was great! Even after a little parsley/cilantro mixup.  Service was fantastic and the environment is comfortable.  We will definitely be back!

-3y8IKVBu6CGAqOap8rL4Q.text: We loved our experience at Rise and Shine! The food was delicious and the atmosphere was fun and lively. The only concern was the price - our check was $34 for me and my 10 year old before tip! Try the pot of  bread for sure and ask for a side off cream cheese syrup!!We will be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool ceiling decor

NCWFegrpoH2_M0hcj1q_Lw.text: I very much appreciate the idea of this place! But while it is very cutesy, I find that it just has a lot going on. I give it three stars for fresh juice, good portions, and friendly service. The food isn't anything out of the ordinary. I do like the pot of bread! I didn't miss my toast and would definitely get it again. The servers also wear pajamas. That was a cool touch. Try it out for yourself!! The restaurant, I mean, not the pajamas.

GeC1NtG2TDnRQ8tWWXpGew.text: This place is so slow and under staff. For the size of the building they should be able to handle a high volume of costumes. What a horrible impression this place has made! It was empty and there was an hour wait. People were walking away left and right.

oseIuvLgNgF3_1zDUwIv5w.text: This place is awesome. They decorated super cute and all the servers are wearing pajamas. Menu was good but service was just a little slow today. I'd definitely go back though.

DPjbzvzFURJnaeCO1eE1IA.text: 40 minute wait..... Looks like a large breakfast place - but only uses less then 1/2 the space inside and no seating on the large deck?????????  Because of the wait we walked across the street.  I have never waited 40 minutes to have breakfast.  Very disappointed...  Hopefully they get it together with a breakfast bar since there was only two of us or get more tables inside and out.  A lot of people walked away because of the wait - they are loosing a lot of business!!!  The one star rating is for this disappointment only since we were not able to try their food - maybe next time.....

f_oh2XS5ZhpJLfuvxdxQYQ.text: Strange review to write when we didn't even get a chance to eat. After waiting 25 minutes to be seated, I was sat a filthy booth. Great first impression. Then when trying to order they were not willing to make me hash browns without onions for which I am completely allergic too.  So we decided to get the bill for the two beverages we ordered that we hadn't even drank yet. So after wasting ten dollars I will continue to bring my business to egg works where they are very accommodating to people with food allergies.

lRInlflPA_Diq7Cz0vvTng.text: The staff is so friendly! Plus their uniforms are pjs! So cute! The server got to us super fast and brought us are food and took our order in a timely manner. She knew what we wanted before we even had time to ask. Very impressed. The food was delicious. The rib eye was cooked perfectly. The chiliques was so yummy and the pot of bread was to die for. The price was great to we are definitely coming back soon.

wgCFDQvrgFqRhgsz1I4oFg.text: Easily the best steak and eggs in the city ! Our server Maddy was awesome! We will be requesting her every time we go!

cCmgjWcHx9izbkqVDsrKPg.text: **** management has responded and basically said, that the diaper changer is properly installed  a with two of four bolts pulling out of the wall. Riiiiight. ******  Let me start by saying that this review will have more to do with management's complete and utter disregard for child safety, and less to do with the food/service, which has always been adequate, but nothing to rave about.  About nine months ago we ate breakfast here and I needed to change my baby's diaper. I put him on the diaper changer and notice it kind of jerked out from the wall and seemed unstable, I finished the diaper change and realize that the four bolts that hold it into the wall were completely stripped and the whole changer was pulling out of the wall. This is obviously completely unsafe, and to me, an emergency, considering that this charger is over 3 feet off the ground, an infant could easily fracture their skull should they fall onto tile from that height. I immediately informed management of the problem, and instead the manager made up a flimsy excuse about teenagers breaking the diaper changer.  About 3 months later we decided to try again, changer was half fixed, the screws in the top had been replaced, but the bottom screws were still pulling out of the wall, I mean, you can literally pull the changer away from the wall, which of course will eventually cause the top screws to pull out again.  I mentioned it to a different manager and she took the opportunity to tell me how awful and crazy the old manager was, instead of just fixing the changer. She did then tell me that it was okay because two of the screws were in. I nicely explained that those changers are supposed to be installed correctly, using all four bolts, so that they are safe, and can hold the weight posted. She ensured me it would be fixed.  Guess what? Three months later, still not fixed. Still pulling out of the wall. Rise and shine complete lack of care for infant and child safety makes me question what other things they do that are less than safe.  We will never, ever be back, as I have given management almost a year to correct this extremely unsafe situation, and unfortunately it's going to take someone's infant getting injured or worse before they take this seriously. If you aren't going to fix it, at least remove the changer all together, instead of risking the safety of every child placed on that changer, whose parent may not notice the loose bolts.  Shame on you rise and shine! I will encourage all my friends and family with small children to avoid your restaurants now, and in the future.

4xQ5d-zfgdkIv8Gvk2poaA.text: Want people to serve you food in their pajamas? This is the place! I think it's cute!  Saw this place on las vegas weekly so I figured why not give it a try! I am guessing their theme is like being in a "farm". There's three different doors you can enter in this place ha! As soon as you enter you'll see these umbrellas with flower print in them, some moves some doesn't. Can you imagine staring at them if everything moves? LOL. Oh and there's a big cow "poster" on the wall!  Loco mock - You can't expect this to be 100% good because we all know that's Hawaiian food. I ordered medium well on my patty, it's okay. I also didn't like how much gravy they put, its almost like a soup!!! Not enough rice for how big the patty is and like I said how much gravy is in it! Chocolate milk - A place that uses milk with their powdered cocoa! I hate when places uses water with this!  The register is a step away from the hostess so you have no idea which line unless you ask. But all in all I liked it and I'll give it a second try maybe third :P

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pOBdC3bRc-2PpIpMSWxU2g.text: The staff is cool but the wait for your food is ridiculous. It took almost an hour to get the food when we finally started to get our food they forgot my moms plate but brought her the side of avocado she ordered.she waited another 10 minutes till she got the food that she even needed the avocado for. This place is way overrated.

Azikter9achBVtltxQgd9w.text: My boyfriend and I came off a suggestion his co-worker made. You can tell this place is usually busy because for 2 we were told it was a 25 minute wait, then waited another 20 minutes after being seated to get any service, and the only reason we were was because I had to tell someone otherwise who knows how long we'd be sitting there. If rick is your server, he might not even pay attention to you. The smoothies were pretty good! I got the rib eye steak and eggs which was okay, but pretty salty. My boyfriend got the loco moco which he said was pretty good. Can't say it was good enough to suggest to anyone I know though.

p8LWewH4g9K9S5kuyvXD-w.text: Went there this morning. I had the chicken and waffles, and my friend had the s'mores waffles. We were both blown away. I was given the cinnamon stick infused bottle of maple syrup, and my friend was impressed by the way the Cinnamon Toast Crunch (the graham crackers on her s'mores waffles) were baked into the waffle. The marshmallows were toasted, much to her delight, and the chocolate chips were infused into the batter of the waffle.   My chicken was fried exactly as it should be. No extra grease dripping off of it. The waffle was baked and crispy, I was very impressed. The maple syrup was good, although while infused with real cinnamon stick I couldn't really tell much of a difference.  The waitress we had was excellent, and while not so friendly, was a perfect server. I personally don't want conversation and strangers pretending they're my friends at breakfast, so this was perfect for me, although lonely hearts that need serving staff to be their new buddies will be disheartened. Be wary if you're a Millenial that needs everyone to be approving of their alternate lifestyle and requires everyone to care about it. These people don't, they have a job to accomplish and do it both rapidly and exceptionally.  Five stars for the staff and the food. Kudos to the cooks that I couldn't personally tip and congratulate.

-XtZBnybrI4VyGpXABw5Vg.text: We've been here in Las Vegas for a few days and have eaten at several different highly rated, and very good, restaurants (Bacchanal, Carnevino, Americana) but this was definitely my favorite meal. I had the spice rubbed ribeye and chilaquiles and it was EPIC!!! We also had bread in a cup, pancakes, eggs Benedict, french toast and they were all so good. We will keep this on or "must eat" list for the next time we are in town

jYb9Sohfw9OI-w_lsXvN7A.text: Picture this:   It's Memorial Day weekend, and instead of a long slumber, your SO drags you out of bed promising a delicious brunch. As I reluctantly got dressed this morning, I will say I had lofty expectations for this restaurant hoping they would fill my belly without leaving my wallet empty.   We arrived around noon on a Saturday and were seated within just a few (maybe 3-5) minutes. What awaited us at the table was a sizeable menu with the everyday breakfast items and a few curious twists. I decided on the bananas foster waffle: a delectable waffle topped with cinnamon, brown sugar bananas, orange zest, whipped cream and a dollop of vanilla ice cream. Now, I know what you must be thinking. Is it breakfast? Is it lunch? Is it a shareable dessert? (Quite possibly all of the above???)  Ten minutes later, I'm staring down this beast only armed with a fork and knife. One bite in, and I'm ready to come back next weekend! This delectable treat is sure to make you reconsider stopping at a Denny's or IHOP ever again! The combo with scrambled eggs and crispy bacon (how I requested it cooked) were absolute perfection. This was worth waking up for, and I'm so thankful this place exists a mere seven minute drive from my house!!!  Congratulations Rise & Shine for making another customer for life!

Xx4I0XOluYE8CITSsc2ZBw.text: Meh.   I was really excited to try this place because it caught my eye as I drove by and I'm always open to trying a cute new breakfast spot in Vegas.   The wait was really long. That's our own fault though for deciding to wait. It was a beautiful day and patio was closed. A lot of empty tables inside.   Food was good and presentation of the food was nice. Sadly, for all the time waiting, I was kind of just ready to move on with my day at that point.   On the check, the server wrote in what 18% percent gratuity would be and added it in and circled the total with the 18%. Kind of tacky.   Long story short, food was good but not that good.

AmTP8p-i1s_NdpDl01uiPA.text: We visited this place for the first time today and we were in no way disappointed! Firstly, we were greeted immediately. They took our name down and said it would be about a 15 minute wait. It was very nice outside, so we asked if it was to be possible to be seated outside and the server said that it was no problem! I was a little nervous about being the only customers outside, as most places forget about you, but that was not the case. They were very attentive and the food was amazing. Nicole, our server, was awesome. It was the first, but definitely not the last time we will go to this restaurant.

RouAW04B4hp_qcRVlxRTsw.text: Went here with 6 friends for breakfast. Was amazing! Great service and reasonable pricing. Will be going back

GD8teuQ23pmX9goPISmdjQ.text: This place is so good I wish there was one in SD. Anyone who has spend time in vegas knows that steak and eggs is a important staple.  This wonder spot specializing in every kind of steak and eggs just hits the spot,  great service, great food, and resonable prices!

LoXEPp_a-eI-bX4SWOWW0Q.text: This place has such a fun decor with it was dimly lit with umbrella like designs hanging from the ceiling. I love the employees' uniforms it is so cute and appropriate that they are dressed in PJs. The breakfast menu is far from basic they have several different ways to cook eggs Benedict plus unique pancakes that I've have never seen on another menu. My son had the chocolate chip red velvet pancake with a cream cheese like sauce. First of all it was huge!!! One pancake was larger than the plate. For a sweet breakfast it was very good and fluffy. I had the Belgian waffle with strawberries and whipped cream and totally enjoyed it. The waffle was crisp but fluffy at the same time and was loaded with strawberries and whipped cream. The coffee was piping hot and plentiful.  Service was good the wait was super friendly and made sure everyone liked their meal. The prices were a little high but you get a ton of food.

ty0OKfmj6-GYP6VDUQlkng.text: TRY THE CHICKEN FRIED STEAK!!! Amazing. We also came here for my mom's birthday and we just mentioned it to our waitress and she brought out this big ass birthday pancake for her!! The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the pot of bread, it was hard.

rrYdWu70N6lNoaUuSZsOXA.text: Amber was very attentive and friendly. Wanted to update my review. Thank you! We like to eat here because the cup of bread is so good.

dH4yzEclzNVP-0sGvCYVjg.text: Rise and Shine has a cozy atmosphere and comfortable with booths and tables. An interesting concept is that the wait staff are dressed in pajamas.     We were seated promptly and ordered water and coffee. The water arrived immediately but no coffee. After an extended wait a server was flagged down to get the coffee. Our server Sarah apologized for the delay. We arrived for breakfast shortly after a group of 14, hence the volume seemed to over whelm the kitchen with a long wait time for our breakfast order.  The order of Pancakes was delicious and consisted of 2 hubcap size cakes. Too much for the average person. The Chilaquiles had an over abundance of spicy ranchero chips and a little short on the refried beans. We received the bill and were told to take our time. I put my credit on it and waited for our server to pick it up. After a lengthy wait I waived at Sarah and she advised us to pay at the register.

0iQMJwulI8rqZQPkYa5OUA.text: Haven't been to this place in awhile due to horrible service. I decided to give the place a second chance. There are approximately 4 parties total in the restaurant. Coffee is cold, and my waitress took lunch right after taking our order. My parties food has been under a heating lamp for over 5 minutes. The staff does not seem to care much about customer service. I understand a waitress needs to eat, just not in front of their customers. . After finishing lunch our waitress brings our food. "The plates are extremely hot." Thanks heating lamp I appreciate it. After expressing concern for the time taken to cook the food our waitress replied with attitude. The manager came by and apologized for the miscommunication. The food tasted well. Over all not to bad of an experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My waitress at lunch giving outstanding customer service.

8FcAH0Fxz6SGR2apwtReZw.text: Big thanks to Nicole and the team for a lovely breakfast this morning.  er recommendations were on point, the coffee is DELICIOUS as was all the food.  Also, major props for putting up with a large group first thing in the morning.  I'll definitely be back!

6X6wF7fCXKG-Lu8uHevLgA.text: Walking in blind, someone one new to the restaurant I was a bit taken back by the interior decorations and waiters outfits.  THEY WERE PAJAMAS!!lol  Sounds weird but by the end of our time eating I noticed their uniforms placed a comforting aspect to our meal.  Our server ASHLEY was AMAZING!!  Ask for her whenever possible. She went above and beyond even being short staffed.  She took the time to explain the menu and the popular favorites.  If you do stop by here make sure you get a steak. It's not a steakhouse but the quality is comparable to that of one. Sounds crazy I know but take a leap of faith like I did and I assure you, you won't be disappointed.

COnhIV9g_pAu3t-KoauvCw.text: A really fun place to have breakfast! The food is good and the atmosphere makes the experience enjoyable!  All the waiters and waitresses wear pajamas which I think is a really fun touch. :)  The food is decently priced very comparable to egg works or ihop price range.  I went for lunch and had a chicken Caesar salad which was very good and the portion was large. A member of our party got the steak and eggs which he also enjoyed.  A cute place and service was fast and friendly. Will return :)

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Cesar Salad :) the chicken is warm and not chilled grilled which is a huge plus in my book!

7WlcuGFKhWgf0fyuFUKp9g.text: This was our first time at rise and shine a steak and egg place and we loved it! Amberley was super fantastic, Service was outstanding and the food was amazing! Can't wait to come back

h0_aEgFt3Xrv-K9ZRo8vaA.text: I really really wanted to like this place. It's a shame we spent over $60 to be disappointed. My boyfriend and I love steak and eggs and always said we will eventually try this place out. So, Saturday around 1pm today we walked in an almost empty restaurant. The atmosphere was great, our seats were perfect, the music was comfortable and it just seemed like it was gonna be a good experience. After all, how can you fuck up breakfast?   Anyways, we ordered and to start off. the coffee was room temp, and the container that the creamer came in had a black muck in it. Clearly it was dirty and reused without washing. But sure, restaurants make mistakes and things happen so we were willing to let that one go. But I guess our brunch wasn't over yet because after this one mistake after another kept happening. Second was my smoothie. I saw it sitting on the counter after being finished for a good 10-15 min before it was brought to our table, its weird because you'd think "fresh" smoothies should be delivered as soon as possible. And when the smoothie was delivered she refilled my water, but when I looked down to drink there was some kind of dirt that fell in the water. But whatever, I'll drink from his cup instead..   food comes out and our steak was waaay underdone. The hash browns were burnt and oily and the eggs were over cooked.  Unfortunately we couldn't eat it and had to send it back. This was minutes after trying to flag the server down. Through all this our food remains sitting in front of us uneaten and getting colder. when she finally notices we were trying to get her attention she tells us that she thought we had asked for medium rare. She said they'll throw the steak back on the grill. And to order the hash browns less crispy next time. We thought it was weird that they would throw the same piece of steak that we already tried to eat back on their grill. but I guess she wasn't kidding lol. So then it came out the second time and it was dry and overdone with my omelette that was more rubbery the second time it came out because it was the same eggs that came with our meal. I guess they thought why would you re do the omelette if we only complained about the steak and the hash browns, right???? well, it's so the cheese doesn't solidify by the time it comes out and so the eggs don't turn out rubbery that's why! It's either they're lazy or just don't wanna use their resources properly. As for the hash browns they came out soggy and much greasier. over all, the food tasted like left overs when it was time to eat it.   the second time the server comes back to check on how we were liking our food I was just fed up from how sloppy this place has been so I said mine was fine. My boyfriend told her he didn't like his at all but he and I were both hungry so we'll eat it.   At this point honestly, what can you do? She tried  to give him a $5 coupon for the next time we come back but I don't think we will be coming back. Terrible impression overall.   We still left her a 20% tip though because we're not terrible people. We just really wanted a good breakfast dammit! lol

XiYx4d-4kglfR0irkrmjMw.text: Went here for breakfast with the family. The place was the busiest around and most other stores struggling to stay open as we saw a few that were closed and available for lease. There is a nice outdoor area that also has kids play zone and games for our little one. Big bonus as she was bored post food. I ordered the eggs Benedict (normal) and did poached hard eggs. I should have done normal as my mom and wife's eggs were poached perfect (I dislike the runny egg white). The taste was still good and serving size was nice (too much for most, perfect for me). I ordered crispy hash browns and they were done very well. Wife had the salmon eggs Benedict and she liked hers. She didn't like mine as much and I think it's because they did a drizzle of balsamic vinegar over the hollandays sauce. I would definitely go here again. I also found it nice being off strip and away from everything.   Also daughter got the half waffle and came with whipped cream. I finished that. Real maple syrup and had cinnamon sticks innit even though I could not taste it. The waffle was good and fluffy and the syrup soaked in nicely even after being cold I found it very good.

Rlq4GvQ21MgE6FlD3sK4pw.text: Great breakfast! I had the buttermilk pancakes and eggs and he had the biscuits and gravy with hashbrowns. It was all excellent! We had delivery thru postmates. It was made quickly we were pleased all around. Very good biscuits and gravy I would recommend both meals!

Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wjaPHrMEVgOrAmSwoTfFHw.text: My boy jeremy with the monopoly pajama has recommended the best steak I could eat from this restaurant from a surfer look he has great taste and wouldn't lie to you if I could rate more then 5 stars I would I eat here every Friday now

ttH5CqiO95vI_BXxhNHhLQ.text: Get the Ribeye Steak and eggs (the Ultimate) with a cup of bread...you can't go wrong!!!! Good Eats D Zolecki

fke-ADe1XRwQ3NxZgokYXQ.text: I have given this restaurant 4 stars because the service was 5 stars but the food was only 3 stars due to a overly charred, yet undercooked steak. I understand though that all of their managers were out of town for a training conference, so that this could what contributed to the food only being a 3. I give our server, Devyn, 5 stars though. We moved here from Chicago 9 months ago and have been consistently disappointed with the hospitality we've experienced here in Las Vegas. Thanks to Devyn that experience is starting to change. She is a competent, caring, attentive, and efficient server. She is a gem with a gift of hospitality. Thank you Devyn!

Ue5SCdiYVBQ0RfuCXKz4rw.text: Jeremy had us from the moment he greeted us in his Monopoly pajamas! He was so kind and genuine, it made my first experience at Rise & Shine amazing. Loved him!!! The food was also amazing and I DEFINITELY recommend getting the cup of bread! Oh my goodness, best breakfast item I've had in a while!! Got the ribeye steak and it was so juicy and good. Also got a smoothie, delicious!! Everything was fresh and I'm so happy we came! Thank you Jeremy!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cup o&#39; bread!

4prWZ1385VSx9_WsaxiJNQ.text: AMBERLY H was our server, she was fantastic, I will drive across town just to eat here. Thank you so much for the great service and great food, and a very clean establishment.

yLo3741K3g1aVMhsrH2HAg.text: Here visiting from Atlanta. Breakfast was fantastic and our server Amberly H was amazing

JaiPaAfRwHYZPSteDjlQ8Q.text: This is my new favorite breakfast place in the city! I tried their S'mores Waffle & definitely didn't need to add syrup, it was sweet enough.   I also tried their fresh juice, ordered watermelon & strawberry juice, great complement to my meal.   Service was excellent! I will definitely come back whenever I'm in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;mores Waffle

H4Ycz3FHc4qTg9gs5-k_gQ.text: This place was pretty good! We had a party of 15 and Our waitress was amazing! Our food cane out quick and everything was delicious. I'm excited to go back and try some more menu items!

sKyoSSia7_V1kKchJIrX4A.text: I don't often pass out the 5 stars, but I honestly couldn't find anything wrong with the past two meals I've had here.   First time we came here, around 10 am, it was PACKED. Literally not a seat in the house. The staff still managed to seat us promptly and deliver our food in less time than I've waited at some Chipotle's. They were even apologetic about both the wait to be seated and the wait for food, which really wasn't long compared so other popular breakfast joints in town.  I'm a big fan of their fresh pressed juice, especially the strawberry watermelon one. TRY IT! I tend to do breakfast a bit on the healthy side, so I'm always the one ordering the egg white omelette with all sorts of substitutions. Even so, their hash browns are THE BEST. They slice the potatoes nice and thin so that they come out crispy...hopefully the way everyone likes them. That's how I like them! No soggy or greasy hash browns here!  Each time I've come in the staff has been dressed up, once for Halloween and once they were all wearing pajamas. It def gives a different vibe to your weekend breakfast routine. I love it!

xThexQf_PyO-UncAsoSw1g.text: This restaurant is awesome,  The staff is friendly,  genuine and just great. I have eaten here several times. Our waitress was Lucy, we received excellent customer service and our food in a timely manner. I enjoyed the chicken fried steak and their waffles are really, really good.  They have a variety of freshly squeezed juices. The ambiance is warm and inviting.  This restaurant also sales merch(decorative socks and T Shirts)

7GU0rE3TW2umleN4-77T8A.text: Service was great. Cup of bread was delicious. I don't remember the name of the waffle I got but it was basically a smores waffle with cinnamon toast crunch on it, delicious even though they didn't bring it out with syrup and took forever to actually get it and start eating. Steak was cooked perfectly, just how I asked. I asked for over medium eggs and received fully cooked fried eggs. I really wanted my steak with some yolk. For the waffle dish we asked for over medium eggs and sausage, we received scrambled eggs and bacon. That error is hard to over look because it is in no way similar to what we ordered. Paid $35 for those two meals and it definitely was not worth it in my opinion. The steak and eggs were a good portion for the price but definitely not the waffle. Probably won't be coming back.

FC1EkBbjmuqRLW6oP5R8iA.text: Fancy steakhouse omelet. Ordered steak medium rare with a light sear and they delivered perfectly! Said no hash browns or toast and cheerful server offered avocado instead. Yes please! Ordered hot tea and she kept extra hot water on the table and offered another tea bag. (Not sure if there was an extra charge for the avocado or second tea bag.) Sat outside on the sunny patio but there are enough trees to offer shade. Worth the drive across town for this.

nk6vZmWla1YRqKXVBzcA4w.text: We walked in and were told the wait would be about 10-20 mins, no problem, we looked around and read some of the funny quotes on the t-shirts , some very comical, we enjoyed the cute flower umbrellas hanging from the ceiling, seemed cozy and we were eager to see how the food was going to be.  We actually were seated only 10 mins of waiting, nice surprise and were sat near the fresh juice drink bar, and had to order the Watermelon juice and a fresh squeezed orange juice , yes the watermelon was fresh and not imitation, it was so refreshingly delicious, and pretty much the most flavorful item I ordered.  We came during Halloween weekend and all the staff were dressed in costumes which added to the fun environment... "Harry Potter" served us and he was great and knew the menu very well.  The unfortunate reason for the 3 stars was the food, although looking good, we found for some reason the eggs were a little rubbery and we had to keep adding salt... As per recommendation of "Harry" as to get either the Banger sausage, the kielbasa or bacon, he raved about the bacon especially if ordered extra crispy...  So I ordered the classic which included 2 eggs, bacon (extra crispy) and hash browns with choice of bread and of course the cinnamon pot of bread (you must try the pot of bread if you dine here a positive plug and reward for the meal).  When the meal arrived, the bacon was barely past pink and did not stand up to attention by any means, sad... I was only able to eat a few bites of the eggs , and no it wasn't a picky morning, just an unfortunate meal for me. My friends got a classic with 3 egg whites and one yolk, avocado and hash browns, she also had the same problem with her eggs being rubbery and tasting like they came from a carton not a fresh egg. And chicken fried steak and gravy  The hash browns were almost done well enough, a bit of bite it took to eat and the steak my friend said was dry but edible.  I think something must have been wrong with the coffee machine because it tasted burnt but was cold...  So to sum up, we might give it another shot and try completely different meals but will make sure to order the watermelon juice and pot of bread for sure. We left feeling underwhelmed and still hungry.

X3y8f0NCpSE9Qskwba4HNQ.text: If you dont get s thing else just do yourself a favor and get a side of pop over bread... you will thank me later!  This place has amazing food and good service and never disappoints.

HFp2OY8mYKGSkdekJRknXg.text: Goooood Morning!! We decided to pay this place a visit after a few recommendations so we did. I looked at a few pics and thought this place looks aite...we got in and the place looked very very unique, it has a real brunch feel, especially today for some reason waitresses were in pajamas! Lol anywho food, we got the chilaquiles, spice rubbed rib eye chilaquiles, country fried steak and eggs, and my little one had the silver dollar cakes. All of it was delicious, the little one finished his plate and was eating out of mine! The spice rubbed rib eye was amazing, i had it medium well and the flavor of the spices, juices from the meat wow!! Chilaquiles were very enjoyable with some sour cream, chees was there and even had beans on the bottom so mix well!! Eggs were ever easy so it all came together in great unity for an epic breakfast! Thanks Rise and Shine, we will see you again very soon!!!

PbFD0pUU0gVvOMM8q5Dwrw.text: Probably the premiere place to get some steak and eggs in my opinion. It's not a $5-6 steak and egg that you can get as a late night special, but you pay for better quality and things you can't get elsewhere.   One of their highlights I would say is their pot of bread. It's almost like a cinnamon roll, and especially when you dip it into their cream cheese icing (or whatever the deliciousness is), it takes just like one. Since they have a full breakfast menu, you can get a variety of items. One of my favorites are the chilaquiles with the ribeye steak. Unfortunately it doesn't come with the pot of bread, but you could always get it on the side, it's worth it! The servers all wear pajamas, so I guess it fits into the theme of Rise and Shine, and I think it's pretty cool. Definitely worth the visit!

jIfB510WkUOUMfSmVyULgg.text: My family and I went to lunch at Rise & Shine and the food was great! The costumer service was great. Sara, our server, was super friendly, patient, and helpful. She was fast and took care of us really well. Definitely will go back! Thanks to Rise & Shine and Sara!

0AOLX91tOXKINpYCjBAHaQ.text: A couple of friends brought my daughter here for breakfast after a sleepover recently & when she got home, she was ranting & raving about how we needed to go back. She thought I would love it. I decided to give it a shot today since I was in the area...I can see why she recommended it.  It's a cute place that is spacious, the decor is happy, the people are all pleasant (who wouldn't be happy wearing pj's at work?!) & then the food...it's really good.  This morning I ordered:  -latte w/Nutella & whipped cream -build your own omelette (I chose cheddar, spinach & avocado w/ the pot of bread as my side choice) -strawberry watermelon juice  The latte was ok. Tasted more like a hot cocoa & wasn't hot enough for me. I felt like I had to drink it quick so I wouldn't lose the heat. Next time I'll opt for the French press coffee.  The omelette was pretty darn good. The egg portion was fluffy & the ingredients I added were fresh & tasty. My favorite part of the plate? The hash browns. Holy cow were those good. They are thick cut strips of real potatoes that were the perfect combo of crispy & seasoned with some softer pieces underneath. I want to high five the chef for the perfect grilling of this deliciousness on my plate. The pot of bread that I chose was amazing too. It came out hot with a side of butter and cream cheese sauce. When I removed the bread from the pot, I found that there were swirls of cinnamon throughout it. I dipped it in the cream cheese & to my delight, I realized it was like a cinnamon roll. So so good.  The waiter recommended their fresh squeezed juices that are squeezed fresh on site. I decided I wanted something else after the quick latte so I ordered the strawberry watermelon juice. It was ok. Definitely fresh. The flavor was more watermelon than strawberry & it was sweet but had a bit of a bitter aftertaste like I had just bitten into the white/green part of the melon. I think I'll try a different flavor next time.  The service was good. I had a waiter named Roy who was patient & friendly. He was as quick as he could be.   Overall I'm happy with the experience & will definitely come back!

jex5_pPK_cuKeIxEJNgicw.text: Recently I treated my daughter to breakfast at Rise and Shine. It has a lovely rustic look, very clean and neat. The staff was very friendly. Now let's talk about the food, can you say Delicious. Yes it's a  little  pricy  but it's  well worth the price. Go check it out and check out the pj's the servers have on. Also love those umbrellas

xxLZ1bTLiqokOtr3xSZUqQ.text: For my first time all in all was not a bad experience. Restaurant was very clean and we were sat right away. The menu has a good variety, although the beverages were a bit overpriced. The food portions are good for what u pay. The steak I had was charred to much but under cooked on the inside. I would come back, just need to try something different.

_k8RrnmG9PPg04lMhwuNPw.text: Great place for breakfast but be prepared for a wait, this place is always busy! The service is more often than not, excellent and the servers have great personalities! I love the Go Go Green Juice.

Fr5U6awclXkxQeurYrdzkg.text: Oh my! We LOvE this Place!!!! At first I didn't think it would be as intimate and lovely as the one in southern highlands.... But it exceeded my expectation. Now that I live on the west side I'm so HAPPy they have this location! The service was outstanding! I cannot remember our servers name for the life of me... ( I wanna give her the recognition she deserves... She was a beautiful African American woman with pink pjs on who was just a delight!)  ... She answered so many questions for us with the new additions to the menu! ... The fresh juice was delish!  My steak was so good ;-) the pancakes OMG I swear they're sprinkled with Angels dust!!!!!! So Good!!!!!!!!!!!! .... The burrito is the bomb also! Yum yum yum!!!!!!!!!!  You gotta check this place out... Pot-o-bread is TO DiE FOR!!!!!!!!!  We  this place!

c_025gn2OWY9gqvMaiyrww.text: What is not to love about rise & shine, my husband and I came in on a Sunday morning before church at 9am. No wait, no line, no problems.  We were greeted by a beautiful hostess who had us promptly seated and minutes later we were greeted by our sweet and fun waitress in blue pajamas with white lining on the arms and the ends of her bottoms. (I wish I remembered her name we tipped her extra because she was perfect.) anywho, she got us drinks immediately and helped us to decipher some things on the menu. We went with the pot of bread for each of us. HELLO, so good?!? And my husband had the Italian iced coffee.   we came with our 5 month old, they didn't have a sling or highchair for her carseat but she slept the entire time and they put her carseat in a chair, we kind of wish she woke up just so she could see the beautiful umbrellas on the ceiling.   For our entrees I had chicken and waffles - well seasoned, slightly spicy, too much breading but so delicious... and my husband had the ultimate steak and eggs, he was so wowed by the flavor of everything on his plate he asked if we could come back with our whole family for Father's Day.   We asked to book a table a whole month in advance for Father's Day and were told that Sunday mornings we probably shouldn't have a problem but to call ahead to get a time estimate, the manager was awesome and so was our hostess.   Now here comes the con. - I won't mark the restaurant 4 stars just because the cashier ruined my morning so...  We rated our visit a 15 until it was time to checkout. We approached the check out and had to check out with the woman in the front... She was happy to take my money but angry and pissed to take my virtual stamp card. As a matter of fact, she wanted me to step to the side and figure out how to make it work while she checked other people out and then when I did she gave me credit for one thing when essentially I was owed credit for the coffee, and both entrees. Makes me sad that on every table they hype up the app and if everyone gets that same push back j don't care how beautiful your establishment is, how great your food is, and how amazing your management and waitress staff is, the cashier needs an attitude adjustment. She set a bad tone for my Sunday, which was also my birthday weekend. Let her know we appreciate what help we got. So be warned, unless you've used "epoxy" the app before, don't ask questions when you check out.

i4ql7gtsgB4dnkZ4TApSZA.text: The wear your pajamas atmosphere is great. Bright colors and fresh squeezed juices get everything going right.  Now to the meal. Steak and eggs was the best choice. A thinly sliced ribeye with a great char to the cooked. Still being left medium rare with a great cook on the meat takes skill. The potatoes are hash with a flat almost fettuccine cut. They are finished with a great crispy edges to give them good texture. Eggs were scrambled with good flavors. The overall occasion is a must return.

eas94cXOv3S3mqTczQabkg.text: First off, food is always a 5 star. Service however is usually a 2 at best. This Sunday, I actually had a good server, which Is why I waited to do a review. I wanted to request to no be sat in a certain persons section since the last 3 times I have gone here, I've sat in his section. I got a new guy this time and wish I remembered his name. He was attentive and did his job properly and they were moderately busy.   The "other" server, in the past has been outright rude. Not the best way to start a morning. We sat outside, waited about 10 minutes to be greeted by our server. By then we were ready to order food and our drinks. While I was giving my food order, he was texting on his phone and missed my order. I had to do I again, then the meal was wrong. I got a rude look as he took my plate back instead of just fixing the one wrong item. So I sat with no food for about 10-15 minutes while the amazing cooks replaced the meal.   The next time I had this server, it was barely busy, but apparently 2 servers called in sick, it was a holiday weekend. Waited over 45 minutes for our food, this same server never came to the table to fill drinks or explain. I walked to the kitchen to get my own coffee where he grabbed the cups from my hands to fill it. Also, greeted with an attitude. When I was asked by the manager how my meal was, I said "food was great, service and server were terrible. " she replied simply "oh".  I think the service here needs to be put on attention. If you're not a morning person, a breakfast restaurant might not be a great career choice franky.

6J-RlItxUZ6fqIpTgtAWGQ.text: They serve your food on a platter and it is completely full. Bring a very large appetite here. Sausage gravy is amazing, NY chicken fried steak is huge and very flavorful. Buffalo chicken was perfect, medium spice bursting with flavor.  Amberly was our waitress and was very friendly and attentive. She took extra time to explain menu items as this is our first time here.    I recommend this place to everyone.

B6Bu0RO2GmQ2O1xa1JHacA.text: Horrible service.  Waited 10 mins for seat, then 15 mins to order, then over 35 mins for food which never came.  We left after almost an hour of never getting our meal.  Never trying this again.

ePN0tJqdx-wFxlZh4fvvzw.text: Seems like always a great place to grab breakfast or lunch foods. Good amount on the menu but not too much to make you dizzy. Ive ate here a few times and the food has always been good. The food is prepred the way you ask from steaks to eggs. And the wait staff has always been polite and curtious. If your in the mood for some hearty delicious brunch style food well this is a place to try.

xspmGzH-zH7H1NJJDuY1uA.text: Initial impressions upon walking in the door is that the restaurant is very spacious. On the other hand, the menu is a bit busy and doesn't really lead me to any particular area of the menu to order. For a place with "steak" in the name I was expecting more "steak" entrees. Service was a bit slow given that the place wasn't that busy. Staff were also not the friendliest, but not the worst I've experienced.  As for the food, it was ok. My steak was cooked to how I ordered it, although it was bland. I somehow feel like Denny's is a step above this place. There was nothing that wowed me about the food. Service improved towards the end. My coffee was refilled before dropping below half. Overall this place is okay. Would I necessarily return here again? No, but if the only choice was between here and McDonald's for breakfast, I'd probably go here instead.

GatfaZYcOiTTw5WJYAe1-g.text: Steak and eggs are filling and flavorful.  They offer actual hash browns, not just cubed potatoes.  Service was kind and attentive.  I'll becoming back for breakfast again.

j3EolazpJ_D3yshF-dhJDw.text: Excellent place for breakfast or lunch. Nice variety to choose from with very good coffee and juices. On our first visit here my wife had the Salmon Eggs Benedict with Watermelon & Strawberry Juice. I had the Ultimate Steak & Eggs Breakfast with coffee. Filling and satisfying portions. Will be back soon. Looking forward to trying other menu items as well as their French Press Coffee.

ACKPKBxFK9mlIOOmaeKasg.text: Amberly was my waitress and she was awesome . She helped me choose what to eat since I was so indecisive. And she recommended the steak house omelette which was delicious ! Perfect for when you want some steak but not too much . She always kept making sure my coffee was nice and warm and the service was great ! I will totally be eat here again !

J2f4kOudq7VX2nF5sTycDg.text: In terms if service, we arrived on a Saturday around 10 am, and there was plenty of seating, however we had to wait 15 minutes. We asked to be seated outside. The outdoor patio is pet friendly, which is both good and bad. Although I would love to bring my furry friends, I could do without the pet hair blowing around my eggs.  We ordered an iced coffee for $4, which we won't order again. Received the coffee to find out it was coffee, chocolate syrup, and nesquick powder and a ton of ice. Would have been good except they didn't stir the powder and with the shape of the glass and amount of ice they used, it makes it almost impossible to stir, so you get big globs of powder.  We ordered the bacon wrapped steak and two egg breakfast. We also got a pot of bread which was delicious.  Generous portion of bacon and good potatoes. Potatoes could use a bit more salt though...  Great venue overall..nice space between tables. Two people for breakfast cost about $40.  We would go back again.

xc9fCLhn0cz2I0AjzR6rTw.text: There's usually a wait every time I go here, but the food makes it work it. The fresh orange juice is amazing and so it the Smoke Salmon and Bacon Bagel. LOVE LOVE the pot bread. & I like how the servers all wear pajamas. I wonder if most of them sleep on what they're wearing to work the next.   I've been here a few times and am definitely impressed by their food, not so much their service. Hasn't been consistent. Servers have either been to over bearing or never came by after dropping off our food. Over all though, their food makes up for it.
