dugDugzLZZBffhvw-yjUQg.text: I'm in love with this place! Our server, Amberleigh was awesome from the start. She explained the menu from top to bottom, including all her favorites and which dishes were most popular. I ordered the crispy French toast.....  Best French toast I've had in my 33 years on this planet! My hubski ordered the moco loco, also delish. Kiddo had the silver dollar pancakes.. to which he said, "they are almost as good as yours"  Overall, great experience! Stuffed to the max! I'd like to make one small note.... the lady in the back with the gorgeous red hair flowing.. should tie it back. Also, she should refrain from grabbing her phone and iPads with the same gloves she's handling all the food with. Sorry.. I had to throw that part in there  That's the only reason for my 4 stars. We will be back for sure! Thanks for the awesome breakfast!!

DTZ6Lxb4JAkF57ij-7dLJA.text: Driving this morning and saw Rise & Shine a steak & egg place, since I had not had breakfast yet I checked out the menu online, it looked inviting so I decided to give it a try. I am glad I did, fortunately it was not packed yet so my first visit quite calm. A lot of that is due to the relaxed atmosphere, but still the customer is priority. I got sat facing the open kitchen which for me ( picky about the way the food is handled & who is preparing it ) was not off putting. The fun thing is that the servers wear pajamas. Pricing is consistent with similar restaurants, but the food I think was quite a bit better. Asked for my steak well done and unlike a lot of well done steaks I have received this one had a great char on the outside but was still tender enough on the outside ( no hockey puck here ). Service was excellent from the hostess all the way through and including bus help. I highly recommend coming here and this will now be my go to breakfast place.

ubCK1aiRnknXwWzJwjy8HA.text: The food was so bomb. The steak chilaquiles was definitely mouth watering. Our waitress was super friendly and she took great care of us. Shoutout to Ashley!!!

E1aKUDlCAd7R-1_r1eOIZA.text: Nice!!! Where do I start. The food first. I say great, steak cooked as ordered and done properly. Service is excellent! Our waitress Madison did an excellent job. Pretty busy for a Sunday. Rise n Shine moved up to the top breakfast spots for me.  They have French Press coffee, just like at home. That's refreshing to get at a restaurant, tasty. Great breakfast spot in Vegas, not your typical greasy spoon casino cafe. Price is reasonable, not like Denny's but who the heck goes there anyway.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rise n Shine flower lights.... ;)
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy!!! Biscuits n Gravy
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Ultimate Steak n Eggs

1y7r3_dJCVt1dwVPa838KQ.text: Not sure if it is an off day or what but I am done eating and still waiting for a drink refill and my toast. I would love to love this place but when you are paying a premium you expect premium food and service. I just don't see it. My daughter got a waffle and added strawberries for $2.25. It was 1 strawberry cut up. What??

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Is this $2.25 worth of strawberries?

AeziTFGeB1aoaxoeWUFZYg.text: Not from the area but all I can say is whenever I'm back in the Vegas area I will definitely eat here again! A very clean and welcoming environment with excellent breakfast! It's always nice too when the waitress is nice and helpful! Ashley did an outstanding job recommending items on the menu and took care of us! Thank you Rise &I Shine for a great visit

z3-tmr1VpoptYPNmCr-V8g.text: Such a great breakfast/brunch spot. Our waitress Ashley was excellent. So knowledgeable, courteous, and attentive. She also kept us from ordering more then one of the biggest pancake I've ever seen. Haha. Ashley made our experience a special one.

UNO0hSVicLfM_XFPhBYUJA.text: Ummmmm wow! Visiting here from out of town. My husband comes to Vegas often for work and recommended this place. Absolutely does not disappoint! I got the chilaquiles. Being from Southern California, I wasn't expecting much compared to what we get at home. They were the absolute best chilaquiles I've ever had! My husband got steak and eggs....delish. I won't go into what my kids got, but I will say absolutely everyone ate every last bite.

HySgxfvBLrxTchzUZCSHUw.text: This was probably the best breakfast I have ever had.  The facility was very nice and clean and had alot of room.  Very nice atmosphere.  Our waiter, Bruce, and the manager, Nicole were so awesome.  Very attentive and friendly.  The food was fantastic.  I had the chicken fried steak and eggs breakfast.  The chicken fried steak was so fresh and tender and the breading was perfect.  They did not over bread as some places do. Also had a side order of corn beef and hash that was just perfect.  Whole experience was worth 5 stars to me.  I would recommend to anyone.

oSO3p9V30AuItubAtMjFkw.text: Have always heard great things about this place. All of it was True. Great food and fast service. My waitress, Ashley, was easily one of the best waitresses I have ever had. I will be back often.

wdX2BgwIwkA42jW2iVU7PA.text: The only reason I am giving this a star at all is due to our waitress who was really sweet. Our food came out cold and under cooked. There was absolutely no flavor to my potatoes even though it appears as though they were cooked with onions. My watermelon strawberry juice had a faint meat taste which I attribute to the fruit being cut with utensils used with meat or even a cutting board not fully washed. The sausage was hard and I don't mean burnt I mean tough and slightly dried out it also smelled bad. After one bite of that I decided to just eat my toast, the only thing palatable. My husband and I will not be back.

A2wpFv7-OPdYX8Gl6Kwa5A.text: I give this place 4 stars because the food is good. The breakfast everyone had, the coffee, and the "pot of bread" were really good. The service... Completely atrocious. I hate to say it, but it was. Yes they were busy and I do cut them some slack for that. It was, however, beyond bad. We waited 10 min before anyone came over, asked for extra napkins multiple times, couldn't find our server throughout breakfast.. I've visited the S.Highlands location and the service was better there but it's smaller. Give it a try. It could've just been the particular server we had.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Press Lavazza Coffee and timer:)

c6eYv3incsecSeDjat4Spg.text: Went with sisters on a saturday morning. 10 minute wait. Was pretty busy, but not that busy and server took long to get to greet us once seated and a long to return with drinks. Waited over 25 minutes for our food and I noticed some people who were seated after us go their food before us, but the fancy omelette made up for it. It comes with a steak the size of your palm, hash browns and biscuit. Delicious! Sisters liked the red velvet pancakes but the ham steak was not good. Overall cute place with big portions and outdoor seating. Friendly, but slow service. I recommend just ordering take out.

9t-anasS8SdsOX57JI-B5g.text: 2nd time that I have had Breakfast here and 2nd time that I leave here satisfied. The food is really good. There pancakes wow huge and yummy.

WPpGfGP10gsf019jKKoKqg.text: My friend asked, "you like steak, right?" I responded with a "DUH!" .. She said she had the perfect spot in mind for me, as I was in town visiting from Sacramento.  Instantly fell in love with this place. The ambience is super cute and the employees all seem upbeat and in a good mood. We waited for about 15 minutes for a table on a Saturday morning.  First things first - they were ON TOP of the coffee game, yo. I rarely had to wait for a coffee refill, it just kept coming around.  My second fave thing about my experience, was that I told my server about my "dilemma" - that I really wanted a steak but that I REALLY wanted an omelet too (fat kid probs) and she said oh yeah, just order the steak and eggs, and we can make the eggs into an omelet for ya, and you can just pay 50 cents per each veggie you want to add. Wow! Super awesome. So it stands, I had a steak cooked medium with a 3-egg omelet with veggies. It also came with a side of toast, and of course, potatoes. This place is the real deal, I fell in love with it and will be back soon! :)

nCjpAjbQXTjAdeQ9r2VeNw.text: $5 for a juice-granted its fresh squeezed but $5? Also portion small. Bathroom was dirty and clearly had not been checked on a while as the wastebasket was overflowing with trash. They switched the eggs between my companion and I-ordered over medium and my companion over easy-he got mine and I got his.  Pot a bread is nice touch and the decor was cute. Usually a breakfast place is packed on Sunday, this one not do much. Maybe a few tweaks and it will be.

rd2erV2m3gb9ZLSBY3ol2Q.text: This place sucks. I usually dont complain about food but i came here and had about 3 bites of food.   I ordered chilaquiles which is a dish i have prepared before. It contains chile sauce and is usually seved with sour cream on the side or on top with fried eggs and beans.   On the menu it says that it is served with refried beans, sauce, cheddar cheese, sour cream, salsa, and two eggs.  What i got was basically nachos chips with NO sauce and beans under all the chips and when i asked for a little bit of sauce they took my plate and re did the whole thing which was nice of them. But when i got my plate back the plate was drenched in an exaggerated amount of sauce. It literally spilled off my plate as i put my fork in it..  And they forgot the beans.   So i asked for a side of beans and i was so over the fact that i couldnt eat my food without spilling sauce everywhere.   So i had about 3 bites before i pushed my plate away and just asked them to take it back. At that point i wasnt going to have them bring back a third plate.   The manager was nice enough to take it off out bill but gave zero fucks that it even happened. But at least out server was nice.  I would never come here again. My boyfriends food turned out the way it was supposed to. But we both agreed that the food was just "okay"

QWsu3SfjDtw8jF7Pi2Cp7A.text: Fantastic spot -- from the fresh juices, italian coffee, all the way down to the warm syrup. Looking for a delicious breakfast? This is the place to go, no doubt about it. Thank you to our server, Chelsea for the outstanding service! We will be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iPHDzIp9KCmETTiOMQ5now.text: Great service and great food.  The bread pots are delicious!  Love their chicken fried steak and turkey sausage.  Big servings.

UqWB2BTFlTXyiQ4FXS_chA.text: We have eaten here four times since its opening. The food is good but service  is slow.  Today (5/29) we were there around 8am. They weren't very busy but we still had to wait 30 minutes for our food. To make matters worse the steak was well done and I ordered it medium rare.  The manager came by to make sure everything was fine.  My partner ate his breakfast while I waited for mine.  What bothers  me is this would have been a good opportunity to offer a complimentary beverage or discount the meal for the inconvenience.     There far too many breakfast places around to have this kind of poor quality. We will stick we Egg Works.

OQWKnEy4tUw3x6ATvaI5YQ.text: Such a good experience. I had the steak and eggs and it was phenomenal; the steak was literally so juicy. Our server Ashley was so incredibly nice and so informative. Definitely a thumbs up

I2ox-wG7pvYkFHretFWnIA.text: AmberLee Was AMAZING!! She was so polite & friendly food was great hash browns were really good!!

DsRi8b3k23EpbPh_zjyu7g.text: Cheerful ambiance, but with quarter filled restaurant, service was more than inadequate. We sat and waited at length before we were greeted and waited even longer for our beverages. Prices were steep for basic breakfast. Food was not memorable. It will be very unlikely that we visit agin.

O56jkQ9PM6h80170qsRVlg.text: We were looking forward to trying this place. After being told it was a 45 minute wait the hostess never put our name down. Once we finally sat we waiting for nearly an hour and never got our food. The waiter came over once and told us our food would be right out, 20 minutes later it wasn't. We asked for the check because we were sick of waiting and the manager said she would take care of everything (I found this extremely funny being we never did get our food so what was she actually taking care of) and she asked us come back sometime. (Ha)  On the plus side, the orange juice ad the French press werr great.

306xW6ixfP26tOiVjtk-dQ.text: DELICIOUS! Try the Steak chilaquiles :) Desire was our server. Very attentive and sweet.

AwsB-o3dcbcUVvOZZYSz0g.text: I just want to start out by saying this place has excellent service. Each time I have come here, all waiters and waitresses are always attentive, and sometimes I want to ask them what they are on because I'm a tired mom of a toddler.   Usually when I dine out with my kid, it's always a hit or miss. You can kind of tell if the service team is new, doesn't, have kids, or doesn't want to deal with them. At the end of my meal I can tell they are very familiar with toddler age patrons. For one thing, they brought out his food/drink immediately.   So why the 4 stars? To be honest, it's the food. I feel that their menu really isn't special. Pancakes were salty and reminded me of out if the box taste. Our table also ordered a couple of French press coffee. I think their French press was either broken or not put together correctly because the coffee grounds were pouring out with the coffee. I came in late, so it wasn't worth it to mention to the waitress ( the group I was with, really don't complain about coffee).  It's like they are the Cheesecake Factory of breakfast restaurants. Pricey, huge amount of average food, good service.

eJ2D4ms97RN9pGh6QOgE5A.text: I loved the spinning flower umbrellas hanging from the ceiling. All the servers wear pajamas, so a casual vibe. At 10am on a Friday there was no crowd so the wait seemed a bit excessive but once the food came, all was good. The coffee was wonderful, as advertised. We ordered pancakes with strawberries, hash browns, and the corned beef hash. All delicious, including the rye toast.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original pancakes with strawberries, side of hash browns, and corned beef hash with scrambled eggs and rye toast.

kEmEJDJZf-YlBHt47BAsgQ.text: My husband had the steak and avo egg white omelet, and it was very flavorful, great spices, the hash browns were perfect and OMG, the cinnamon bun in a cup is to die for!  I had the Belgian waffle and it was the best waffle ever! Didn't even need butter or syrup, it was that good. However, the maple syrup had just a touch of cinnamon and was amazing! Sammie was our server and she was awesome! I absolutely love the fact that the servers are in their jammies! We will definitely be back next time we go to Vegas!

fDRGW_mHPgqOcpVNgbWQuQ.text: I have gone to this place in the past and either I was unaware of what I paid or prices have been raised.  I went for breakfast with my 3 year old and 1 year old boys today.  I ordered 2 kids apple juices (8.50), a kids meal that they shared, a breakfast sandwich, and a coffee that when I requested a refill was told they would have to charge me for a second cup.  When the waitress brought me the bill I offered my card and she said go to the counter.  Upon ringing it up I was told  $49.81.........Ridiculous.  If you look the menu up online to order for pickup or delivery there are no prices, only single dollar signs....:::

RXp1cpehCpe-_LTPUngRig.text: Food is excellent and great service. I do wish they served their lunch specials earlier though. I got the Buffalo fried chicken. The portions are huge, so I got two meals out of it.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FTzIs-k7wyxb-fkPG4CHjA.text: HATE THIS PLACE.  PERIOD. My steak is ALWAYS burnt, no lie! Then the next visit, I got these loco moco, the patties were burnt on the outside and RAW on the inside.  Disgusting! Never coming back again. EVER.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Do these people know how to cook? The outside tastes super burnt and the inside is still red worst loco moco ever.

h9jj9y7XZEsgsUeY2uRQOw.text: Service was great, long wait but it wasn't too bad. I liked how they had inside and patio seating.   POT O BREAD! Definitely was sort of like a cinnamon roll with yummy cream cheese frosting on side so you can control how much you want. I liked the fact that they offer freshly squeezed juices in carafes if you're in a large party. We ordered the green go go juice carafe and it was enough for 3 of us. It was on the sweet side, I'm guessing due to the honeydew but I enjoyed it.   3/5 for the chicken & waffles. I'm not a huge fan of salty things... and most of the time, restaurants over season their dishes IMO (like metro diner's chicken & waffles) but the chicken here was definitely lacking some flavor! It was super juicy and the waffle tasted amazing with the warm syrup they offered but it was on the bland side. I would probably order just waffles next time.   2/5 chilaquiles was a big portion but again, lacked flavor. My sister said it needed more sauce. The meat was very tender though. She didn't end up finishing more than 1/3 of her order.  Looks like pancakes, waffles and their juices are the way to go but I'll try a steak & egg dish next time.

ll29HrzmV08ebowFJuNapg.text: I find it very hard to believe the negative remarks regarding service, we have been several times and the longest wait was 10 minutes to be seated. Within 5 minutes for drink orders and and food out and on our plates within 20 minutes. Always cooked to perfection, always correct, always tasty!  Our waitress which we have been lucky to be seated in her area the past 2times,  Devon was amazing, attentive, Johnny on the spot! Constantly but not overly annoying asking if all was well, if we needed anything, refills etc... This place is great for breakfast and with the serving sizes the price is just right. We highly recommend this for breakfast early lunch! All wait staff and busser were quick, constantly working on something, no on just standing around, they all help each other! Plus can you imagine the awesome dress code is wearing PJ's, seriously!!  If your lucky Devon will be your server!

FJn1h7823KjeQBQxR2hraw.text: This is one of our breakfast go to place. They are always consistent with their food and service.  I like the fact that they can wear pajamas at work---makes me feel at home! Bread pot and French Press coffee is always our starter and I usually order their Loco Moco or their steak and eggs and the steaks has a coffee flavor as well. Yummy! They also have the Southern Highlands location.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not your typical corned beef hash!
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak with extra gravy please, pretty please!
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread pot with sweet cream cheese sauce, love it with my French press!

0o6hL_nLvM5SkbkZarUenA.text: AMAAAAZING! Everything is just THE BEST. The Ribeye steak is delicious and the dessert is like nothing I've tried before

aLwPxKz4x8T8nR6heAZ8Vw.text: ***REVISED*** This place is GREAT and we love it.  However the following review was for our last experience which was just bad.  If you are looking for a great breakfast spot in Summerlin, this is it.  Food is great and MOST of the staff are awesome.  3/7/19 We have been going to this location since we moved to Summerlin.  A few of the wait staff deserve 5 stars.  Yesterday we had a server who was TERRIBLE! He had a table next to ours that were his regulars.  This guy was bending over backwards for them, hot cups of coffee rather then filling from the pitcher, birthday pancake bs, coddling them, practically wiping their faces.  Food took over 30 minutes to come out, sure they were busy but the section next to his all got their food even if sat after us, WAY before we got ours.  He got 3 our of 4 of our dishes wrong, didn't even bother to check on us for awhile after.  My food was ice cold, and looked like he forgot to order what I had asked for (which he did mess up anyway) and just had the kitchen throw some dry diced chicken on someone else's order. When I said my food was cold he seemed put out and said he could replace it.  After sitting for over an hour, with two small children, there was no way I was going to wait for this dude to get another one made.  All the while overly waiting on the table next to us, I am not exaggerating.  He ignored and gave ALL his other tables lousy service to he could kiss butt to his regulars.   He then gives us two $5 coupons that can only be used during the week (we were there on a Saturday since we work during the week and don't usually go there other then weekends) and still gets our bill wrong by adding extra items.  His fake smile is really what set me off on the whole thing.  His gushing of the other table then the dead eyes and condescending tone was too much for me.  I wish I would have gotten his name because it was ridiculous.

pfh04NBLHTz-UseDM7nSZA.text: Overall: an excellent place for breakfast.  We came for a late breakfast on Thursday, around 1130 with 3 adults and a baby and we were seated right away.  The server was pleasant and prompt with refills.  We had the steak & chilaquilles, the salmon, bacon bagel sandwich, and the french toast.  All were outstanding, although the steak had a bit of gristle.  The only small complaint we had was that it did take quite a while to receive our orders.  The table next to us got their food much more rapidly.  I recommend this spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye steak and chilaquilles
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon, bacon bagel sandwich

fCJxpiMgmkC4oq7WJY1kAQ.text: Great place! Great food. Waitresses were friendly and food came out fast. Love the umbrellas that hang from the ceiling. I will definitely go back again and maybe try the other locations

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flower umbrellas
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs, hash browns and sausage

rBVC2bijE6RSmM6E_pvn0g.text: Large. Ginormous. Mountainous. Gigantic. Humongous. Enormous. Colossal. Massive. What's another synonym for big? Rise & Shine... This place has some of the largest portions of food I've seen yet. As far as breakfast goes, I only know of one other place that comes close. You need to come to this restaurant prepared for a feast. It surely won't disappoint.   My boyfriend and I came here hungry on a Sunday. We had never been. There was many people waiting in the lobby area. It took us maybe 20-30 minutes to get seated during mid-morning rush hours. They seemed like they were able to accommodate large parties. So, that's good to know.   Our server was dressed in a llama pajama outfit. It was AWESOME. She was friendly and attentive, even though they were very busy. She made recommendations about her favorite food. My only slight annoyance was that she didn't tell us that we were ordering WAY, WAY too much food. However, that's still okay. It was worth trying all of it.  We ordered the Country Friend New York Steak & Eggs, Buffalo-Style Crispy Chicken Breasts & Eggs, and Banana Frosted Flake Pancakes. For two of us.   All of it was fantastic. Again, if I have not made it clear enough, the portions were massively colossal to epic proportions. Yes, too much food. It was all very tasty though. We didn't want to stop eating, even though there was no dent made in the food. Hashtag, leftovers...  Overall, super awesome breakfast joint. The only possible set back is that it did take awhile to get our food once ordered. I would say 20-30 minutes, but if you're not in a rush, it is definitely worth the wait. Super happy customer here! And, again, HUGE portions. Don't be afraid to share.

zmVVGWCDIw6Cqrl4jLudeA.text: This is my First time coming to this place and it was awesome my server was Devyn I ordered the ribeye and eggs the ribeye was cooked beyond perfection I got my steak medium rare and it was definitely the best I've had in awhile can't wait to come back !

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye and eggs

OqCgfxZCoo9ZwrcgvbHAbg.text: Flavor was great on the steak. Kids portion of pancakes was large and tasty, my eggs Benedict were basic, the server was super sweet and nice, ice coffee was ehhh but most importantly.......everything was room temperature.  we were hungry on a Saturday morning before Labor Day shopping so we didn't complain but had the food of been hot, it would have been great. In their defense they were busy with a wait but room temperature food is new to me.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mTgqll0VD7zeJ04teOhe-Q.text: Came here for the first time and loved it! With busy breakfast places it's sometimes difficult to find good service, but that was not an issue here. The hostess was actually so helpful and patient in giving me directions to red rock; just the little details like that make a place so great!   The food was amazing- I am LIVING for the pot of bread and the chicken fried steak. So good, definitely recommend.  Lots of parking as well, clean, and honestly just really cozy. Loved this place!! Will be back.

AP3mPi-783gTgU5IlnpVuA.text: First of all, the restaurant is so cute and I love the design. I was enthralled by the spinning umbrellas. Ate here for the first time today and I am very pleased. One of the best breakfast places ever. Their coffee is amazing . I got the hazelnut Nutella coffee and it was delicious, just the right amount of sweetness . The meal portions are very large. I got the NY steak spinach egg Benedict. It was delicious! I had my steak medium rare and it was  very tender and juicy. Just high quality meat on top of a yummy bagel. The cup 'o bread is also a must have! I loved how soft the bread was and the dipping sauce is just perfect.   I was pleased with the service . Also I love their merch ! It's so adorable and funny  . I will definitely come back again
