2Xu787LpGCa7ANBEx-0nQg.text: Good place to go for brunch as the food is good, although some menu items are overpriced for what they are. Also, service isn't consistent! Not always the best, which in this town, service is everything IMO. Pot o bread, country fried steak, & the chicken and waffles are all meals I have tried and were really good!

LpL1XiFIhD1AdewaYxzvNg.text: Great breakfast place. Servers wear pajamas and their smoothies are very fresh. My favorite is the brown sugar banana waffle with vanilla ice cream.  It's delicious and sweet. Their french toast is a must as well.

kA2zCtwQTm4h9JysXidOtQ.text: This place is awesome. Great Food and Quality service. If you eat here definitely eat steak breakfast because it seems to be a favorite. I had the steak omelette  and it was amazing. Also, highly recommend the bread in a cup with frosting if you have a sweet tooth.

ZAnTFi99GhwGMv6oHufCkA.text: Food was cold and not much flavor, normally it's so much better. Service was even worse. The man we had came ten minutes after we sat down and then gave us the food cold . He kept forgetting everything. Sad bc this place use to be so good

FkOPbHN0Zy1TPRR6amNW_w.text: Great food, great service and really reasonable prices. It was a little slow when we came in for a late breakfast so Amberly was our hostess, waitress, and cashier. She answered all of our questions and made a great suggestion. We live on the other side of town but will be back again!

VZFp7LOjnx_Acrw7RsFNPg.text: So ... food is still on point and I REALLY want to love this place but the service is erratic .  Last time we actually left after 10 min. Seated but no acknowledgment or even drink order . Servers folding napkins and hanging out. So ... we were out.  Maybe a bit impulsive but there are far too many options for them to not be on point - and it is $$$ so expect better.  Not sure if I will be back.

_WyJKVzDbPSKOlIzUaWr2w.text: Really poor experience.  I don't usually give 2 stars but our servicer was sweet hence the second star.  Well lets start with one dish where the sweet was too sweet (my sons dish) and the savory had no flavor. The next dish had no seasoning and the third dish (chicken and waffles) had an abundance of batter,  so thick I was able to peel it off and there was a chunk of batter that was larger than a McDonald's chicken nugget.  The chicken breast that was under all that batter had absolutely NO taste (once again, no flavor)  Needless to say, it was not edible.   So unfortunate because I was looking forward to it since it's my favorite dish at their other location in Southern Highlands.  The upside is that they did acknowledge that I didn't eat my meal but because my husband had already paid the bill, the manager gave me a whopping $5 gift certificate for the incontinence of my $15 dish.

qObT9127wy9AxKpNAZMvMQ.text: Adorable restaurant!  Great food and atmosphere.  They have an outdoor patio as well.    Our waitress was eggcellent ! Priced reasonably.  Definitely recommend!

102Zefdgs4-z_sJQdps8Iw.text: We gave this place a shot again because we have family in town and wanted to go somewhere close.  Of course we were met with disappointment and embarrassment again.  My big takeaway is that employees are not empowered enough to make decisions and make things right for the customer.  Owner is not there to discuss policy and manager is also not there, and no one can make a decisions other than the two people not there.  I invited my family to breakfast because I have a few $50 gift cards, and I wanted to treat them after a long flight.  There's no notice anywhere that they can't accept multiple gift cards.  I go to pay a $158 bill... I had 3 gift cards, one with $3.59 in it and two with $50 that I was expecting to significantly defray my cost.  However, cashier tells me they can't accept more than 2 forms of payment.  I start offering solutions... can you split the check and do two forms per check? "No", can you void the order and ring it up in two checks? "No owner doesn't allow it".  Is owner here to discuss? "No", can I speak to a manager? "Manager is not here", so everything is no? "Unfortunately" and there's no one to talk to about it? "Unfortunately no".  Can you attempt to run the cards and see if it will work? "Unfortunately no".  It was so frustrating and embarrassing since I had told my family I would cover.  I have perfectly good payment forms and the restaurant has no way to accept them.  They should have some upfront notice that they can't accept gift cards.  This is a huge issue if you plan to pay a certain way and are not permitted.  Ownership and management should find a way to empower their employees to make decisions and fix things when they are not around.   What a terrible experience, when I was trying to give this place another chance after a year of avoiding it given the way we were treated last time.  My family was so excited during breakfast only to them have them all feel terrible when we left.  Awful experience.  *** edited to say the below response from management is incorrect, you did NOT allow three forms of payment from me.  Check your records.  I was only able to use one of my 3 gift cards and the rest had to be put on my personal card.  I'm happy to go back with my receipt so you can see.  No one was empowered to make any exceptions in this case, even though we were not splitting the check between multiple people... it is just gift cards.  Something I should've been able to use whether I was a party of 1 or 20.

D9mN-GOlN59qW1I6UAGxzQ.text: Came into this restaurant today for a morning breakfast meeting with some colleagues. Looked like a fun little place at first and i was excited to try it. I learned immediately that there was no wi-fi network available, which I find slightly ridiculous in 2018. I had my meal which was pretty boring and fairly tasteless. Upon finishing my meal, I needed to leave and asked the waitress for my part of the check to be split off so I could pay. She refused, and told me the machine could only split the check two ways (there was 6 of us). Now, I'm no genius here... But I do understand point of sale systems and I do know that they can run multiple transactions and split checks many different ways. This was merely her not wanting to do it, or restaurant policy. Either way it's pretty ridiculous. Suffice to say I won't be returning to this location.

MtfdYZd-6q-b7IUeeIdC1w.text: This place is awesome for breakfast. Their food has large portions and is very tasty staff is very friendly and knowledgeable of their product

aYiVn5tQqWjCs67ZsOa-iw.text: Came here for a late breakfast on a Sunday.  Had a party of 5 and had to wait about 25 minutes.  I had the crunchy cinnamon French Toast and it was awesome.  Portion was huge - would up taking half home.  My sister in law had the steak and egg bagel sandwich and enjoyed that as well.   We had a 5 year old with us and her silver dollar pancake were delivered 5-10 minutes AFTER the adults' food.  That was a bit frustrating but may have been bc they were so busy.  Very good place for breakfast!!

oaNhgaIdW1xrCQ6k0nhgng.text: Great start and chilequilles and red velvet pancakes. Don't forget the bread in a cup... delicious!

sWlzIB4bXp7F1x0Vv7V31Q.text: Delish! I'm glad to have a spacious, un-pretentious, good customer service breakfast/brunch spot close by!   My husband had the rib eye with eggs and I got the country fried steak and eggs. Both were hearty portions and tasted great! We ended our meal with the Pot o bread. We had Chelsea as our server and service was great!  I called ahead to verify wait time and if we could bring our Frenchie. For a 70 degree Saturday morning, there was no wait for patio seating. If you do bring a pup, I recommend bringing a caribiner to hook their leash to one of the wooden poles- especially if your dog is an explorer like mine. There's also an Astro turfed area where I am assuming you can "walk" your dog although I wouldn't since it is so close to dining. I also fed my dog the orange garnishes that came on the plates.  We will definitely be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country fried steak and eggs in the foreground with a rib eye and eggs in the back
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half dinner roll half cinnamon roll with a side of cream cheese-- yum!!
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruce patiently waiting for service

KHlEA_WvsM-ZaTPGxsiFWg.text: Phenomenal breakfast food. Soo many options (veggie ones!) And amazing fresh squeezed  juices! Seatedly and serviced quickly. Such a fun, quirky atmosphere with friendly team members. I was impressed and we will be back! P.s. they have corn hole!! :)

ylYtpsJGaCZ-JxPf5E2mbg.text: Absolutely love this place! I come here every time I'm in town. Been to both locations, and both are great, but I still love going to the original. Food is amazing! Juice bar!! And the fresh baked cup of bread is always good. Did I mention the food is amazing?! And I love how everyone wears pajamas. That is such a cool touch.

bSicW4ZA_R2hNw_a2GMH_g.text: Had a wonderful server Sammy, she was fast and sweet.  Food awesome,  we will be back !

lx-5ZLxMxvrWKCJ_jbmaNw.text: Came in on a Friday morning, but I will not be back.  First the pros...cute atmosphere.  Staff was very friendly.  They gave us a free cup of bread for the wait -it was really yummy.  Now the cons.  The eggs were overcooked on my benedict.  I am not a breakfast snob, but I do expect a breakfast restaurant to be able to properly cook eggs.  My husband ordered a specialty frozen/iced coffee drink, which was the worst frozen coffee ever.  Tasted like watered down hot chocolate.  No flavor.  Our server was very nice but was slow, and the check was wrong.  But the worst of it was paying.  You have to pay at the register, and we waited 20 minutes in line just to pay our check (there were only 2 parties paying ahead of us).  Not sure why it took so long, but it definitely sealed the deal on our decision never to return.  Worst dining experience in a long time.  I only gave it 2 stars because the staff was very friendly.

YyNziDeAKgzwsQzcfeLOlQ.text: Just had the Bananas Fosters waffles (w/o the ice cream though) and it's insane how delicious they were. These waffles are so light they melt in your mouth, but crisp on the edges like waffle cones. It all might sound too sweet but the banana can pull it back a little in each bite, so I don't feel too much like I'm having dessert for breakfast.. So awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VTC8yuecx-sYL3-dg2uQYw.text: Had going away breakfast with a friend on the fly and everything was made to order so fresh and yumma.   Service a little slow but it's a Sunday morning and to be expected. Was so yumma.  I think our server name was Sarah Torres she was so kind and on it (I asked host her name) he too was awesome and funny.  Thanks for the perfect Sunday morning.  PS: I luv the wear pj's to wait on you!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6h4iCPZapEeLmJA-rxJ3Ow.text: First the portion of food you get is huge. Love the servers in PJ's.  The server Amber Lee was simply outstanding answered all my questions and was super polite and very friendly. She alone will make sure my wife and I will come back again!!!! The Cup O Bread is the bomb and must to order at anytime of the day all around 5 stars well deserved!!!

vXn1aM5QE8K8A3VgczfnPA.text: First time I have eaten here and I will certainly be back!   I am a huge breakfast fan and this place absolutely did not disappoint!  Great food and wonderful service from Amberly!

t3CYCjv_tzNlJ8k4yOqRvQ.text: I love rise and  shine! I eat here 4 to 5 times a week!! My favorite food is the island inspired Loco moco. I had some yummy sweet cream pancakes  today. There is always a small wait to get  in the door, that's awesome due to them just opening up! Always worth the wait and I'll be back in a few days!! I'm going to come in my pj's next time!!

iR-iDFad9nMA5ypEJKsJIQ.text: This is a great breakfast place. However before you commit to going, be prepared for a long wait to get seats and a long wait to get your food!  Our server, Ashley, was very good and real friendly.  Made our wait pleasant and the food was worth the wait!

s6iX-0bx7HaWVggy7cxjGQ.text: Krys is awesome one the best servers and the rest of the staff was really nice as well too . The food was really delicious especially the French toast and the steak.

55RrIR4XcKLDDVlUipeqUQ.text: Amazing place, awesome food, trippy decor... all you could ask for in a breakfast place. And more! Love Rise & Shine.

XC00mFs96jVjTS1-HQEsjA.text: Great food for reasonable price. I had the chilaquiles. Very good. Couldn't finish it cause it was so huge. Only thing that could have made it better was if they went a little easier on the sauce. Otherwise great. Had a bite of my moms steakhouse omelette and fell in love. Definitely getting that next time I come. And the hash browns are to die for. Not to mention they freshly squeeze their juices here. My new favorite breakfast spot.

vUnBRt_1F0fK-PHI-TZCEQ.text: Delicious. The staff was friendly and attentive. The food is great and has a cool and unique twist on it. The pot of bread is nice and delicious. Cool atmosphere and overall a top notch experience for a brunch.

7LSYP5O-792AX5Lwx_Lkyg.text: When I got up and said I wanted steak and eggs this place really satisfied my craving! I got the Ribeye Chilaquiles and my hubby got the chicken and waffle, we both cleared our plates! Definitely coming back.

lA_1UIgZbcExqvCNWiPVGg.text: Fantastic food amd great staff.  The kids plates were perfect size.  My wife and I both had the ham and eggs benedict.  It had great flavor and was cooked perfectly.  We will definitely be coming here again.

tbfEw5gBbxM4n2iRbcmEPQ.text: The first thing I loved about this place was the customer service. Meagan , the hostess, was a warm spirit and quite helpful. Our server, Jackie, was pleasant and had a array of knowledge of the complete menu. The food here has everything from those who want to eat healthy to indulge in a decadent brunch. I most certainly will return!!!

pOzn4GfmqWuZJJTNqfGJbg.text: Great place!!! The food was delicious. I got the salmon eggs benedict and my boyfriend got the chicken fried steak. Both were very tasty!  Love the decor and the huge outdoor patio (we sat outside). Friendly punctual service too. Would highly recommend!!

9ze_RvxLqTriHlZXCxpbXA.text: Over priced breakfast for mediocre food. They don't know if they want to sell socks or meals. Pick one and master it. Their uniforms(pajamas) show in the service "lozy". Never again

R02em6B3lwkPE_gOoipo7A.text: I have been here about 4 or 5 times now, and up until this time it has been a great experience. When my food came out there was a BRIGHT RED piece of hair sitting on top of my friend chicken :( they were more than willing to remake my food, and provided a biscuit to snack on. The shock was when the bill came out they didn't compensate the cost of the original dish. I've been in the restaurant industry and the first rule is that hair in a customer's food means you comp their meal.

2dcBZzA-bcRmVNST-XQ6dg.text: Rise & Shine is amazing!!! The food is fresh and full of flavor. Freshly squeezed juices are awesome. All of the staff is super friendly. There are times that the restaurant is crazy busy, but so worth the wait. Pot of bread is an awesome appetizer. The southern style chicken fried New York steak and eggs is the best my favorite. Love the decor & pjs for uniforms so unique and cute. Everyone needs to spread the word about this amazing place. LOCALS SUPPORTING LOCALS!!! My favorite restaurant!!! Everyone needs to come and try this place out.

yQo_KS4gGnvxGZmFdMO9dQ.text: I've heard a lot about this place and wanted to give it a try , and I'm happy we did . Food is amazing with big portions so make sure you bring an appetite!! Love the fact that the servers wear pajamas, flower umbrellas as fans is a very cute idea !! Don't remember our servers name but she was awesome !! Very attentive and knowledgeable !! Will be back every weekend !!!

GfVcXbkfu8M3fBxvsvxNyA.text: Best breakfast place in Las Vegas.  The strawberry and watermelon fresh juice was refreshing. I had ultimate steak and eggs and it was delicious.  My kids loved the cinnamon pot bread.

Z0ZfIOJY8Wn_kQ6TeWGDvQ.text: The breakfast was very good! The portion size was perfect and the ingredients were fresh not canned. The service was good and timely. The kids meal 1+2+3 was the perfect for our almost 2 year old. We will be back!

Eo_ry8_i36aSbpn_3fClew.text: Great new breakfast place very needed in the area. Huge patio seating and healthy portions of good food. We will be back!

SnnD3Nt_V7UQpZzg8hqieg.text: Ribeye steak and eggs with Pot of Bread. Best breakfast in Las Vegas!!!!!!

EIPs7HyvXsn8PVvwLpwlSQ.text: Went to one on flamingo and 215 food was excellent and the servers that I have had were great! Only problem I had was I had a three month old baby I took to bathroom to do a diaper change and there was no where to change my baby. I asked the hostess where I can go she said they dont have changing tables, and told me people go to their cars. So in 105 degrees in vegas I went to change my baby. Unacceptable to me and if mcdonalds can have changing tables so should this place... its a family restaurant. You need to accommodate people with babies. But food was great!

W1F9TQBgR09N5WUfCueyhw.text: Wow, wow, wow!! Amazingly delicious food, generous portions, super friendly service, and cute ambiance inside this restaurant. We tried it for the first time this week, and will certainly be back. Best french toast ever!!

0BhKnEO7hzvUM7YC8j7a8w.text: Great food. Unfortunately waitress had a bad attitude. I don't know if she was having a bad day or of it was something directed toward us. We were excited for breakfast, food was great, but ready to leave. When we get our check with our meal, without a follow up, then it ruins my experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VpvQuKMqsSkJDPOqjrXROQ.text: Great service, menu is ok it's not very organized. I love their French toast and their chicken fried steak. They give you great portions for the price you pay. I take all my family there to try it when they come.

8p1BVu4Je23Dve7bBJN68w.text: Food was great, and Ashley did a great job! The only reason I give it four stars is that we were sat but no one came to our table for a while. Not sure who our server was supposed to be but we are glad we got Ashley. She was very friendly and efficient. The loco moco which she suggested was really good.

KEzRdV6nZ345jwAVfQ14mw.text: Random search on yelp got us here since we are in the neighborhood!   Hubby said it's his new favorite place for chicken and waffles and I thought the corn beef hash was really good too!  Definitely will come back when the folks are in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles!
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn beef hash
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot of bread -  rivals Jamm

ohVeI2ZpqyoX4GsFccypWw.text: This location sucks. Unfriendly servers and the price I paid for the nasty food I got wasn't worth it. I ordered their corned beef hash and I didn't even finish one bite because it was so gross! I paid $13 for eating just the eggs that came with it and the pot of bread, which the server forgot to give to me and had to remind her, and it tasted like it's been reheated because the bread was stale already. Never going back to this location. The one at Southern Highlands is wayyyyy better!

IGck72FGzLzZDO8qonH4vg.text: One of my favorite breakfast restaurants in Las Vegas. The ribeye and eggs is the bomb. Ashley Silva is the nicest waitress. Go see the crew in pajamas!

G2Xw0jSFOjkd9sKtZCsNrw.text: Looking over the menu they had a wonderful selection. Everything from an assortment of fruit smoothies to different versions of eggs benedict. However, based on the size of the portions versus the price charged, I feel that they were a little on the pricey side. Would I come back?  Definitely.  But for my budget it would not be a weekly restaurant .

HkWe8eNANX9GghbhsER2dg.text: Our waitress, as well as the food was great! Not too busy yet, so we didn't wait. Maybe early Sundays is the time to be there?  Highly recommend.

buPp9bJUFaFJj0r-i2G2-g.text: Went for breakfast ,service was good and food was not, had steak and eggs with spinach with hollandaise sauce, which was like powder version instead of home made sauce we all love and crave...hash browns had dirty oil taste. my fiancee had french toast very thin and not fluffy....we won't be going back...just could not get past the sauce ruined whole dish....

sQYPtdZp-BlBJMaf-EQnyw.text: Really enjoyed this place. It's about a 10/15 minute drive the strip headed towards the mountains which will give you some good scenery. The service was great and the food was even better. I got the two eggs bacon and hashbrowns and my party got the s'mores waffle and chicken and waffle. Everyone loved their food. Would go back next time I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon roll
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smores waffle &amp; chicken and waffle &amp; Cinnamon roll in a mug

NeJTYSh6FSY0pDxLareQUw.text: I've been really excited to come try this place since I looooovvveeee breakfast and it's only five minutes from my house. Although it will admit the previous reviews made me a little nervous about the wait.   We came at about 10 am on a Friday and we were seated right away. We got coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice. I thought the juice bar was a great touch! I ordered the ultimate steak & eggs w/ pot o bread and it was divine! I ordered my steak medium rare and it was closer to medium but I didn't mind. And the pot o bread was yummy and very fluffy. The hash browns and eggs were just as delicious. Definitely a little bigger portion size so be prepared to leave full! Overall I really enjoyed the whole experience and I can't wait to come back! Especially since it's so close!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Ultimate Steak and Eggs and Pot o Bread (sorry I can&#39;t remember what my mom had)

3dkMv4yRV9rCS8eYQTN93Q.text: Absolutely incredible! My son had the bananas foster Belgian waffles, I had the crispy cinnamon raisin French toast. He finished everything on his plate, from the orange zested whipped cream to the bananas to the Belgian waffle, the ice cream. EVERYTHING!!! Mine was just as good. The first impression as I walked in the door was that we would probably have to wait for a table. Nope, seated right away. Order was taken in a timely manner, drinks as well as meal.  Make sure to look up toward the sky while there. You'll see what I mean. Great meal, great service, great place. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Cinnamon Raisin French Toast, Fantastic!!!
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. INCREDIBLE!!! Banana Foster Belgian Waffles

wu43CRz3ilnAtBe4ojgYGQ.text: They had trouble in the kitchen so wait staff was running around like crazy.....but when food finally arrived it was fantastic......i had the philly cheesesteak omelette.....excellent!!!  The table behind us sent their food back 3 times and was being a little too picky to the point of annoyance......Manager Sarah to the rescue!!!  She quelled the unpleasant guests complaints and did an outstanding job of customer service....i called her over to compliment her!  I will give them a pass on the kitchen problem and will return and will give a better rating if all goes well which I would expect......

KuTR1vBgnpr9ngml1HOv1Q.text: My girlfriend and I went to the new location off of Valley Verde in Henderson, best food ever! We had the best server Petty! She made us laugh so hard. She was also very kind and made our visit pleasant and enjoyable. We will always come back to this place! The pricing is great.

uoVmTvepAubCrFPg_si9XA.text: All these reviews about the food, how good it is and how bad it is. My suggestion is take a look at the back of the place and you will see how dirty it is. No fan on when the rear door is open, boxes all over the place, etc. etc. The restrooms are disgusting.The food itself is so, so. The Mexican dish they offer is so bad that it is disgusting. If you don't know how to make it, don't offer it. Unless they start cleaning up the place they will not last. Please clean up and offer your customers a nice clean experience.

QMlbb9sInWuhQrP-7R_xAQ.text: Amberly provided excellent service, especially as I walked in 15 min before closing, I normally don't do that, but was hungry and really wanted to try this place. Food was excellent!

IqHV6srdXLJxs9mlqE8MvQ.text: Best pot of bread EVER! I love the Go Go Green juice they have .. im so addicted to it .. and ordered build your own omelette with spinach, onions, bell pepper and bacon .. im not big with harsh brown its not them its just i dont like potatoes so instead i ask for a toast  then my brother and my bf both have the 2 egg breakfast! Its been awhile ive been here but its the best breakfast place ever

SH1kPCxew3HqflbPX7Zs5Q.text: First time here and I have to say it's awesome! The staff is super friendly. Frankie was my server. Friendly, funny and attentive. I'm from San Diego but next time I visit good ole Sin City I will Rise & Shine at my new fave spot.

EDZ3ftrnPiznOr32a0xvFA.text: Service and food is two thumbs up here.  I can't remember the waitress name (shame on me) but she was attentive to all of our needs. My boyfriend and I both ordered the ribeye steak and eggs and it was so good.  Our dishes came with hashbrown and also a choice of bread.  One of the bread options is bread in a cup, which is pretty much a cinnamon roll in a cup.  It was unique, soft, and hot.  If you like cinnamon rolls you should probably choose that as your choice of bread.  The ambiance had a bit of a whimisical feel.  There were spinning umbrellas, and the colors in the restaurant were vibrant.  They also sell silly socks and reataurant apparel and items at the front counter.  The servers also wear pajamas.  A little silly but suits the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye steak and eggs.  Comes hashbrown and your choice of toast
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread in a cup, one of the bread choices.
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinning umbrellas inside restsurant

7VYD5zhd7y4wwg18XXrTeQ.text: This was my first time in with my husband and toddler. I have driven by this place many times on my way to work and finally decided it was time to try it out. The building is so cute! They have ample parking. We were seated immediately which is always nice with a toddler. We loved the decor inside and my toddler was amazed by the ceiling with it's umbrellas with flowers. I thought the wait staff wearing jammies was so cute. Our waitress was Sammy and she was so great! My hubby had the waffle platter and loved it, my daughter had the little pancake meal and gobbled up the pancakes which is rare for her. I tasted both the waffle and the pancakes and they were so delicious! I had the carne asada chillaquilles and they were really good and a little spicy. I'm more of a sweet breakfast person so I should have gone with something more of a French toast or waffle. We saw someone order the red velvet pancakes and when they came out, they were huge!! Looked amazing though.  We will definitely be back to try some of the different things!

l-Ld_Dv3_wnvXXutt243qg.text: This is a very cute and cozy breakfast place. The food is always good and service is fast. Pancakes are gigantic and always amazing!

ZvL3qwzYGmbuV64vbr_NuQ.text: One of my fav spots to eat I never do reviews but for this morning I will , Ashley was our server and wow what an amazing dining experience made it so much fun and easy. I had the white omelette steak and damn!!! So good lol

duzn7SNtcn2v6BBpXvzTwg.text: Second try. Still avg at best. Atmosphere- trying too hard to be cute and building to cavernous to be warm. Service attentive but not great, got order wrong, cleared table while everyone eating and ignored us when we told them men's room flooded. Food average...ham to salty and dry, bread pot a good idea but only a so so  result. Management seems out of it. If you can't get into egg and i, you could try this but lower your expectations considerably.

LMdF-tGZ3fznSP3XGKP55Q.text: I come to eat with my family on Sunday  The food was good as usual The server was very nice but the food Took at least One hour The staff is very nice over there  they gave us 15% off because we complain for the food take forever

kPTQ5Cki-Dvxe4p4j-2a-w.text: First time here. Very impressed. Have the Ultimate breakfast. Amberley was awesome. Will return often.

_3YoJx5Llb1khJ_S2Ey9HQ.text: Went for breakfast. The coffee wasn't that flavorful, I got the philly bagel and it was super bland and greasy. They're kind of expensive but you do get a good amount of food.

7_Woow7d_22ObmFmVp-Iug.text: It's a little busy during rush hour but the food is good and we had a good waitress. They have a nice variety and many different choices!

6Rlk_vz10lxy80oYM7hmxA.text: I had the crunchy cinnamon French toast and it was really good! Probably one of the best French toasts I've had. They give you big portions. Only ate half. Our waitress Ashley was very nice and friendly! Over all great experience!

RDXDGUJJbHNiSeBD8BnUxw.text: Second time here and luckily we sat in the same spot with a great view. It was a bit warm inside today but our Server Jerry was just as cheerful and fun as we remember!  Well be back!

Eqee39TZPrbWR2JjfwzbaA.text: I have come here twice now. The first time Brody was our server and he gave some excellent recommendations and service. My sister and I split the steak omelet. It wasn't necessarily a big portion, but it was perfect for both of us to share.  The second time I came here and ordered the same thing; ordered my steak medium-rare and received well done, which is why I am giving 4 stars.   I will be coming back :)

3qswXotMqF4QfwZXPMO7rg.text: Amber was an amazing server she made our experience so pleasant. We will definitely come back and request her as our waitress.

4-59deL6PeQbwAlpU3ZBvQ.text: Ok, first thing, I have to say that our waitress was the best, secondly, the food was great, and thirdly, loved the atmosphere. My sons and I had my birthday brunch here on Oct 3, and they was so charming, thanks for the great service, we will be back.

11T8p8gVDeEHwi2SJRONdw.text: Pot o'bread was ridiculously good. Had a chicken and egg white omelet and it was delicious. Hubby had the ultimate steak and eggs and practically licked the plate clean. Our server Brody was helpful with the menu and was on top of drinks and coffee. Highly recommend them for breakfast. Left feeling happy and full.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool decorations. Love the sunny happy vibe in here.

5ozjMT8AgO46UVof93-aJA.text: Love this place!!! Chicken and waffles keeps me coming back with the nice and warm syrup. Can't forget the pot of bread you get with certain dishes such as their omelets. Nice portion sizes.

Cdevro9ovjWsWYQuJQqo4Q.text: The wait for a Sunday morning wasn't too bad (approx 20 min).  Food arriving at the table was a little slower than expected, by we did have a large group.  The food was fantastic. Portions were large. One order of eggs were undercooked, but that was fixed quickly.

hoYY6N_ae6gSNWexO5El5Q.text: This place is awful! Don't understand any of the good reviews. We came in on a Saturday morning at opening. It was empty so food should have been at least hot. Waffles were extra crispy and hard. Same with the biscuits even though they were covered in gravy. Every meal was completely cold. No refills on drinks and just about the worst service I think I've had in a long time. The manager knew we were upset and didn't say a word. Horrible place! And extremely over priced. $87 for 3 adults and a child. Never again!

J8o528dMTn5PgvHMmiBUgg.text: Rise and Shine is right next to the LVAC Summerlin on Flamingo Road and Hwy 215, I have heard stories about the steak specials for breakfast in this place for months since they turned to old Crab Shack into this steak restaurant - The key word is steak - The steak was grilled to perfection combined with fresh leaves of spinach mixed with the Hollandaise covered on a seed bagel with drilled golden Hollandaise Sauce over the bagel, hash brown potatoes, the grilled dish was spectacular. The atmosphere is gorgeous inside, large, high ceilings, colorful, and at 655 AM in this morning before Christmas Eve, there was not only four customers waiting for the doors to open with me, but folks coming into the restaurant to order breakfast to take home to their families. The chef had this special baked "bread in a cup" with cinnamon that my son adored. We had so much food left over between the two of us that we took our breakfast home for lunch and let me remind you, this was the first meal of the day, when my son eats, but he still couldn't finish all the steak and bagels that came with the extra large giant plate. The service was excellent. In the far corner were baskets of fruit where the waitress squeezed fresh juices for the Las Vegas Athletic Club fans eating after their yoga aerobic classes. These body builders want the best after lifting. The place is a class act for athletes, families, and groups ready to enjoy the day by starting the morning with steak for breakfast. The stories are True, this is the best place to have breakfast in Las Vegas, Nevada.

DCVicULjq-3M7apxybgy0w.text: Location is misleading for first time visitors. It looks like there are no customers and you have to drive around the building where the main parking is located. When we finally found the door, we were promptly greeted and seated at a nice booth.  Portions are huge. I had the corned beef hash and scrambled eggs. The hash had a good flavor but over fried and greasy. The bread in a pot was a nice touch. My partner had eggs over easy, perfectly prepared, and bangers. They were very tasty, I would order them next time. The server was very nice, she answered all our questions and checked back to see if we needed anything. All in all, it was a good experience. The decor is interesting and fun.

UySGU92HZ2X0YXbtT4zqBA.text: First time here today and will definitely go back. We had 8 people (4kids) and Jerry our server was amazing. He was so extremely  patient with us ordering and us changing our order for the kids. He was quick with drinks and any extras we asked for. He was funny and not annoyed at the kids like at most restaurants. I ordered the BLT salad and the biscuits and gravy and it was fresh and tasty and the food came out quick for an 8 top. The portions are large I took enough home for two more meals for my daughter and I. Prices are reasonable so Jerry and Rise and Shine get 5 stars. He was so great we double tipped him too he deserved it for his great attitude and quick service.

YgtezdHJ7OYzqa1tFEEoFw.text: As a fellow business owner I know the value of customer feedback. As such I make it a point to COMPLAIN when I must and COMPLIMENT whenever something warrants it.  I made my first visit to your business on 12/17 around noon.  I'd like to compliment you on what you've put together - Joe's Crab Shack never looked better!  Hostess was prompt.  Server (Ashley) was an A+ - I'm a bit hard of hearing and she was very patient and helpful with me. I never felt unattended or rushed to get "the table turned". She's a keeper!!  Rib-eye, eggs, hash-browns - also an A+ - I really don't know how I could suggest any improvements to them.  Water - I choose to drink water with my meals and yours was a real disappointment compared to other restaurants in the area (Fuddruckers, Roadhouse, Famous Daves, etc). It just tasted "off with a metal flavor" Let's go with a D on this one.  Sourdough Toast - I guess I'd give it a C... but compared to rest of the meal it was a distraction.  Price / Value - Let's go with a B on this one.... as a consumer I'd have been blown away had it only been $10.95 (not that I suggest this is reasonable!) and I would have been disappointed had it been $18.95. Your current pricing will encourage me to return and bring others with me.  I know this is extreme feedback. I hope you find it helpful. I know how hard staying profitable, retaining great staff, and attracting a loyal customer base can be.

FQHBQGs9w3yp0M_wI4Q1fw.text: The ambiance was amazing with the colorful umbrellas & the arrangement of everything. The noise level is very low even with as large as it is. My friend & I always try to find new breakfast places & this is now our new fav ! Really can't believe some of the reviews, our experience was superb from the hostess to the server & the food was DELICIOUS, cooked to perfection . We shared the steak and eggs Benedict SERIOUSLY did I say DELICIOUS , and huge servings. I'm going to tell all about it & am a fan, in fact going again with another friend soon!  Try it yourself you will be pleasantly surprised.

AmVwzIMuecK3NGmZ-jrFqw.text: Worst Eggs Benedict ever, by far! We ordered two Eggs Benedict breakfasts and both had Egg that were over cooked and the Hollandaise Sauce had broken. The sauce was just a runny watery, tasteless, liquid flooding the bottom of the dishes making the English muffins soggy. To make things worse they drizzled the whole dish with a Balsamic Vinegar that overpowered the taste of everything. Balsamic doesn't belong on top of your eggs - yuck.  My husbands Rib Eye steak was so tough he couldn't eat it. We also ordered the pancakes that were so thick they were dry to eat and still doughy in the middle. No matter how much syrup or butter you put on them it didn't help. Never eat there again - lesson learned

Wxvrz-t5aWbU7dK_6hLYdQ.text: Food and service are great once you are seated. Just a little frustrating waiting 30 min for a table when there are so many table waiting to be bussed.

EfiswZl0XFd5FccbM6TYug.text: First time here at rise and shine. Ordered me a "loco moco" . Best one I've ever and customer service great! Definitely will be coming back .

M1VXIFp9lg4-t9eeKE6LJA.text: The food is AWESOME! The service is GREAT! Big country style plates & very affordable! Me and my fiance will definitely be coming back!!!

ZZCSiST8CfnKOxsHjwV04Q.text: Two months ago this was one of my favorite places for breakfast but like typical Vegas, service and quality are gone.  Before we ordered we asked the waitress if we could split the bill between 5 of us.  She said the menu said it could only be split by two but since we told her early enough she could do it.  She put it all on one bill.  Two of us ordered the Nutella Cappuccinos which are $4+.  The waitress came by to offer us refills of regular coffee; she filled my cup up half way.  What she didn't tell us was that there was an additional $2.95 charge for the refill, two months ago, there was not. I ordered a Loco Mocco, it was terrible.  So salty, the eggs were under cooked and the burger was burned (I ordered medium).  When we checked out, the girl at the counter asked how it was. As we started telling her about the coffee charge she really didn't want to hear it so she walked away and asked someone else to deal with us.  We explained the coffee refill and service issues with her but she just wanted to argue saying that it's the owner's rules to charge for refills.  Again, I explained we were offered refills but never told we would be charged for them.  If this is policy, you should at least let the guest know.  A simple "I'm sorry" was all we needed.  She offered to take off the charge for the coffee but again let us know it was their policy.  She missed the whole point, we told her we would never come back but at this point she didn't want to listen, she told us we could just leave, there was no charge.  We weren't complaining to get free food; we were trying to let them know they had a customer service issue they needed to fix.  Needless to say, we won't be back.

h3TV2htHvAhOtxhtIVeeHw.text: Rise & Shine is well worth the wait....while I understand it's not fun or what alot of people enjoy doing is waiting for a bit, it's part of the whole process if you want a great breakfast place. That says a whole lot about the establishment....it must be good food and greatly staffed. So my fav is the Chicken n Waffles, it's by far the best in town!! 2nd in line is the Spice Rubbed Rib Eye Steak Chilaquiles, it amazingly hits my palette in every way possible and never lets me down! 3rd choice would have to be my honey's fav, the New York Steak Spinach & Benedict Bagel, he can't go to this place without ordering this plate every time, it makes your tummy smile. The plates I've just mentioned are all crowd pleaders, decisions, decisions!! So my recommendation is to you I would definitely come in and checkout this breakfast joint out, even if it's for the Belgian Waffles, they won't ever come out cold. This place is all made to order. So if you are looking for a fast food place this thankfully is not a fly by the seat of your pants, kind of thing! It's a very warm and cozy spot that you can hang with all your BFF's and loved ones. I hope you enjoy it as much as I do. My friends and family just love this place. I would recommend this place to just about anyone for some, "yummy to my tummy" food!!! Enjoy.......

XCIA8DFmrtDIjTsuoXUjug.text: I should start this review by stating the Rise N Shine WAS one of my favorite places to eat. The food WAS great and the staff WAS amazing. This time was much different. My parents and I decided to enjoy this beautiful fall day and have a great lunch outside. When we arrive at the flamingo and 215 location, we were informed the outside was closed to clean. We informed the hostess we were going somewhere else to eat outside and it was only then that she reluctantly stated "if that is what it takes to get you to stay, you can eat the outside".  We were seated outside and our server Corey attempted to take great care of us. My mother and I both ordered the patty melt which was spot on in the past but not today. My father ordered the corned beef hash which also was usually great. After waiting an inordinate amount of time, which we would allow for perfect food, we received our orders. My mom and I fought our way through half of our patty melts.  The reason it was such a fight was do to the unbelievably salty over seasoning. When we informed our server, he said that since we ate half he would see what he could do. He came back and said he would give us a 15% family and friends discount. That was better than nothing but not appropriate. No manager came to speak with us even though I know that is the way any restaurant should respond to complaints. We do not fault our server because we know he was trying his best under less than ideal conditions. My father who white knuckled his way through his corned beef hash exclaimed after the fact mentioned his meal was way too greasy and below standards. I am sad to say that we will not be dining at Rise N Shine again unless they can repair their now broken systems. Please fix it so I can return.

M929dPgEixzfWJN7FPVEmQ.text: We went here for the first time on a Saturday morning, me, my daughter and her two 5 year olds. We had about a 15 minute wait, which isn't bad for a breakfast place at 930 in the morning. We were seated and our waiter brought menus and took our drink orders quickly. The Orange juice is fresh squeezed and tasted amazing. The downside is that it's $4.25. I got biscuits and gravy, it was very good and the biscuits were outstanding. My daughter got eggs Benedict, which were good, but she said next time she'd order then without the balsamic vinegar. The hash browns are unique and so good.  The twins shared a 1+2+3 breakfast (eggs, bacon and pancakes) and it was the perfect amount for them to split.  The pancakes are yummy and the maple syrup is real and comes to the table warm with a cinnamon stick in the bottle. Delicious, but I would probably ask for it without the cinnamon next time. Service was quick and our waiter was attentive without being annoying. For the 2 adult meals, 1 kids meal, 2 sodas, 1 tea and 1 juice the bill was $45.

Mnz6uyTScIBP4dppi7XJHQ.text: I will never patronize this restaurant again.  I went to Rise and Shine on Flamingo with three of my friends and arrived at 10:30 a.m.  we were told it would be a 45 minute wait.  After an hour I went to the hostess stand and she said 5 minutes more we were next in line.  There were empty tables on the patio and in the restaurant.  15 minutes later I was still waiting.  I went to ask for the manager and a young girl said I am the manager.  I asked her name and she refused to give it to me.  I asked what the problem was and she said the kitchen is backed up, we have just opened and we have problems.  I asked since we were next on the list could we at least sit down and have a cup of coffee.  She said no and that if we don't like waiting we could leave.  I asked for the name of the owners and she said we are a family business and I don't give this information out.  she then proceeded to cross our name off the list and I asked if she was refusing to serve us.  She said oh I assume since you are not happy that you are leaving.  My friend said this is not the way you treat customers who are asking you a question and she said Oh Well you don't like it leave.  She said this in front of all of the customers who were also leaving.  In the parking lot all the customers leaving were telling people who where arriving not to both because management is rude and the wait is now over two hours.  There are many restaurants in Las Vegas and when you are treated rudely by managers there is no reason to return and give them hard earned money.  We left and went to I Hop on Tropicana; we were greeted by the manager who was friendly, the waitress was delightful and the food was delicious.  Plus we got to use our 2-1 coupons found online.  What a difference.  The owners of this restaurant need to go in and see what is going on.  I am the manager of a restaurant and if I found any of my team speaking to customers in such a manner they would not even see the door on the way out.

y_CjVz9WaExUaLYBqqOddA.text: We went on Saturday, May 2nd around 9:00am. We were a party of six. The hostess (if you would call her that) advised us it would be a 20-25 minute wait. So we sat and waited. People came and also waited. After 25 minutes, we were going to inquire about the wait when another gentleman very politely spoke with the "hostess" to inquire about why no one was being seated when there were plenty of tables both inside and out that were available. The "hostess" stated that no one was being seated until all the tickets were cleared in the kitchen. While we were sitting waiting, the wait time increased significantly for newcomers. Some times were quoted at 45+ minutes. We felt this was unacceptable as we were never informed of what was happening and were not offered anything to drink, perhaps a discount for the long the wait or at the very least an apology. The gentleman asked to speak with the manager to which the "hostess" stated the manager had told her 10 minutes previously not to seat anyone. She apologized however she would not make eye contact when the apology was given. In fact, she completely looked the other way when she apologized not once, but twice. We ended up leaving. We advised the other patrons that were also waiting inside and out what had transpired and they left as well. The "hostess" had no business being in a hostess position as she had absolutely NO customer service skills. The manager should have come out and advised us what was happening and she never did. In fact, she never made eye contact to any of us. There needs to be more training or more staff. I had been there once before on a weekday morning and had a pleasant experience (other than the fact we paid almost $30 for a party of 2). Hence the reason I recommended to my family we should go. I was very disappointed at the experience we had. We won't be going back any time soon.

sDohAhm4rmKxg3iJMrduAA.text: Food is good, but service time is very slow. Make sure you're not in a rush to get in and out of here because it won't happen.

U2ujO9-lSXzY2CLwWcQwvQ.text: We love coming to this place, staff is always great! Today we had Stacy and she was amazing, thank you Stacy for great service.  Food was great, perfect serving size and the flavor was perfect.

focb_C0i7u8fto8isl1-xw.text: So overpriced and still looks like a Joe's crab shack. Go to a casino and get steak and eggs for 6 dollars and you will get the same quality. I thought the waitress was rude and wore see through pajamas.

m4Atmh3ffeGwWG_5coJidw.text: This is my favorite spot for breakfast. The service is always great and the food is delicious.  I love the casual atmosphere.  The background music caters to all.  Ashley is my favorite server! You will not be disappointed. Oh yeah they wear PJ's as their uniform. Awesomeness.

7U6YOo4KX52EMFgq5Gfw4w.text: This was hands down the best breakfast we had in a while. Food was amazing you can tell it was all made in house and super fresh. Our waitress Desire was amazing. She knew the menu very well and made sure what we ordered was exactly what we wanted. She was very attentive and smiling the whole time. All around great place.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half eaten but so good. Hollandaise was one of the best I&#39;ve ever have.

Z2e9sFDu39zu04aI57e54w.text: Ambiance: This was definitely the highlight. From the spinning flowers hanging from the ceiling (which were just umbrellas on fans) to the extensive juice bar, this former Joes Crab Shack has come a long way in terms of its aesthetic appeal.   Food: Will 'meh' suffice? As I heard one lady say as we left, "would have rather had a breakfast sandwich at Starbucks..." All six meals on our table were overly seasoned and greasy. As for the highly publicized Pot of Bread, it's actually just a small cinnamon roll that, while warm and flaky, severely lacked sweetness.  Service: Dreadful. The initial wait was 35 minutes for a table of six, but hey, understandable for a new breakfast joint on a Saturday morning. What I really struggled with was the time between ordering and receiving our food. It's new, there's sure to be some inexperience, but 50 minutes from when you order to when the food gets to your table leads to an upsetting experience.

t250F7i3oY18hBO7fxk2cA.text: Very good service with Amberly. Portions were huge. Amberly told us how big the servings were so we got half orders.

PMScpxZQWA4QOdw6ZAe64w.text: Best steak and eggs hands down.. steak had a wionderful flavor. Food was fast and service was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BkUBoWpk7Y4f0qT5KPSsRQ.text: Good service. Good French toast. Good quantities. I liked the hash browns I tasted. My dining companion liked the eggs Benedict. The only slight negative was the coffee wasn't the greatest. It's definitely a place to try when you're looking for breakfast but it's a big menu and the lunch items might also be worth looking at.

ojEmoVTIL42uYQN8a3EWbA.text: Love this place. The service is awesome. I had my bridal party here for breakfast and they are amazing! Analisa really made an effort to cater to us, they are so patient with the huge group. I just want to thank you guys for being so awesome and helping us kick off our beautiful day!!!! I will definitely be back! =]

KMVfZe6jhiaP6gZkJbcomA.text: Let me start by saying,  I'm not a huge breakfast fan,  but the boyfriend is, so we thought we'd try this place.   UPON ARRIVAL: Every time we've been here there has been a wait (not long) but that's a good thing-it means people like it!  They have always been very quick to seat people as soon as a table opens.   SERVICE:  This is a big one for me,  as i work in the hospitality industry (bartender). Every time we have visited, we have received AMAZING service from EVERYONE; from the hostess,  to the server, to the food runner.   FOOD/MENU:  Not an overly large menu but i was very pleased at the vegetable options (as I'm a vegetarian). Food is outstanding,  as everything we've ever ordered has been delicious and sizable. If you're a coffee drinker,  order the French press.. it's enough for 2 and is very tasty.  They even give you a timer so you can have it as weak or as strong as you like.  AMBIANCE/DECOR:  It is spacious enough that you don't feel like you're sitting on someone else's lap, like in other smaller breakfast places. Colorful, upside down umbrellas grace the ceiling and is very cute. The floorplan is very open, and you don't feel like you are boxed in. Restrooms are always clean.   The boyfriend and i have been here at least a half a dozen times, with many more to come. I'd recommend this place to ANYONE and EVERYONE.

3H7lCs8_qVm4WAyCwHEcmQ.text: Super cute restaurant with so many wonderful options! First of service was amazing Frankie took very good care of us and helped us with our many questions.  Strawberry juice is the ticket!!! Waffle was everything and def will be recommending this to my friends

rEepKd9bK6yp2VQ_sUTArg.text: Chelsea is the best Food server then any other breakfast place! She is patient and warm my husband is a food server at Bellagio. We know service! The ultimate breakfast is delicious you get a Ribeye Steak and hash browns and eggs plus you have to ask for the pot of bread it is delicious.

dp19MXBh-5ix131Vj7R8cA.text: We got here pretty early on a Sunday and we were sat immediately. Our server was gracious and professional. We ordered two kids meals and two traditional meals with waters and coffee. The kids split a juice, which was amazing btw. The good came rather quickly and was delicious! I mean wow. My only complaint is our meal cost over $50. Maybe it's a little above our lifestyle but I couldn't believe breakfast would cost that much. I didn't complain or anything but I was inwardly shocked. If we could afford it we would definitely go back

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oZc37XjXak7Q0LUkJdS-aA.text: Our first visit here. What a great place! The staff was upbeat and friendly. The food was yummy.. I had steak and eggs and was very surprised that they cooked the steak properly. I'm all about meat and potatoes and was expecting the usual over cooked steak- (as has been my usual experience for breakfast restaurants) It was yummy and properly done! yay! The juice tasted like someone literally went back to squeeze oranges for me. Really good.  The AC was a bit much though and I could hear other patrons saying they were cold too. Not a biggie but maybe bring a sweatshirt unless you eat outside :) Keep up the good work!

fHoc_TeT_AiM4ND-Uql9JA.text: Always wanted to go to their Southern Highlands location, but never made it out to the area. How lucky that they opened one up next to my nearest LVAC!  The fiance and I went there this past Sunday for lunch...loved it. She had one of the steak burritos and I had the spiced steak. Meat was top-notch...rivaled the quality of more expensive steak restaurants. Oh and like many reviewers say about the other location - GET THE POT OF BREAD. You won't regret it, especially if you like cinnamon. Outdoor seating is nice too.  Service was a bit slow and it took a while to process our check due to computer system slowness. However, they just opened so I'll cut them some slack in this department. The food was that great that it compensates for the service slowness.  Our new go-to breakfast/brunch spot. Check it out, you won't regret it.

3KAIaufuSjhf5a2WF0tsXg.text: This places has awesome breakfast! The only reason I gave them 4 stars is for the wait. They have so many tables inside and outside yet they will let them sit empty and have you wait 20 minutes. I don't get it.  The steak is good for breakfast and the pot of bread is to die for!

_1D4HxGA4LQx6eLhxdiwPA.text: This place is amazing, the waitress wears jammies, fresh squeezed orange juice, French press coffee and a smoothie bar.  I got waffle and fried chicken and Stephen got eggs Benedict, everything was delicious.  Lots of room too, they don't have everyone crammed into a tight area like the egg works does.

j2nrbf1P-VqVQAnPlKOxYA.text: Although the wait was 30 minutes it was well worth it and completely understandable for being brand new. Congrats to Rise&Shine for being so busy right from the start!   Alright well coming from Northern Utah and growing up with a few tasty Home Style restaurants; Rise & Shine has sure taken me back! The quality and flavors of the food are completely worth the wait! Biscuits&Gravy with two eggs! Mmmmmmm!!!!  As I'd like to say I've found myself a Diamond in the Rough. The sausage gravy was perfectly crafted on two very moist buttermilk biscuits. I recommend trying the B&G!!

5TPUnX7RyhUJX3perlxp7A.text: Really good food, friendly staff. I really enjoyed my fried new York steak and eggs. The steak itself was a little overdone, but delicious non the less. Will definitely return for the chicken and waffles.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GR_u6O6QAIv6ODTl4VrR4A.text: Great breakfast spot if you're looking for something off-Strip. Kudos to the cooks for substituting the chicken in my Chicken Avocado Egg Whites omelette for sausage. The kid sitting across from my table was killing the fluffiest pancakes I've ever seen in Las Vegas. I'll try not to care about carbs the next time I come.

0OZe7buDrKWrdE2jIud8Pw.text: Delicious! My first time trying this place out, and totally missing out the whole time I hadn't been coming here, what a great find  minus 1 star for cooking my NY steak well WELL done instead of medium. Overall, still tasty

tG9CrU7l9j6mGcKZptMqMg.text: Look no further if you're up for a great start to the day.  And waitresses in pajamas?  Rise and Shine has everything you are looking for in breakfast fare. Even the coffee is a rival to Dunkin!! And I think I know my corned beef hash- theirs is the best I've ever homemade had, hands down...no, hands up!

atUJD0kFnT2A-PO2EKQcyg.text: Great place for breakfast. They are who they say they are. Steaks cooked to the proper temp and a comfortable family environment. Wait staff are dressed in pajamas so casual is the go to move. Try the potted bread. Very good. They have a French press option for their coffee and is well worth it. They make fresh smoothies at the bar, very yummy. I will continue to come here. Everyone should give it a try. Why not 5 stars? They can get overwhelmed at times (weekend mornings).

mbA14ToXO_SypsQzhQTaAw.text: Just had the Best Breakfast of our weekend. Chilaquiles poached eggs for me and Bananas Foster Waffle for Mona. OUTSTANDING!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot o Bread!
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilequiles &amp; Poached Eggs!!
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas Foster Waffle!

fmK9FWX78HKN_TX3NuUjiA.text: Probably the best breakfast place I've been to Vegas (and yes I've been to Baby stacks).  The Philly cheese steak two fisted breakfast sandwich is filling and does require two fists to eat. Most underrated menu item is the watermelon-strawberry juice which is the True definition of refreshing.  I would recommend going between 7-9 as it tends to get crowded later. Highly recommended and you'll enjoy it

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Philly cheeses steak bagel sandwich and watermelon-strawberry juice

7ddKAh2BnaWgrxOsSz6H4g.text: First off, let me say that I'm a breakfast connoisseur   This place is AMAZING. The food is top notch. The staff was amazing and so was management. We had a small issue and it was handled so professionally that afterward it wasn't an issue at all. I'll definitely be back! Can't wait.

6XKY4GJaw8b5bzlje0hCrQ.text: I been tired of eating breakfast/food lately as what I eat all tasted the same. I came to Rise and Shine today and totally woke up my taste buds. The watermelon and strawberry juice was outstanding. The French toast was prefect with sweetness and not overwhelming in one particular flavor. Very well blended. I'm definitely be coming back. The manger was the best with her moose pjs. Love the theme!

cr3fEokM8Mjsk5TVdSvi-g.text: Servers in pajamas really relaxes me. Haha other than that, I don't remember what I ate. Family friendly neighborhood breakfast/brunch fix.

IulVhlDp3VCxkmcKV-jRZw.text: Amazing food and great staff!! Frankie was very friendly and fast making sure we had what we needed. By Far my favorite breakfast spot! We will be back to visit Frankie and have more amazing food again!!

whGD2BiN3LjEUV856v3dcQ.text: Their breakfast portions are pretty big! Their coffee is GREAT and their steak and eggs are my fave! First time I went out waitress was extremely nice, which always makes the visit nice and she even gave us coffee to go!

Q7Dr8UAg0R2iQmlTVFmU-Q.text: I saw another comment that sums up my feelings: "The food looks amazing,  tastes ok." I really think this place is a 3.5. I went up to 4 because the atmosphere, service, and portions were great. The food was pricey and it tasted okay, but not great. I had the three little piggies bagel sandwich. The concept is great: eggs, cheese, bacon, ham, and a banger sausage on a bagel. In reality, the sandwich was hard to manage. It was impossible to pick up - big, bulky, and the bottom bagel was slippery and soggy. Each element tasted good, but I didn't get to take that big bite that would meld all the elements together. The fries that came on the side were super yummy though. My honey had the chicken fried steak with country gravy, eggs, and hash browns. He said it was okay, but he wasn't really fond of the breading on the steak. All in all it was a fun experience nut the food was only okay. Not sure I will go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak with eggs.
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three little piggies... good but not gteat.

fAPkaQ9qem-M3ViV-wRGgA.text: First timer, the food was not impressive. The service wasn't either. The waitresses all congregated together in the kitchen. Our waitress disappeared while we waited and waited for our check. When we tried to flag another waitress down she gave us an ugly look as not to bother her. The Manager never came over. Won't be going back.

Cv0NRlBif3kcM_hj-XFAfA.text: Delicious food and top notch costumer service.,Amberly was our waitress and she was exceptional , we are currently in our way to Vegas and already talking about what we are gonna have this time around .:') .. Give it a try ,you won't regret it .

nDZRdVHfccaXiMIqTAy62w.text: Best steak and eggs I've ever had! Everything is extremely fresh. Even the OJ is squeezed there fresh daily. The staff was great and attentive. We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Talk about a breakfast burrito!
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs were amazing

KvfGUdz9UphWPQ5NmgB7Pg.text: Overall awesome place.  Kinda surprising to see any reviews less than 4-5 stars.  Food was fast to come out and was amazing.   Service was quick and polite.   Great atmosphere an large enough floor that we didn't have to wait long even on a busy Sunday.   Really enjoyed our meals (fried steak and eggs and philly bagel).  Will be back soon!

D7XI9gPYpmC5ZABl9mgvmg.text: I love that it's not your typical small seating breakfast spot with delicious food. This is a nice size restaurant! I say that because I always find the smaller restaurants have the best breakfast food. I wanted to have breakfast somewhere new today on this beautiful sunny Presidents Day. I decided to come here based off Yelp (of course, duh) and hence the weather I wanted to eat outside on their patio.   Fortunately, unlike most of you there was no wait today. The server was prompt once we were seated. The menu was overwhelming because everything looked so great. The only serve half & half and milk for creamer to your coffee. Personal preference: When you drink coffee every morning before leaving to work at home flavored creamer is just as addicting as the coffee itself. I felt obligated to order steak and eggs because that's what they're known for so there I was ordering "The Ultimate". I really wanted to try the bagel sandwiches but I stuck to my basic grounds for my first visit. I give my entree a 3/5 because one star for the amazing hash browns, 1 star for my eggs being over medium like I asked them to be and 1 star for my steak having the right amount of pink your average medium steak should be. The minus 2 stars for my overly seasoned steak. Did the cook accidentally smother my steak with black pepper or is this how they prep their steaks. On a higher note, my breakfast date had the three little pigs bagel entrees and her rating was a 5/5! Is noted they use high quality bacon instead of those measly small slices they serve else where. I knew I should've got the damn bagel entree to begin with, lol.   The highlight of our visit was the pot of bread who the kind server recommended. It's a dinner roll wrapped in a cinnamon roll with a side of homemade icing. You can substitute it for your toast with your entrees. Another highlight was the MILITARY DISCOUNT WITH YOUR ID OF COURSE! I'm not military but my friend was and I feel like this discount speaks volumes. I have a lot of military friends and I find it so respectable when places offer it!

n967LlNGGVnL9KL4AMlRuA.text: Collin is very sweet and very professional.. I ordered the chicken and waffles, cinnamon pancakes and my friend ordered the fancy steak omelette . i didn't really like the chicken and waffles but the go go juice was good and very refreshing.. i will definitely come back for the pancakes, go go juice & the great service!!! Thanks again Collin, youre awesome! :)
