0YTAquEw7-cx_vqQWGMMSw.text: My boyfriend and I have been here a few times and really liked it. Last Friday my mom was in town and we decided to come here for breakfast before going to do some touristy stuff. My mom ordered the carrot apple juice. When the server, Freddy or Frankie? brought out the drinks he dumped her juice as well as my orange juice all over us. My mom was wearing a white shirt and I light shoes. He was very apologetic and came back with a busboy and cleaned up. However when we got our bill all that was applied was a friend's and family discount which came to about $8. My mom's shirt was ruined, my white sneakers were ruined, and we had to go home and change which messed up our plans.  We understand accidents happen but no manager came out and when we told the girl at checkout what happened and that we'd like more of a discount she initially did not want to help at all. She ended up giving an additional $20 off but did not seem concerned when we showed her our clothing. This was not enough to replace the stained clothes and shoes and even after several washes they're ruined. Disappointed in how this was handled. Expected more from a non chain restaurant.

xdwudxH_5Ec1hBCZDfXw3g.text: Cute brunch place in a good location! Atmosphere was great, food was perfect, service was great, overall nothing negative about our visit. The pot of bread is adorable! It's a cinnamon bread with powdered sugar, served with a side of icing to dip it into. I loved that their coffee cups were decent size, unlike other breakfast places that serve coffee in the tiny mugs. Everyone was very friendly. The girl working the smoothie bar came over to offer us a sample of the berry smoothly because she had some leftover and it was delicious! I also liked that the servers wear pajamas, it was very unique. I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I got the custom omelette, with tomato, spinach, and avocado with cheddar cheese.
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pot of bread!

9ALga6O4RS7S1GPmSdvVeQ.text: ABSOLUTELY PHENOMINAL!! Our server Kris was amazing, first time dining at the flamingo and 215 location and will return for the great service and perfected food. So upon our arrival we ordered the gogo green and watermelon strawberry juice and they were some of the best juices I've ever had. We explained to Kris that were so torn between all the wonderful dishes and asked her to just choose whatever dish she likes the most, for both of us. Well she chose the pot of bread to start and then the steak and eggs and chicken fried steak; what an amazing choice!!! loved every minute of our visit.

73EKPHBuGtWHX577qMqFjw.text: Food Is amazing! Portions huge! Staff very friendly maybe because they came work in their PJs !! Kris needs a raise she is awesome!!!! Get the pot of bread!!!

J8NrbHZwyMIa4nCvLMdUeg.text: We went at about 1pm on Saturday and we asked if we could be seated outside, beautiful day and were told no, it's time to clean up the out side.  Then the 2 young ladies were going to seat us on the far west side of the restaurant between to families with toddlers and the sun was beating in full force.  We asked if we could sit away from the sun next to some other people and were told no, that section is closed you can only sit in the booth.  Really? I asked and she said that was all they had available... Are you kidding me... the whole place was empty with the exception of 3 booth and one table.  We going to that area at least once a week, but instead we went over to Famous Dave's.  The owner needs to check these girls out or replace them.  What harm is there in sitting a few feet away... We will never go back.  : (

vnAUf4StPTmP52RoWLxF8Q.text: We have been coming to this restaurant for a while.  Food is good, but service is terrible.  We have talked to the manager before hoping that the service would improve and we could keep coming back.  Today was another day of poor service even though they were not very busy.  After talking to the manager/owner we realized the problem with their service is never going to improve because she thinks everything is just fine.   She stated she has plenty of happy customers basically letting us know she doesn't need our business.  Las Vegas is full of wonderful restaurants that offer great food and service and appreciate the patronage from their customers, especially those that live in the area and return regularly.  This restaurant is not one of those.  While we were paying our bill the manager/owner just stood there ignoring us.  Knowing we did not and have not had good service in her restaurant just didn't matter.  With management like this, I understand why service never gets better.

DJhBTq0MILdmpB322gOKOA.text: Great service from Tyler!   Wonderful breakfast with my mom & grandma.  This place has only been opened a week but they have breakfast down to a tee!  Chicken & waffles were cooked perfectly and service was fantastic.  Definitely will be back :-).

gagnH8M6MaT9oibx9joapg.text: What a great place for breakfast! I had the eggs benadict (with extra hollandaise sauce), a pot of bread, & an iced tea. I arrived at 2pm on a Sunday (they close at 3pm) & was seated right away. Service was excellent. I think my server's name was Roy. I love the spinning upside down umbrella decor & that all the servers wear pjs. The only thing I would recommend is to ask for the eggs benadict without the balsamic drizzle. The sweetness just doesn't compliment the hollandaise sauce. Also, the size of the pot of bread in the photos is a little misleading. It's served in a tiny espresso size cup, not a regular size coffee mug. However, it is the perfect size for a one person side dish so it didn't really bother me. I'd definitely get it again....& again.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs benadict (with extra hollandaise sauce), a pot of bread, &amp; an iced tra. Delicious!

QvOMGl1enSskST8uKPpabw.text: Can't see what the fuss is all about.  The pot of bread was a cinnamon roll baked In a ramekin; the hash browns were all greasy; the fried eggs had burn marks on the whites and the bangers were not real British bangers but just large Sausages.  The whole was served most unappetizingly with the eggs flung on top of these greasy hash browns.  Service unbelievably slow.

3dCtPzRNwquo4JG78x6qrQ.text: I've eaten at Rise & Shine four times. Might go back just because good breakfast isn't easy to find in Vegas. Sure hotels have the $75 for two thing that could be decent but I can't find a consistent thing.  So, the reason I've been there 4 times was that #1 was pretty good. Egg white omelet that was nice and moist, not fluffed up like styrofoam and cheese melted nicely throughout. Yes the toast didn't arrive with breakfast and when it finally came it wasn't warm. Cold and bland. But OJ was great and so was the coffee even though the server asked if I wanted cream, which is odd, and didn't bring it anyway and I had to ask and wait while the coffee lost its edge. The place was crowded and we noticed the quirky umbrellas on the ceiling were for sale at $45 a pop. Being from NYC, the umbrella-on-the-go capital of the world, these seem cheap like that. You read it right. $45 clams. IN THE DESERT!!!!. The servers where pajamas and most have gray ones and you don't notice that's what they're wearing. It looks sloppy. Not really amused by it. They sell them too. Something like 25-35 clams for those. There's nothing great about them. It seemed greedy.  All in all trip #1 was decent. Trip #2 started going downhill fast. Same issue with the cream for coffee and the cold toast late with the omelet. It seemed like this is planned or something. OJ-great but this time asked twice. Egg white omelet was nothing like the first time. It was fluffed up and dry. So so but with cold toast it wasn't that good. We did try the pancakes, they were very good flavor, but arrived 5 minutes after the rest of the food. I'm pretty sure, based on when I asked, that it was a kitchen error, not server. Cause it came out right then.  I have no idea why we came a fourth time because, oh yeah, because our new favorite place across the parking lot didn't open until 7 so we drove over here, parked walked the 150 feet around the building to find they opened at 7 too. But #3 was a doosie. Yes. Had to double ask for cream for coffee. Got the late cold toast with the overcooked omelet, but the icing on the cake was the pancakes. I told the waitress we were going to take the pancakes to go. I just wanted a fork full-very good. She brought a box. I paid, we got up to go, walked out without the pancakes, got half-way around the building and ran back for them. Table was still as we left it, not cleared, but the cakes were gone. I asked and she said, well we threw them out, they couldn't leave food around, even though my unfinished omelet was still on a plate waiting for a busser. No joke. No one ran us down to say "hey you forgot your cakes!!" Nope. Gone.   Never in my life have I seen this and I'm from NYC not small town America.   So 86 Rise & Shine and their $45 dollar dopey umbrellas. The Crab Shack before it was bad too and a coat of Sesame Street yellow paint ain't changing anything.

Z9v_592KXcYdb3fG8l_Xyg.text: Phenomenal breakfast sandwiches. Great coffee and excellent service. Huge menu

qTEdE2Zt7ba01ShsHsMK4Q.text: I agree with all of the other reviews. The food was excellent. The service was as expected in a place like this. The portions were fair for the price. I had the ribeye and eggs. My daughter ordered off the kids menu. My wife got a fried  chicken sandwich. We were all happy with it.

inxbyJmnzgi8lBKyoouJEQ.text: Great food!!! Great service! Ashely (Red hair) was the best!!!!! Checked on us constantly made sure we were taken care of. Best of service I received while visiting Vegas. Go Broncos!

44X4QwOBoey-nzqaTLFoJA.text: Biscuits and gravy were some of the best I've had for a long time. Freshly squeezed orange juice was another key feature of the meal. Definitely worth going back.

L2uJpI0VZ38Gwbn8XyViAw.text: My first breakfast by my self was over $21. Second time we waited 20 min. Before i got up to find a waitress. Three of us was almost $65. Third and last, the eggs Benedict had vinegar hollindase sause with shaved deli ham smoked and liquid smoke drisseled all over it. Never again. Back to egg works down the street.

scJLWvYs_gLT0AonkTNDxw.text: I heard that the food was good at Rise & shine and was happy I finally had the opportunity to try it. I decided to go to the Flamingo location. I walked in and loved the decor and seeing the staff in their PJ's. The place wasn't packed at all but for some reason we had to wait for the hostess to seat us. When she finally did approach us, there was no smile on her face and a lack of enthusiasm to say the least. She almost looked as though we had disturbed her. Whoa! She grabbed the menus and told us to follow her.. still no "hi welcome in" nothing.  Since she didn't ask, before I followed her I asked if there was a booth available, she snapped at me and said we were headed to a booth. Whoa again! That alone left a bad taste in all of our mouths. Our waitress was very friendly and upbeat. After waiting some time for our order, I was disappointed with my chicken and waffles. The chicken was bland but my waffle was yummy. My friend loved her french toast and everything else was mediocre. To be honest for 3 people and a $86 tab for a ok breakfast with a side of bad attitude I think this will be my first and last visit to Rise & Shine.

KgBetT3k0o9o64XJ6ur-Ug.text: My friend and I went to breakfast on a Thursday morning at the Flamingo location.  The staff was very friendly.  Adam was our server, who was helpful about the menu items and very attentive about our particular requests (water no ice, Cooking spray vs butter for the omelet, etc).  The steak and eggs breakfast was some of the best I have had in a while.  I enjoyed a treat with the Pot O'Bread, requesting the cream cheese syrup on the side instead of butter.  It was yummy-moan-worthy-goodness.  Their organic hot sauce has sadly spoiled me from all others.  If I use Tapatio, Cholula or Tabasco at another restaurant, I find myself thinking fondly of Rise & Shine's hot sauce... which I had to purchase.

-biaJrGEh3S9l1NnMJM3Dw.text: This is my new favorite breakfast place in Vegas. We both ordered a steak and egg variation, I had the steak and omelette and Lily had the ultimate steak and eggs. First off, the steak was a quality cut of meat. I've been to more that my fair share of breakfast places that serve you a grissled piece of meat that represents what should be steak, this place is not that. Our eggs were delicious and the hash browns were a perfect blend of crispy and soft. I ordered a blended fruit drink and was pleasantly surprised by fresh fruit drink, not a sugary canned drink. And finally on to the biscuit, as soon as I saw it I knew, it was just like my grand mother made, delicious. If I had another hand they would have three thumbs up... Eat here...

H7ndLsqHvjwc7TdsoIw93w.text: Okay like most really good breakfast places this place is not cheap. But holy giant pancakes Batman. I mean honestly, I have reviewed another breakfast place in town and thought I saw the worlds largest pancake. NOPE! This places pancakes would break records. Not to mention their unique pancake flavors. I had the Banana Frosted Flake Pancakes. You read that right, they make a pancake with Bananas and Frosted Flakes in them, they also put some pecans in their for a little extra treat. I truly believe that when God created the pancake his eventual goal was the Banana Frosted Flake Pancakes. These were freaking awesome! Did I mention they were huge. A normal person needs to just ask for the to go box when the food comes out, I did. Oh and I enjoyed me some Banana Frosted Flake Pancakes the next two mornings on what I put in that to go box. My wife was also super complementary of their country gravy and biscuits (she is not a fan of pancakes - I know lame...), but we are from the southeast originally so she is somewhat of an expert where gravy is concerned and this she said was the best she has had in Vegas. The place is family friendly and I now take the title I granted another establishment and give it to this place. BEST BREAKFAST IN VEGAS!

AnU9yuk-pUbXobuAMUSZ5g.text: Great food (can't go wrong with pot of bread)!!  Desiree was wonderful!! Super genuine and kind!

US8Iuq78tP1MrjTuN4USQw.text: This morning a friend and I were going to go here for breakfast. I am disabled and find your entrance is not easy to access.  It seems that the front  (and only visible)  entrance is up hill from the parking lot. I did not have my walker with me so was unable to walk that far unassisted. It would be nice if you posted a sign in the parking lot showing where the front entrance is.  To just walk around the building looking for a way in is very difficult on those with difficulty ambulating.  Would enjoy visiting this restaurant in the future but thought you should know that your entrance is very unfriendly for some disabled patrons.

FnN9ABKPoxlv371vNiw4vw.text: We were really looking forward to trying this place out! Unfortunately the wait was about 30 minutes longer than we were told,( 20 min)(we almost left at that point)! Then we get the worst table in the place while other, more desirable tables were available! Our waitress seemed disengaged from our simple needs like, coffee, getting the orders right, bringing the toast out with the food etc. She didn't seem to give a sh*t!  The food was OK at best! The pajama uniforms were horrible! The seating kinda sucked! It seemed unorganized and chaotic!

EyZyFo2XQc2IrzvvPoeMzg.text: This is a must when in Vegas!!!!!!! Food is delicious staff is very friendly. They also give you a bread in a cup is a must try for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LxwIYXcliMtNFaOOYZNFrw.text: We went to Rise & Shine for the first time this morning. Nicole was our server and she was fantastic. Some of the best service we've had anywhere, including fine dining. Our orders were cooked perfectly and the portion sizes were generous. They also brought warmed maple syrup to the table...a really nice touch. They have a wide variety of items for just about anyone. Try it, you won't be disappointed!!!  We are moving back to LV soon and will definitely be regulars.

IPzV75HsHYdGQVRJ23vf3w.text: I debated between a 3 and 4 star review for this breakfast restaurant. The food itself was decent, but the overall experience.. I'm kinda meh on it.   Of course, I expect pretty much any breakfast/brunch restaurant to have a wait at around 11a on a Sunday, and Rise & Shine was no exception. The wait was about 30 minutes, which wasn't terrible, but I was ready to eat by the time we were seated.  Our server, while.. serviceable, had a distinct lack of warmth. She took our orders, came back to check on us, filled our water and coffee, but it all felt very robotic, almost like we were a bother. She never cracked a smile until she handed us the bill. O-Kay.... is it chilly in here?   The food itself was good, though. I really enjoyed my French toast crunch (I don't think that's what it was really called). The bread was just thick enough, the batter yummy, and it had just enough crunch to it. The turkey kilbasa was alright- pretty much a hot dog. The eggs were fine- although be forewarned, if you order scrambled eggs, they aren't actually scrambled. They're fried eggs mixed up in a pan. My dining companion had a real problem with this!   I sampled a bite of the amazingly HUGE pancakes. They were good, very dense and fluffy.   So remember the wait to get seated? Well, the wait to pay our bill was almost as long! Checkout was at the register up front, which is fine, but we stood in line at least 15 minutes in order to pay. They definitely need a better system here.  The two meals and 1 cup of coffee ended up coming to $35... a smidge over what I prefer to spend on breakfast, but oh well.   Rise & Shine.. not bad, but I won't go out of my way to return. Shine on!

Wa1OsGPNAUOjqkY8GCL_GQ.text: We are here on vacation and wanted to try an off strip breakfast place before hitting the road. This was a little out of the way but definitely worth it. The food was fantastic, the staff was friendly and it was just the right price. I had a Philly cheese steak bagel sandwich, the meat was delicious, I would recommend going with a plain bagel rather than the everything bagel though because the flavors in the bagel were a little overwhelming. Hubby had a steak and chorizo burrito. The flavors in it were excellent, the sauce on it was great and the beans served in n the side were very tasty as well. The decor is cute and the wait staff dress in pajamas which is a fun and cute touch.  Overall very happy with our experience.

vPk-6Qk_yg5L4_fRxP0rsQ.text: Great food. Great service. Careful on ordering the pancakes. They are HUGE! But delicious! Amberly was awesome the day we went. Will be back for sure.

9qwQh7MaSWylS0IBQY0pOQ.text: Great breakfast spot. Ribeye was well - seasoned and everything was delicious. Fresh juice damn good too. Fun atmosphere (they where pajamas). And service was great as well (Stacey was sweet).  Will be back.

OGYUu-S-9sBeDWxtk1rWsw.text: Nice little breakfast place for locals. Located inside southern highlands in the same plaza as Smith's and can be easily located.   The staff dressed in pjs which is really cute. Came here once for breakfast and enjoyed it. We got corned beef hash that comes with a pot of bread which was delicious, and the rubbed rib eye steak chilaquiles which was gigantic!!! Also ordered a side of muffin and gravy which was good. Overall enjoyed the food and the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Muffin and gravy, corned beef has, rib eye steak chilaquiles and pot of bread

9-2oJATU0qNDZvI0ZUujFQ.text: Ok this story is somewhat unbelievable. I met my family here around 1:15 pm. They had been there and basically done. The restaurant was pretty bare, only a couple other tables. I ordered a chicken sandwich and was asked if I wanted fries or hash browns. I said hash browns. Later the waitress brings my food immediately apologizing that they messed up and gave me fries cause that's what they are used to. She said do you want me to take it back and fix it or just bring your hash browns on the side. I said well I'd rather just get on the side at this point so you don't take my sandwich and it takes longer. Ok, so here comes my hash browns and the waitress with a rubber glove. She then reaches onto my plate and says ok let me take these fries so they can see I didn't leave them with you. Seriously? Did that just happen? I've never heard of such a thing!! She was confused why i was confused!! Absolutely absurd! My 16 month old cousin ate the leftover fries off my plate! Yay! The chicken sandwich was horribly dry. So crazy!!

aeo9Scp9IcK2-YKoaGYvRw.text: Had breakfast here for the first time. Arrived about 11:30a on Monday and was seated immediately. Server wearing pajamas came right over to take our orders. The menu is expansive and has lots of great and different choices. Portions are large. The chicken fried steak was the best we've ever had anywhere and was very tender and came with the gravy on the side. The smoked salmon eggs Benedict with spinach was amazing too. We'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

y7LUsutryW017Knq10JvTg.text: Things we've tried: Cup of bread Red velvet pancakes Ultimate Chicken & waffle Chilaquiles  Banana foster waffle Country fried steak  Cup of bread is really good when served warm!!! The first time we ordered some it was a bit cold and unenjoyable but the times when it was warm it was amazing...!! The red velvet pancakes I could go without it was like eating a whole thing of cake and that's not what I expected, but I'm sure other people would enjoy it!! It is literally 4x the size of my hand and was spilling out of the plate! Good to share with 3-4 people! Ultimate was pretty good! The steak was pretty decent, if you want medium rare I definitely recommend asking for rare instead since it continues cooking as they serve it. The eggs the first time we ordered this tasted like they had been cooked in the steal far and sauces and it was absolutely divine!! The other instances weren't the case and was lackluster. The hashbrowns are wonderful...!!! The sausages are pretty good! But not that amazing. The banana foster waffles ARE SO GOOD.... ordered it twice!! The rest weren't particularly noteworthy to be honest!   The ambiance is great, the service is sweet and they also have cute socks for sale. It's cozy and we returned twice within our week and a half trip to LV so we definitely enjoyed our stay!

FgKjokSfhGXvqAwLsLAiow.text: First time here and the food was amazing! At first, I was a little confused with the waitress and waiters attire, then realized they're all supposed to wear their Pj's. Our waiter was more than amazing! Pancakes are family size and were delicious! Love the decor of the place! Can't wait to go again!

V5xCCxZR2wIbANF-WSEneQ.text: We're new to Vegas and wanted to try some good breakfast. We went to Rise and Shine and were not disappointed. Not only great food but great customer service!

gbUYUe5OVx9t3dAS5fkvqw.text: Simply outstanding!  So glad we found this spot while visiting Vegas. The food was wonderful and the atmosphere was so cool with the waitresses all wearing pajamas. From the fresh squeezed OJ to the bread in a bowl, it was perfect. Don't miss giving it a try!

rQLD84PBOCZjx5l8gqEadA.text: I walked in and thought, am I tripping'!? Is it me or is the ceiling moving... pajamas everywhere... spinning...spinning. And we're back, it wasn't just me - there are artistic umbrella-like flowers spinning from the ceiling and cute flower pot mosaics. The decor is colorful, farm and garden. And there are pajamas, the servers are actually all wearing pj's... which is encouraging- next time I'll partake and we can all be friends. I'm really enjoying the vibe.  On to the food - the portions are large and the menu has a mix of favorites and lots of mixing-it-up. The egg-in-the-hole bacon French toast sounded creative. However, I went for the Three Pigs bagel sandwich with hash browns. It was huge! The over medium eggs were cooked perfectly - that's a deal breaker, so I was very happy that they were so drippy and messy! The sandwich was a monster; it was ooey, gooey, meaty, cheesy all over the place. The sandwich was good, liked the banger especially & the everything bagel. I was not happy with the soggy hash browns that tasted weirdly burnt and soggy at the same time. The neighbors' fries looked better.  Overall, it's a bright atmosphere, service was good, and the sandwich was good & from what I've seen so far - it's a decent breakfast spot in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three Little Pigs Bagel Sandwich breakfast-

4BLjjmC7Bzjz38yP1sWNug.text: Second time trying this breakfast spot and I love the atmosphere. It's different from the buffets, and small little places to go to. Nice outdoor area. Waited about 10 minutes because it was a pretty busy time at 11:20 but as soon as we sat the place started to clear out. Our server was very friendly and offered to review the menu since it's a little overwhelming. The three plates we had were all very large ports and I couldn't even finish my eggs and bacon. Overall very delightful breakfast meal. Prices are average 10-16$ I think would be fair per plate.

mJyGqSTIcQhP2S3I7t6UHQ.text: ATTENTION wear your sweatpants when you come here. This place doesn't play games and neither should you. Their menu is incredible and nice and big. Just the way I like it. Their red velvet pancakes are delish and so perfect. Three people can share an order. Their chilaquiles rock as well. And their bacon is my fav.

P_zncAqF-oOLUEYA3FwyHw.text: Unfortunately, I won't be back. I was given the wrong meal and by the time the waitress came by the others in my party had almost finished their meals. Ordered just a few scrambled eggs and paid for those as I ate alone. Staff apologized, but did nothing to makeup for it. I was really excited to come here, so this was very disappointing.

gSzdMkoiDiR4KPjJhMWLeQ.text: This place is AWSM! Love everything I've ever ordered - today we tried the chicken breast & waffles - delicious! The chicken was super crispy & the waffle light & fluffy. Coupled with a glass of fresh squeezed watermelon & strawberry juice & it was a magnificent morning. Also pick up ordering is now available here finally so giddy up! I'd definitely suggest trying out any of their specialty pancakes (we had red velvet with cream cheese syrup - DIVINE!) enjoy...

Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids steak &amp; egg with hash browns

ExFhSszixpKVj1ZNw_FjKw.text: Such an amazing restaurant!! Cute atmosphere and decor .. although the fans made it pretty damn cold in there ... especially in January!   We had great service and delicious food!!  I had the egg white chicken omelette while my boyfriend had the chicken fried steak .. he's made it clear that he has FINALLY found a spot in Vegas worth having the chicken fried steak, YES!  I would absolutely come back to this place - great food & people!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg white chicken omelette

PWjjLlekiPdqSset7HbygA.text: Woke up late from a previous long day and decided to have breakfast instead of lunch at noon. Rise & Shine was absolutely perfect for our huge appetites. It was my first time there and will absolutely come back. Everything was delicious.

RTFkPkT_1S17yvuS9MC4ZA.text: They have socks and shirts for sale at the front and they have pretty funny & cute sayings on it. The place is pretty big and it didn't take too long for my friends & I to be seated.   Service was great! A lot of options on their menu. My favorite food from this restaurant has to be the pot o bread. I could eat a bunch of those!!!! Their coffees are pretty good as well. I ordered an eggs Benedict bagel and thought it was okay, but my friends ordered the same thing and loved it. Definitely will come back here to try something new :) I saw a cinnamon crunch french toast on the menu and that sounds bomb!

KHM-dMZ6bDTw_HHa7MkV5w.text: Another Vegas Breakfast spot with a gourmet touch. If you're a visitor here you should leave the strip and explore. If you're a local you should be adding this spot on your Vegas gem list. This establishment specializes with Steak and eggs variations.The menu is strong and has a lot of options. However, this morning since its close to the 4th of July and my meat consumption has been kinda of consistent over the past month. I decided to do the Chicken and waffles. Started off with a awesome Hazelnut cappuccino. I might add they have a wonderful cappuccino and fresh juice selection. I want to inject this idea to those of you who are kind enough to read my post. Don't ruin your experience by comparing this establishments Chicken and waffles to another's establishments Chicken and waffles. The dish was huge. Enormous lightly battered fluffy and crunchy chicken breast. Moist not heavily seasoned. Waffles were also gigantic soft and airy. Great combination of different flavors and taste. The Maple Syrup accented the chicken with waffles. One of the most important aspects was my interaction with the staff. Talking with Barry my server was delightful. Very personable and inviting. The young lady who was the hostess was very professional and informative. About the restaurant. Both shared interesting tidbits about the restaurant. I had a great time and wonderful experience. You will too.

f2dRrRChC5UYFltaUe3EUQ.text: Servers in jammies, piping hot coffee... typical Saturday right?!  The food was very good. Served piping hot and there was ALOT of it.

DFNem-NmHFfGh50aiKPr4Q.text: A friend came here posted pics and I had to Come!   My husband and I have been twice, service is friendly and the food is good.   My favorite is the cup of bread, I'm not sure why lol it's warm tasty and hello carbs    The foods good and they're fun here!!  Good prices and service  check them out!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs!! Yes

ZbU60k58yqS0E_7NrLZnRQ.text: Best breakfast spot! Their steak is so soft, flavorful & juicy, so delicious. My Husband loves their corned beef hash extra crispy. Their pancakes are moist & fluffy, taste like yellow cake. The wait may sometime be a while but it's well worth it. Friendly servers & beautiful atmosphere

m8ljUsQ3yNNEKwYIyzCthA.text: Good place to go and get breakfast, but not the best service.    I have been coming to rise and shine since they opened and the food has always been great. I love their omelets, and their steak and egg dishes. It is on the more pricy side, but the quality is there when it comes to the food.   Be prepared to wait on weekends. Usually for me it's about a 10 -15 min wait.   The downfall of this place is the service. It sometimes takes a while for the server to get the drink / food order. I usually expect super fast pace service especially in a breakfast establish on the weekends.

T4sLROOgZ78uoL47hBW0ig.text: We're out n about early.  And came across Rise & Shine. Our server Sammie is a friendly Lil' Cutie and very helpful.  And made some great suggestions for our first time here. My hubby got the biscuits & Gravy. Which he loved.  I got the Avo-bagel and xtra crispy hash browns.  I had to bring some of it home.   We WILL be back. Love the "Jammies" uniforms so cute.  Ceiling fans  Such a family friendly place and the servers and cooks are 10

gvILQhdHkLBzi50GPRFySA.text: Just ordered through post mates. The thing that gets me is I'm a first time costumer and out of all the places I could have spent my money I decided to give this place a try. While it taste good I'm just surprised on how skimpy the food was.

oMMWRdHkEgd0AswPlHTmiw.text: We had a great breakfast here at Rise and Shine. (Waffles, fruit juices, and smoked salmon Benedict) Brandon R. our waiter, gave us great service and definitely would recommend this place!

AQLfVSvdHGTpYu3wrxB2Tg.text: This was a cute spot for breakfast. Our server was really nice. The food was just okay so the prices seemed a little high. One of my major complaints was that the service was so slow. They were busy, so I do take that into account but I watched three tables next to me get their food before ours, even though we sat and ordered way before them. I ordered a boring salad and some fruit because that's all they offered for plant based eaters but on our way out, they had a sign up that said they had the Impossible Burger, which I totally could have had. They didn't have that sign up when I first got there, it was maybe in a different spot or something but it definitely wasn't there when we walked in. I would've ordered that- they should add a note to the menu or do a specials flyer for the table. I'm disappointed.

OqQ1wYeEXxEQd3tMbfpyzA.text: Fantastic! The service was spot on by Samantha! The biscuits and gravy were the best we have had in Las Vegas!

W2XOqDxSmUOF4Ss7dpa_Ug.text: I wanted to check this restaurant out because I read the review of Susan L. ( Las Vegas ). This restaurant looked fairly new on the outside as well as on the inside. All in all a very nice clean location. The service was friendly and the restaurant was packed. There is plenty of parking. We ordered the Steak with white mushroom cheese omelette, Eggs Benedict, and S'mores Waffle. All of the food was really great and the presentation looked really good. They were even selling sox at the restaurant? My son bought two pairs. This is the only restaurant I've been to that sells sox. The juice from the juice bar was really good. I thought having a fresh juice bar in the restaurant was kinda cool. Overall good experience. It's a place I would go back to if in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak with a White mushroom spinach cheese omelette
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Juice Bar

6f4sb0vw4uoAmXZB27IfEQ.text: I drive by this place on a daily basis and have always muttered to myself "I must try this place" so it was high time i ventured over for a relaxing breakfast. Depending on where in the lot you park, it may be challenging to find the front door, but there is a side door.  ATMOSPHERE- Its a bright inviting place, the decor was very winsome and perhaps enchanting especially the large flower decorations hanging from the ceiling.  SERVICE- Service was very attentive, and i suppose that's much better than wondering where your server is. Everything was done expeditiously.   FOOD- The food was presented very neatly and in an appealing manner -a professional plating presentation indeed. The food tasted fresh and seemed to be up to today's standard. The OJ was freshly squeezed juice and not that syrupy stuff out of a commercial grade machine btw.  All in all it was a good breakfast, but nothing spectacular or to write home about, besides the decor and employees pajama theme (which was unique and inviting) it was a pretty basic experience and the prices were a touch higher then i'd have liked....but after some other breakfast experiences at other joints in town i wouldn't write this one off as this is a pretty good option

R4lgFqReqTIf8iFI-er8Mw.text: Ok I had never been to this place before and oh em gee. I loved it.   1. The servers are all so sweet and so cute in their Jammie's so I'm sure no one would care if you went and ate in your jammies too ! We had Lucelia and she was such a doll! Her bright smile and brighter personality would make anyone feel welcomed and happy to be there. Super management material right there !   2. The decor is super cute and fun to look at. I feel like it's  a great spot for anyone and everyone.    3.  The food wasn't bad!   I got the watermelon and strawberry juice. It was a bit bland but I genuinely didn't expect it to be overly sweet for this time of season as both fruits are out of season. It was still super tasty, fresh and all fresh from its fruits.  My kid got the Cinnamon Toast Crunch French toast and let me say one thing #Yummmmy it was sooo delish.   I got the country fried steak because I've been staying off fried foods and really wanted something country for this country gal. The steak wasn't a typical country fried steak to me. It was a bit too greasy and the breading just fell right off and I'm used to my steak being pulverized by a tenderizer BUT the flavor was really good and the flavor of the hash browns also amazing. I asked for my eggs over medium and they were cooked to perfection. I'm sure I'll try something a lot lighter the next time we go in.   Perfect start to our daughter mother day today!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SD5xMfePztlNn4ECXqgdcw.text: Ordered the corn beef and hash and the country fried steak. Both horrible!! Won't be ordering from here again

WL0_zXxv5ldU4mpknQ-VLw.text: I've been to this location twice and I won't be coming back. I don't understand what the hype is about this place. The food is overpriced and they don't do the basic breakfast items well. The ham steak is dry. Hash browns were too loose and burnt. The biscuits were too hard... even after pouring gravy over them.  Country gravy was ok. The country fried steak was large but nothing special. $17 for an average country fried steak, eggs and burnt hash browns and you can't include some bread? No thanks. If I wanted to spend that much for my breakfast I'd rather go to Kitchen Table Squared at the Gramercy.   They have some specialty breakfast items that are probably pretty good but if this breakfast place can't handle cooking hash browns then they certainly won't get my business again.  However, their cup o bread is delicious so I will give them that.

jL6hlNiL-KsT7fVmgIzq9A.text: This place is always delicious, and I often find myself here after a brisk morning hike. It's the perfect remedy for a strenuous outing, particularly the steak omelet and the white chocolate caramel latte! Everyone is warm and friendly in their typical uniform of cozy pajamas. And the food is always spot-on.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious!
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best steak and eggs!

v5aV_0oLnKgUkuRf9EhSpQ.text: Service here was great! Very warm and welcoming staff and Amberly, our lovely waitress was so sweet! She never failed to check up on us and made some GREAT recommendations. She offered to box up our leftovers for us and everything. The waiters and waitresses wear pajamas as their uniform which goes with the whole cute rise and shine theme. The restaurant itself is so cute and has these umbrellas hanging down from the ceiling and it's very warm and cozy. Perfect for a rainy day brunch with your significant other or just a fun day out with the family. If you get Amberly as your waitress, then you are guaranteed amazing service!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avo-Veggie Eggs Benedict, Red Velvet Chocolate Chip Pancakes, Loco Moco Hawaiin Style pancakes!

mXXUDxgGhNA8dxoVppMtvg.text: I just left this place and I'm pretty angry... Angry that I haven't been here sooner!  This is easily one of the best places for breakfast in Las Vegas.    I'm a total coffee snob, so the fact they have French Press coffee is reason enough for me to go back.  I love that they bring over this little timer for you to use and decide how strong you want your coffee.    I will also go on to say that I'm basically a retired red meat eater, so it's very rare(no pun intended) that I decide to eat a steak.  I woke up today fiending for some red meat, but I'm mulling over whether or not I want to break my meat eating for a breakfast place.  Breakfast places, even good ones, are never really known for quality steak.    I'm glad I chose this place!  There are so many amazing options on the menu to choose from, my decision was hard, but I figured I might as well try the restaurant's namesake and I'm glad I did.    I got the "The Ultimate" which was a spice-rubbed thin cut rib eye steak, potatoes, eggs and a choice of bread.  I opted for the biscuit.    The Steak:  Juicy, full of flavor, tender and effin delicious!  Seriously, better than some middle of the road steak houses I've been to in vegas.    The Eggs:  Eggs were eggs. They were good.  The Potatoes:  Loved them!  Kind of like wide cut hashbrowns, but better.    The Biscuit:  Dense, soft, crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside.  They were delicious!   The Service: Great!  Attentive, friendly and fast.   It will be a while before I eat red meat again, but it won't be a while before I go back.  So many other things I want to try!

9TLQ_dnegIxlh7X0hBykQg.text: Okay.  That's just it.  Husband ordered philly cheese steak and egg. It supposedly shaved ribeye but it was ground. Not shaved. Plus. He didn't get offered any pot of bread, biscuit or toast. We asked our waiter and he said NO so fast. We then asked for the menu again from a different waiter. And it's written right there on the menu. The dish should come with pot of bread, biscuit or toast. He immediately came when he saw us asked for the menu again and apologized but he said this is because the iPad doesn't have an option for it. Hello. You're a waiter. You should know the menu like the back of your hand. It's your job, buddy. Not owning the mistake and quick saying no to a customer is a BAD customer service. Btw. He then gave us a very sad ONe piece of biscuit.  Btw the banana foster waffle that I ordered was okay. Good toppings but the batter was so cake-y. Not like waffle.  On top of this, as we pay our bills at the cashier, there is a customer walk in. This is 2:47. Aaaaand the cashier told us, "never fails, 10 min before we closed". WoW. Talking about BAD customer service ever. Who ever train the people here should be seriously questioned if they want their customer coming back to the restaurant.  And yes.  We still tip our waiter. Because we are nice people.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana foster waffle and the &#34;not-shaved&#34; philly cheese steak

kD95Ixen_GW-K-3LKjbKdQ.text: Randomly found this place and it was a great breakfast find!! I ordered turkey kielbasa and eggs. The sides (hash browns n biscuit) were solid. Ordered pancakes as a side and as a connoisseur of pancakes I'd have to say they were some of the best I've had. The service was exceptional and all of the staff was super friendly. I rarely venture off the strip when I'm in Vegas but this place is well worth it.

TbjaG17xvUzUZK-slWSoyQ.text: This place is no joke.  They were packed and the food still came out at a decent time.  My steak and eggs were cooked perfectly and the seasoning was delicious. Service was very friendly, both at the table and at the counter. My wife had an issue with her steak and eggs being undercooked, but they apologized and gave her a new fresh plate with everything cooked right. Based on other Yelp reviews I had the pot of bread, which lived up to its expectations.  It made my wife wish she didn't get the wheat toast.  Unfortunately I had to share.....

yK_egFqpQl80P7X5GNHyQw.text: Tried this place for the first time with my parents. It was great service-We had Amberlee as our server, she was very friendly and on top of things. My parents shared the Fancy Steakhouse Omelet and I got the Biscuits and Gravy-good sized portions. Will most likely return.

onULUuvrFVcI12E0I5bYkg.text: I came to eat here expecting to have a delicious warm breakfast with my kid he got the philly steak and eggs, they were  good he liked them I order the rise and shine chilaquiles and they came out super cold they were colder than my ex (and trust me she was cold) long story short the server took them back and they gave me a fresh new chilaquiles and they were colder than the first ones the server asked me if I wanted another one by this time my kid was almost done with his meal and I just told the server that I was just gonna eat them like that they were pretty bad and chewy I only eat the egg and the slice of avocado that came with it I'm not a picky person I was fine with that I only wanted a warm meal in company of my kid but then the server came with a voucher of 5off for my next visit and I was like come on people what make you thing that I want to come back to a place where they can't even serve warm food and then offering 5 dlls off on my next visit! I felt pretty offended to be honest. That's when I ask the server to send the manager over  a lady wearing pijamas came to my table and I was like are you the manager, I told her that I was offended and I was not asking for me to not pay for the food or asking for any discounts or a different dish I just wanted a warm meal. She never ask me how can she fix the situation she made it sound like it was my fault because I didn't want a different dish. At the end she still charge me for the cold food I didn't eat and expecting me to come back to redeem my 5off coupon.I hated that place. Some servers wear pijamas which looks pretty lazy the place is not homey not cozy everyone look miserable there. That is definitely a place where I don't want to go back ever, if I only had an option to give this place a 0

ztljlrDHxO6KqmhIgffG8Q.text: Great atmosphere! They wear cute tasteful PJ's and are really friendly. The food was great! My steak was cooked to perfection and the fresh squeezed juices was a tasteful healthy delight.

v67lNR3QWXzqPO5sWOrI3g.text: While my husband had an amazing breakfast of steak and eggs, I ordered the chicken and waffles. The breading had so much cayenne in it I couldn't eat it. I asked if the menu noted that they put cayenne in the food and was told no, but the waitress would talk to the kitchen?  Very disappointed

AeeLLXg2s5cJ9HHpbSgWoA.text: Pretty dang good!  Awesome waffles really good omelette. Far superior to IHOP at about the same price...  Only reason I didn't give them five stars is because we've only been there once!

hggBrBzsBXVHdJXg3E7iWA.text: Let me start this review off by saying there food is amazing. I absolutely love just about everything on the menu! That being said today while eating here I witnessed an employee in the kitchen wipe her nose with her bare hand then grab a plate . This is unsanitary and just flat out gross. And for her to just do it where everyone can see is foul. Would that be okay with you? How would you like it if I wipe my nose on my hand then bring you your food? This is unacceptable. Sad to say but I will no longer be a customer at an establishment that allows this.

xGr9C2JdTPu4GbaPbmbWsA.text: Good food, good fun, they have something called potted bread a cute bun in a cup covered with powdered sugar and cinnamon. But wait there's more, the chicken fried steak is amazing and by the way I don't like chicken fried anything but this was so tender and tasty. Recommend someone in your party to try it just to experience it. Then there's the waffles, banana foster, frosted flakes, Nutella, you name it. Can you say diet? pyytGF7LSzIdoAUQtYvQew.text: I love big breakfasts and brunches. Omelets, soft, fluffy pancakes, hot coffee, mmm. We were visiting friends and came here on a Sunday morning. Our server was great and the food was fantastic. I got an omelet and had hash browns, with the pot of bread beforehand. The taste of everything was just outstanding. My friend made the mistake of letting me try her blueberry pancakes and I aye about half of them, haha. I wish we had one of these places in Phoenix.

3FmJccCZSdzqsA4lgT5t7w.text: Food was okay, a bit over cooked. The orange juice was great and fresh squeezed. The service was good, people were really nice. 3 stars because I think it's a bit over priced and over rated for what it is, I would still rather go to Egg Works down the street!!

My husband had the cornbeef hash. Umm. You must try their pot of bread which is a combination of cinnamon roll with a biscuit.  This place is good  for the entire family.

10Xhruc4VFSluo6zQdPOsQ.text: YES. I always loved getting steak & eggs and places like the grand cafe - but now a place that SPECIALIZES in it?! YES!  My ONLY *issue* is that it was SO GOOD that I wanted more!!! (No really, can I get a bigger steak, YUM!)  I will definitely be coming back!

Finally asked if a server had been assigned to our table... Nope... Looking around and see just one buss boy busting his tail... No one helping him. Three waiters and two waitresses for the whole place. . People lined up outside waiting,  to while four tables sat unoccupied... Looks like a problem with management and leadership

ppL2Z9dsxljDh5HguOYLpA.text: Very cute excellent food great service very fresh wonderful experience for my first time hope you open a location in Henderson soon by the way Amber Lee was fabulous very efficient respectful sweet

TVXtXXNUP1bS2nyrD8j15A.text: Waffle amazing! Chiliquiles amazing! Laura amazing! Great food, service and atmosphere. Gluten free savory options as well!

c1atSFK1ke25WNU--s2pyw.text: Really like this spot. They always accommodate  my special requests no problem. My daughter LOVES the red velvet pancakes and the s'mores waffles. I do the ham steak and egg whites with fruit. Always perfect

Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. S&#39;mores waffles. Sunday treat done right

KJ-0XkTKoomCInbS2Ll32w.text: My husband and I were so excited to try this place out! We LOVE breakfast!! When we arrived the hostess was pleasant enough and we were seated fairly quickly considering they only had maybe seven tables of customers. Our server was very nice, however this seemed to be his first server job. We ordered our food and no joke waited 25+ minutes for it to come out. This wasn't a huge deal as we were in no rush however the server NEVER checked in on us or offered anything while we were waiting. Zero acknowledgment that the food was very very late. We were so happy when it finally arrived as we were starving and it looked really good! Looks can be deceiving. I ordered the eggs Benedict and the sauce was awful! It tasted like it was a mix, which I think is super sad at a breakfast restaurant, also one of my eggs was hard! My husband had the steak omelette and he barely touched it. The icing on the cake was when we went to pay we asked for change and our server never returned or acknowledged us again even though we sat there waiting for almost 10 minutes! He stole his tip that's for sure! Overall very very disappointing as the location and restaurant style were perfect. Hopefully they figure out how to operate a successful business soon as we would love to come back if they overhaul the staff and menu!

CAxoO5ulTcoY7Z1WD7j2kg.text: Went to Rise and Shine at around 1030am this morning and was quoted 30 to 35 min... But if we chose to ask for 1st available it would more than likely be sooner. It is after all a soft opening and was willing to give them a break when it hit the 60 minute mark. We heard the hosts saying we were about to be sat next... We like to keep an eye on things UNTIL a group of 3 walked in and approached the hostess. They said something to the host who walked away then came back and told them they would be sat next. Thinking this HAD TO BE some sort of mistake I waited to see what would happen. A minute later the host called them to take them to what was suppose to be MY TABLE!!!! So I went to ask the hostess's what happened and why they got sat first and so fast... They told me it was the owner's best friend and therefore had priority seating.WOW  oh and that I would be seated shortly... Hmmm no thanx you obviously don't want my business. This is my first and probably only yelp review ever... Being in the restaurant industry myself in usually very understanding but this just set me off..Off to Bite around the corner

NnAK7if2Iu-WTCVXUW7yOw.text: the "lack of service" killed the very good meal.  this is a tough location as it is not easy to get into but great food will survive a challenge.  food was great.  had the cream cheese lox omlet. but the servers, at least the ladies, seem to have quite the chip on their shoulder.  when i go out for breakfast, it is an expensive treat, not a daily thing.  paying $3 for a cup of coffee and not being asked if i would enjoy another cup until after i had finished breakfast.....but at least the cashier was kind enough to take the coffee off my tab. nut shell....great food. tough location for access. servers with "attitudes". no newspaper rack anywhere around so bring your own. me, i'll wait for the next breakfast place to open. i just don't put up with "lack of service".

YXq9JzUFiVc8Ezug18JbeQ.text: Just tried Rise&shine for the first time with my family, we all were very pleased.  We all ordered something different and everyone was extremely pleased. The service was top-notch, our server Desiree was phenomenal, she was very knowledgeable and welcoming.  GREAT FOOD and SERVICE.  We will definitely return.

xeUSHoxHxNl2ZwboKXgprg.text: This place is as confused as trying to find your way out of a casino with blind folds on.  they will do better i just went too soon.  food just ok  egg works is the way to go

Puvvwr4mdk84B12NMSYCNQ.text: Our first meal at this amazing restaurant was fabulous with delicious food, awesome staff, fun decor and more! We will go back! What a surprisingly great experience!

bGpJTUasIF-MkzoulttvUg.text: Third time was not the charm... I consider myself to be very fair individual and before I give any place a bad review I am going to make sure it wasn't just an off day or anything else.  All three times that I visited, the service was extremely slow and the servers consistently lacked a pleasant attitude and basic service skills.  The food is mediocre at best and certainly not worth the price.  This pains me as I love the location near Southern Highlands and I was extremely excited when I learned they were opening a new location less than a mile from my home.  On my third and last visit which also happened to be my birthday we did not even make it through coffee before a handful of issues came up.  Even something as simple as creamer for my coffee was a task proven to be challenging.  Upon checkout I had no intention of any sort of complaint - I just simply wanted to pay our tab and be on our way until I was questioned on why we were leaving without eating so, of course, I was willing to offer my feedback only to receive a very rude, defensive response from the Rise & Shine employee.  What a shame.  Luckily I wasn't willing to allow such a negative start to my day ruin any part of my Birthday so we were off to a nearby breakfast gem that took great care of us!  I will not return to Rise & Shine.

7BmbyIT6B8jSyMfdX6CBPQ.text: Great breakfast - more than I could eat. The pot of bread was novel and tasty. Will be back again.

UzQn_v-WW_d5e1timAWYbg.text: waited 45 mins after being told only 25 minute wait.  Sat down server came right away took our drink order and then took our food order.  Waited for the food for over 45 mins. A lady came to table and asked how everything was,  don't know if she was the manager,  but we told her would be nice if our food came out cause we ordered 45 mins ago....  She just shrugged her shoulders and said they were really busy and walked away.  Everyone in the resturant looked they were waiting for the food forever.  Never came back to follow up.  Food was OK.  The server was great,  I know it wasn't her fault she looked a little annoyed at everything going on,  cause I am sure a lot of people were mad.  Decor and place looked very nice, was hoping for a better experience. Don't think I will be back,  much better breakfast places around with fast service.  Place looked and felt disorganized no proccess in place.

Y77gXX8mDLTqXCGFXkazng.text: I am very picky when it comes to eating chilaquiles but this place does it PERFECTLY! The chips were still crunchy, they were zesty but not overly spicy and just all around delicious! The staff is very friendly and we were able to have an easy conversation with the manager. They are all smiles and able to roll with the punches of the day, I would definitely recommend this place to friends and family! :D

bGcV-hyAYQBegJmaFb9p6g.text: Great food. Great coffee. Great service.  Nice to have a breakfast place that isn't a chain or tucked in a strip mall next to a hair salon.

Mz2mPO7-O0IgljsiVeoc7A.text: The overall atmosphere is pretty quirky and cute but that's about the only good thing I could say here. Our server I want to say Amber or Alexa although I'm not positive if that was the name really didn't seem to care about us. The service from her was really textbook and straight to the script which would have been fine if she wasn't actually having interactions with the other tables in our sections, maybe it was because we are a 22 year old couple with a 7 month old baby and so we seem unapproachable? Or maybe it was because we weren't an elderly couple talking about juicing. Either way it was pretty off putting on a service aspect. Anyway I ordered the loco moco medium rare and ended up with a crispy on the outside almost raw on the inside burger which was fine until my garbage disposal method of eating started to slow and I actually tasted the consistency and temperature difference of the outside and inside of the meat and felt kind of sick (it didn't actually make me sick) also kind of found it irritating that the hostess had tables waiting when there were tons of open tables. All in all won't be back 2 stars one badly cooked burger but other decent food but impersonal service isn't good but don't be interested in one table and a a robot to the next.

5ClUfIg7dD_yejELVcfzRA.text: Called to place an order to take out, Manager argued and said they do not place orders to go during the weekend, and the only way to take out is to wait in line, be seated then once food was on table ask for it to be packed to go.... Otherwise she said they didn't want our money. So we went to EggWorks!

E6LpMWAAW92IrrYvruGWyQ.text: Was expecting a phenomenal breakfast experience based on the name.  Unfortunately everything was just mediocre.  As you enter the decor is inviting with giant upside-down umbrellas painted like flowers spinning from the ceiling.  We were greeted by the holidays who sat us next to the kitchen, even though the restaurant was practically empty. There are some terms on the menu that were unfamiliar, like "pot of bread". We had to all and we're told that it is a lightly sweet cinnamon roll with no frosting baked in a tea cup.  I tried that ad my bread option with the 2 egg breakfast. The eggs were done as I asked and treated fine.  My husband ordered the steak and chilaquiles.  We're surprised that the chilaquiles were made with doritos chips. The steal looked like someone reused another steak and shaved it in half. When we asked for a box the server was not even curious about why my husband ate so little. The bill was $35 before tip.  I don't think this will be a place we come back to for breakfast.

xbd2HejaD3zyuE63xXevjg.text: Our server Chris was very friendly and diligent. The food came very timely and tasted delicious as always! This is one of our favorite spots in town. Never disappointed!

-VoKlm0CbPI0yRn0eUDQrw.text: My wife and I paid a visit for the first time on weekday just after the lunch hour. First off--great chicken fried steak. Made on premises which is a rare thing indeed. Most places use the frozen ready to cook version. I'd give it a perfect 10 except that it was a bit to 'spicy' for my personal taste (cayenne pepper?)...but very close. The gravy was also excellent.  Very good potatoes. Waiter was a good guy and attentive enough. What really surprised and disappointed me was how messy the whole place was. I am far from a 'neat-freak' but  I couldn't help but notice how dirty the men's bathroom was -- sinks filthy, toilets dirty and trash overflowing onto the floor. The main floors in the restaurant had lots of bits of food and other 'droppings' visible. I realize it was after the lunch rush but there were more employees milling around than there were customers in the place. It would seem to be a simple management decision to have someone begin an effort to clean up. Which brings me to a strange moment. When my wife and I arrived she went to the restroom while I was being seated. As I mention, the place during this time of day was far from busy and there were plenty of open tables and booths. I requested to the hostess the we be seated at a table rather than a booth. She proceeds to lead me to a table right in front of the kitchen which is a location I am usually not a snob about...however there were two workers mopping the floor in the area between the table and the kitchen entrance. I stood there kind of waiting for the mopping to get done thinking to myself "why, in this sea of empty tables, would she interrupt these guys and want to sit us here?" I was getting ready to nicely ask for another table when a management-type lady came over and whispered into the ear of the hostess....who then picked up our menus off the table and said to me..."oh, lets move you...I didn't realize they were mopping"?!?!?!? Wow.  So..overall a very good review for the food (other than the surprisingly dry and boring wheat toast). My wife ordered a salad and gave it a solid "A".   Pretty sure we'll be back -- seems like a great place to bring out-of-town guests. I am going to assume the cleanliness issues were a fluke (again, lots of various level employees milling around and not one of them cleaning -- other than our two moppers at the kitchen entrance who weren't observed doing any other cleaning up during our one hour there) rather than poor management.  This would have been a four-star review rather than a three -- and as I said -- I am NOT a clean-freak so the condition of the facility was enough to garner my attention.

QTFS2pXblmF0B8uQ3qhwsw.text: Maybe we came on an off day, but for a place that has "steak" in its name, they sucked! I give the eggs, service and decor 5 stars but the Steaks were definitely bland.

QF4APdGnnKQsTOckah8JCA.text: As an avid bruncher and vegas native, I like to think I know a thing or two about local breakfast eateries. Been meaning to try this spot for a few months now as its within a few miles from home and could easily become the go to location. Made plans ahead of time with another couple who hadn't tried this spot either but was interested.  Arrived around 11am on a Sunday to a 30 min wait. Not surprising and expected for time and day. What was surprising was how slow service seemed to move with how big the restaurant was. I've worked in the restaurant industry in the past so it didn't take long to notice where the bottleneck issues were coming from. Regardless, I wasn't too annoyed as it was still Sunday and brunchday afterall. Our servers name was Chelsea, she was super friendly and welcoming within a few seconds of seating. They have a nice looking beverage bar in the corner but not an elaborate beverage list to match. Fresh squeezed OG is available. Ambience is fun and fresh and the Jammie's are a kitchy touch. The menu has a nice variety of choices which is great but nothing signature. Chelsea informed us that the waffle iron was not working at the moment which was off to me they only had one waffle machine and cut a chunk of the menu options right away. Our table ordered a Loco Moco, Chilaquiles, chicken fried steak, and house pancakes. Drinks were quick and coffee was hot and fresh. Time seemed to have dragged on by the time our plates arrived ( We had three cups of coffee. ) Chelsea was very attentive and reassuring our order was on its way. When our food arrived it was dropped off by one staff member who could only carry 3/4 of the dishes. No biggie but she didn't acknowledge the lack of complete order and left. Pancakes arrived not too long after. These cakes were massive. I was pumped. The syrup is served warm which is great.  FOOD QUALITY AND TASTE- the massive pancakes are a dense heavy cake and very sweet. Not fluffy like I envisioned. Too dry to eat on their own but overkill sweet with syrup. Seemed like a waffle dough/batter to me. My co-eater did eat a share as I could barely make a dent. The chilaquiles looked the part but was off in traditional red sauce flavor but not a bad try. The loco Moco comes with a teriyaki gravy poured over the dish and would have preferred it on the side. The sweet/salty flavor was overkill and ruined the dish. The spam was also on the burned side so another intense flavor added to the teriyaki gravy profile. Hard pass. The chicken fried steak was a success as were all the eggs at the table.  We didn't linger after completing our meal and walked out of there about 2 hours and $75 later. Chelsea saved the experience for us but an overall opinion of the meal won't make us regulars but worth another try.

cNsn-1HKZaxwMI0db-krpA.text: New location opened on Flamingo & 215. Was so crowded but worth the wait. Ordered our breakfast, not that complicated, wanted regular eggs instead of egg whites for my omelette didn't think it was a big deal & waiter said it was ok. I knew it was going to be bad when we first got our coffees and literally 10 mins later we got our pot of bread after reminding the waiter first. He said sorry & a couple of minutes later we finally got the pot of bread. Minutes later waiter returned to say sorry for the delay for the food but there were "issues in the kitchen." As we are getting our food the waiter comes by & says sorry but the chef won't make my omelette with regular eggs because it's on the menu with egg whites then quickly asked if I wanted to order something else from the menu and by this time we've been waiting like 25 mins for our food. But the other waitress handing us our food says of course you can get what you order which was an omelette with regular eggs. Then the waiter says oh I didn't know that. He then says I must of not put in the order correctly. He only admitted his mistake because the other waitress said it in front of him. So first he lied by blaming the chef that the order would not be done by the chef then when he got caught he said oh yeah I must not have put the order in right. So I asked to speak with the manager, Casey, & she was amazing. She apologized & said the waiter was new and there was no excuse for waiting until the wrong order was cooked & brought it to the table. It seemed he had done this to other tables as well because the table behind us was also having issues with their order from our same waiter. Casey took care of our entire meal. I told her I wasn't looking for anything free, just making her aware of the situation but she still took care of everything. So my upsetting late late breakfast was better thanks to Casey. And by the way I did get my omelette with regular eggs.

QrZ5lZMdTqHK0pR_KFwntg.text: An update Review. I had such a wonderful meal the day before I decided to take friends to breakfast. The service was atrocious, the food was disgusting. Water glasses sat empty,  no refills on anything. The waiter said how was everything  we sort of wins and he walked away  never giving us a chance to explain about the food .  The cashier asked how was everything I said the food was atrocious the service was terrible  and she shrugged it off . I said we will not return We drove off after paying our bill and everyone pulled off to the side of the 215 and were physically ill. I don't know what happened but for people physically ill at the same time? I would venture and say it was the food.

1x1fOkF-U4zj9LvEB5IFMQ.text: A must try breakfast joint in Las Vegas. Of all the great places around here for breakfast (there are plenty) this is the place we will continue to visit every time we're in town. Friendly staff, great food, many options, and you just cannot beat the cup of bread!

n0ylZgnRKnkxVl2hPV8Npw.text: This place was really good. I had strawberry and watermelon juice, which was amazing. I had a regular breakfast, but it was just as good. I'll definitely be back.

Osl-QN5L538YmPXL778cTQ.text: Today was my second time here i just had to bring my husband (first time was with my mom)! This place is great wait isn't long and customer service was great! First trip we had Devin (female waitress) and she made sure our first time was great the portions are huge and very filling second trip we had Amberly who's customer service was just as phenomenal my husband couldn't stop talking about his meal! He got the fried chicken and waffles which i might add was absolutely great again thanks to our servers who took great care of us!

ED0V8a3rmhmiLqlr_oT4kQ.text: Went here for bfast today, arrived at 10am, waited to be seated by 1015am; me and my husband ordered, a red velvet pancake with syrup and creamcheese, i got a banana berry smoothie, the classic 2 eggs (over hard), bacon, hash potatoes and a cup-o-bread; he ordered regular coffee, the ribeye steak (medium rare) and eggs (over easy) with hash potatoes and cup-o bread; our drinks came in, our food came by 1058am, food is already cold, (you dont want cold hash potatoes, steak is cold as well), no cup-o bread was served for neither of our orders, no cream cheese for the pancake; we ate whatever we feel due to hunger, and we asked the waitress attending our table regarding the bread and she states "oh they didnt bring it, i can get it", my husband said "no need coz we are almost done" and she states she will put it as to go and looks at our pancake and says "oh they didnt give you cream cheese for that, let me get you some", she comes back with a bag and a styro in it with only one cup-o bread and a bottled syrup (instead of the cream cheese) and sees a bottled syrup already in our table and says "oh they already gave you syrup", we understand how things get busy but we dont think we're gonna come back here, thank you for the experience

_EacfHDIRtF6JMp7xcnANQ.text: Rise & Shine is a great breakfast spot & one that I go to often. It's never too busy, but their location has enough space to hold a lot of people. I never have to wait to be seated, food comes out right away & service is friendly.  On top of that, their portion sizes are huge & food is delicious! My boyfriend changes up his order, but most of the time gets the "Ultimate Steak & Eggs." I get the "Chicken & Waffles." Their "Pot of Bread" is my favorite side!  I love this place!

_4e041uDHKC6t08236OOJw.text: This place was great. Fresh squeezed orange juice, the avo-veggie Benedict, kids ABC breakfast and the omelets were on point! Services was fantastic and relatively quick for a sit down place. Also super kid friendly. Would definitely come back next time were in town.

bJD6bVbw6FWzRCUcUPpayA.text: I ordered the Lox omelette.  Huge disappointment given the $14 price.  They over cooked the eggs to the point of leatheryness.  It was way salty too.  I did say something and they offered to make me another omelette or something else off the menu, however I didn't have time for a redo.  Probably not going back, at least for a while.

rBTNvxUKCqc7aHLU-nRtbA.text: On our way back to Cali and stopped here for brunch. Food was very good except asked for hash browns crispy and they were oily and soggy but chicken fried steak was crunchy and tender. Latte I ordered was disappointing to me but brothers banana shake was delish. Probably will never go back but if lived in Vegas would. Cute decor inside.

srBSBKFXv76OYOkoHuo_yg.text: My mom, two small kids, and I finally tried this place after weeks of seeing it on our way to Target. The outside of the building is so warm and inviting and exciting.   Walking to our table was fun and our waitress was patient with us as we looked at all the beautiful decorations inside. My infant son was mesmerized and entertained by the decor the whole time!  I ordered their fresh green juice and their breakfast with eggs, bacon, and hash browns. My juice was fresh and delicious and my food was well seasoned, cooked, and presented!  Every employee was wearing pajamas and each individual employee was cheerful, helpful, and made us all feel welcome and wanted.   All of our food was exceptionally prepared and served. The restaurant is clean and thoughtfully decorated. The staff is friendly and efficient. We can wait to return and try everything on their menu!

CPf4v5gokFz23FFMtRPwaQ.text: I was expecting more from this place based upon the reviews and what others have mentioned. This was my first time here. I got the egg was fine. The cornbeef has was made from cornbeef brisket. This is definitely different. It was pretty good but had a hint of of rosemary or some other type of seasoning which gave it an odd flavor. Honestly, they could have left that off and it would have been so much better. The waffle was fine.   They're pricey for what you're getting. You can get more bang for your buck elsewhere. If you're budget conscious, then look elsewhere.   Would I come back? Probably not.   Would I recommend it? No.   Were the staff friendly? No. Everyone was just robotic doing their job. It was not crowded when we were here.

n4v9qkam-7FjPQ-0rDZghg.text: Stopped here last minute after going to Squeeze In where the wait was pretty significant. Did not realize it would be just as long here for Sunday brunch but we were quoted a wait time of 25 minutes and were seated in about 20. We got a nice big booth in Nicole L's section. I thought this was a very cute place with the spinning umbrellas on the ceiling along with the funny t-shirts for sale.   My husband and I were in the mood for corned beef and hash with eggs so we both got that along with French press coffee. We also chose the cup of bread which is basically a warm cinnamon roll with a side of cream cheese frosting. Our eggs were cooked correctly and the corned beef and hash was awesome.   The coffee gives you 3 full cups and it's presented with a little timer for 3,4, and 5 minutes so you can choose how long you want it steeped. Nicole was on top of our drinks and food and everything was very good. We want to come back and order the pancakes next time.

GPr-p-Pm7296Guj9zjTGAg.text: This place looked amazing from the outside, after entering the building my thoughts drastically changed.  The service was something to be desired, the place looks like it has never been dusted, the umbrellas hanging from the ceiling had cobwebs all over them and this is hanging right over my table.  DO NOT buy any of their iced coffee.  It's mostly ice and about 3 sips through a straw before it's gone, at a cost of 4.35 a glass with no refills.  Jack in the box has a way better iced coffee at a lower cost and much more for your money, hell McDonald's has better iced coffee for a lower price.  The food was decent with exception to their tasteless hash browns which is the only reason they got a star from me.  I honestly wish I went to Denny's!  I will not be returning their and I hope this was helpful

Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Iced mocha, very big price for a very small glass with mostly ice, about 3 or 4 ounces of actual drink.
