yTWiwItJd5UoHiMwVBsmMQ.text: If you are in the mood for Steak & Eggs vvoid this place when it's busy.  Everytime I had steak here it was burnt. I suspect the cooks are in a rush an raise the flame way too high.  Shame on the servers for allowing to be served even though it's clearly burnt. Service was ok. Will not return.  I'll need to find a different spot for Steak & Eggs.

YG4XWImyVuoyK5-AHTMgJA.text: I'm only giving this place 2 stars because the server is not familiar with ingredients in products and refused to go ask which I requested.  So since she refused, I ordered something else because of allergy issues and I now know this is not a place I can come often or recommend to people with allergy issues because it does not seem to be a concern here especially with this server.  Customer service and allergy concerns should start with the manager and apparently this location it's not impressed upon the servers to go ask when requested.  If you have good allergies beware of this location.  I'll spend my money someplace else.  I only came here because of a family bday desire.  I won't come back to a place that refuses to go ask..plus we had two small kids in our party, no one ever brought them crayons and paper to draw on, we had to get it ourselves.  In addition, we had to request refills on coffee and drinks, etc.  I know this may sound picky but in a town that has so many choices for you to spend your money at, why pick a place that in appearance does not care about the customers on a personal level because of the amount of business that passes through, they will continue to make money, so customer satisfaction I guess does not have to be a priority...

xfmAODKqGsWIkPG1j8ClCw.text: Absolutely love this place . The decor is so cute and all the servers wear pajamas which is awesome. I've been here multiple times and they were all great experiences. I bring most of my out of town guests here as well .   Some of the MUST tries are the Banana Foster Waffle and the Spice Rubbed Rib Eye Steak Chilaquiles. You will not regret it ! The steaks are always seasoned and cooked to perfection . I had one of the best lattes I've ever tried here . I have also tried the Green GOGO juice and it's also good .   This menu is huge and I have yet to try something that I didn't love . There is literally something for everyone on this menu. If you're not in the mood for breakfast they also have lunch items.   This is on my top 5 best breakfast places in Las Vegas. Service is great , environment is great , and the food is fantastic . What more can you ask for ! Don't miss out ! Check this place out ASAP .

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spice rubbed Rib Eye Steak Chilaquiles

Ww3Xu8M1jQjDcL2Hkfu4tg.text: I have visited a couple times before this review. What stands out in my mind is that they serve far too much food for breakfast/lunch. Sure, they offer a box to take the leftovers home, but, unless you are sharing the food with a dog, breakfast food doesn't keep or reheat very well.   The bread in a cup is great. To me, that's breakfast -- then your breakfast arrives. Everything I've tasted was good. The avocado, turkey, bacon, swiss on a bagel was good, big and messy (Roasted Turkey California Bagel). I've had the "Loco Moco" steak burger with Spam and "gravy-yaki" sauce. Very good.   The staff wearing pajamas is cute, but inconsistent. Makes those who are wearing pajamas look odd. Embrace it or not.  Clean. Friendly (for Vegas). Crowded. Usually a wait.  I will complain about a pet peeve of mine: poorly named menu items. If it's a burrito, call it a burrito. It's not "bananas Foster" just because the bananas have cinnamon on them. It's not "California" because of an avocado. Chopped steak does not make it "Philly-Style," with or without onions and peppers. Still not sure what a "chilaquiles" is. I looked it up. It's supposed to be a traditional Mexican dish with tortilla chips. Sounds like breakfast nachos, but it doesn't say that on the menu. I might like breakfast nachos, and I may have ordered them if I knew what it was.  And I'm not sure chocolate and pancakes go together -- ever.   If your not in a rush and like a well-made-over Crab Shack, enjoy a nice breakfast or brunch!

2ho4Gzi4QzIZQ9S0zy82eg.text: This is always one of our favorite breakfast spots and it's right by our gym. We pass it every morning after our workout, and we can smell the bacon!  This place has a special place in my heart for many reasons, the coffee, the food, and the servers! We've had so many incredible, servers and they really make the experience.   Our latest experience was this Sunday, with Sammy. She made sure we had an amazing time, and enjoyed our meals, and kept the coffee pouring. We usually get a bagel sandwich and the Fried Chicken, and its more than plenty, but this time we decided to try something new.  We went with the Rise and Shine Burrito and the Chicken and Waffles. Both were huge and sooooo tasty! It was honestly, one of the best breakfasts in town I've had in a while.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Rise and Shine Burrito in the front and the Chicken and Waffles (+2eggs) in the back. Both excellent!

O2lHXWyLJW-rnspAWTBypw.text: Out doing errands with a good friend. As I'm new to the area, I'm establishing my new "Go To" list. Unfortunately this will not be making the list.  The decor is cutesy and the wait staff are wearing PJ's. That's different and what makes two of the three stars. Stacy was our waitress and she was very friendly and efficient. Thus the third star.  My friend had the ham steak. It was large and he felt well worth the money. It had a good flavor but the rest of his meal was bland at best.  I had the Moco Loco and was quite disappointed. The meal was over cooked. The rice was dry and crunchy. The steak burger was ordered medium and was provided as well done. It had a burnt taste to it.  Overall very disappointed - especially when it was $37.00 for the two meals.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham Steak - Good sized ham
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute decor
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moco Loco

nOM7iibjr4AMd1T24MbwDw.text: This is, by far, the best breakfast restaurant in Las Vegas. (According to my nobody opinion.)   Their food is always cooked to perfection. I've tried many things on their menu, and usually I'm a creature of habit, but nothing here has ever disappointed me. (Or any of my guests)   For the most part everything is big enough to share and they have something on the menu for every taste and diet.  The chilaquiles with steak is one of my favorites. Crunchy, savory...add a cup of that amazing cinnamon roll and all your taste buds will feel like they're at a party.   Their ribeye steak and eggs is always cooked to perfection. I love how they make their steaks charred on the outside.   I recently discovered their freshly squeezed juices and wowza! I didn't know I loved kale. (I don't, but with honeydew melon, apples, and cucumber you'd think I was healthy. Nope, just a glutton. Hehe.)   At the location on Flamingo I love to watch the kitchen workers make the food while sitting at the bar. Their teamwork is amazing to see and the hard work they put into the food is impressive. I appreciate the food more when I see how they take pride in the quality of it. Well done team!   Every time I have someone come visit I take them here. EVERY time. Then, they ask about it when they come back. THAT is how you know it's good.   Writing this I already can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Working the pass line pros @ Rise &amp; Shine.

cmNTaFrjGxOeqjhpO26tgA.text: Love this place! Every time I'm in town I ALWAYS GO HERE. Fort apache and Flamingo is the best location.

Ns7aZDpjl37-72QwfDIoeA.text: Another fantastic breakfast spot in the Las Vegas valley. This one is somewhat of a journey from my neck of the woods as I reside of the southeast side of town, but let me just tell you that bomb breakfast like this is well worth the journey.   Located on the cusp of Summerlin, just off the 215 exit at Flamingo, breakfast goers and hungry customers can easily spot this breakfast joint and stop in for a delicious hearty breakfast. They have ample parking and seating so your wait time will be minimal. We were seated almost instantaneously and before I could mouth the words "coffee", our kind server had already greeted us at our table with a fresh pot in hand. Now that's what I call impeccable service!  After glancing over their extensive menu, I decided to order the steak and chorizo breakfast burrito. I had just completed a 5k run earlier that morning so my appetite was all riled up and ready to conquer this bad boy. Every bite was simply fantastic, plus they included both red and green sauce along with an extra side of salsa for just enough extra kick! We also tried the "Cup O' Bread" which is basically a warm cinnamon roll in a mug with the frosting on the side. It's the perfect serving size and a great compliment to your breakfast entree or even just a simple cup of coffee.   All in all, I'm really happy to have discovered another incredible breakfast spot in our city. I can honestly say i now I have another great reason to come back to this side of town real soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and chorizo breakfast burrito
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dJHfX8EgE4pfI4sbLBwoyw.text: I give this place a 5/5 stars because it has all the elements of what breakfast is about. The servers are even in theme with the restaurant by wearing pajamas. I love that! Also they have freshly squeezed juice and lots of healthy options for vegetarians. This place is also great for big parties, they have roomy indoor and outdoor seating. Highly recommend for breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AvoVeggie Eggs Benedict and Egg White Omelet

QTvrKfHEfwdmL-Y5C3NU-g.text: This place was pretty good! I feel like so many breakfast places are the same and this one was not one of those places. First, I am not a morning person so getting here at 11AM meant I had to wait 20 minutes. But once 20mins hit, I was sat. They turned tables really fast so that was awesome.  Menu was huge, a lot to choose from. I ordered an ice coffee, which I would not get again just because it kind of had a powdery taste to it, but still good. I also got the eggs Benedict, which I've never had before, and it was very tasty! My boyfriend had a bite and said compared to others, it was on the better side.   Good service, good food. I'd come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tJnyfVE5K_C-rjJJWcyy8A.text: This is a surprisingly good place yet for some reason not as popular as the many other overcrowded breakfast joints in Las Vegas.   I really don't get why some of the packed and overpriced egg joints are so busy and serve bad food, slowly, and are often out of menu items. Some serve store-bought items like muffins and charge several bucks for something you can buy at Costco for .25 cents.  But Rise & Shine was really different. It appears to be a former bar and grill and perhaps it still is at night. But at breakfast, the menu was inventive and healthy with great options that don't have to weigh you down.  I had a great steak everything bagel sandwich and fruit that was prepared perfectly. My wife and son had kale smoothies that were actually good along with other items.  We also had some oatmeal that was prepared perfectly and I think from steel cut grains not instant.  Forget about the chain restaurants with egg in the name, drive out a little further and enjoy a far better breakfast.  They also have a nice and comfortable patio for those who prefer to eat outside.

zYe8d7QB0aqBGlzlA7j94Q.text: This was one of the best breakfast I've had in Las Vegas. Deep off the Vegas strip this was well worth the trip. The rib eye steak and eggs was off the chain and the biscuit  and gravy was also top notch. This is definitely a must do well recovering from one of those long Vegas nights.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Ultimate Steak &amp; Egg Breakfast

MS1Y0kQ5JwKY1XKHftvoig.text: As you can see i have been here a few times and though i loved the food, the service was unsatisfactory to say the least. Well its been over a year and someone visiting wanted to check it out. We did, I mean it had been a year.   Ya, nope...service was still not good. We were seated within the time they quoted us but qaited almost 10 min before we even saw our server. He took our drink order and then 25 min after being seated he took our food order. We finally ate a lil over an hour after being seated.   The food was good, like always. Service not good.

H3DLdznQLosnHoWYDel23A.text: Great service, great food, and the pot o' bread is the best! Rise & Shine is one of our favorite places for breakfast.  The servers wear pajamas and the ceiling has cool umbrellas and did I mention the pot o'bread?  It's basically a cinnamon sweet roll served in a cup with cream cheese frosting on the side and it accompanies most breakfast dishes here: delicious!  I usually get an omelette to go along with my bread, but I'm also a fan of their corned beef and hash.  Although this place does get busy, they have an outdoor patio for more seating and the wait on the weekends is usually a lot shorter than other breakfast joints.  We just dined here today, a Sunday, arriving around 10:30am and only had to wait for 10 minutes or so.  The staff is always so pleasant and very attentive to your needs throughout the meal.  Definitely a winner in our breakfast dining book.

RXLNtftgZzb0WVlB_349PA.text: I've been here a couple of times now and I love everything I've tries here so far. If you're craving pancakes and a lot of them, come here. The pancakes are HUGE! I'm talking bigger than your head. None of us have ever been able to finish more than half. The chicken fried steak is huge too! But it is delicious. The rib eye is amazing too. But if you like it pink, get it rare. It's a thin steak so it usually comes out well done. I don't think you can really fo wrong with anything you order here.   They do get busy so you may have a long wait on weekends so be prepared. With being busy, comes not the greatest customer service. Everytime I've gone, it's been hard to get a hold of a server anytime we needed anything. One thing I wish would be better, is the time it takes for the servers to check on you. Still worth going to tho.

X2HO_KNmbxeDxaBRMabuig.text: Wow talk about going down hill fast!  Just two months I have a rave review of this place.  Went back there today and ordered the same thing the ribeye steak and eggs.  The steak was probably the cheapest cut of steak I've ever had.  In my picture you can see it's all fat barely edible!  The potatoes which were so amazing last time today were so overcooked and greasy.  My friends breakfast was equally disappointing.  The waitress was so annoying she was rushing us along I was halfway through my plate and put my fourth down for a minute and she tried to take my plate away?  Oh well it's a shame the food got so bad so quick.  Probably won't be back here anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Here was half my breakfast steak all fat!  Gross

gOh5p_2xgFQyqcNL3GbM2A.text: My 2nd time here with my sister and brother Tony and Kids. 1st time I had steak and eggs it was awesome. This time I had the Red Velvet Pancakes w/sausages yummayyyyy!! I love Red Velvet anything! This is a nice spot to bring the family for some good breakfast.

4sWthen-lZ9dUmiE3Sg_vA.text: With a wink and a nod to kitsch in both menu and design, my recent trip to breakfast spot Rise and Shine managed to entertain and disappoint on many levels. I dined with two other guests, ordering the New York Steak, Spinach, and Benedict Bagel.   In a nutshell:  Possibly the worst hollandaise I've had in ... well, ever.   My guest had ordered the smoked salmon benedict and had the same reaction. It lacked all the classic hollandaise flavor notes, almost as if the sauce broke and they opted to serve it anyways.   Cloying balsamic reduction drizzled all over my steak wasn't listed in the menu description and muted an otherwise perfectly cooked, well seasoned New York Steak.   Spinach wasn't cooked for some reason, not even blanched a bit.   My other guest was also straddling the fence on his dish. He had perfectly cooked eggs with his giant bone-in country ham steak breakfast. Our eyes lit up when the ham arrived with those beautiful cross hatch char marks from the grill. But the cost of those char marks was a very dry piece of meat that he ultimately left behind.   On the plus side, damn amazing pancakes. Fluffy in height yet dense with flavor, spiced with cinnamon and topped with a cinnamon syrup. It was a good thing I saved it for last so I could end on a high note. Honestly, if I came back I'd be all over the griddle menu.  Kudos to our waiter who was friendly and quick to offer up refills, checking in often.

hYjOBfdbVh4-lkxkrjXheg.text: Food was real good, service was a little slow. It was nice to sit outside and look at the mountains. Definitely will be back for the pot o bread, delish.

qCylRnualLAnfSQbJkoAzg.text: Great food, nice people. Lovely space. I only wish they did a side salad:(. Otherwise a very welcomed edition to the 'hood.

AmZSP61U6xUIdguZrd_hUg.text: Haven't been there in awhile, had a great time with Desiree. Super sweet girl, great to chat with! Always makes us feel special.

820MloplByXd6kNP46BagQ.text: Chicken fried steak and eggs is the best I have had. Friendly staff and fun environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You have to try the chicken fried steak and eggs. The traditional breakfast is also well cooked.

iTVcO6-sExwcMu8zZY4JbA.text: A family favorite for sure! The food was delicious and the service was terrific! We are looking forward to our next visit.

YM3oZYWN5X9Ha_cJqRGJDA.text: Today was my first and last time dining here. I went here for a late lunch today with my family because my kids wanted pancakes. The place is decorated cutely and the food was okay. However the service was so bad, it was almost comical. My food and my children's food came out but we weren't given any utensils or syrup. Our server never came by so we had to get up and ask someone else for help. They told us we couldn't have utensils until they were wrapped in napkins. We again asked politely for at least 2 forks for the kids. We were told no so we simply took the forks ourselves (about 10 minutes later someone brought us over utensils wrapped in napkins). We never got syrup so we had to ask the booth behind us if we could use theirs. My mom's food came out a few minutes later, but her side never came. When we got the receipt her side was still on there so we got them to take it off & mentioned our bad experience...they gave us 10% off but really a few dollars off didn't make us feel better about the situation. As we were talking and standing up to leave another family heard us and said "you didn't get any utensils either?"   The food is not bad so if you don't mind waiting forever for everything and having to hassle everyone for things then don't let my review discourage you. But if you have kids or a tight schedule (or just want to be waited on) then this is not the place to go.

z4D40mZ9dLn4SYehbYkymQ.text: This is my second most favorite place in Vegas to have breakfast! I've probably tried half the menu and not one thing has been bad. Absolutely delicious food! Eggs are always cooked to perfection, best chicken fried steak EVER, awesome lattes, amazing French toast, perfectly grilled steaks, I could go on and on. Love the ambiance, too!   The only reason I'm giving this 4 stars is due to the attitude of some of the wait staff. Pretty snippy, even with fellow coworkers that I've seen.

SffTfjZ9KY-Ph8I730wCiA.text: We have been coming here for quiet some time now every Sunday.   The employees are beyond friendly and the food is amazing.  If you can ask for Sara for your server.  She always remembers our order and is a delight.  She always make our visit that much more enjoyable.  Chicken and waffles are my fav and probably the best I've ever had.  Annalise the manager should be proud of her team.  She has always been beyond accommodating to us.  Her upbeat personality rounds out a perfect breakfast for us every time.  Keep up the great work. We will be back next Sunday.

7kBo_XLH8417_nUg-NVlLg.text: This was my breakfast stop for my short visit to Vegas. The hospitality was very pleasant and the food was amazing. I had the Bananas Foster waffle...the best waffle I've ever had in my life! My boyfriend hates bananas but kept getting little bites. It was huge so I could barely put a dent in it. I'm now back home in Ohio and I've been thinking about this waffle almost every morning. The only reason I gave 4 stars is because of the prices but other than that I can't wait to go back.

Cool beans.

EipyfT3f1JYMu-dtsr3yDw.text: If you want gourmet steak and eggs served by a waitress in pajamas, this is the place. Any way you want them, with an air of whimsy. The portions are large, the paninis are delicious, the philly steak and eggs was divine, the coffee strong, and the refills plentiful.

YLlu9mhH4GwoKYvqIsnzXA.text: Amazing. This place can be summed up in the word AMAZING! Not only is the atmosphere cute and the employees wear pjs, but the fact that they went above and beyond. We hosted a bridal brunch here around 1 pm on a Saturday. They were helpful, so kind, and very well organized. Some places just give you a bad attitude for having a large group. But they served all 35 of ladies with big smiles on their faces. We RSVP'd ahead of time, and when we got there to set up- the tables were ready to go. I know we were blocking the paths sometimes and I apologized to one of them and she said "no, don't be sorry. This is your guys party!" How sweet is that?!?! I am just so happy with the customer service with this place!! Hands down the best customer service I've received in awhile!

p_EwB8FNLsBRwivd9oLIfw.text: Service very good and fast Hash browns best in Las Vegas Waitress very friendly and efficient  Large menu

ybOrT1Azyn0zGH6IaAK74g.text: Came here on a Sunday and had a great experience. Amberly was a fantastic server, very polite and efficient. When she warns you about the portions, heed her warning: we ordered red velvet pancakes that were larger than dinner platters, delicious but definitely should be shared.

XHzm-ZZf4xyhOGWp360oNA.text: I love this place from the fresh-squeezed orange juice to the pajamas on the waiters and the Loco Moco is simply splendid, you must try it.

C0mCk1semUIAfh8eLsFzFg.text: Came here because it had great reviews. Super disappointed:( coffee was cold and had zero flavor. Ordered the steak and spinach benny, steak medium rare... it came medium and the rest of the food was just warm. Nothing was hot like it had just been made. Server delivered the food and gave us the check at the same time?? Never asked us how the food was or came back after we finished eating. Pretty disappointed.

JJWp4aHd21YlrOwBGWLk1w.text: This is my go to breakfast place whenever I'm in the Vegas area.  Ashley has been my server at least twice now and she's excellent and takes care of all of her customers.  Oh yeah, and try that Bread in a cup... it's awesome

BjeJO4JE2vlXvErVRNtpgA.text: I've been here several times, really enjoy the food, service and atmosphere! Be prepared, come VERY hungry!!Portion sizes fairly big! Especially the pancakes, which are deee...licious!!! My Daughter and I, for a side dish, ordered 1 plain pancake & couldn't even finish it!!

m1NynzV0ULfcRsIeu9hGvQ.text: SO, I do like this place! I just think that the food could be a little bit better. I will start by saying the atmosphere of the place is amazing and homey. I like that all the employees are wearing pajamas. They little umbrellas hanging of the ceiling are cute too. The place just has a really nice country breakfast place feel. I really enjoyed our waitress and she called us hun and baby. It was just a very welcoming and authentic staff.  The food was good don't get me wrong. I order the steak omelette and I am really picky about the way steak is cooked and prepared, and they prepared it very well. However, I just feel like something was missing in the food and I don't quite know how to explain it. The menu is so big as well that I always am trying to pick what to order! However, I will say that the pot-o-bread is freaking amazing. I love the little sweet things. I like to experience sweet and savory during breakfast, and maybe that's what was lacking but I had some chicken and waffle and was a little dissapponted in how the chicken was cooked. Still a good chicken and waffle just need to be less breading and more flavorful chicken.

bKxyRNMZa6wO-_41OvT9Dw.text: I've been eye balling this place for sometime so when I finally got a chance to go I have to say, I was not disappointed. I love that decor with the flower fans in the ceiling and the down home feeling seating. I thought is was super cute that they wait staff wore pajamas as the uniform. My sister and I ordered the ultimate I believe. It came with these cute cinnamon bun pot breads with cream cheese icing. They were very tasty. Once we got our breakfast we realized that we could have shared. It was worth every penny and its not really expensive. The steak was perfect. Perfectly done and perfectly seasoned, we didn't really need A1. The staff were nice and attentive. Over all a great experience. I recommend this place to everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is steak, eggs, and hash browns. I think it&#39;s called the Ultimate or something like that. It&#39;s amazing!
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They make these delicious cinnamon pot bread with cream cheese icing!!!

Jtnpv1Apb6IwbSlOCfLKXQ.text: My husband loves this place.   Although we are not breakfast people, we always recommend this place when we have visitors.   They make delicious gravy and biscuits.   My fav is chicken fried steak. Their sausage gravy is really good.   And don't forget to order fresh squeezed orange juice.

yrN2KYvTQm0VKd8HmoJjCw.text: This place has become one of my favorite breakfast places!  Went here after church with my family and we were not disappointed!  I had the country fried steak but also sampled other dishes that my family got.  The steak, loco moco, and ham and cheese benedict were also fantastic.  I loved how the loco moco had spam.  Will definitely come back!  So many things to choose from!

nBLoV0U15sT8FuVENPyxOQ.text: It was ok. I had the Loco Moco and it was good, but wasn't that great. I'll probably go for a steak and egg breakfast or one of the waffles or something next time. The serving for the chicken and waffles is huge too, biggest I've ever seen.  However, for being a breakfast place, they need to step up their coffee game. This is some of the weakest and worst coffee I've ever had and that alone makes me not want to come back with so many options nearby.

ENt_oFNn7K8gQfO3Sv9IZA.text: Fresh made carrot and green apple juice for me  and waffles with powdered sugar for my sons  A little for everyone.  Nice setting.  Good place to eat after the craziness of Thanksgiving.

Dqc4hVfbnHcTHYMrVGwUXg.text: First time in Vegas. We were looking for a breakfast place close to our stay. Rise & Shine was less than a mile away so it was perfect.  First off, the restaurant is beautiful. Flowers everywhere! The staff are dressed in pajamas, which is fun, and they are so friendly.  The restaurant was also busy which is a sign of good food :)  Anyways, it was very difficult to make a selection but I finally settled on the pancakes. However, these were no average pancakes. They were huge!!!! Also, they tasted like cake. We asked the waitress what they were made out of... SWEET CREAM pancake mix. So delicious!!!!!  The service was wonderful, the food was marvelous and the atmosphere was perfect for a casual morning. Will definitely go back if I ever find myself in Vegas again.

gSTo6A1VpYIKSRfMOu4MOQ.text: Extremely large portions served by a wait staff in their pajamas! Feels like Grandma's warm and cozy kitchen at the cabin. Ask for the the best server in the morning Frankie. If you can't find it on the menu, he'll help you find it. I love this place on Friday mornings.

22KzeHmkD1KDz9-XJpbEHQ.text: To be honest I am a repeat customer here for awhile and the past couple of times I have come to this location it's been a s*** show. This time especially. To start things off the wait I was told was 15-20 min and I waited for 35-40. Second they bring out one persons dish while all of us sit there and watch her eat. Third the wait for our food was at least an hour. Fourth they bring my food and half of the food was cold while the rest was just barely warm. Also I had someone order the steak salad... she got 4 small pieces of steak and was extremely disappointed... don't know if I'm gonna keep going here if they continue to raise their prices and give less and less food.

rVnCXMlvtUCm7iquusQmTQ.text: First time eating here. Everybody that I came in contact with was very friendly. I ordered a steak and avocado egg white omelette which was very tasty. The hash browns were amazing but the server was the highlight and was extremely friendly, attentive, speedy, and made great recommendations on everything. I will definitely return!

q8uKD6j4OSf814oYVQk-BA.text: ASHLEY... was an amazing waitress she has great energy greeting us with her beautiful smile and making us feel so welcomed. Breakfast was so delicious and such a big portion well worth the money!! Def a must try!!!!

_CuAn_nrqjxC1YD8H1BwMw.text: cute, the servers are dressed in PJ's. Nice touch. Food was good, it was good overall, service was good.  But, there were a few things that it didn't make 5 stars: They served this cinnamon covered roll in a little metal cup. The dough was completely raw inside the cup and inedible. This is supposed to be one of their signature items. The coffee was tasteless It's supposed to be Lavazza, if it was, someone didn't know how to brew it and they charged you extra for the coffee, Maybe it's a LV thing? Most places I've been to include coffee with breakfast. Also the prices were through the roof. I've paid less for breakfast in Manhattan...

IMpXHzVOl-rx9POdR6Cpgw.text: Surprisingly phenomenal. First went to Bite down the street. Not a single soul there.. so found that suspicious and left. Sure glad we ended up here. Pancakes...bomb. Steak...bomb. Biscuit...awesome. Will come back soon, maybe even tmorrow. Cute spot good service; )

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak medium well...perfect.  eggs good

oh96-YKoDrE2dNCdtZMXkQ.text: My first trip to Rise and Shine was to their Southern Highland location a while back.  We loved it and were in there often until it started getting so packed you can never get in there.  I was sad about the traffic but what can you do? That place was so good ... great breakfast and great service ... that it deserves all the demand!!  I was excited when this location opened!  But my first visit was disappointing.  The service was slow and not so great.  I've since chalked that up to growing pains in the new location.    Today's visit has been wonderful and exactly what I remember from my visits to SH location.  I got the Ribeye & Scrambled Eggs w/ their pot of bread.  The PoB is a flower pot or coffee cup with a light fluffy cinnamon bread baked in.  This is so fricken cool and tastes good too.  The steak was perfectly cooked and seasoned.  I also recommend any of their oversized bagel sandwiches.    This is a must visit for anyone up on the west side!!

fSeG8ANE8edS9tOVixbNBw.text: Our first time here and the food is amazing. My son loves the camp fire s'mores waffles and the fresh fruit smoothies. The ultimate steak and eggs was so flavorful.

SJIBok68bIdBPYn24jAiEg.text: The food was great! Best breakfast we have had since we moved to Vegas! The service was excellent! Our waitress Ashley Silva was fabulous! Her recommendations were on point! Definitely will be back and will recommend to our friends!

DwsBVme54AW2zx3thOLVlQ.text: We've been here several times and never had a bad experience. Today was no exception. Food is delicious and service is excellent. Our server today was Ashley, she's super nice and has great customer service!

cSq6go2DvQnW8EZy6yq90g.text: This is the second time I go try eat at this place and both occasions I find myself and family waiting in front to be seated and my last visit we waited so long we left. We never going there again.

OTpi8YGmvm8atBFo5eHiig.text: After my previous experience there I was hesitant to go again, however I was extremely happy this time. My sister ordered the chorizo burrito, it was so delicious I can't stop thinking about it. I will definitely be back. & I gave the chicken and waffles another try and they actually were much better. The service was perfect and we were served very quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wM-IMFVUlAw78Xj1iwncjw.text: Better than I thought it would be. When we sat down I was a little taken back by the higher prices but the portions and the quality more than offset the prices.Coffee was excellent,  food was excellent and the service was excellent, well worth it.  I totally love that the serving employees were wearing pajamas.

LRUu68rQWry9I8DgUGro0g.text: Had a great experience with Amberly as our waitress. Food was fantastic and she was very accommodating and patient. Would come back again!

-hGcg_7L-yPkb4b1RVAGUA.text: Was very impressed with the food and more so the service. Our server Ashley was warm and friendly and our food came out hot and fast....not warm like most breakfast places. Definitely will be returning.

eQKNq0fMvl_PleamcuwKdQ.text: Had a great breakfast yesterday. Food was so yummy and our server Ashley was awesome, so sweet and kind.

fmW0DAoulEqAZnfilss28Q.text: I had been told that the one in southern highlands was really good so I stopped in here. The only time I've been and will ever go, so I can only speak on the item I had on the menu.   Biscuits and sausage gravy- the biscuits were hard I honestly think they were leftovers from days before. The gravy consistency was good but hardly any meat in it.   The experience- feels like it is closing down while you're there. Staff was more into each other than serving their guests. One server even had headphones in.

YElkY2-A9eBNbOwfr1lFaw.text: The wait was definitely worth it! Great food, great service. I'm always satisfied after my visit here. I wish there would've been outdoor seating available it was a nice day. The manager even paid a visit to our table which is always appreciated

nLeGG-18uPmlqKd5dJ0FJQ.text: Sadly, bad experience twice in a row at Rise & Shine.   We ordered a standard breakfast that took a LONG time.  Certainly things can and do take time to prepare.  What is highly irritating is to watch several tables seated AFTER us, get their food BEFORE and LEAVE the restaurant and we STILL don't have our food.   WHAT?  We asked our server where our food was.  She came back and said that the kitchen was working on getting the poached eggs. When it was finally delivered, she was told by her manager (then told us)  poached eggs take 10 minutes.  A poached egg takes 3-4 minutes tops, not 10.   Regardless of the preparation time,  the kitchen needs to plan accordingly to get food out in a timely manner and in order received,  not based on how long things take which is the explanation we were given.  If something does take longer, make sure your customer knows that.  But, eggs take longer?  I would assume a large portion of their items contain eggs. What about simply acknowledging the error, apologizing and making it right?    Excuses add fuel to the fire.    The bill had coffee removed and we were given a $5.00 coupon toward our next visit.  While that was kind, management needs to fix a problem when it occurs, not wait until "next time." The manager also should have been proactive in coming to our table to discuss.  Our server was kind and the food good ~ none of this was her issue.   Want a happy customer? Make it a great experience!  This was not the experience we were looking for.     Cute place!   Needs better customer service before spending your time and money.

00tcLzIyd7kGsTI1SbEDKA.text: Found this place today . Pass it a million times and finally decided to try it. Ridiculously delicious  ! Loved it! Adorable decor, the food is fresh and better than any of the usual breakfast places in town. Get the fresh juices , watermelon and strawberry was insanely refreshing.  Vegetarian options available.  I had the avocado egg bagel, crazy good. I'm coming back to try everything else. Very eclectic menu. It's the old Joe's crab shack building near lvac. Katie was a great server , and the servers wear Pajamas lol

lvQH2CQgN8vCwse14OXW2Q.text: The overall ambience is great. Although when we arrive on a Sunday morning there were many used tables unattended. But there were many server that day but it was sort of unorganized. I was excited about the order of country fried steak but then when I saw how small the serving were I was very dissappointed and  it was dry and too much peppers. The next few orders came the same way. I wouldnt waste my money here again..left hungry and disapointed but spent almost $100!

O2HQwpkmaiu2We3MplkWpA.text: We went to the W. Flamingo location for our first visit.  We had no idea what the Pot of bread was, our server explained it but since we had a lot of food coming he said he could box it up for us to take home.    I ordered the steak & eggs(ribeye, yum). Medium rare, over easy eggs. It came out perfect! Nice red center, juicy steak. Eggs were exactly how I wanted and the hash browns were nice and crispy. I usually never get steak and eggs but so glad I did.    My husband got the ham & eggs (eggs sunnyside up) and this too was great. Nice portion of the ham steak.    Our adult son got the Bananas Foster waffle and a side of crispy bacon. Usually when a place says you get ice cream with your waffle it is a little scoop. Not here! A HUGE scoop of ice cream and some whipped cream topped the bananas foster waffle.  He said the orange zest was a nice touch too. Nice crisp waffle. And he was really pleased with the crispy bacon; all you have to do is ask.  Our server was fantastic, came by numerous times for coffee and water refills and to see if we needed anything. When he brought our check he brought our boxed up Pot of Bread (still smoking hot). We will be back to try other things on the menu.

nd_4ztvdqJIjM5p3_5DUcQ.text: I have been here before so I decide to return for lunch. The place had a few tables sat and wasn't that busy. The food took longer than it should have and my guest ordered chicken fingers and was charged for ranch. My burger was plain, no lettuce, tomato, just the cheese and bacon I ordered on it. To many other places to go in Vegas for better food sand service.

lWY7SjTBGuk9YxP0z20wLQ.text: Walk in prior to going to the gym and ask the lady at the front if I can make reservation. Told me that they don't make reservation in advance and I have to be there physically which I totally understand. I then asked if I can call to be put on a waiting list right before Im about to finish my work out. The lady said yes. No problem so far.   I called the place 50mins later and ask to be put down on the waiting list and manager denied me. I told manager that I have came in prior and lady at the front told me that I can call in advance. Manager asked me who I've spoke with and basically denied my request because I couldn't gave her a name. I'm not trying to be difficult, simply want to put my name down on the waiting list like everyone else and I was finishing up at the gym which is 5 mins away from the facility. If a staff don't introduce their names to me at the front, I'm not going to be like:"what's your name?" Either training your staffs better or honor what they've told to the customer!! Failed management. One star for being so accommodating! Way to go to lose your new customers. I'd be sure to tell all my friends and family not to go here.

h-5NY5Ef_DMefIvHFtXe2A.text: 1 hour wait ridiculous and their was plenty of table to sit . No good for me going for the first time I really wanted to try it for the first time, but no!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One hour wait and plenty of tables to sit!
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1:30 wait ridiculous! What a bad business!

B-O8O5DTwJXR0NKMtet0Ow.text: The food was amazing. Try the corn beef hash..banana foster waffle.. chicken and waffle... Smoked Salmon Benedict.. Everything was beyond expectations. Our server Ashley was perfect. This place is a gem.

zviAE80E5rA__DlN4MAIgA.text: Belgian waffle smells like heaven!! Little wait but oh so worth it!!! Everything tastes so good & such big portions!! Love this spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just a cheese omelet please!
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict!!
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffles!!!

TPguCXLr7X9BwZyWZlGg-g.text: Yummy yummy yummy!!!! Amazing Fresh squeezed juice! I had watermelon & strawberry! Had the Steak &spinach Benedict and I came in hungry and left very satisfied. My friend had the banana frosted pancakes.... Amazing as well! Didn't need syrup (but comes warm with cinnamon sticks in it) they were moist and delicious! French press coffee was outstanding! So glad they opened here in Sprig valley so I can come more often!!!!! I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oreo Butterscotch Pancakes! Bigger than my son! They were amazing!
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Press!
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0iHxzQZb0kEKi4FPRC6yJQ.text: First time going , shitty service and was scared to go back 2nd time going back all the employees just looked at us like they where stupid took us 20 mins of standing when it wasnt busy and still didn't get a seat ... WE ENEDED UP WALKING OUT THE DOOR SINCE WE GOT NO HELP OR SEAT  Wouldnt recommend this place to anyone until they change employees and staff and focus on there job !!!

3V4sWnnSgZ_kgjwk4GK2Vw.text: Ate breakfast today at the Grand Opening of the West Flamingo store with my wife we were told we were the second paying customers...some what of an honor.  The place is very roomy plenty of tables and booths, the decor is nice there are parasols of various colors hanging from the ceilings a very nice look. The menu had numerous selections for breakfast, steaks, ham steaks, chicken fried steaks, rib eye steaks, omletes, traditional bacon and eggs.  We had the rib eye and eggs, comes with hash browns and toast however they have an item called "bread in the pot" it's a small hot cinnamon roll in a small cup with butter it was hot and delicious.  Our servings were nice large portions with 3 eggs.  My wife who is a coffee lover, said that their coffee was Outstanding.  They offer French Pressed Coffee too, somewhat of a nice different approach and they have a juice bar and all the juices are made right at the bar...the juice bar also makes smoothies to order.    Breakfast is breakfast... there are numerous places to eat in this area, I would highly recommend try this one and compare to the others, this will be on the top of your list. The staff was very friendly and very attentive to our needs and well versed on all the items on the menu.  They also serve a lunch and have a very appealing lunch menu, I'm looking forward to trying it out.

fFzDTtqtAo3RsUw7cXxA-Q.text: The wait staff are dressed in pajamas which is so fun. The decorations are unique and colorful with upside down umbrellas on ceiling. I'm not a big fan of sweets but you must try the pot of bread which is a cinnamon roll in a cup. It's freshly made, warm and so delicious! The best cinnamon roll I've had. They have a large variety of breakfast choices in their menu and the portions are large. They also have freshly squeezed juices and smoothies. Overall I was very satisfied and will definitely go back.

2npt64OBFXHRbbZWJSU_Bg.text: So this location just opened around the corner from my house. Being a breakfast lover I had to check it out. Still in the soft opening phase but things were running fairly well. I got my breakfast, side of fruit and toast in 3 separate deliveries for example. Not too much delay and the food came out hot so not a big deal. One minor snafu as I asked for no onions and had to send it back. Normally that would annoy me but the waitress was sweet and understanding about it and I got a new omelet quick. May not sound like it bit I felt the service was good and will only improve.  So the food. I ordered the fancy steak omelet and it was delicious. Steak was perfectly medium rare and the omelet was well prepared. Side of bernaise sauce was delicious and a great compliment. Lots of fruit as a side and the hash browns have great flavor. One pet peeve I have to mention. I hate when places don't butter your toast! Haha silly to some but I want it buttered right out of the toaster so it melts into the toast. Being that this was my only.comolaint about the food though, I highly recommend this spot and look forward to going back.

_GIWw1EjDRL8m6hcdYNOrg.text: Loved this place! Food was great, large enough to take home and have again! Waitress was terrific and kept my coffee filled many times.  My only caveat is pricing.  Expect a $30 to $40 bill for 2 if you get one of the many special breakfasts. Still, Ribeye and eggs is a great day starter.  We will be back.

ZYW9G9q_YTdE_y5fQfw6hg.text: Gorgeous day for some breakfast outside! Steak benedict and biscuits and gravy were on point!  Poached eggs were over cooked but easy to overlook since everything else tasted so amazing! I'll definitely be a frequent flyer here!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak benedict and biscuits and gravy outside on a gorgeous day!  Heaven!

G6ihOBLdcX00dW-3JslPEg.text: Awesome food! We tried the chicken and waffles, biscuits and gravy, and just normal egg plate. The hash browns were out of this world and the staff was so friendly!

9N_U1G9srnkCltS7OK4n4Q.text: We wanted to try this place out badly and were told the wait was 25-30 minutes. They ended up running behind, which is totally understandable on a busy Saturday. I have always worked in food service and I'm very understanding about these things.   After 45 minutes, we checked on the status. The hostess said there was one group ahead of us and she would come outside and call. They weren't calling anyone, we saw her come outside maybe once.   Finally, after an hour, I went back in. Our name was crossed off and the hostess tried to tell me that that wasn't us, it was a different party. Funny though, that's where I remember her writing us down and our name wasn't anywhere else on the list.   She did not apologize or own up to their mistake, and this is what bothers me the most. I wasn't angry about the situation until she did that, if she had apologized and owned up to their error I would have happily accepted the table that they rushed to set up for us.  Instead, we left. I will never eat here on the basis of that alone, as clearly the staff isn't trained with good customer service skills and would sooner lie to a guest than remedy the situation appropriately.

-Czcx8Dc9LKgoqla6mByrg.text: Nice and big place, lots of tables, especially if they're using the patio. We sat outside and it was lovely. I had "Rise and Shine Chilaquilles" which was like breakfast nachos and AWESOME. My over-easy eggs sat on a pile of tortilla chips soaked in ranchero sauce with refried beans, cheddar and cotija. I'm already planning a return trip to eat it again. My friend had "The Ultimate Steak and Egg Breakfast" with a big ribeye cooked perfectly, two eggs and hashbrowns. We both had the "Pot of Bread" which was an ok cinnamon roll. The icing served on the side was the best part. We also shared a French press of coffee, which was delicious.  Not so great: the hollandaise was way too buttery.  It's not a classic hollandaise. (We got a side of it to try).  I asked about the bearnaise (served with "Fancy Breakfast Omelette"), but according to the server it doesn't have much tarragon in it, which is the essential ingredient in a classic bearnaise.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu from website

pFw_0VeZjRf1ZA7iqc2yzA.text: I ordered the Rib Eye. It was cooked to perfection! The pot if bread is delicious. The cream cheese dipping complements the pot of bread perfectly. The hasbrown is fresh and crispy. Coffee is strong just as I want it. Tyler, the chef - family owner, is very knowledgeable and friendly. Jerry, my server, is great. Will definitely be back with my family.

LnyQ34xHu_ILfIctgguBgw.text: On the menu  2  Ultimate steak and egg breakfast plates.  Not enough can be said for good food but poor service Puts a damper on the whole experience.  The steak was juicy and tender, right do beds Hash brown  potatoes average...need seasoning  Eggs cooked fine  Coffee cold and lacked strength  Waited for creamer...never came Waited for toast. ....never came  Waited for apology...never came  We won't be back...other surrounding options better.. we came 20 miles away from Vegas based on reviews Never Again.

GdEqTvvOymH2liDqCBah6A.text: I went here for my birthday and it was maybe the 4th time we had been there. It was nice as usual. The only downfall I would say is paying $5 for a glass of orange juice. The "cup of bread" is delicious. I usually get the chicken, avo, spinach egg white omelette. It is usually very good, but the last few times the avocado was hard and tasted weird. It might just be out of season. Otherwise, this is a great place to eat breakfast!

gRNbMi1Te7j5aMk31K6kDA.text: First time here. Service was good but food was just okay, nothing really special. I ordered their ultimate steak something (medium well) and it has a burnt taste. Latte wasn't good, Sambalatte is way better. Waffle was burnt too! Wouldn't mind giving this place a second chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rise and Shine at West Flamingo :)

1_VvE6p7eqAM2LNnCKsltQ.text: Great staff, always nice and polite. Even if they're busy they acknowledge you and bring you the food fast. Been to the Southern Highlands location and they're both always consistent with their menu and service. Highly recommend this place.

lz3x42GAMgChlz11jpvJ4Q.text: Just moved to the area looking for some bomb breakfast and boy this place didn't disappoint!! Big portions and quick service.  Stacy was on point she recommended the steak chiliquiles which was amazing.  Can't wait to come back again

oPRV6TecOpZJWCQFH_7YEQ.text: Om nom nom nom nom. more please! nom nom nom nom nom nom.  Edit: 4/10/15 (9:14PM)  Upgraded my ranking. It's currently 9:14PM and I'm still thinking about that bacon.  -----------------------------------------------  1. Environment: The environment is wonderful and pretty. Very roomy and spacious with a great outdoor area with pretty flowers in the ceiling. Great for brunches and breakfast dates.   2. Service: Since I tried this place during it's "soft opening" I don't think it would be fair for me to give an evaluation on it yet. But the staff was knowledgeable of the menu and gave me a great recommendation.  3. Food: O M G! I know Rise & Shine is a Steak & Egg Place but for someone that's on food rehab you can't always indulge in pancake and eggs.  The item I ordered was the Salad (with bacon, avocado, and chicken) and it was *aaaammmmmmzing* I mean, a salad is a salad, but their ingredients are fresh and the bacon is to-die-for; perfectly crispy, not too greasy, oh so nummy, f*** food rehab. Everything else in the salad was good, dressing was a bit tangy for my taste but THAT BACON!

Ej812r3PM36rygmOjGwZRw.text: Wow!!!!  Huge pancakes!!  Make sure you realize that the pancakes are HUGE. You can put in a half order, or maybe share. Great food. Great service!!!  Loved our server, Amberly!

Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z7Fx2Ke6SmPE_wQ9HzxZcw.text: Very very good food, large portions. Calming atmosphere, kind of like a country breakfast feeling. They have a delicious s'mores waffle. Huge chicken and waffles.  Mean manager lady..

PTIfBk6jjK7gfpVP-qWoUg.text: Excellent breakfast. My husband, son, and I went on a Saturday morning around 7:30. We were seated immediately, our waiter was at our table within 30 seconds and we had our drinks within a couple of minutes. My son ordered the apple juice. Our waiter commented that they had a juice bar. I dismissed it, thinking that's what they called their concentrated juice machine in the back. My son said the juice was really good, so my husband ordered a carafe of orange juice with two glasses. I told him no thanks as I can't stand sugary restaurant OJ...but when the waiter said they had a juice bar (which actually was visible, but my head was buried in the menu) he meant it. I would come back here just for the juice. It was amazing! My son ordered the Ribeye and eggs, my husband ordered the country fried steak, and I got the chicken and waffles. The chicken and waffles were delicious - chicken crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside and just enough peppery seasoning, waffle perfectly cooked, tasted great with the syrup on top. I tried my husband's country fried steak, and it was delicious, the gravy wasn't too thick or too thin, just right, and tons of flavor.  My son refused to share his, so there you go. Our server was attentive and friendly, in fact the entire staff was friendly. So nice to see a place that tries hard to keep our business. We will definitely be back.

tP01hIsw8T8cUNMZSkeHZg.text: After a nice morning hike at red rock, this place was perfect to satiate my hunger. One word, CHILAQUILES! Its perfectly made, not too soggy with the perfect amount of avocado, sour cream, salsa and two types of cholula hot sauces to choose from. The upside down umbrellas remind me of being under the weather but their food (chilaquiles) makes everything better.

Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

unO3WhECSSnzBfyNN1X19A.text: It's an old Joe's Crab Shack building turned into a very cute and cozy colorful farm style restaurant. Feels warm and inviting coming in. Staff are great and very attentive. Food was delicious and servings are generous. We all left with full bellies! I had chilequilles , very tasty and filling! My son had the Philly cheesesteak omelette, yummy!!!

mbja8Hq4SKKmkV7Ro-5QZQ.text: Soooo good! Come here on the weekends typically and the service is always great. I have has some so/so meals but the servers have always been so nice and accommodating.

dtUGycrzt_0KTpCLIIuI3w.text: Hands down one of my favorite breakfast spots! The orange juice is the most delicious juice I've ever had. Service is great! And food is always hot and spot on. If something isn't right they will fix it without hassle. I had Samantha as my waitress one on visit and another lovely lady( I don't remember her name) but she had short black hair and tattoos. Both were very accommodating and patient as I was traveling with an elderly who can be difficult and a large party

WXTdMv2y9Xuj_T5OYxpSfw.text: This place is ok...service was on point... but food sucked.... pure fat...yuck yuck yuck... I can't believe they gave me PACE for salsa... even blueberry hill has real salsa....

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pIvGDvx6vQAZ5MaFu-jl0g.text: Anytime we go on vacay our rule is to not eat anywhere we have at home. This place was super yummy. I had the Chiliquiles which was out of this world good. My daughter had the pancakes which were OMG SO DELICIOUS!!! When ever you are in Vegas you really need to try this place.

A_-pOMNe69UigrHzl7n_Ug.text: Decent food a little over priced $50 for breakfast seems steep to me for a breakfast  burrito French toast and 2 glasses of Oj

IGrPbxeiJy2EVgI4GrT8Eg.text: Great place! We have lived around the corner from this place for years and finally came in. Amberly was our server. She was awesome, very nice and attentive. We ordered the 3 little pigs two fisted bagel sandwich and the Chicken and waffles. It was all delicious. The chicken was moist and perfectly seasoned, hash browns were great and the sandwich was humongous! We will be back!

BWreDHcCh0AS1XINgTwj1Q.text: This was the best steak and eggs I ever had. Service was also great, provided with very friendly staff.

kikywbv8ywjiSmQQKcR-CA.text: The food was outstanding some of the best in all of Las Vegas. I had steak and eggs everything was cooked perfect. My wife had the philly cheese steak breakfast bagel. Her words "this is the best bagel breakfast sandwich I have ever had". If there is one thing they could improve on would be the service it was a little slow and not as helpful as you would hope for with it being our first time there. But I am going back a few more times it might be my Sunday morning spot. Highly recommend!! They only thing that would make this place any better is if they had flavored cream, like French vanilla etc, for coffee.

LHL2XPsrU0Io0u7l8K_igg.text: Our server Samantha was very nice and personable. They have a variety of hot teas, fresh juice bar, and the essential coffee and sodas. The steak to my surprise was perfectly cooked! Too often I walk into a breakfast place and get over cooked obviously frozen steaks so I was excited to see the quality of the product was worth what I paid for it. Definitely will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cup of bread was delicious!!!!
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OoZ0bwB6WHZWA_U2UgidSg.text: Crazy good food..... MeMe had Steak and eggs which were cooked to perfection! I had Eggs and Bangor sausages.... Yum yum!!!! Everything was perfect!!!!!

o69S51puR4tu-BdqeA11gg.text: This was our last meal in Vegas and we spent the least amount of money and had the best quality for the amount we got.  Chicken and waffles were the best ever you have to try them. The chicken is dredged in a crunchy coating, moist inside and topped with cinnamon infused syrup. Husband ate the chicken fried steak large portions and legit chicken fried steak. They put the gravy in 2 cups on the side so you can add as much or as little as you want. Sister ordered the rib eye steak which was moist flavorful and melt in your mouth. Ambiance was nice and wait staff wears pajamas and are tentative to your needs. This is the place to have breakfast in Las Vegas.

lHz40Ou8J-VVVfp0M-26aQ.text: 3.5. Big portions, delicious breakfast bagel sandwich, friendly service, and didn't get crazy busy. Food came out a bit slowly, but it wasn't unbearable. Was a tiny bit annoyed that my sandwich came with potatoes instead of french fries as listed on the menu; otherwise I might've rounded up.

hBPVY0KUPKDOXReHeHUH9Q.text: Let's just say that I drove 30 minutes to get here and it was worth every bite. Everything about tho solace was wonderful. Great servers & great food. I really recommend the orange juice! My steak was cooked perfectly and wow the pancakes were just the best way to end my meal. Left so full, but so satisfied
