gQrIgk9cFE3DVm8qNy4Afg.text: great breakfast! you get a lot for your money! our server was a little english woman (sorry forgot her name) but she was so lovely and provided exceptional service!

vThnDr0uJ-9-bVzqakjCaQ.text: First-timer! The restaurant is super cozy, cabin-like, spacious (so the wait is no longer than 20min at the most) perfect for big parties. The decor is sleepwear! The servers all wear pjs! So it's definitely a casual, cozy non-pretentious atmosphere. Perfect place to have a comfortable, relaxing breakfast, especially on the weekend. We decided to split 2 entrees since their portions are huge! The menu is extensive! You will want it all. They have everything from freshly squeezed/pressed juices, smoothies, to your choice of coffee, espressos, lattes, (they serve LAVAZZA coffee) yes please!  I ordered the "Go-Go" Green juice. (Kale & cucumber) it was perfection! Super refreshing!  On to food, we split the  Egg White - Avocado - Steak omelet: Amazing. Steak was cooked and seasoned perfectly, sliced on top, along with avocado slices.  Belgian Waffle w/strawberries: Came with whipped butter on the side and a cinnamon, butter, maple syrup.   Everything was great. Service was friendly and efficient! I will definitely be returning!

RUl63WKuGZ55zT2gwSeWNQ.text: The food was good. The restaurant was too dark. I need to see at morning breakfast place. It felt dirty. My son and his family love the place. I won't go back

rXkOJ78RXv9v3eqYikyyMw.text: Service was slow, food wasnt hot, hashbrowns were not hashbrown, biscuit and gravy out of a can, and the omelet no flavor, most likely will not be cominv back....sad.

KPMHIh9Y3WEXOzP9AptG3g.text: The food is delicious.  BUT. It's also very pricey and the serving sizes are super small for the kids plates. For a family of 4, 2 adult and 2 kids, it's an over $50 bill just for some breakfast. I'd rather go to Blueberry Hill that's also delicious, yet affordable (a $30 bill), and the portion sizes are better.  This place nickel and dimes you for everything, they charged $1 for a small side of ranch.  So while the food is incredibly tasty, it's just not worth it for the price. We won't be back anytime soon. 4 stars for taste 2 for price.

NQ6GgSqUnrA2cBgvbWekdQ.text: Amazing food. Fair prices. All around awesome. Make sure you get a pot of bread, they are to die for! This is one of my breakfast favorites. When in doubt get something from the steak and eggs category they are all solid. My only complaint is that they are always busy, but they have been pretty timely everytime I have been here.

SIQEaSyJOYYUll0Bs8igbw.text: I am huge fan of Rise & Shine southern highland location. I'm super excited that this location opened up! Not only is this place closer, but their menu is larger! a different menu item is their Loco moco. it was pretty good! they were extremely busy with a long wait, but like the other location, customer service is always on par. they also have more fresh fruit juices at this location, too. will for sure be back soon!

yf45U7ZZOUHts0GKzODQTw.text: Bf and I decided to try the newest breakfast spot in our neighborhood on Memorial Day.  When we arrived the wait was 45 minutes, but were pleasantly surprised when they called our name in only 25 minutes.   The decor is cute!  Food servers in jammies...clever!   The pot of bread was unique...a cinnamon roll baked in a small coffee cup with a side of butter and cream cheese glaze.  Mine came out hot of the oven, so of course it went down the hatch with no trouble.  Omelet and potatoes were also tasty.  The food was a bit slow in getting to the table after we ordered, but our server was very friendly and attentive.   I dont know if the food stands out from all the other breakfast places, but its just as good.

dtb3OBkCjcv6_nufHnfiWQ.text: Food was fresh and came out right....service was excellent everyone in the party enjoyed!

uHSFwM6kPQp77h-iUKesmQ.text: Being a breakfast lover at anytime of the day, I was happy to see that they serve it all day long.  We waited (four of us) for about 20 minutes (arrived at 1:15 on Memorial Day) and ended up at an outside (non covered) table.  Thank goodness the desert heat hadn't started yet and the clouds from Mt.Charleston were drifting over us as this would not have been acceptable.  In fact..for Las Vegas..you can have outdoor dining but it really should be 100% covered.  The hostess took our drink orders and served them promptly, but had to wait too long to place our order.  But the reason why I didn't give this place a 5* rating was because it took so long to get our 3 (2 adult and 1 child) meals!  Way.  Too.  Long.  It took almost 45 minutes!  Plus, I had to ask the hostess for water and coffee refill at which she quickly (the only speedy part) did and felt bad about our wait time and comped us 2 more apple juices for the kids.    The food finally arrived and all very good: Buffalo style chicken breast and eggs, build your own omelette and silver dollar pancakes for the kids.  In fact..all the food was so tasty and plentiful..but the wait was too much (albeit nothing arrived cold).

GXYuVzZbAqA8xRt_svImjA.text: Hands down the best breakfast menu steak I have ever had "Spice-Rubbed Ribeye Steak Chilaquiles". If you like a good rub on your steak, this is a must try. Just the right amount of marbling to give the ribeye a great flavor. It compared to some dinner menu ribeye steaks at some fine dining restaurants I've dined at.  The chips were a little salty for my liking, but still delicious! My girlfriend had the Southern Style Chicken Fried NY Steak, which she enjoyed also. The house coffee had a nice fresh taste also. There were several healthier menu options we will try on the next visit.

QTarsXORVUVvPo885MO5hQ.text: Great food!!! We went for breakfast on a Sunday morning. Did not have to wait for a seat, even though it was busy. My husband ordered the chicken fried steak and I had the biscuits and gravy. Everything was good. The steak was easy to cut with a fork and had just a little spice to give it a great flavor. The biscuits and gravy also good, but barely ate them as we shared the chicken fried steak because it was a huge portion. Also recommend trying the pot of bread, super yummy with warm cream cheese frosting.

dgwUya0zJZcUf86GZYgT9w.text: My family and I came to Rise and Shine for lunch today.  After a 30 minute wait, we waited an a additional 45 minutes to receive our meal. During this time the waitress never came by to check on us or refill our drinks. When she finally came back, she admitted that she forgot to put our order in. The manager came over to apologize and offer to discount our meal.  However, when we received the bill nothing was taken off. The food there is okay, but the customer service is horrendous.

7-jWBWSxzTEzG9okLhg0Mg.text: Delicious food. Good variations on standard breakfast items and the waitresses are attentive and friendly.  The one big issue I saw (and one that almost had us walking out in the first 5 minutes) was the young blonde hostess. What a disaster. We get there with children in tow at 10am on a Friday morning (not even a weekend) and we were immediately greeted by someone who seemed frazzled and a bit stand-offish when asked the wait time by saying "I know that I have a ton of tables open but I don't want to slam the kitchen so I need you to wait up here for 10-15 minutes". You clearly had the staff and the tables free yet she was ill-equipped either by training or lack of common sense to seat us immediately. Then she begrudgingly seats us and then asks if we need a booster seat. We say yes and she says "Can you wait here at the table and I will be back in a few minutes as I need to cash these people(who just walked up) out". So I got my own damn booster seat and we sat down instead of waiting for her to bring us one from across the restaurant. A horrible impression.  The young lady is not hostess material and she certainly is not a good first line for your restaurant. She is better suited for the tanning place next door.  The food was great. I had the Salmon Benedict and everything was very tasty. Our waitress was very attentive and pleasant. Overall a good experience until we go to pay the check. The hostess asks if we want to add a tip electronically and we say yes and the amount and then she prints us out a bill with $0 added to the tip. Again, might be a serious lack of training or she might not be a good fit but the coming and leaving from your restaurant was unpleasant at best.

bR0UrzWfzdzi4FN5VBYaLA.text: Best breakfast place in town hands down..Christy the bomb and so nice! Get them eggs country scrambled yeah man.

Zcsn4eisl9AWW2ekrAu0Tw.text: Perfect friendly place for families!  Only no changing tables, but it's made up by the friendly staff!  Thanks Tyler for your awesome service!

FwJJ1xx4Zw0C6hsEoiwGBA.text: This was my second time coming here. Both times we had to wait over a half hour to get seated. Wouldn't be that big of a deal, but there were plenty of tables available. Seams understaffed and not managed very well. The first time, we got our food fairly quick and it was very good. The second time the food was also good, but we waited over 45 minutes to get our food. I would give the food 4-5 stars, but the unnecessary wait will probably keep us from coming back. Shouldn't take an hour and a half to eat lunch.

bAWNO0x_Rg29h8oZvRj0fA.text: My wife and I arrived early on Saturday morning and were promptly seated. We ordered coffe with nutella and were brought a small shot of chocolate syrup not nutella. I tried the corned beef hash which tasted metallic, probably from a can.  We also tried the "pot of bread." It was in a double espresso cup, not a pot,  and undercooked. The toast slices were very small and the bacon grease was not drained properly. The coffee and eggs were very good. Probably will not return. There are too many problems to fix including menu issues.

gTk7xgOIAEcCaIU69bPn8Q.text: Kaysea told me about this location when we were both in line at Starbucks yesterday, she is an amazing person. I ordered the spice rubbed rib eye chilaquiles, the flavor was amazing and I got a colorful mixture. The squeezed orange juice was great. The waitresses and all the staff had the place going like clockwork, things ran smoothly from what I observed. I recommend this place for sure. One small thing, I must have misunderstood the menu; for I had three squeezed orange juices and I didn't see anything about being charged each time for an orange juice.

5Ai9Dfi2tjH-zHEuKKCAWg.text: After having breakfast one day I returned for lunch the following day. My waitstaff were outstanding, the decor was interesting, and the food was good.  Although there is a complete breakfast menu, the lunch menu is very limited.  I would highly recommend the Rise and Shine for breakfast but suggest selecting a different restaurant for lunch.

UoY_FM0qsLn6zMEKPKJpGw.text: This place is amazing! Food is great, proportions are huge, service is excellent! I can't say enough good things! The fresh squeezed OJ will make you reconsider everything you have ever thought you knew about juice.

qC8T2ElmIVi0YVNthpoRYg.text: Well we thought we would try again.  This time we went on a Thursday morning and were seated right away.  We had to wait forever (with our two small grandchildren) for Tyler to take our order.  He was very laid back and is in no hurry to do anything.  The food came out cold.  Won't be back.

_xW6q-_w3B56Pdl-UAMVaQ.text: I've been here about three times and each time has been different. The food taste and quality is inconsistent and the wait is pretty long usually. The last time I went, it seemed like they didn't have enough tables to fill the dining space, thus slower turnaround.

TyTKqyNj-VNBZtKYSUWRgw.text: Eggs were fine. Biscuits and gravy not so great. I'm pretty sure the bottom of the biscuits were concrete. Could not cut the biscuit bottoms with a fork. My wife enjoyed her steak and eggs but I won't go back.

R3dgJAZGbItxfURK0RuP8g.text: The ribeye steak was tender and flavorful in the ultimate breakfast!  The watermelon and strawberry juice was bland and overpriced.  The waitress was average and the wait was long. I give the restaurant a three because it's just average.  I could take it or leave it on coming back again.

T4raFItDb5DJ43WvpC88yQ.text: This place is amazing! Came in at 10 for 20 min wait but was well worth it. Got the fancy omelet, mushrooms steak cheddar cheese and spinach added with hashbrowns on the side. So filling! I also tried the pot of bread, which is actually a mini cinnamon roll baked in a tiny teacup with icing on the side. Very tasty! I may just have to make this my regular breakfast joint. These guys are better than bluebery hill! Will totally be back~

W7j5-L9RUsgZ6wtD0VUUpw.text: This place is the CUTEST! i love the umbrella decor on the ceiling. Drove pass this place on my way to bite one sunday and had to look it up on yelp! after reading reviews of my fellow yelpers i decided to check it out. the decor is cute the servers are all in pajamas. They have a lovely looking patio area which would be great when it starts warming up out. The inside is huge plenty of seating. The menu has some basic breakfast and sandwiches options. as well as some custom stuff. I recommend the buffalo fried chicken. The bread in a pot is delicious so soft and fluffy not overwhelmingly sweet. The service is alright they don't seem to like when you say you are sharing items though and you have to constantly remind them for little things like sugar, utensils, and creamer.

VWI6TL1uVHs4vUBHNoUuaA.text: I love the food at this place but the only bad thing I would have to say about this place is I found two hairs in my omelette and a hair in my potatoes!!!!

oSRGHHoY3BXxC5kyYcBXXQ.text: This is my first time here......super busy on the weekends. Staff was super friendly and offered some good healthy choices. My wife and I sat at the bar and had a wonderful time

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FR4efk5mfAa-Pne3FzG6TA.text: Holy cow, what a great place. The servers where pj's, what could be better then that. I love all the food I have tried. Only thing I can say is go hungry, and have the pancakes, you get 2 platter size pancakes with cinnamon maple syrup.  Yum!

2RMATbDLF9mzAl4ANdh20A.text: Mediocre at best. Portions were good size, however the food was borderline flavorless. Great atmosphere, but lacking good service. We had 3 different servers, every time we asked for something a different person showed up. We had to ask for things multiple times before actually getting what was supposed to have with our meal. The only positive thing I can say is the French press coffee was amazing. We won't be back.... EVER

kgb9FHFOqlWKx5LdbvDxaw.text: Good was amazing especially the philly cheese steak and egg breakfast and the smores waffle. Yummy! Service was great, never had to wait too long for anything. Would definitely come back again.

lAkN6uKqoS0FqitNzUeuRw.text: Went there today with my bestfriend around 1:30p and the place is pretty much empty about 3 to 4 table is filled with customer.  We come in and greeted by the hostess and we requested booth, she says all the booths are dirty right now we will get it cleaned, it took about good 10 to 15 mins wait, even all the booths are clean and one is dirty. I stood up waiting from the waiting area and this server Sarah came up to me, all the booths are still dirty and I will clean them up with the attitude and negative vibe I got for her. Next thing u know she went back to the back to get a rag that took her a while as well. Me and my BFF went to the table that she said she had cleaned, but it's still pretty wet when we had seated. I ask her a napkin so I can wipe the table off and she had took few steps ignoring my request and turned around and said ok. My BFF can already tell tht I am not happy with the customer service In this place, so she had went up to the customer and told her the story. While my friend is talking to the hostess, I had gathered our stuff went to the counter as well. We are pretty disappointed with the server "SARAH", because she was very rude and not an inch of customer service skills she had. While talking to the hostess and Madison (manager) the server still yapping at the back of course prolly about us. I had a good experience here at the first visit my sister brought me there. I had brought my BFF there so she can try the place, but after that experience with that server "SARAH", I feel disgusted and just lost my appetite. Thank you for the manager Madison for handling the situation very well, but I hope u guys talk to SARAH on how she can improve her customer service skills. Goodluck!

KZyEOc6g_INtz3ivX-1Syw.text: Always good and consistent. Staff is incredibly friendly, there's never any wait because the place is so large. Definitely one of my favorite for breakfast joints. Special thanks to amberlee (not sure of spelling) for the amazing service! Definitely would recommend and definitely will becoming back

bbABOYljgq2yLZn-wNhJmQ.text: This is easily one of our favorite places to have breakfast.  Meat lovers will enjoy the ribeye steak and eggs plate, I sure did!!!  Also had a huge Belgian waffle with cinnamon syrup and whipped butter, delicious!!  Very friendly and fun atmosphere.  Highly recommend this place!

NmFciGjXhM8tWUlnKUmH0Q.text: my boyfriend and I are always trying new breakfast spots around town. I work by this location and I've always seen it driving by so we decided to go this morning. The wait was about 15 minutes as promised. the house was packed so I was thinking this must be a really good spot. We asked what our waitress recommended (which by the way was wearing PJs, how FUN!) for us first timers and she recommended the ultimate ribeye breakfast and a side of pancakes for us both to share. We ended up ordering just that but the red velvet pancakes. OMG. The red velvet pancakes are to DIE for. Chocolate overload. And the ribeye was cooked to perfection . Our over easy eggs were perfectly runny and the potatoes had so much flavor. A new favorite for sure. We will be back soon, maybe even next weekend

dfMPqOyUojwciBQXUjoFjQ.text: I've been here several times.  It is a solid breakfast place.  My favorite is the smoked salmon benedict.  It is SO good!  The pot of bread is good and it just looks really cool.  The staff is always friendly.  We try to go early - not too hard when the little ones wake us up at 6:00 a.m. - because it gets busy and there can be quite a wait.

gu1wlS8qCGoM1nHN1cJ3NQ.text: Always great service and the banana foster waffle is AMAZING! This is officially our family breakfast stop! Love it!

XDSklK-nGjrfsLVxkS8mpQ.text: Krys is awesome! She was a very attentive server and the food was great!!!!!!! I got a waffle and it was so fluffy I could die!

MEFzVIM7AHgyU-vPnFLovw.text: it is a little bit on the pricey side.. We had 3 orange juices and a coffee, and we were at the 20$ mark already... fresh squeezed sure.. .. just unexpected.  We brought our dogs.. we had to ask for water.. there is no doggie menu, and the waitress offered us to order a side of bacon for the dogs.. 4 strips.. $5? no thanks.   I had the 3 pigs bagel sandwich. The bagel was grilled (good) but it was still relatively cold when you bit into it, and then the grilled side really wasn't toasted that much, so it was soggy with a little grease and cold.. I was disappointed. :( I also wasn't asked how I would have liked my eggs? Is that odd?   Everything else was ok.. just wished I went somewhere else ....

BbsnVc_v5mu6W45lbZZvzA.text: Mmmmmm bomb. Had the bacon egg in a hole French toast. So good. Also had the green go go juice I liked that as well.

vqtkSL0eeOcvJAKHfUOMjA.text: First time impressions: I became a bit worried about the wait at first, but quickly forgot about it. Rise and Shine delivers on the food quality and variety. What other places offer a french press on your table for your morning brew? The ultimate rib eye breakfast came with a steak that hit the grill with just the right amount of char and pink. Prices are reasonable. I forgot what my one complaint was...

PxYhSoZpQBb8M4k7W2fo9w.text: I really wanted a hamsteak and Rise & Shine had it on their online menu. Me and my wife came here and this is the best breakfast we have had in a long time. Our server Amberly was the best. I ordered my hamsteak with a side of hollandaise sauce and sunny side up eggs. It was amazing. Definitely coming back.

KL5Rn_AMQ2gbDOOspIPo5w.text: I have to say I went here a while ago and I loved the service, food and quality! But now it was a Monday morning and we waited for a table when the place was empty plus our server was MIA most of the time and the wait from ordering to receiving food was atrocious! I want to give them another shot but this was just all kinds of bad. Our server wasn't attentive and kept running back and forth to try to get our items. I'm disappointed in the service.

mpSHdScUKBaJyCiNqi1Zgg.text: Let me start off by saying I'm not much of a morning person but when I am up in time for breakfast I take the opportunity to try a new place. Rise and Shine is a really cute place. The employee's wear pj's as their uniform which I think is super comfy why not. The food is delicious and the service was wonderful. I'll be back again.

0e91LkoDYvW2bA6QZ5P53A.text: Wow! Love this place! Amazing food, I had the New York Benedict Bagel and the eggs were perfect.  My husband had the melt-in-your-mouth ribeye. Every detail is there down to the Cinnamon sticks in the Maple syrup. And the service? Home away from home. Laid-back Christmas morning at Grandma's kinda breakfast. Our server was so fun! We can't wait to bring our kids to Rise-and-Shine (a.k.a. Nicole's place) to meet the family and enjoy a good food coma. Don't miss this place!!!

p0d-F1HkjjCN9xcbZKFB0g.text: We can't say more good about this place!  Family owned and operated and Nicole made us feel just like family. Fun conversation and food that was oh, so good.  The cup-o-bread is amazing only to be trumped by the cinnamon crusted French toast. Our time there was like being at home with the cool cousins you haven't seen in years. I won't miss this place anytime I'm in town!!

1WibJcWvJTLUPhSWF1_30g.text: My son's steak was 1/3 fat which the manager called a "fat cap" (no fat cap should be 1/3 of a steak)she offered to bring him another one and take his meal off of the bill, what she failed to mention was charging me for another steak which was more than my son's first meal. In Las Vegas you have to have better customer service if you're going to change that much for mediocre food.

LotiFZ-MYX-VarfOODvYng.text: Wow , long wait but worth it  Great Steak and eggs , great Corned beef hash and eggs and  The Biscuits and Gravy are the BEST I've ever had , ever !!!!!!  Chelsea is our server .. Very attentive

QaLgrO74csS40CG90cO45w.text: I came with my mommy friends and those without. The space was great for all of us. 3 mommies 2 babies under 6 months, 1 1yr old and 1 2yr old and 2 other adults. We were seated inside and it was a nice scenary.  I got the bottomless coffee. I was disappointed because when I see bottomless I expect my mug to always be full!! They only served my mug twice! What a disappointment.  I ordered the french toast with the platter. French toast was fluffy and tasted okay. Nothing special. The eggs and turkey kielbasa were okay as well. Again nothing special.  When checking out the line was outrageous. Only one cashier, I hope they open at least 2 people at the register!  Overall service can improve and food was just okay.

cLENxUoEarV4xs7V0EyGKg.text: This was my first time having breakfast and wow! One of the best breakfast I had. I had the protein egg white omelet and it was scrumptuous! Service was awesome and love the pj look!! Will definitely return and great place to bring company for a great breakfast and environment.

sNS_Vm2WjdmgbPjMnzJC_Q.text: OMG I had no idea there was a summerlin location 5 minutes from my house!! One of the managers Jennifer had informed me that instead of me driving 30 min to southern highlands.... There was also another location BY MEEEE. My life is saved, everything is so good and the location and building is so cute! Our food came out in a timely manner and everything was cooked to perfection. I am not going any other breakfast place ever again.  Also, my server Chelsea is the bessttttt she was so happy and positive and made my whole experience!

hA2wc0skNxTYdzF9Uic8Ng.text: Please go there and try their hash browns. They are super good. I also ate the chilequiles (sp?) and I enjoyed them. My wife loved her breakfast. Great experience overall.

2E014o37-M6Y7wi6s8kL3g.text: This is actually my second time here and the food is delicious,the service is great, the kids have a good portion menu and the staff is friendly. I love their Pajama outfits.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs, Turkey Kilbasa and shredded potatoes.
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My scrambled eggs and chilaquiles.
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids 1+2+3 meal, 1egg 2 strips of bacon and 3 pancakes.

VuYHoTfYmK9IGiTnDOUwCQ.text: My family and I visited for Mother's Day and we all absolutely loved it! Wonderful warm service and great atmosphere. Highly recommended!

IIGipxBfBeaPeqm11tHwIw.text: Been here multiple times and I've had good experiences with them. Since it is a popular breakfast spot expect it to be busy during the weekend. I hardly have to wait for a seat because I usually go with just my girlfriend. If you have a bigger party you might have to wait. If there's one thing I would suggest you try here... it's the chicken and waffles! They use chicken breast and it always comes out amazing for me. I love how it's crispy and goes well with the waffles. Their syrup is really good and they try to keep it warm at all times. As far as pricing goes it's your usual $10+ price range for almost any breakfast spot. The staff is super friendly and the establishment is clean. I see myself coming here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

PPTP4yKwSwWGcZ6d6CpY1A.text: What a great place for breakfast! I went there two days in a row, and the hostess remembered me!  The first time I went I ordered the ultimate steak and egg breakfast. The steak is a ribeye, a bit thin, but was delicious. It took up a big portion of my plate. The eggs are cooked perfectly and the hashbrowns are large shreds instead of small shreds nice and crispy on the outside tender on the inside.  The second time I went, I had the buffalo chicken with eggs breakfast. Now buffalo sauce for breakfast didn't sound great to me, so I asked for gravy instead. The size of the piece of chicken fried chicken I received was huge. It overtook my plate. I could only eat about a third. The batter was wonderful! I think this is the best fry batter I have ever had. It was light and crispy, not oily or greasy at all.   It had a little little flavoring of the buffalo sauce and the better, and that was just right. I think I might order it the next time as presented on the menu.  They have a lot of nice things on the menu, including a many different kinds of pancakes (mmmm..chocolate chip!), original omelettes such as lox and cream cheese, or you can make your own. They also have French toast and The  normal breakfast fair.  They offer a different variety of sausages for your choosing. Not just the patty or regular pork sausage. They offer chicken sausage and another type that unfortunately I can't remember! If you have a chance, get online and look at the menu. There's just so much there I can't describe it all!  The servers are all dressed in pajamas, so you can tell who is a server and who is the patron. The service was great by the way.  They offer French pressed coffee which I ordered the second day, and let seep a  little too long. It was very strong. They give you three timers, so you can decide whether you want it mild medium or strong. I normally like very strong coffee so I went for it.  Next time, I will choose a different timer.   There are lots and lots of breakfast places here in Las Vegas, for me to go to the same place two days in a row, that pretty much says it all. I love to eat breakfast out and plan to try just about everything on the menu there.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinning umbrellas

GyRqsbSdioSoSIIWcZ7N6A.text: Heard about this place from fellow yeeps, pictures looked good and was hungry so we decided to check it out. Off of Flamingo & Grand Canyon area in the south side shopping plaza. Parking was easy, plentiful. As soon as we came in we were seated right away at a four top table. The servers wear pajamas which I thought was pretty cool, GET INTO THE SPIRIT!  The decor has a farm-country like atmosphere with bright colors and pictures of cows everywhere, can't miss any of them. It's very wide open layout, there's outdoor seating which also looks comfortable. I ordered the ultimate steak and eggs (got them poached) with rye toast, also came with home fries.   It took quite a while to get our order and I got my steak medium rare, was about 25 minutes. My steak was awesome, very little fat and tender. My eggs were over poached, I like to break it over my potatoes and couldn't quite do that because the yolk was hard. Generally when you go to breakfast places its intact and still runny.   Aside from the wait and the eggs everything else was OK. Our waitress gave us good service, she checked on us twice after we got our food. The meal was very reasonable under $30 for me and wifey. The menu was huge so would definitely return to try out something else as there were awesome selections.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The check.
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not runny! Over poached.
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak with poached eggs.

JUNnd8YIa_qWhpCqDhcoYQ.text: This place is one of the best places I've been too. The service was great and the waitress was so nice. Her name is Ashley if anyone wants to know. The spiced rubbed steak was so tasty and juicy. I highly recommend this place to anyone.

-reRWzyHkm679z36SyCiqg.text: The food here was amazing!  My husband got the rib eye and eggs and those were great. I had the parfait and toast and it was really good. Are waitress Sarah was awesome and very helpful when choosing what to order!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parfait was so yummy

tgjU5WMP-Z5DfrayxIQTAw.text: I love coming to Rise and Shine, they have some of the best pancakes on the west coast!  Servers are always friendly and it's adorable that they serve you in PJs. The staff is always friendly and efficient. They always keep my coffee or iced tea glass filled!  I've been here a few times and have tried several different things, but the pancakes will always be my go to! They are as big as my head and I always have left overs to snack on at home.  I love the cinnamon maple syrup too! I recently saw their chef on the CW talking about waffles and next time I am in I will definitely be trying the banana's fosters waffle! It looked to die for on my TV screen!  5 stars all across the board from me!

cf6ljOd8NEZK7-5yxzXXvQ.text: I love this place. The food is yummy, and the options are seemingly endless (breakfast-wise)! The staff wears their pjs, and the inside of the restaurant is decorated beautifully. The pot of bread is my favorite. It is a little pot of cinnamon bread with frosting to dip it in. Their cinnamon french toast is amazing.   The reason my review is lacking one star is because every time we are finished eating, our server disappears! Three time I've been here, we've needed boxes. They usually drop off the check for you to pay up front. The restaurant is hardly busy when we go (around 11am), so where do our servers disappear to??   Other than that, delicious food! Will be back.

QEGIOWmhvrdRtnnd9vqxCg.text: Highly recommend.  Smoked salmon bagel, loco moco, and bananas foster waffle were all awesome.

W-7ygSFTrpV_mlDM-RQ3Rg.text: Best steak and eggs in Las Vegas. Whatever they season their beef with is perfect. Can get a bit busy on the weekends, so expect a 15 min wait. Worth the drive!

9_kUM655Ufi5j_S5Djs9Ow.text: I went to Rise & Shine today for the 1st time. We received the check and went up too pay. Before I stepped out the door I realized I had left my ray-ban sun glasses on the table so I went back and spoke to Tyler our waiter(can easily be identified by LV neck tat), the table had already been bussed (by Tyler) and my glasses were nowhere to be seen. There was no one sitting behind us and an old couple in front of us.  The manager came out and was very nice but she then said she 100% guarantees no one on her staff would of took them, not sure how someone could make a statement like that.  I'm not accusing anyone of anything but I no longer have my glasses. Not sure if breakfast food you can pretty much get anywhere is worth the risk of someone going through your purse or taking your property. I will not be back.

jtauRetqdDFgLnoW-T3QHw.text: My husband and I just moved into town and were looking for a nice place to have a family breakfast. I was so pleased that my steak and eggs were cooked perfectly and Amber our server kept the coffee full, and made us feel  comfortable. Loved the red velvet pancakes as well!

2vu1iFFm7-2Q7wpMp6rs1A.text: This was our first visit and we were excited to try it. I ordered a glass of freshly squeezed orange juice. It was not worth $4.25. I ordered the steak and eggs and my husband ordered the the steaks wrapped in bacon and eggs. I forget the menu name. The steaks were good and properly seasoned but the eggs were small and the potatoes lacked seasoning. I didn't like that we didn't receive our toast with our meal. We were 1/2 way done when the toast arrived after we were assured "it was coming up". I used the lady's room here and it was very very dusty and lacked supplies. It needs a deep cleaning for sure!! I also didn't like the lack of uniformity of the staff. The hostess' wear regular street clothing, the waitresses wear PJ's, the cooks and busers wear an identifiable shirt and khaki pants. I bring this up because when we needed something we didn't know who to ask we couldn't tell who's an employee or a patron. Also, the PJs worn by some were a bit disheveled. Not very professional. All in all this place is nothing special and the food wasn't great. Stars for decor and some of the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor is cute.
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak wrapped in bacon with eggs.

U8xjBZP79Ur1-59zWyIHiQ.text: They have the best food in town. Their steak and eggs melts in your mouth, you don't even need any A1 or stake sauce. The buffalo chicken steak is also one of my favorites. The. Waitresses are always friendly. At time you make have to wait but the wait is so worth it.

7udV-ymx3uEiSigPR_LnBA.text: One of my favorite breakfast place, i love their s'mores waffle. They have fresh orange juice and great coffee ( lavazza ). Their uniform are cool ( pyjama ). Definitly a big yes !!

J-4r5F5h6XCs7jo4eu10hg.text: I love this spot! The great decor is only slightly less pleasant than the staff, and that's just because they're always on point. I love having this place so close to me, which makes it even easier to roll in with my ridiculous pajamas on. Even though there are a few awesome breakfast joints around here, this is always my go-to. The food is the best pre-noon fare I've found in a long, long time. I've now had almost every item on the menu, and can honestly say there isn't a single thing I don't love here (the red velvet pancakes take the cake though, [pun only slightly intended]). The only downside is the occasional wait, but that can't be helped when you find a gem like this.

5KkS-zpjdYaQriC9KRlCig.text: Never had a bad meal there. Luv the crispy French toast. Always good friendly service. They should have a special day when the patrons arrive  in pajamas, just like the wait staff. And, I think Victoria Secret should sponsor it.

fhelXkbpfJ3ks65mYxrTBQ.text: A go-to place for a great breakfast! They have an extensive. Menu with lots of healthy choices...like make your own yoghurt parfait with fresh berries. Also have all the traditional items as well - and make sure you try the "pot-o-bread" - yum!

bsQgH5F5es34sCBd25Peuw.text: Service was very slow and price was a bit on the steep side for breakfast.   Food was good when we got it. May try it again before we leave.

I5AxifTZYdnudgYWh73YQQ.text: Great breakfast family restaurant, very busy on weekends but worth the wait. Server was not on his game, forgot toast  and bacon side orders for two meals. Steak and poached eggs on bagel is a huge portion. Steak and eggs done perfectly but whatever they used on the bagel was a little funky tasting.

jujnd1W0HScgQi_hvZiDNg.text: Third time I have been here... service continues to be bad even on slow days. Took forever to get our food and all was not served at the same time. cup o bread was yummy but not worth going there again. Three strikes... never again.

IpEYxYf9oQHFPPlOoNFoZA.text: Had the Corned Beef hash and Poached Eggs with a fresh OJ. The OJ was good so was the service. The food was TERRIBLE! The so called poached eggs were hard boiled and looked like they were sitting in the water for days. The Hash was the worst I ever tried! It was made of what looked like diced pieces of Oscar Meyer cold cuts and diced potatoes that were EXTREMELY OVERCOOKED! It was like I had someone's leftover food. I had heartburn the rest of the day after that.. I recommend that they give up their gimmicky Pajama Uniforms and teach their staff how to prepare food!   NEVER AGAIN

8xC8Fp-hcNSQmHiLTzRrLw.text: This place is conveniently located on flamingo and 215. I came here before I went to the gym. I ordered a freshly squeezed orange juice that was pretty good. I also had a "go go green" juice that was really good and refreshing. This place is okay. The drinks are the only reason why I would ever come back. The food was very mediocre. The service was really slow for as empty as the place was. Most of the employees wear pajamas as uniforms. Kinda sloppy if you ask me....

VssCbIsFfrd00hkMQZlU4A.text: A friend and I visited Rise and Shine a few days ago for the first time. We arrived 30 minutes before they closed and asked the host if they were still seating and apologized for our late arrival. The kind gentleman assured us that it wasn't an issue and got us seated right away. The waitress was also extremely polite and very helpful. But most of all, the food was fantastic! An all around great experience.

d2lKwh42GLM6mSPeS92jEA.text: Great food, huge portions!  Definitely get the Ultimate!  Eggs over easy! Pot bread just ok. Good coffee too!

zDhlCseHYiQgRdvsJwqr4w.text: My husband and I ate here a couple of months ago and we totally enjoyed the busy atmosphere, great service, and the food that was plentiful and delicious.  Breakfast for 2 set us back $50+ with tip.  So, we decided to keep it as a special occassion, not an eating out frequently ( as we do) kinda place. Ironically, our waitress told us prices were set to go up soon.  I inquired if we could purchase 6 of the pot of bread to carry out.  She checked and told me $1.75 each, which seemed reasonable.  Yesterday, I invited a friend out for lunch, raving about how great it was.  We arrived, and the first thing I noticed was how empty the place was...I ordered the 3 eggs on top of corned beef hash dish.  I chose this over 2 other selections, located in the same area in the menu, because it included that delicious pot of bread...after asking the waitress how much it would be to order  separately...$3.50! (after being quoted $1.75 few weeks before.)  That was kind of a turn off.  My friend ordered a banana parfait, (for $9.50) it looked, and she said tasted delicious, however I noticed that the cook threw a couple of sliced banana at the bottem of the glass, no pudding, just 2 lonely banana slices at the bottem, and pudding at the top, no layering of the pudding.  It looked skimpy.  My corned beef dish arrived.  Again, skimpy portion, and no sliced potatos, just chipped beef and onions, I asked the waitress and she had no clue or offer to remedy the problem.  Only that thats the recipe, they make in-house.  The flavors were not what I expected, alot of sage, very disappointing.  Oh, and yes, they did raise their prices.  We were so excited for a new place to go and relax, and to take our friends to, and, unfortunately, their clever touches are not enough for us to go back again.  They had a good thing going, but have lost us as customers, greedy pricing, and shorting of food does not keep diners.

X0jdo7pHh_NpX7B2K-u2WQ.text: Not a great visit today. We told Laura - our server - that two people were joining us, but they were only having coffee - so a total party of four. From that moment on, she had no interest in service at our table. It took more than 10 minutes for the two of us to place our order, because she simply did not come back to the table. When the food arrived, my omelette was overcooked and rubbery. I had planned to send it back. But Laura never returned. She eventually walked by and dropped off the check but did not ask how everything was. We needed a to-go box and did not get one. When I shared this information with the manager on duty, she did not really seem to care about it. Said Laura was one of their top three servers. I said that made this even more unacceptable! If you want average food for an average price, with less than average service, check it out. But too many breakfast options in Vegas for me to come back.

HZMum9_lJBIKFr0n4WesiQ.text: After eating at the Southern Highlands location and being very pleased, I Thought that I'd give this location a try. I did not have the same experience. I ordered the same Omelette. It was very firm and over cooked. It also seemed to lack flavor so I found myself using half the pepper shaker to make it more palatable. Yes the pot of bread was good but I really wanted a nice omelette. The service was okay except for the cashier, not so friendly. The restaurant itself has a charming atmosphere and is decorated lovely. But if you want better prepared food then I would take the drive to their Southern Highlands location- your food will likely be much better. Or try The Original Pancake House. Now,  go relax and have breakfast or brunch!

RbE6wFs-4azyTmq2wFZqBw.text: This was our first visit to Rise & Shine for breakfast.  Definitely won't be our last.  We sat on the patio as it was a beautiful morning and it was a bit quieter outside. The waiters/waitresses wear pajamas!!! How fitting for the restaurant name "Rise & Shine"! Love it!!  We were a party of five and all of us ordered something just a bit different.  Myself, I ordered the kids + seniors special, 3 pancakes with two strips of crispy bacon and one scrambled egg. Such a deal!!! Wouldn't find this deal where I live.  The pancakes were amazing and the bacon yummy and cooked perfect.  Even my scrambled egg was cooked perfect.  My DH ordered the same, but upgraded his pancakes to the velvet pancakes for an extra dollar.  Omg they were sooooo tastey!  For coffee they even serve "French Press" coffee if you prefer.  Wow!  In my town, this is only served at the finer restaurants, not a breakfast spot.  When the waitress brought the carafe to the table she also brought a three sand timer so I could time and choose my own strength of coffee.  My daughter ordered the French toast and it looked amazing also.  The wait staff were so friendly.  I will post photos of three of our meals.  Definitely will go back next time we are visiting family, and will be spreading the word to friends who have second homes in Summerlin.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Toast
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Senior pancake breakfast
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Senior Velvet pancake breakfast

btXBs38lvGRjHpaqgRWHNg.text: On a Saturday morning, there was only one waiter for the entire patio area. It took a good 10 to 15 minutes just to get coffees for a table of 3. The service was extremely slow and the food was just so-so, not worth the wait.   Maybe it was a rough day or something because a manager came out to thank us and the tables around us for our patience. I think we would have been more understanding if that comment had been made in the course of our meal instead of at the end when we were settling our bill and frustrated. It wasn't a very good first impression and I don't think I'll be back.

KKfXd4wG-slyxqdDs2VVMA.text: Definitely recommend this place, HUGE menu and amazing service. Our server Nicole was very friendly and let us try their infamous cup of bread (must try!!!) and was very attentive to us.

PXeBMw8__sCXotsDKvi8UQ.text: The second location is by LVAC on flamingo and 215 formerly Joe's Crab Shack. They are open from 7am-3pm the menu is large with a small lunch section.   For a family of 3 we spent $50 before tip ordering two of the ultimate steak and eggs and silver dollar pancakes for our child and orange juices. Second trip- Vanilla latte was great!   They offer a potted bread which is a cinnamon bun in a cup with butter and icing on the side which I was thrilled about! Ask for the icing though. It was delicious!!  I wasn't a fan of the hash browns, a little underdone with no taste I suggest offering a substitute other than tomato and avocado. Our steaks were fantastic and flavoring was great.   They offer freshly squeezed orange juice which is good but not worth the $5 and NO refills with a tall skinny glass. My kid had more orange juice than I did with her plastic cup so I highly suggest that be changed.   There's no changing table in the restroom so I had to change my infant on the seat next to me. I'd certainly suggest installing that right away.

eKVkPcqvBdZyrwHlIZsudw.text: Tables that were seated well after me got their food. I ordered the oatmeal and it had clumps of oatmeal on it. Then I found the hair in the oatmeal. My husband's good was not hot. Prices higher than other Vegas restaurants. Cute decor but I can't eat that   As to your response you really did not resolve the matter. You didn't charge  me for food that  I couldn't eat. I barely had two mouthfuls. I left hungry and sick to my stomach. What was the resolution?  Don't think I'd give you another chance. Plenty of breakfast places out there

WgTUjhiuJ3xvevv8Z-b-qg.text: Omg!!! They have THE BEST French toast I've ever had in my life!!! They're syrup is to die for! Delicious coffee and sweetbread. I HIGHLY recommend this place... if you haven't tried it... you don't know what your missing!!

LYwHExr3OnRRobZMFQkLhg.text: OMG....talk about the best pancakes in Veas. The pic does it no justice. I would suggest sharing am order with 2 or 3 people, just get extra sides. Lol

6WTmIugbmuhbVtJafcxUoA.text: The wait to get a table was a long one. But the food here is amazing, so the wait was worth it. Still it's not my favorite breakfast spot, but I do say it's worth the visit. The service is friendly and the atmosphere is nice. Overall, I will gladly be returning.

TCd4PEe3OVZv-M0WA2quHA.text: Loved it, great service great chicken fried steak, the staff wear pajamas. I used to go the the other location years ago

Kiq5yknU4yv45nyWf8u0Qg.text: I live in Indiana... and when I come to Vegas, this is my #1 choice for breakfast. Fast, friendly service. Many different menu options. Have a family member with several food allergies (dairy, gluten, several fruits), and she can eat here without issue. I would highly recommend the "Cup of Bread" with your meal. Half cinnamon roll/half sweet bread with cream cheese dipping sauce, served in a mug! Very awesome atmosphere and even better food!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nsmLrUtTlsVGYBCsevcmlQ.text: Love this place, definitively missed by a lot of people. The portions are massive and the steak n eggs are the best in town. The pancakes are favorite though. They are huge so get a half order but they are soft in the middle and have crispy edges and they're not too thick. These people know how to make it. Only issue is that I got orange juice and it was almost 6 bucks for a small glass, which is kind of overpriced in my opinion, but overall a great establishment.

7c8wYrMDR4FtUFDX4pi8SQ.text: This is my first time eating at this restaurant and the atmosphere is really nice. They have pretty flower umbrellas hanging from the ceiling. Right away, Amberly, assisted us. She recommended the Hazelnut Nutella coffee and it was delicious. She was very efficient and has great customer service. I ordered the S'mores Waffle platter and it was very delicious. We had a great server and great food -- this is defiantly a go-to breakfast restaurant with your family!

0VuJ07Dy5eOme_iGZ0dspw.text: Great breakfast -lunch spot. Umbrellas twirl on the ceilings, pots hang on walls, servers in Pajamas! Lots of outdoor seating & bright inside. Can't wait to try the Banana Frosted Flakes Pancakes! Servings look large! Can't wait to come back fo

Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Juice &amp; coffee station

XqWLtDeSew45UJTqgr1xzg.text: Good service but seemed like there is a big issue in the kitchen(looked crazy) our food came out very slow and cold! Not sure we wanted to come back here again!

bq_UKAfORP8951vwmDtJrw.text: Really enjoyed my breakfast this past week here. First time and ordered the Ribeye steak and eggs with the breakfast mug bread for me and Hubby had the Chilaquiles with seasoned ribeye. It was a lot of food and we both brought home half a steak. Ordered it medium and came out perfect. Our server was very attentive and kept our coffee cups full. Loved the T-shirt's and socks they have for sale in the little entry way. I think they were $12.00 each and they had some cute sayings on them. We don't eat out for steak and eggs very often but will definitely be bringing my family, even the the non-carnivore, as they have lots of options. Our bill for the two of us was a little under $50 including the tip, but not bad when you consider the quality and portion size of what is given. Won't be a regular place for us on a retired budget but very good for those who like to splurge and indulge a little every now and then.

jUjmAtlwiGYdE-bxWzCM9w.text: It was our first time here and we are definitely coming back! We asked for patio seating because it was a nice morning. The table was a little dirty, however we cleaned it with a wet napkin. The server was very sweet and knowledgeable about the menu and food. I ordered the fresh squeezed orange juice, however it tasted like grapefruit because orange was not in seasoned. My spouse and I got the cinnamon bread in a cup with the cream cheese syrup and it was delicious, not to sweet! I ordered the Lox Salmon Benedict with a huge fruit platter that contained honey dew, cantaloupe, pineapple, strawberries, and blueberries (forgot to take a picture)! This fruit platter came in clutch for my little son who loved it!  The lox was fresh and overall my plate was gone! My spouse ordered the three egg bacon classic and it was okay. Our server did an amazing job, she always checked on us and made sure everything was going well!

OvSI2RZX0Ddff9q_Cgi46w.text: Arrived with a group of 7 on Saturday at about 1pm after a long night of drinking on the Strip. There was no wait! The atmosphere here is very welcoming and we were greeted and seated in a timely manner. My group's coffee and water cups never went empty here! The reviews for this place are hit or miss, but I'm glad our experience was a hit!  I forgot out server's name but she was the sweetest. She called us hun all the time and even joked along with us. She made our experience really fun and comfortable.  My order:  Pot of bread - 9/10 Small cinnamon roll served in a mug with a side of icing. I just wish it wasn't such a small portion but it was really soft, gooey and delicious. ORDER THIS  Loco Moco - 8/10 Beef patties cooked how you like on top of rice. Topped with eggs, SPAM, gravy and teriyaki sauce. The rice was kinda dry and the burger patties were a bit tough but the gravy and runny eggs really saved the day on this one.   Also, the portions here are huge so get your gut ready  All my friends really liked their food. Rise and Shine is definitely on our go to list when we visit LV again

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco

Lzqs9QQu2fbK03tBVALg7g.text: Well, this was disappointing! Kept it simple, bacon and eggs.... no onions please, bacon crisp, butter the toast, please. So.... the coffee was ok, yet, the hash browns were loaded with chives (onions), in fact, they had migrated under the eggs. The toast was dry, hard, nearly inedible, unless you were looking for Melba Toast. Seemed to be a fairly busy place.... but now on my "never again" list!! Too bad, but there are plenty of great breakfast places... so no loss!

2K8v5RiOobyJzHCuJY2d6Q.text: Came here during 10am sunday, expected it to be busy with waiting time. We waited 20 minutes to be seated for a party of 2 which is not bad at all. Food wait took longer, had 3 refills of coffee before our food came and the steak wasnt hot anymore and eggs were cold. Our side orders never came and server just offered to get it boxed to go. Portion was fairly generous though. Overall food tasted good but it wouldve been better served hot. We noticed parties of 2 that arrived same time as we did, eat and finish way ahead of us. Not a great first impression.

jPn5MClsIlpLzPJU6W-YkQ.text: My wife's medium rare ribeye steak was cooked perfectly and my Hawaiian entree was excellent.

oluB1NIh46VarHqwXf932Q.text: This place was so good!!! I'm from California but my sister stays in Vegas!! And we decided to try it out!! Our waitress was so nice, I wish I would've got her name!! Their uniforms are pajamas which I think is so cute!! Their food is definitely filling and affordable!! They have a fresh juice bar right in the restaurant!! I was really satisfied with my order!! I got the Rise & Shine burrito I think minus the chorizo since I'm a vegetarian but they do have veggie options!! And let me tell you sis I still was full!! Plus I added pancakes because I was going hard considering it was a little vacay lol!! Our waitress said they were a good size, so I'm thinking the regular size like from the frozen food section!! Nope you guessed it they were bigger, better, & softer!!! Look below because I came with receipts sis!!! I can't wait until I go back to Vegas because I'm definitely going again!! Shout out to our waitress because she made us feel so welcome and gave us options!! I don't her name but she has dark hair and we were talking about wearing pajamas outside because they were $30 lol!! It was the weekend of 4.20.19 on a Saturday!! So manager can she get an extra day off with pay please!! Thank you guys

VTxWnXqoBtoD3ZNxUqtelw.text: We wanted a real breakfast away from The Strip.  Found this place on  Yelp and decided to give it a try.  So glad we made the trip!    My husband had the French Toast with 2 eggs and bacon.  The French Toast was crispy on the edges and the bacon was perfect.  I had the waffle which was delicious.  I was happy they offered coconut milk for my coffee since I cannot do dairy.  Portions are big and we were happily stuffed.  Took off one star for our waiter who we both felt could of been better.

5wIT2GP-TfpyYuI2LAhcsA.text: Food okay super overpriced- the taste isn't worth the price . I would recommend MTO cafe better !

ijva_HPOIdMy7RVpjAITYA.text: This place is awesome if you love breakfast food. They have plenty of egg dishes, burritos,  steak and even smoothies. The waitresses have the cutest uniforms,  their jammies! My waitress today was totally sweet.  The chef forgot my balsamic glaze on my eggs benedict and she noticed right away. She quickly went to the kitchen and brought me some in those little sauce cups. Saved the day, I love that stuff,  really gives the eggs and extra oomph. The ambiance is super cute,  they have farm decor and umbrellas that rotate on the ceiling.  The noise level is moderate to loud depending when you go. They do have outdoor seating, although I'm sure its seasonal. Definitely a place to add to your breakfast/ brunch rotation.

KalrL6ajuGefFJGviEji9Q.text: Rise & Shine - A Steak & Egg Place  What came first, the chicken or the egg?    It really doesn't matter because I'm going to eat both.  Rise & Shine is known for great breakfast steaks and of course, their eggs. I've had their steaks once and have to agree with most of the Yelpers that it's pretty good, priced just right, and always perfect for breakfast.  By the way, they use only USDA prime meats here.  Lately, I have been on an egg kick.  I love eggs and can even notice the quality of them.  Here at Rise & Shine, the eggs seemed to taste a whole lot better than everyone else's.  I have no idea where Rise & Shine gets their eggs, but it's good, thick, and very fluffy when scrambled.  I'll keep my meal small with just 3 scrambled eggs with cheddar cheese, 4 slices of bacon, and a chicken breast.  I call this meal the EBC for Egg, Bacon, and Chicken.  The bacon is okay, the chicken breast is flavorful, but the eggs...phenomenal.    Prices for their set meals is about average compared to the other breakfast joints in town.  An omelet made with 3 eggs with all the carbs cost around $10.  Their steak and eggs breakfast is roughly $15. My meal is usually a little more since I am getting different proteins a la carte. The restaurant is pretty big and very popular during the weekend mornings.  As for their service, it's as good as it gets. I appreciate the fact that they're always willing to substitute items or add extra proteins for me.    2017 Yelp Review #80

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs, Bacon, &amp; Chicken Breast @ Rise &amp; Shine

kC0LP3Uel5yg3zBwSZg5mA.text: The atmosphere is warm and pleasant. The service is fast and the food is awesome. I had their version of the Loco Moco. The ground/chopped steak was well cooked and charred just right.  The slices of Spam could have been a little more crispy. The "gravy-yaki" was a nice surprise of savory and sweet. VmgDLFx7qr-ZOQ9A5tcHiA.text: Rise & Shine is a whimsical breakfast place! I love the parasols hanging from the ceiling ,the wait staff in their PJ's and the generous portion sizes! The restaurant was a former Joe's Crab Shack so it is pretty big inside which means if there is a wait it goes by pretty quickly.   I ordered the Bacon & Egg in the Hole French Toast ($11.95). You can typically get half orders of the pancakes and French Toast . The one I ordered only comes in a full size because it is a specialized dish. There is a hole in the middle of the French Toast with an over hard egg in the middle. They also put bacon strips in it. This was the first time I had something like this but I really liked it. I also had a side of hashbrowns and bangers ( English Sausage). The bangers were also another first they tasted less salty then your normal sausage which is a plus for me because I hate salty foods and they hate me too!   This is a breakfast place that is also great for groups since there is a lot of seating with big booths and tables . They also don't rush you out when you are finished with your meal so you can feel free and chit chat just a little bit longer over your cup of coffee.

PMf3FgNGuB2NPI9pPE0Fxw.text: Wednesday morning in Las Vegas... normally tourists are usually heading to bed and sleeping off a hangover, or possibly donning sunglasses and lounging poolside.  But not this tourist; with family living in town, we left the air-conditioned confines of our hotel on the Strip and ventured into Spring Valley to meet my in-laws here.  Even though we were strong in numbers (7 total), we had the run of the place at 10:00 AM (which is more like 2:00 PM anywhere else in the world).  A bunch of folks ordered coffee in a French Press (which they were VERY excited about), though I abstained for java and got a glass of watermelon & strawberry juice.  After perusing the menu, I decided on the Ultimate Steak & Egg Breakfast, with 3 scrambled eggs and a "pot of bread" (looks like they bake the bread dough in a small coffee cup).  The food was very hearty (definitely needed in this town); my steak was perfectly medium-rare and the pot of bread was served with a sweet buttery dipping sauce.  My wife ordered the corned beef hash and was very satisfied with her selection.  Everyone in my party was pleased with their meal, and we (eventually) ventured back into the heat after breakfast.  The service was excellent... our server was very patient with us, answering all our (inane) questions about the menu.  All the staff were also dressed in pajamas, which made me feel very overdressed in my t-shirt & shorts.  Next time, I'll just roll out of bed and stumble into this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A cup of bread and a glass of watermelon &amp; strawberry juice.

6GGUj5YI9Tnk66s7ZGxydA.text: Oh gosh, this place was so good. The steak was juicy and flavorful and I switched the hash browns with fruit which was presented in an ombre assortment. All the options for sides were delicious such as the pot o' bread which was very reminiscent of a fresh cinnamon roll. The french press coffee was nice and strong, and the pressed juices were refreshing (highly recommend the strawberry watermelon). The interior is so cute and the waiters/waitresses wear pajamas, I took a star off because there seemed to be some confusion with the service during our meal. It is a little more expensive at this place ($15-20 for entrees) but overall worth it.

Each member left full and content. Our server today was Nicole, she was so personable, and made our stay extra nice.  A must get is the bread in a cup. Just get it and don't doubt, it's a nice lil surprise in a cup. The ultimate Ribeye, is my favorite. Today it was perfect! So far, I'll keep coming back when in town.

okURrxmv6uvF1ilRJz2nlw.text: If you can get over the obvious fact this used to be a Joe Crab's shack, the inside ambiance is great. They have spinning upside umbrellas and lights that adorn the ceiling, and all the servers wear onesie pajamas.  The food does not stand out to me, but it is of good quality. I have yet to try their steak and eggs, but the pancakes, the french toast, the eggs, the eggs benedict, the hash browns, and the bacon are on par with most breakfast places. Edible, but nothing I am scrambling to come back for. Portions are typical of a standard breakfast place.  The service, however, was not good. I have been to this place three times, and every time the service has been severely lacking. Don't get within an hour of them closing, as the ambiance drops as employees begin mopping and cleaning next to you while you eat, and the servers stop caring whether you need more coffee or anything. Each time I have been it had taken a good 5 plus minutes or more before even being acknowledged after being sat. Make sure you ask for everything you need when they do talk to you, because that might be the last time someone stops by before your bill.   Speaking of the bill, this place is pricey, especially for what you get, food and service wise.  They do fresh squeeze their juice, and you will pay for it, but it is very delicious. Consider getting the carafe if more than one person at your table is getting orange juice, it will save you a little bit. The servers will not point this out to you.

I also had a glass of fresh watermelon / strawberry juice & fresh it was! The waitress brought my fresh cinnamon bun thingy in a cup out early so I could enjoy it with my cup of organic black tea (very thoughtful). The food came out very fast. The atmosphere was very hip n casual. The wait service was very very pleasant, professional. Our waitress Samantha S. was the best! Great food. Great service and reasonable prices. Seen there is a location in our new hometown. We'll be back!

FMzyKZxWivApdCisiyfpEQ.text: It's always a great morning if Rise and Shine is on your agenda! The name reveals that they specialize in steak and egg dishes, and I have never been much of a fan... partially because I didn't realize how many different variations there were of this dish.  SPICE RUBBED RIB EYE WITH CHILAQUILES: This was incredible. Steak was nicely seasoned and cooked to a perfect medium rare, with a huge portion of tortilla chips, beans, and cheese, along with avocado, salsa, and sour cream to doctor it to your liking. Portion is enough for two, or one, if you don't plan on eating til dinner. CHICKEN FRIED STEAK AND EGGS: HUGE steak, crunchy exterior, perfectly seasoned country gravy. This is the South on a plate. Side it with a biscuit and gravy for the full effect. It's a super-heavy dish though, consider yourself warned. STEAK AND EGGS: The classic dish was also done well. Table agreed the steak on this plate was the best, but the hashbrown potatoes left something to be desired. Would sub for another side next time.  DRINKS: The French press coffee and the fresh-squeezed juices are good choices, the Green Go Go juice in particular (kale, cucumber, melon, parsley).  Service was friendly, love how some of the servers are in PJs. I hear they get busy on weekends, but the food is certainly worth the wait and way better than that other nearby breakfast spot. Note that meals are ~$15/ea, which justifies the huge portions, but may be a bit more than you expect.

sWT0-vimVwAbRdGHLPcLFA.text: I absolutely love this place!  . Great food and delicious coffee ! Plus we had an awesome waitress named Amberly!  She is so friendly and on top of our need. Thank you Amberly for great customer service!

uuwg3ILUol9k_oHwpuuUTw.text: Stumbled on this place while in Summerlin, Amazing food and awesome service! Will be returning as often as possible! Perhaps they will open one in Henderson but until then, we will return as often as possible. Fyi, best cinnamon french toast on the planet!

mADy45Zhgv6HKLL2ddKtFg.text: First time for breakfast here! Decor was awesome! Servers wear the cuteness pajamas. Food was great, we also had freshly squeezed orange juice and a delicious latte with nutella. We were seated immediately and Nicole was our amazing waitress. She was attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu. Thank you for the great experience Nicole!

tuCGqqUTTNs0x57B1EAb4w.text: My first time here and I gotta say I will be back! The wait for a table was about 30 min, but that's normal for a breakfast spot on a Sunday at 11 am. The service was very good. The waitress was friendly and came often to check on us. The food was very good! Very generous potions and delicious. I had the cheese steak and eggs, my wife had the chicken and waffles and my kids had the red velvet pancakes. My favorite was the chicken and waffles, but everything was good.

MHfObuKkUH5kB1sB3qO5RA.text: They asked me if I wanted to sit at the bar or wait 10-15 minutes. I chose to wait for a myriad of reasons, the most prominent being that I don't like sitting by the kitchen it makes it impossible to talk. Being seated by the kitchen is the worst seat in almost any usual restaurant, so whenever a place sits me near it I tend to not come back. So we wait our time and they sit me, literally, in the table that is the absolute closest to the kitchen without being the bar. Needless to say, I started off my meal highly irritated. Worse than this, the lighting in the area I was in was horrid. I like to take pictures of my food and even my selfie ring light was not fighting the backlight from the windows. I really wish they had more inside lighting,   However, despite my minor complaints with being seated and the lighting, I will give Rise & Shine another shot. The other features of this experience won me back over in time. Our waitress was nice, our food was good (and in some cases exceptional) and I felt really special getting to drink french press coffee. That's a nice touch!   I had the french toast with bacon and egg in the middle and my boyfriend had a fancy steak omelette. The steak on his omelette was surprisingly good. I would even call it great. It was soft, tender, buttery, delicious - everything a steak should be. I don't like their pot-of-bread and wouldn't get it again. If you wanna try some pot-of-bread, do yourself a favor and hit up Jamms!  Coming back for the food, hoping for a slightly better atmosphere. But even if the atmosphere is the same and this doesn't end up being my cup-of-tea for a peaceful breakfast - it would make a STELLAR family option.

This place is fun too...the waitresses all wear pajamas and they sell socks with different sayings  I definitely recommend trying this place out...they are only open til 3pm though so, there's not dinner there but that's ok

L5irjgMOnVn98T8WbsPfZw.text: Wife had amazing steak chilaquiles I had a chicken fried steak that had too much batter and wasn't very good. When I responded as such to our server Devon she replied she would "dispose of the evidence" I had literally only taken 2 bites out of the steak and she didn't press it any further. When we checked out With Kristi. The cashier she asked how it was and we replied not very good, she just repeated our statement and gave us our change without any other words. When I asked for the manager she said we could speak with one tomorrow afternoon after 2pm. Never coming again. Not even for the chilaquiles.

wcP3wIgo83-PmMUr0kDIBQ.text: Great place for breakfast.  Always good service.  French toast is my favorite.

AjBM97prH8o03RlM439xdA.text: Rise and Shine is a very enjoyable establishment for an early riser's breakfast fix. The ambiance and the attentive and friendly staff made for a pleasant rainy morning of steak, eggs, and coffee.  I'd love to take a nap after partaking in the ultimate steak and egg. 18oz rib eye grilled nicely  with sides of hash brown, toast, and eggs my way. Breakfast fundamentals, but executed deliciously. Chelsea was also nice enough to keep the tasty coffee topped off which i apprectiated.  I would definitely recommend Rise and Shine for those who admire a good breakfast experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The basics

nGByHjwdh14g4n9I_99i4A.text: I want to give a 3.5 star as I keep switching between 3 and 4... but not an option! Came here on fourth of July for breakfast around 8am. This restaurant is HUGE, tons of seating both indoor and outdoor. We were seated immediately, no wait. The interior is so cute and colorful. and the servers are in pajamas, creating a unique experience. Our server Ashley was awesome! I would give her 5 stars alone but the food was not great. I ordered an omelet with sausage, jalapeno and onion, nothing standout about this... could probably make a better one myself. The hashbrown are where they lost major points. They were literally potato chip shreds. They were sooo hard and burnt, I think honestly the worst hashbrowns I have ever had. The toast was the highlight of the meal somehow, although the butter was not soft. This place is pretty expensive for breakfast and although it is cute and the service was good I was completely disappointed by the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Lp58EN33z6eX_MCDbUFmzw.text: We decided to grab a brunch before we headed back to Long Beach, CA and of course I turned to my yelp app... We were checking out the fish tank(Didn't see mermaids) at Silverton and one that popped near by with high reviews happened to be closed for 3 weeks(a little crazy!) so I quickly looked up option B and came across Rise & Shine a Steak & Egg Place... Let me just say we were meant to come here instead of the other place! We had to wait a little while since a few tables had to be cleared out but we had time to look over the menu while we waited so we didn't waste any time and ordered right away... And we were very thankful for the kids coloring papers because our kids were really coloring and we actually had peaceful waiting time it was sooo nice! And our server was really nice and attentive too, I wish we had asked her her name! She is the one with black PJ on:-) Well whoever you were, you were great! Thank you:-)  Anyways, we ordered friend chicken and waffle, Chicken fried steak and kids 1+2+3, all soooo delicious and we scoffed down pretty much all of it no problem! We officially added this place to must stop by restaurant in Las Vegas list:-)

UZY9s45WumgY_uu2YTBTTw.text: Located near the LVAC, so a workout and breakfast here is easy. Friendly service, good food, it arrived fast and hot. Atmosphere is meh - formerly a Joe's Crab Shack. Large patio is great though, and the place is huge so you should be able to get seated fairly quickly. Lavazza coffee...brewed OR French Press sooo good. Server kept it topped off (thanks G, we thought you were amazing!) Turkey kielbasa v. good, frosted flake banana pancake is worth a try at least once - one pancake and it's huge. Eggs cooked to perfection. The chicken fried steak on a scale of 1 - 10 was a 6, was as big as the plate but a bit on the tough dry side. Going back to try a few other dishes. I'm on the fence with this place for now, am a devout breakfast person!  Update...went back, french toast stuffed with the eggs n bacon - a delicious original. OJ was watery and too tangy...the server warned us though, as the oranges they had were out iof season. Classic pancakes - 2 huge hotcakes so plan to share. Syrup was warmed - nice! They were wearing their PJ'S on Sunday morning...fun idea! Oh and they had steak n eggs on kids menu.

-tTG2GvJDkUmvt4pyW-Q_Q.text: I visited here on February 18th, 2017. I am underwhelmed with the service. I arrived with my group around 10:00 AM on a Saturday and waited inside with the 35 other people waiting for their tables. Since it was pouring rain and there wasn't anywhere to stand everyone was packed like sardines inside the waiting area (which wasn't a problem, as no one can control the weather.). I was quietly chatting with my group and was rudely told to "move away from the counter so people can pay" by the cashier Braden. We ignored this comment and went on with our meal. Food was great and our waiter was awesome, I believe his name was Roy. He is the reason this review is getting 2 stars instead of one. When we finished our meal we met again with Braden to pay for our bill. He rudely told us he would not split our check and then went on to embarrass us as we tried to figure out the situation by shouting to the entire line of people behind us that he would "be right with them after us.". We paid for everything and left quickly to get out of the awkward situation.  Unfortunately he ruined our experience and we will not be returning because we don't feel very welcome. He seemed to be training possibly but was left to handle a busy Saturday morning by himself without a manager and didn't do well at all. I am disappointed in the way he handled our situation and the way he embarrassed us. He should not be handling cashier if he doesn't have the people skills to keep a situation under control without publicly embarrassing an entire family. Hopefully he will continue to learn and will hopefully not do this to anyone else who visits.  I will be sharing my experience with my friends and family.

Cv2tgZzabSy5s63xYeZqjw.text: Friends and I were looking for a place that was different with a local vibe.  Went on Yelp and found this awesome place.  Waitress serve you in pajamas and the pot in a cup roll is Bombay! The bangers were well cooked and the food was great!

mwRRgbi4ljBbfBQ4Km2aAg.text: This place is very unique. From the servers dressed in pajamas, to the flower lights/spinners coming down from the top of the barn house feel ceiling. To the fresh squeezed juices, and warm syrup.... The menu is not to big but big enough to make you have to choose between 2 things you really want. The wait took a little longer, but the quality of the food was worth it. I got an omelette which was amazing with the fresh cut potato hash browns and delicious biscuit. My partner got the egg n bacon in the hole French toast. Latte w/ Nutella was delicious. Overall a great experience and I left very satisfied. My server was Kristi who was amazing and gave all the right suggestions.

Od7mf6K60phvTFkdzoL_Ow.text: My wife and I have made this our weekend brunch place. The food is always incredible as well as the service. We always recommend this place and will continue to come here weekly!

7PRelu-z_amfCL7oVtECCA.text: Ordered the fresh orange juice, for the $$$ I'd expect a larger glass. My wife had the chicken and waffle, much better than Hash House!!! I had the S'mores waffle, loved it. Plan on going back.

Checking in is kinda nightmarish and the older lady with tats who reaks of cigarettes smoke is the worst server ever!  But the atmosphere is so delightful, the outfits worn are adorable and the food seriously is incredible. DGz5gcqXZjQZf0BKtcUR8A.text: Staff was super friendly. The food was really good and completely worth the wait! I loved the fresh squeezed orange juice, and also loved how everyone working, was in pajamas. It gave it a very cozy breakfast environment. I hope to come back again soon:)!
