Loved the French Toast w/ eggs and bacon in the hole.  The hostesses and cashier need to be a little faster but the overall experience was very good.  Yes, I'll be back.

BmNXYyKJ1MqyFgnFyqpHaQ.text: Best place for breakfast we have found in s long time. Service was great and food was even better all severes where in pjs and tables are set up so u from my feel like u r eating with the table next to you can't wait to come back .

k1kh7dX05Wjw4ur1Zaa_yw.text: The food is great, albeit gigantic and better for sharing than for one. Many places can make good brunch food, but I love this place for the service. We have been twice on weekdays, so I cannot speak for rush times, but the hosts and servers have been quick and kind both times. In a town where service is mostly disregarded, this stands out. It is a bit pricey, but for the quality and quantity, I'll take it. It has become a go-to.

2PYLmMLDRgfBCCnBEkvFFw.text: I love Rise and Shine! If you're looking for a great steak and eggs this is the place to go!! When you go, ask for Ashley she is the best! She is super friendly, very attentive and nice, always refilling our drinks and making sure we have everything we need! I give the food five stars because it is very good but I give Ashley 10 stars because the service is the best!! You go to a restaurant for the food and come back for the service and that is why I always come back because Rise and Shine has both!

iEs0SqQkSYH8DzyWKskeAQ.text: i love brunch. i will wait a very long time to get in on a good brunch.  that said, nothing is worse than waiting a long time to get in on an average brunch.  i should have gone through the trouble at home! the place is huge and seats a lot of patrons, so i don't know why the wait was so long. i ordered steak and eggs.  the steak was a thin cut rib-eye and cooked properly so therefore tender but over-seasoned.  it made every bit snap with flavor, but was not necessary for a rib eye.  i ordered poached eggs to go along and you could taste the vinegar added to the water to poach as a kitchen trick.  especially with over-seasoned steak, the contrast of the rich and buttery yolk was needed, only to be overpowered by the tartness of vinegar.  ick.  i didn't complain.  it was fine.  the portions were decent so the menu was a little pricier.  don't mind paying for well-executed food or something more interesting.  this was neither.

3_ba8YvZ8Hy0C8h9bKEtUw.text: Best place to go for Breakfast! First time trying this restaurant and going to be coming back again. Very happy me and my boyfriend had a breakfast date for our first time moving to Vegas from California.

S_kb-EI-E27i8WedF8IgdQ.text: The food was expenseive and average. The pot bread was great and so was the table French Press. The service was friendly and prompt. The hostess was awesome and worked extra hard to get us the table we wanted. The hostess needs a raise.

f8YOG0G0E3NR6f8BYB6N9A.text: The food was good but the quality was kind of cheap. I ordered and egg white omelet with salsa.. The salsa tasted like the Pace salsa from the grocery store.. Little disappointing. The hash browns are great but pretty greasy... Feeling a pit in my stomach now! This would be a great place if you have a hangover.. Not healthy enough to come regularly.

VB7kV8YcLvTd2HNV6TNRTA.text: Great service, great food... Will come back whenever we visit Vegas. The corned beef hash was out of this world, a must try! Ask for Krys, best server/entertainer/life consultant in town!

5I_zoCuycuOv2zXfqM3v2A.text: Amber was an AWESOME server and she was SO nice and friendly our entire visit! She gave us a tour of the menu and after finding out I was pescatarian she gave me a bunch of her favorite options! . SO MANY DIFFERENT KINDS OF EXCELLENT FOOD HERE!! I got the Avo-Veggie Benedict and it was incredible, my boyfriend got the corn beef hash and he said his was great too! You can tell they REALLY care about what they are serving their patrons here, which is really nice.  GET ONE OF THEIR FRESH PRESSED JUICES IF YOU COME HERE!! The watermelon strawberry is so refreshing and delicious!   This is definitely going to be our new breakfast spot on the weekends, I hope Amber is looking for a couple of regulars!!

qEm62u7kXyL72MQIvl0cRQ.text: I took my mom and family out for breakfast and couple weeks back. You'll spend some money at this place, but the service is great, food is good, and the portions are satisfying. The five star reviews are spot on.

KIhWK6Ezsy9X2eoyckCOHg.text: So our waitress AMBER was awesome... Every time I come to Vegas..  This is the only place I will have breakfast at. I love this place... Get the cup of bread.. A must and OMG the ham is huge. See y'all next time...

veEZCUq4Q9z6jtfQkbKEiw.text: Service was terrible. Our waitress, Katie, took ten minutes to take a drink order and then another ten to bring it. It took her ANOTHER 30 minutes to take our order, after having to be asked, and another 35 for it to come out (obviously that wasn't her fault). The food was delicious, however the service was awful. The girl at the register didn't ask how it was and when I offered up that our service was horrible she said "well that's okay." When I told her I would leave a review online she said "thank you."   We will not be returning as this is not the first awful experience we've had. Another time we came and the kitchen was flooding, and on another experience we had horrible service as well. It's unfortunate because the food is so good.

SP0F0fBNd9Gw8XS4X7wSag.text: We had the Chicken and waffles and it was absolutely amazing and the service was outstanding.  We will definitely go back.

XrO2xPSbo277Dd_Qiisz6w.text: This is now my favorite breakfast spot in Vegas! Not only is the food great, but the service is amazing. My Waitress' name was Ashley. Her service was phenomenal and she made a great suggestion when I didn't know what to order. Don't know if you guys do employee of the month, but she deserves it! definitely coming back again

X0qtu1UZAg0Ig2eGfGAw_A.text: Great place to eat!! First off my server was Ashley who was amazing, helped me with my order best service ever and of course great food will be back!!

YtDqCaeF02MyMD6p9WJgaw.text: Underwhelmed after waiting outside for 30 minutes in the wind. Portions big, but the prices are also. Pancakes came with zero butter. Lots of better breakfast options than this old Joes crab shack.

Qt7xHM-ieRAu2ZeDdVuYqw.text: Took my 91 year old mother here and won't be back. You would think a restaurant that specializes in breakfast and brunch would know how to cook eggs. The eggs Benedict eggs were almost hard boiled! The yolks were hard. They were replaced with scrambled eggs that were equally hard. The server could have cared less. The only reason this place gets 2 stars is for the hostess who was very kind to my mother.

Pc2QRtCVE5LPxn22wcaMlg.text: Samantha was amazing! Fav place for Sunday Breakfast coffee is bomb & cinnamon toast French toast is the go to. Thanks again for the amazing experience As always

Uyo0F3Un3Ab7lqgm4h5VKA.text: Best breakfast. Never disappoints. Even though they are so busy the service is fast and great too. Only complaint is the prices,  $13 for a breakfast sandwich is a bit extreme but I guess they can get away with it. Biscuits and gravy is my favorite.

8R3AHWn5TAI_Q6k9xzh8eQ.text: I ordered the Roast Turkey California Bagel and my boyfriend ordered the Chicken And Waffles. We were both underwhelmed. The chicken on the chicken and waffles was probably the worst thing that came to our table. It seemed way over-battered and almost nearly undercooked. The texture was mushy and off-putting. My bagel sandwich was okay. The portions were large and the service was very good, although we will not be returning.

s432xLjmQkovabyRkU125g.text: After going to LVAC. I was HANGRY! All around the gym there are an array of healthy post-gym appropriate food places....and sometimes you just need some cheesy, yummy, gooey, comfort food for breakfast! This was one of those days!  As I was seated, by myself, I was greeted quickly by an awesome waitress, I think her name was Maddy. She was so nice. Sometimes when you are sitting by yourself, people are a bit weird. Not the case here!   I ordered eggs, with biscuits and sausage gravy. I told you I wanted comfort food!! LOL It was really good, I would totally go back here!  The interior was bright and cheerful, they have a great outdoor patio, and some of the wait staff even wears flannel pajamas. So cute!

vQyzEB6Z6lrqTu9ZLK3nIw.text: We had the loco moco and it was amazing! The service was fantastic and Ashley took great care of us. We'll be back!

krx6HL_btt2Gs7IlpOf7dg.text: This place is run down with poor management.  How can you not have soft drinks?  All the beverages were overpriced.  The waitress who runs the place was condensing when asked about menu items.  She also visited out table three time in the 5 minutes we had been there asking for our drink orders.  When asked about hot drinks, she didn't know what herbal tea was.  Avoid this dump.

w5fgCghiYZeaR_h6SnnLug.text: This was my first visit to this location, and unfortunately will be my last.  I made a take out order for the Smoked Salmon and Bacon Bagel, on an everything bagel for myself, then Red Velvet Chocolate Chip Pancakes, and the ULTIMATE Steak and Eggs, medium rare, and scrambled for the bf.   I got home and opened up his steak and eggs, took a look at the steak, and was very disappointed, I had to do a double take. It was burned on the outside, over seasoned and NOT medium rare. He took a bite out of it and immediately gagged, not only was it over-seasoned, but it was spoiled. It was placed on top of the eggs and hash browns, so the taste of the meat ruined everything else in the box.   We called and spoke to Vanessa, the manager, and expressed our disappointment in the quality of the food. She was immediately apologetic, said it was unacceptable, took our name and ensure that we would be compensated the amount for our next visit. Very well handled and extremely professional.   We were so sickened that we ended up bringing the food back, only to realize that the location we called was the one in Southern Highlands. I was greeted by the manager Analisa at this location. I apologized for the mix-up, told her what we spoke to Vanessa about, and kindly asked Analisa to please take a moment and speak to the manager at the other store, as we explained the situation to her and she'd be able to confirm our agreement. Her immediate response was "She's busy." She didn't even attempt to pick up the phone.   She looked into my box of food, and asked "well, what's wrong with it? That's medium rare" even after I had explained to her that it was burned and over seasoned.   She looked at me as if I was stupid for asking her to call another location, and started to tell me that she'd comp the order OR have the food made again, but I'd have to still pay. She told me she needed the card if I wanted to be refunded and so I headed back to my car to retrieve my wallet. When I returned she had already told the cooks to start the order again, even though I did not agree to it. Turns out she was actually able to go back and just void the purchase, without the need of a card, but couldn't even provide a copy of the voided transaction at all. She even said, in a really condescending manner, "You can come back here and try it." My bf heard that and got upset that she was disrespectful, so he said no, that's fine, let's go, after she wrote "VOID" on my crumpled original transaction receipt. I walked out, and went to the car, and saw Analisa following my bf out of the door, yelling at him, in front of many of the guests that were dining on the patio.   Extremely disappointed in the unprofessionalism of Analisa, and the staff at this location. Will not return.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium rare??? No way

kkrUl_s6ygY2eo_LZ9gXDg.text: Tried this place for the first time today. Wasn't too impressed. The food was delicious and so was the coffee, but our server was eh okay.   We ordered the Texas French Toast with hash browns which were very good and my Cornbeef hash was very tasty. I would go back for the food, but the service kind of lacked.

AVyDW3h3q5nXiYqPA6Wcow.text: Large portions..good flavor and fresh tasting.  Kids meals were a perfect fit for the picky kid. Staff was curious and knew the menu...I would recommend coming here

oqhft05yAt8gNE8DSe14gA.text: I absolutely LOVE this place. I got the crunchy cinnamon French toast with the side of eggs and bacon and it's was heavenly. I'm not exaggerating at all either. My girlfriend got the ribeye steak and eggs w/ potatoes and the steak was DELICIOUS. The service was pretty quick and the waitresses wear cute pajamas. The only reason I didn't put five stars is because our side of toast didn't come buttered and it was kind of stale. I don't know if me wanting the toast to come warm and buttered is weird but I do. Otherwise everything was so so good. OH! also they have fresh squeezed OJ & it was tasty but it cost like $5.. but it was kind of worth it. Highly recommend!

dCIBFlFLCIkQquBQmwcbBA.text: This place is great ! It was my 2nd time eating here and it was just as good. I brought my parents along cause I knew they would feel just as comfortable and enjoy the food just as much as I did.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2tX4nG3u1MufzbXnOYOrHg.text: The best breakfast I have had in a while! We had the corn beef hash which was absolutely amazing and the cinnamon crunch French toast that was to die for! Everything is very fresh...make sure to try the fresh juices too...I will definitely come back the next time I'm in Vegas!!

IJy0u4eQzMDYp4yMeZ-rbw.text: Me and a girlfriend were looking for a place with really good steak and eggs. Came across this on Yelp and decided to give it a try. From start to finish we had really great service. Our waitress Danielle was great! She was very helpful and had great menu knowledge. We ended up getting the Classic Ribeye and eggs along with the country fried steak. Although the service was 5/5 food got 4/5. The Ribeye was a bit over cooked but had a great taste with the espresso seasoning. The CFS on the other hand had no taste what so ever. The batter was eh and gravy barely had any sausage and was very bland. It was fine after a little doctoring up. A bit over priced for what you get and not a lot of flavor. Definitely gonna give this place a second chance to try more things on the menu..

jwFxNq_Re4pz9wva3-_LnQ.text: This place is absolutely amazing. The waiters wear pajamas and the food is huge!! My gf got the turkey Bagel and I got the bacon wrapped steak. Omg the portions are huge!! So good!! I reccomend to anyonw hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Rise & Shine : A Steak & Egg Place - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MQCToEy_t_1UKi1d9cHY0A.text: Cool vibe, very open layout, all staff is dressed in some sort of pajama or sleepwear. Food was good, we went for lunch and had the southwest turkey melt panini and the grilled cheese. Yes, pretty basic choices I know, but it's what we're in the mood for! Fries were the skinny shoestring style, not my favorite but they did have a kind of herb sprinkled on them that was pretty tasty

9ASa7pPH28A4sxF9Xp8mSQ.text: Good ambiance and the server wear pajamas as a uniform our server Madison invited us back in our PJ's. Madison was very friendly and knows the menu well. The food was ok. The idea of all fresh ingredients is great but the execution was mediocre! I have been here several times now and the last visit I ordered Chiliquillas it was as if it sat in the window waiting for the rest of the food to arrive. As a family we enjoy but it is only getting 3 's from me!

vfHeMMqAt-Nyk11tSsLJEg.text: Such a unique place. Great vibes and great food' portions are huge! Visited Las Vegas from California but will definitely be back!!

sSVcmzAN5Zj-8GFue7ZQmQ.text: Went in for Sunday breakfast, it was delicious! The chicken and waffles are amazing!  Chicken was fresh breaded and cooked to order, no frozen fried chicken here!! Service was ok, she was friendly just not overly attentive (especially with a coffee drinker at the table) but for great quality I can overlook having to ask for EVERY refill of coffee! Check it out, you won't be disappointed!!!

rf5xTvLB9h4ieNcwK_7dYw.text: We decided to try this place today and it was very yummy! I had the Belgian waffles with eggs and bacon and my husband had the chicken and waffles. I was eating off his plate more. Will be coming back for sure!

SEdAOCEdjPZUgCin1igBLA.text: Came about noonish and got seated right away. They have the best tomato soup with grilled cheese toast! They also get to wear the cutest pajamas!! Our server Sarah was also so nice and attentive

8FIJdNTfQxhvmfzAjaNxYA.text: We came here after failed attempts at other brunch places: griddle cakes, dw bistro and biscuits 2 burgers were all full. We'll  be back to b2b since we got a Groupon. It was busy here but not bad like the others previously mentioned. The place was really big, especially in comparison to the others and that's why we decided to go here. We came in and it took a little while for the people ahead of us to be seated and when they were the maitre d took a phone call instead and tried to help someone with a misplaced bracelet? Now, why do some  establishments preference people who call to someone who is either next in line or already being helped? I'll never get it. A good business would put the caller on hold. We decided to to sit down at the waiting area because I thought this might be the proper way to get help and plus my arms were getting tired of holding the baby in her car seat. But as you would've guessed, as soon as i sit down a couple comes in and gets help right away. It's s good thing they wanted to sit at the bar, so it didn't take long for me to be seated when I stepped back to the line. These people need to be more aware on who got there first and at least acknowledge that you were. This is our 2nd time here and it seems like majority of 5he staff are stressed out. My server was just ok nothing above average. Didn't ask if we wanted more to drink from our skinny glasses of juice and smoothies, which I do have to commend them for their taste. The ribeye was supposed to be medium but seemed dry at the same time, maybe it was because of the sear. I would recommend medium rare if you like medium. The chilequilas were good and tasty. The salmon on the benedict was too salty but the poached eggs were done just right, especially the yoke. Not too dry and not too runny. And the pot bread is always good. The cooks might be shortstaffed  and rushed and the maitre d and servers have room for improvement, other than that the place is nice, roomy and good for kids and the amount of food you get for your buck is a deal.

HXlASEXVvLvWfhz_tEENtw.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat breakfast! The biscuits and gravy are my go-to as well as the smores waffles. Their juices are also delicious- especially the watermelon strawberry juice.  The staff is also attentive and polite. Anytime I have someone in town visiting, I bring them here and it is always a win.

soyAcWmCe9gtPmLzVVx8Mw.text: Had a great breakfast there today. Now mind you the prices are fairly high but the food is good. Large portions and the bread in the bowl was excellent. Steak and eggs were great.  I think their only problem is the atmosphere. They need to light up the dining area better and I think they should put monitors on the wall for sports, news, and the morning stock market.  People like to be stay connected while eating breakfast.  Romans 10 8 But what does it say? "The word is near you, in your mouth and in your heart" (that is, the word of faith which we preach): 9 that if you confess with your mouth the Lord Jesus and believe in your heart that God has raised Him from the dead, you will be saved. 10 For with the heart one believes unto righteousness, and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation. 11 For the Scripture says, "Whoever believes on Him will not be put to shame." 12 For there is no distinction between Jew and Greek, for the same Lord over all is rich to all who call upon Him. 13 For "whoever calls on the name of the Lord shall be saved."

I8B4Ht_653n-ujZ0WrduVA.text: A great place for breakfast in Las Vegas. The food is excellent and well priced. The staff is great and they wear pajamas as their uniform. Get there early because the wait time for seating can be greater than 20 minutes. I've been to this place twice and both times the food and service was awesome. The Loco Moco and Country Fried Steak are great choices. Also, try their French Press Coffee.

nYVx0_0cNukjH9xOcqxIDw.text: Hands down the best breakfast I've had in Vegas (and I've lived here for almost 5 years). Everything on the menu is delicious and the restaurant ambiance is a perfect combination of indoor outdoor barnyard feel setting. Staff wears comfy pajama uniforms which just adds to the great "breakfast" feel. Will absolutely be a return costumer as long as they're in business.

mHDOnXx4Rbdblx2c-6Zypg.text: Steak & Eggs - perfection!!! The seasoning and grill marks on the steak were great. Awesome flavor. Can't wait for my next trip back. Loved the pot of bread.

2yUHklrx-tEqJI0ykOnWdg.text: The food here is amazing and they have wonderful service and I love how they are always in their pjs .

rhXf-QydFgWGk99uFxk04w.text: My family and I ordered the famous steak and eggs, eggs Benedict, cinnamon toast crunch French toast, and pot of bread. The pot of bread was recommended on yelp but I was disappointed that it was smaller than the Yelp descriptions. It was still delicious and my husband also loved the steak seasoning. In fact, everything was delicious and we would definitely go back again.
